job_description:
LOCATION: Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB)
JOB NUMBER: 27905

Why you should join us:
Are you an effective communicator with strong influential, persuasion and negotiation skills? Are you someone who easily builds trust and relationships across multi-disciplinary teams? Working closely with the Change Operations Team Lead, you will execute the IT Operations Change and Knowledge Management processes. You will ensure that Request For Changes (RFC) are accurate and complete in order to approve them, and that that process governance activities are actioned, while mentoring others on the process and toolset. You will also provide key input into service operations strategy and be responsible for identification and implementation of continuous improvement opportunities.
You will use your expertise to:
Coordinate the Change Advisory Board meetings between Suncor, vendors and change requestors, ensuring technical and business representatives are able to provide input to changes regarding risk, cross application/environment impacts, etc.
Manage RFC from receipt through to closure and ensure failed changes are identified to appropriate parties and that results are captured through either the Post Implementation Review (PIR) or Major Outage review process
Monitor the effectiveness of the change process and recommending process improvements
Measure and report against Change Key Performance Indicators (KPI's) to determine performance of the process and to indicate success and failure rate of changes
Gather requirements for tool component enhancements that support Change Management processes such as ServiceNow access, change matrices and approver groups, as well as risk calculators through regular reviews and updates
Provide governance of Suncor’s RFC approval and supports governance of the process (flagged, expired, comments, ratings, etc.) for multiple vendors and audiences
Coordinate the knowledge management process requirements for the IT Operations organization which develops processes and then facilitate departmental outcomes to meet business needs
Build dedication towards effective teamwork, communicate the benefit of Operations Services in support of overall operational excellence, and assist with the management of the Service Operations team and individual performance improvement through effective mentoring
We’d like to review your application if you have…
Must-haves (minimum requirements):
Five years of IT operations experience
Strong practical knowledge of ITIL and ITSM standard methodologies
The ability to communicate effectively through all channels, including assimilation of complex technical data into a visual dashboard, fit for executive presentation, and well-articulated problem resolution skills
Deep understanding of the vendor outsourcing model and industry best practices, and experience managing vendor relationships
A Computer Science degree or a Technical College diploma
Alignment with our values of: safety above all else, respect, raise the bar, commitments matter and do the right thing
Preference for:
ITIL certification
Experience working within IT Management
Experience leading a team of direct reports
Where you’ll be working, your work schedule, and other meaningful information:
You will work out of our Calgary head office, located in the Suncor Energy Centre at 150 – 6th Ave S.W.
Hours of work are typically a regular 40-hour work week, Monday to Friday
The position has an on-call component; with a scheduled 24/7 on-call and/or shift basis for after-hours support to ensure service level commitments are achieved
You will be required to have working knowledge of departmental Incident, Problem and Change Management procedures in support of operations activities
Why Suncor?
We are Canada's leading integrated energy company with a business portfolio that includes oil sands development and upgrading, offshore oil and gas production, petroleum refining, and product marketing under the Petro-Canada brand. Our global presence offers rewarding opportunities for you to learn, contribute, and grow in a variety of career-building positions. We live by the value of safety above all else – do it safely, or don’t do it. Our strong track record of growth and a focus on sustainability mean tremendous potential for the future. Learn about our mission, vision and values.
In addition to rewarding job opportunities, we offer an attractive employee package, including:
Competitive base salary, compensation programs, and an annual incentive program
Flexible benefits package
Rewarding pension and savings plans
Stay connected to us:
Follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter for the latest job postings and news
Join our Talent Community and sign up to receive customized job alerts
Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see what we’re doing in the communities we live and work in
We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected. We will consider accessibility accommodations to applicants upon request.
Please note that our job postings are typically open for two weeks, so don't delay, apply now.

job_title: ANALYST / SENIOR ANALYST, PORTFOLIO RISK MANAGEMENT
job_description:
Montréal, QCThe Analyst/ Senior Analyst, Portfolio Risk will be responsible for portfolio risk monitoring of BDC portfolios such as Financing, Growth & Transition Capital, Venture Capital, and Wholesale Financing. This includes providing high quality analyses on risk trends as well recommendations to senior management. He/she will act as an expert of available data and actively support the development of new risk measures.


CHALLENGES TO BE MET

Provide independent and effective portfolio monitoring, ensuring key risk issues are raised to management
Identify and analyze historical trends, especially in regards to key risk indicators such as delinquency, downgrading to impairment, provisions on credit losses, pricing, capital, risk mix and risk concentrations, etc.
Actively support the alignment with industry best practices, including the development of new risk analytics and new reports
Identify and develop means for extracting new data from the Bank’s various systems required to monitor portfolio risk and support the ongoing enhancement of risk aggregation and analysis tools
Participate in the development and enhancement of risk models, including PRM Analytix, to address required improvements and alignment with industry best practices
Respond to internal clients’ ad hoc requests by using relevant data available
Keep abreast of industry best practices, changes in BDC operations, product development and IT projects and recommend required changes to risk monitoring and reporting in order maintain an alignment with BDC’s strategies.
Provide value-added insight to senior management on risk trends and concerns.
Provide recommendations to support senior management positioning strategies that are in line with BDC’s risk appetite.
Coordinate the monthly and quarterly risk reports and act as a facilitator for team members in order to ensure high quality and timely delivery
Maintain strong collaboration and relationship with internal clients.
Represent Portfolio Risk Management team in various committees, advisories or working groups, supporting them while considering availability and capacity of internal resources.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline such as finance, accounting, economics, mathematics, statistics.
Preferred experience:
Analyst level: Relevant educational background, no experience necessary
Sr. Analyst level: Minimum 3 years of relevant experience in financial institution (lending, risk management, sales support)
Knowledge of corporate and commercial real estate lending
Experience in risk management within the financial industry is an asset.
Strong analytical skills and detail-oriented
Ability to organize and collate data for management reporting purposes
Strong ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines
Initiative & creativity
Good written and verbal communication skills
Knowledge of Microsoft Excel
Knowledge of databases structure and management (SQL, SAS, etc.) is an asset
Knowledge of statistical/numerical software; such as Matlab, VBA is an asset
Bilingual in both official languages

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

At BDC, we value diversity in our workforce and encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We appreciate all responses and advise that only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

$60,000 - $80,000 a yearExperience in requirements gathering sessions with stakeholders, and developed discovery documentation, diagrams, models, user interface mock-ups, and final Business Requirement Documents (BRD).Deal with vendors and stakeholders in applying for Security and Compliance reviews, vendor assessments and security tests, in order to integrate and align to Business standardsCollaborate with the team on Sprint Planning and assist with planning to accomplish items from backlogs.Generate and compile data from multiple data sources using various business intelligence tools and information management systems.Communicate with client’s business requirements and processes through document analysis, interviews, workshops and flow analysis.Identifying project stakeholders and designated critical stakeholders as SMEs; outlined project system scope, detailed workflows and high-level system capabilities.Experience in resource capacity planning, resource management and resource allocation process.Experience in Risk Analysis of requirements to identify the key business risk areas for the project, prioritized the application development, and testing.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $60,000.00 to $80,000.00 /yearExperience:business analyst: 1 year (Required)

Toronto (Ontario)

EC-06, RE-05 - NOTE: This position is classified at the RE-05 group and level which is roughly equivalent to the EC-06 group and level.

$85,300 to $109,900
For further information on the organization, please visit Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions Canada
Closing date: 8 April 2019 - 23:59, Pacific Time
Who can apply: Persons residing in Canada and Canadian citizens residing abroad.
Apply online
Important messages
We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you need to be accommodated during any phase of the evaluation process, please use the Contact information below to request specialized accommodation. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.
Assessment accommodation
Duties
The Regulatory Data Management (RDM) Division is seeking a highly motivated individual to join their team of Regulatory Business Analysts. In support of OSFI’s mandate and strategic objectives, the successful candidate would work in partnership with internal and external data stakeholders to analyse and identify data collection needs.

Under the supervision of the Manager, Returns Data Analyst, the Regulatory Data Analyst works collaboratively with IM/IT and business units to optimize OSFI’s cross-sector requirements gathering and analysis.

This liaison role requires above average abilities to communicate effectively.

Responsibilities include:
Liaise with Supervision and Regulation sectors (the business clients) to analyze and identify their data requirementsIdentify and develop solutions to optimize data collection, including the maintenance and improvement of existing regulatory data returnsProvide day-to-day direction and assistance to clients, aiding in their understanding of data, associated data processes and tools, and best practices for data governance and managementManage multiple data requests from internal and external sources, including the management of conflicting or non-integrated requirements and responsibilitiesProvide users of OSFI’s Business Intelligence (BI) data access tools with functional supportProvide an interface between business clients and IM/IT on BI issues
Intent of the process
The immediate need is to staff one position with a language requirement of English Essential.


This selection process may be used to establish a pool of qualified candidates, which could be used to staff similar or identical positions with various linguistic profiles and requirements, security profiles and various tenures.
Positions to be filled: 1
Information you must provide
Your résumé.
In order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)
EDUCATION:
A university degree with specialization in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Mathematics, Business, or Accounting, or any specialization relevant to the duties to be performed.
Degree equivalency
EXPERIENCE:
Recent and significant experience working collaboratively with business partners to understand, analyze, and articulate data requirements and recommended solutions, gained while working in the financial services industry*.Recent and significant experience working in a client-service environment.
Recent and significant experience in one or more of the following:
o Gathering and defining business intelligence reporting requirements.
o As a super user, assisting others in the use of business intelligence tools.
o Gathering and defining requirements for financial industry regulatory reporting.
o Gathering and defining requirements for financial risk management reporting systems.

Financial services industry experience is defined as experience working in a financial institution, including banks, insurance companies, pension funds, wealth management firms, and accounting firms (dealing with audits), as well as government departments that directly deal with the supervision and regulation of these institutions or other relevant areas.
If you possess any of the following, your application must also clearly explain how you meet it (other qualifications)
ASSET EDUCATION:
Professional designation or certification in an area relevant to the position to be staffed such as Business Analysis, Data Analysis, Data Management, Business Intelligence, Accounting, Auditing, or Project Management.
Degree equivalency
ASSET EXPERIENCE:
Working with Business Intelligence tools.
The following will be applied / assessed at a later date (essential for the job)
English essential
Information on language requirements
KNOWLEDGE:
Knowledge of data management principles and best practicesKnowledge of Business Intelligence conceptsKnowledge of the software development cycleKnowledge of business risk
COMPETENCIES:
Critical ThinkingResults OrientationWorking as a TeamImpact and Influence
ABILITIES:
Ability to communicate effectively in writingAbility to communicate effectively verbally
The following may be applied / assessed at a later date (may be needed for the job)
ASSET KNOWLEDGE:
Knowledge of Canadian Banking Industry issues and challengesKnowledge of Basel III international banking regulationsKnowledge of Basel III rules, calculations, and reporting requirementsKnowledge of OSFI regulatory reporting requirements
ASSET COMPETENCIES:
Innovation
ORGANIZATIONAL NEEDS:
In order to meet the organization’s employment equity objectives in support of a diversified workforce, ‘right fit’ selection for this position may be made from among qualified candidates who self-declare as being Persons with a disability or Aboriginal peoples.
OPERATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
Willingness to travel on occasion
Conditions of employment
Reliability Status security clearance
Other information
The Public Service of Canada is committed to building a skilled and diverse workforce that reflects the Canadians we serve. We promote employment equity and encourage you to indicate if you belong to one of the designated groups when you apply.
Information on employment equity
In order for your application to be considered, you must submit a completed questionnaire. You will be required to demonstrate how you meet the education and experience criteria (essential and asset) for the initial screening, in answering online screening questions. It is NOT sufficient to only state that the qualifications are met or to provide a listing of current or past responsibilities. Rather, you must clearly demonstrate HOW, WHEN and WHERE the qualification was met through substantiation by examples. Information on your described education and experience provided in the screening questions should be supported by your résumé. Failure to provide the above information in the format required may result in your application being rejected from the process.

A written examination will be administered.

An interview will be administered.

Reference checks may be sought.

Please note that OSFI has offices located in Ottawa, Toronto, Montreal, and Vancouver. If you are screened in, you may be required to travel to one of these locations to complete assessment (exam, interview, etc.).

Candidates invited to an interview will be required to bring proof of their education credentials, in the form of a diploma or official transcript (original documents only). Candidates with foreign credentials must provide proof of Canadian equivalency. Consult the Canadian Information Centre for International Credentials for further information at http://www.cicic.ca/.

Candidates must meet all of the essential qualifications to be appointed to a position. A candidate may be appointed to a position even though he/she does not meet any or all of the asset qualifications. However, meeting these criteria is desirable and may be a deciding factor in choosing the person to be appointed.

Depending on the requirements of the position(s) being staffed from this process, for current or future vacancies, any or all of the asset qualifications, operational requirements, and organizational needs may be applied at the time of staffing. Candidates may be contacted and assessed against these criteria at any time during this process.

Achieving a representative workforce has been identified as an organizational need and may be applied in this appointment process. If this criterion is used, only those who have indicated that they are members of the specified designated group(s) will be considered.
A top down selection of candidates may be used in the determination of those to be given further consideration in the assessment process.

Persons are entitled to participate in the appointment process in the official language of their choice. Applicants are asked to indicate their preferred official language in their application.

For this selection process, our intention is to communicate with applicants by e-mail (including sending invitations for written tests and interviews). Applicants who apply to this selection process must include in their application a valid e-mail address and make sure this address is functional at all times and accepts messages from unknown users.
All job applications must be submitted through the Public Service Resourcing System (PSRS). Do not fax or mail hard copy documents as these will not be accepted. To submit an application online, please click on the button "apply now".

If you do not have Internet access in your home or through friends, relatives or neighbours, here are some suggested locations: campus career centers, libraries, community centers, Internet cafés and Services Canada. You may also call 1-800-O-Canada (1-800-622-6232), or TTY 1-800-926-9105, for information on the nearest public Internet access locations.

Persons with a disability preventing them from applying on-line are asked to contact 1-800-645-5605.

Applicants with disabilities: If you require special accommodation at any stage in the selection process, including technical aid to ensure an equitable assessment of your qualifications, please inform us by sending an e-mail to the following address: HROstaffing@osfi-bsif.gc.ca.

As a Separate Agency, the Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions (OSFI) appoints employees in accordance with the Public Service Employment Act (PSEA). OSFI is named in Schedule V of the Financial Administration Act (FAA) and it offers the same pension and benefits plans as the core Federal Public Service. In addition to this, OSFI employees obtain a minimum of 4 weeks of vacation leave per year, earn a competitive salary, and are eligible for an annual performance bonus.
Preference
Preference will be given to veterans and to Canadian citizens, in that order, with the exception of a job located in Nunavut, where Nunavut Inuit will be appointed first.
Information on the preference to veterans
We thank all those who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

job_title: Data Analyst (internally known as Business Analyst)
job_description:
$36.17 an hourTemporaryMake a difference
Are you passionate about data analysis and looking for an opportunity to positively impact your community? If so, the Business Analyst (Data Analyst) position at Toronto Community Housing may be for you!
The Business Analyst (Data Analyst) will be part of the Data Governance team, reporting to the Data Governance Manager within the Information and Technology Services (ITS) department.
The main focus will be on supporting various initiatives under the Data Governance program, including, but not limited to, establishing best practices in Master Data Management and Data Quality areas. Initially, the Business Analyst (Data Analyst) will be focusing on understanding and modeling TCHC’s current state data in collaboration with the Data Governance and Data Management teams. Also, the Data Analyst will be one of the key resources as part of data conversion effort to consolidate TCHC data into the new business solution.
This role will be actively engaged with different business divisions as part of the Data Governance program to identify data requirements and to ensure that data governance will address various business data needs.
What you’ll do
Data Analysis
Identifies data requirements for enterprise data throughout whole data lifecycle
Performs research and analysis on a regular and ad hoc basis to support data governance activities
Ensures the integrity, quality and accuracy of data while collecting data from internal and external sources supporting data governance activities
Collects, interprets and analyzes data and provides ongoing reporting
Supports and enforces established data standards and guidelines
Manages master data, including creation, updates, and deletion
Proactively monitors data accuracy and facilitates required data corrective actions with business owners
Provides assistance and analytical support to ensure that decision-making processes are aligned with values, policies, and organization-wide business
Data Governance Strategy support
Assists with new initiatives and projects by understanding impacts on data flows, business constrains and requirements
Provides support to data owners/ data stewards in performing data validation
Participates in the creation of data standards, drafting of data and governance policies and management of related documentation
Partners in troubleshooting and resolving master data transactions, SLA impacts, or other operational challenges affected by master data issues
Develops and implements governance oversight and KPI metrics to successfully complete data governance objectives
Collaborates with division and other staff to interpret data, identify trends, communicate meaning and develop recommendations based on findings
Research
Maintains up to date knowledge of information technology products and methodologies as well as government and TCH data policies and standards
Contributes to ideas and actions towards continuous improvement of processes within master data and data quality
Participates in research projects with external and internal partners
 What you’ll need
University Degree in computer science, MIS or other relevant specialty/discipline
University degree in computer science, MIS is preferred
3 years - Previous experience in data analysis and data modeling, 3-5 years’ experience is preferred
Knowledge of data modeling tools
Working experience of SQL
Exposure to data architecture best practices
Previous experience in Data Governance, MDM and / or Data Quality initiatives
Has participated in data conversion activities
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal and collaborative skills, and the ability to communicate architectural concepts to technical and nontechnical audiences
Excellent analytical skills, work well in a demanding dynamic environment and meet overall objectives
Nice to have:
Previous experience in data conversion initiatives
Ability to manage multiple demands within tight timelines
Demonstrate good problem-solving abilities, and have initiative and show sound judgment
Attention to detail and ability to work effectively under time constraints are required
Ability to exhibit maturity, reliability and stability by adhering to commitments is critical in order to maintain business credibility
High level of personal integrity, and the ability to professionally handle confidential matters and show an appropriate level of judgment and maturity
High degree of initiative, dependability and ability to work with little supervision
What’s next
Once you apply, we’ll review your resume and cover letter to determine if your skills and experience match the qualifications for the role. Only qualified candidates will be contacted to move forward in the hiring process. If you are contacted, the process will include one or more interviews and/or assessments and reference checks.
Candidates for unionized positions must score a minimum of 70% to pass any interview or assessment and be considered for the next stage of the recruitment process. Successful candidates will be determined based on score and where applicable, union seniority. Note: not all candidates who score 70% or higher will automatically proceed to the next stage of the recruitment process as this will be dependent on the number of candidates and number of available roles.
Please note: This temporary position may be extended or become permanent in order to meet business needs. If this occurs, the position may not be reposted.

Toronto, ONTemporary$87,888 - $103,249 a yearPlease note that the salary is based on 2018 rates.


Major Responsibilities:


Reporting to the Senior Systems Integrator Clerks, the Business Analyst SII will analyze business operations and application systems in order to bridge the gap of translating business requirements into system specifications to develop custom application solutions.

Assesses information technology and data/systems needs and requirements of business units and identifies and evaluates feasibility of operations, policies, technology, information systems and management practices to improve service delivery
Evaluates the efficiency and effectiveness of business systems and determines information systems strategies by means of feasibility and cost/benefit studies.
Assesses impact of technology on service delivery/resources/business and costs/savings, and develops recommendations, including opportunities for maximizing technology and improving efficiency of business practices
Designs system specifications; preparing requirements for ensuring proper system testing, implementation and operation
Prepares system and user documentation and provides consultation, technical support and user training to the business units on the specific technology application being implemented
Documents and analyzes business requirements utilizing various methods such as: interviewing (JAD sessions), data modeling, business process modeling, business object modeling and user interface design
Provides support to the business units on the specific technology application being implemented and utilized in support of the business
Assists in the development, testing, training and configuration of the specific applications and the fine tuning and implementation of upgrades, new releases and enhancements to the applications
Contributes to successful project completion within budget and on time by identifying risks and developing/recommending mitigation strategies.
Works closely with various stakeholders and partners to understand priorities and impact.
Develops and delivers presentation and training sessions tailored to specific stakeholder groups
Prepares RFI/P/Qs and other formal project documentation
Manages vendors and external contracts
Travels to off-site locations


Key Qualifications:

Post-secondary education in Information Management, Information Technology, Business / Public Administration or other discipline pertinent to the job function, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience performing system analysis and business analysis and/or managing medium to large scale projects.
Experience in documentation and process design techniques such as cases, data and workflow modelling, swim lane diagrams, entity relationship diagrams, activity diagrams, business rule documentation, functional & non-functional identification and screen mock-ups
Experience and of MS Office Suite including Visio, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint and/or other project management software. Experience using Blueprint would be an asset.
Considerable experience coordinating, supporting and facilitating medium to large scale projects including the definition of project purpose and objective, project activities, milestones and deliverables, monitoring and tracking progress, and communication to stakeholders.
Strong understanding of privacy, security and auditing; how these can be reviewed, monitored, and enhanced with regards to systems implementation.
Strong understanding of application deployment approaches, and standard dev-QA-Production cycles.
Knowledge of software development and project management methodologies (RUP, SDLC, Waterfall, Agile, Prince, Zachman).
Knowledge of Municipal Freedom of Information & Protection of Privacy Act (MFIPPA).
Excellent written and oral communication skills, presentation and interpersonal skills to deal effectively with city staff, city councillors, senior management and the public.
Analytical skills in assessing and reviewing business processes to identify options, best practices and opportunities to improve service delivery through technology change and business process innovations.
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills to provide troubleshooting support, prepare technical documentation and reports on problems and to deal effectively with staff at all levels within the organization.
Excellent organizational, conceptual, analytical, problem solving and multi-tasking skills.
Strong leading, listening and interacting skills to work with competing demands, prioritize and meet deadlines.
Ability to prioritize multiple projects, work with cross-functional teams, set clear directions and design terms of references and project plans.
Ability to report to various work sites within the City of Toronto as required.


Equity, Diversity and Inclusion:

The City of Toronto is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment where all employees and members of the public feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the public and the communities in which we live and serve.

Accommodation:


If you are an individual who requires accommodation to apply to this position, due to disability under the Ontario Human Rights Code, please email us at application.accommodation3@toronto.ca, quoting job ID #2322308 and the job title. The City is committed to providing Code-protected accommodation throughout its hiring process. Please visit Hiring Policies and Statements for further details.

ACCEO Solutions Inc., Retail Solutions division, is a Canada-wide leading provider of Retail Point of Sale Software, and is part of the Constellation Software family. They look to us to provide turnkey solutions, with recommendations and guidance on rolling out their systems. Our clients’ computer skills range from advanced to novice. Mississauga, ONReq Id: 230714
 At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we’re revolutionizing how Canadians communicate.

If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values bold ideas, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.

The Bell IT team uses emerging technologies, Agile and DevOps to design and build innovative solutions that enable Bell’s communications services for businesses and consumers. We’re looking for creative problem-solvers who are curious, collaborative and ready to be on the leading edge of technological transformation.

The Information Technology team develops and maintains Bell’s internal systems and applications while also developing integrated technology solutions for customers across all lines of business.

The team manages Bell’s IT Infrastructure and the service availability of over 700 applications, including mission critical billing and service systems. The IT delivery teams drive the IT Work Program with over 60% of IT capital invested in initiatives that support business unit priorities and Bell’s strategic imperatives.

job_title: Business & Predictive Analyst, Integrated Planning Management
job_description:
PermanentHelp us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast

dates back to

1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

The Integrated Planning Management Team supports all forward-looking merchant metrics for CTR. We own the processes, tools and reports used in Merch planning and forecasting. We use data science, analysis and business intuition to transform data into insights that can be actioned. We work closely with Category Business Management, Forecasting, Replenishment, Finance, Cross-Functional and IT teams. We are constantly striving to challenge the way we think, improve the way we operate and drive results.

The Business & Predictive Analyst supports the Merch Planning team to deliver robust and accurate plans and forecasts. You will conduct traditional and machine learning analytics to identify and quantify cause-and-effect relationships, assist in building/optimizing tools that are used by Merch Planning and issue digestible reporting on key business metrics.

What you’ll do

Deliver accurate and timely reporting and analysis to Merchandise Planning to help improve the accuracy and reliability of forecasts, targets and financial plan

Conduct what-if scenario analysis and measure the causal impact of results using predictive/statistical approaches and traditional analysis.

Design & build reporting with visualizations that surface insights effectively and enable actions to be taken efficiently

Ensure the planning and forecasting systems, reports and EUC tools are operational and support the business processes; implement enhancements/new functionality as required.

Manage multiple work requests – these initiatives can range from quick ad-hoc analysis requests, urgent system/tool support issues, or small- to medium-scale process improvements

Ensure the timely and accurate delivery of reporting and tools

Support submission of financial plans, reforecasts, and targets to appropriate teams.

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

Inclusive leaders who build and develop teams that effectively anticipate and respond to disruption, while consistently delivering strong performance

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

1 to 4 years work experience in various roles within merchandising, forecasting, planning, analytics or supply chain.

University degree in business, math, computer science, statistics, engineering or related field

Strong analytical, problem solving, and data mining skills with the ability to summarize and deliver actionable insights or recommendations.

Advanced technical skills in Microsoft Access, Excel, Database systems. Programming with VBA and SQL would be an asset.

Experience using statistical modeling tools with exposure to predictive/machine learning models.

Proficiency with coding and analysis using R, Python, or KNIME

Business mindset with an understanding of the retail industry.

Effective written and verbal communication skills, including presentation abilities.

About Canadian Tire Corporation

Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of

Canada’s Top Employers

.

To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on

LinkedIn

.

#LI-SS1

Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

Ottawa, ON$52,854 - $149,416 a yearHelp bring research to life and drive your career forward with the National Research Council of Canada (NRC), Canada’s largest research and technology organization.

We are looking for a vibrant and dynamic Technical Business Analyst to support our National Programs and Business Services Branch. The Technical Business Analyst would be someone who shares our core values of Integrity, Excellence, Respect and Creativity.

National Programs and Business Services (NPBS) aligns Business professionals to NRC Research Centres and programs, providing business expertise and Intellectual Property (IP) support in a coordinated and responsive manner. This centralized approach allows NRC to prioritize and channel resources in order to grow its diverse business in a strategic and pro-active way.

The Technical Business Analyst (TBA) provides competitive technical and business intelligence analysis services to its internal clients in the NRC Research Centres, advises on technology commercialisation strategies, and evaluates and makes recommendations to support NRC’s intellectual property (IP) strategy. In doing so, the Analyst develops leading edge industry insights that build on the existing business acumen and result in improved understanding of risk and uncertainty in the evaluation of new potential programs/investment opportunities.

The incumbent participates in market analysis, technology forecasting, technology road mapping and business planning activities as requested by NRC Divisional, Research Centres and Program Management and Client Relationship Leaders. The incumbent supports NRC’s leaders in identifying and making effective decisions on the key marketing challenges, improving their competitive intelligence, developing future programs and strategies, and responding to market situations for the business through the development and application of insightful and objective competitive and business analysis.
Screening Criteria
Applicants must demonstrate within the content of their application that they meet the following screening criteria in order to be given further consideration as candidates:
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Science, Engineering or Business Administration. Bachelor’s degree with extensive related business experience may be considered.

Master’s degree in Business Administration would be an asset.

For information on certificates and diplomas issued abroad, please see Degree equivalency
Experience
Significant experience writing in-depth analysis reports including market assessments, industry profiles and corporate profiles.
Significant experience in technology commercialization, bridging client needs and market trends.
Basic experience in the provision and use of competitive technical and business intelligence services.
Condition of Employment
Reliability Status
Language requirements
English
Information on language requirements and self-assessment tests
Assessment Criteria
Candidates will be assessed on the basis of the following criteria:
Technical Competencies
Superior knowledge of analysis tools as well as where and how to find multiple sources of information.
Ability to collect, organize, synthesize, and analyze data.
Working knowledge of the various technical domains required to support internal clients.
Solid knowledge of current and emerging technologies, market awareness and key stakeholders in providing client support.
Ability to summarize findings, develop conclusions from various data sources and write reports and recommendations.
Basic knowledge in the development of value propositions, IP valuations, Return on Investment (ROI) analysis and economic impact modeling.
Behavioural Competencies
Management services - Communication (Level 3)
Management services - Client focus (Level 3)
Management services - Results orientation (Level 3)
Management services - Teamwork (Level 2)

Competency Profile(s)
For this position, the NRC will evaluate candidates using the following competency profiles: Management Services; Technology Extension

Relocation
Relocation assistance will be determined in accordance with the NRC's directives.
Salary Range
This position is classified as a Research Council Officer (RCO), a group that is unique to the NRC. The RCO group uses a person-based classification system instead of the more common duties-based classification system. Candidates are remunerated based on their expertise, skill, outcomes and impacts of their previous work experience. The salary scale for this group is vast, from $52,854 to $149,416 per annum, which permits for employees of all levels from new graduates to world renowned experts to be fairly compensated for their contributions.
Notes
A pre-qualified list may be established for similar positions for a one year period.
NRC employees enjoy a wide-range of benefits including comprehensive health and dental plans, pension and insurance plans, vacation and other leave entitlements.
Preference will be given to Canadian Citizens and Permanent Residents of Canada. Please include citizenship information in your application.
The incumbent must adhere to safe workplace practices at all times.
This position is being advertised internally and externally simultaneously, however first consideration will be given to internal NRC applicants.

$70,000 - $85,000 a yearCrafting something unique takes more than good ideas: it takes a group of dedicated professionals who aren’t afraid to try something new, make it better, and then make it perfect.

If you’re looking for a job that stretches your creative muscles, and gives you the chance to be better every day, this is the opportunity for you.

At VISO, we’re always searching for ways to innovate. Whether in our groundbreaking custom lighting designs, our company culture, or our business strategies, we know that being better is the only way forward. That spirit has fueled our success for over 25 years, and has driven us to be unique, uncompromising, and exceptional in everything we do.

Now we’re looking to add a new member to our analytics team: someone with expertise, technical ability, and a positive, collaborative attitude.

That’s where you come in

As our new Business Analyst, you’ll be responsible for a range of financial duties: things like reporting, data management, costing and analysis.

A big part of this role involves working with our new ERP software, EPICOR. Here you’ll manage end to end business processes, and identify, define, and analyze business requirements. You’ll also support our software transition by being a resource for EPICOR, and contribute to change and product management.

Succeeding in this role means always looking forward to new opportunities, whether that involves improving our systems for efficiency, finding new applications, or furthering our business goals.

Business analysis is an integral role in our company, and you’ll learn all about our core operations as you gain experience with us. If you can deliver on and exceed the expectations of this role, there will be plenty of chances to grow into more senior positions and responsibilities.

Along with relevant experience, we’re seeking someone who:

Takes initiative – you have the drive and independence to finish projects and tasks on your own, and know how to meet deadlines.
Loves learning – constant improvement is your motto: you are an innovator who’s always looking for a better way.
Excels in group settings – you’re as good with people as you are with analysis, and can use strong interpersonal skills to collaborate with anyone who can lend a hand.
Thinks creatively – you’re strategic and excel in problem solving. You aren’t afraid to try different approaches, and know how to switch tactics when things aren’t working.
Working @ Viso

This will be a full-time, permanent position with hours from 9-5, Monday to Friday. We offer a competitive compensation package, which includes a salary between $70,000 and $85,000 per year, commensurate with your experience. You’ll also get full medical and dental after a trial period, as well as free parking, and potential for bonuses.

We do work culture a little bit differently at VISO. Or office is pet friendly, and we encourage people to be themselves at work. As a group we love collaboration, and maintaining the fun, positive, family-like environment of our workplace is a top priority.

If you want to join a team that’s supportive and always looking to do better, we want to hear from you.

Qualifications
Experience in business analysis, preferably in manufacturing or a related industry
Bachelors degree in business or a related field
Strong business communication skills, and ability/interest in working directly with clients
Proficiency with ERP software, including EPICOR
Demonstrated ability to implement new software/systems related to business analytics
We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us with the “Help” button in the application.

We will review applications, and look forward to hearing from you.
Please send your resume and cover letter to hr@visoinc.com with the subject title “Business Analyst”.

We look forward to receiving your resume!

Toronto, ONIPG Mediabrands was created by Interpublic Group in 2007 to manage all of its global media related assets. Today that means we manage and invest $38 billion in global media on the behalf of our clients, employ over 8,500 diverse and daring marketing communication specialists worldwide and operate our company businesses in more than 130 countries.
Are you a go getter? Do you want to work in a fast-paced modern environment? Are your SQL skills better than all your friends? Are you passionate about data, efficiency and Business Intelligence? Do you love Application Development? Are you a creative out-of-the-box thinker?
If so, IPG Mediabrands has the perfect opportunity to get your career to the next level!
Working in a growing team, the Data Warehouse Engineer is responsible for managing the data load processes for our Data & Technology Solutions team.
You will predominately be working with a variety of data sources, including APIs, relational databases and flat files and will be responsible for extracting & loading them into a Data Warehouse using SSIS & Python scripting for the team of Data Analysts & Report Writers to then visualize in BI Reports & Dashboards for IPG Mediabrands Agency clients (internal and external).
This role will involve maintaining current SSIS packages and API pulls for various sources (including Facebook & Google) and then working to extract new metrics from other new sources as and when they are identified.
You will participate in all aspects of the report creation process, from the initial requirements gathering meetings with internal teams to learning how to gather the data from various external sources, to modelling this data for efficient reporting. Then by using the SDLC, follow through on these steps in designing & creating the necessary database objects before the design & development of the extract, transform and load process to populate them.
Responsibilities:
Managing Data Load processes from multiple data sources using Python API calls and MS SSIS ETL packages. This will include maintaining a scheduled load process & upkeep of existing packages as well as new ones that you will design & develop.
Designing & development of customized load packages from existing and new data sources based on client requirements.
Make recommendations for improvements to management & senior management on improvements for existing API Calls or Extract pulls.
Assist Data Analysts in Ad-Hoc BI report requests including identifying necessary data sources, fields and metrics needed before writing queries to obtain the report output where necessary.
Debug existing application software and create patches and hot fixes when necessary.
Work closely with team during QA to facilitate quick diagnosis & resolutions for the identified defects
Documentation of all processes & code including upkeep and maintenance of software design documentation and traceability matrixes in accordance with organizational standards
Mentor other team members with an aptitude for learning on how to work with API’s.
Participation in DBA tasks on MS SQL Server data warehouse (shared with rest of team).
Immediately integrate & work closely with established team.
Required Skills
Extremely Strong SQL and PL/SQL skills with ability to work independently with stored procedures, functions, views & materialized views to write complex queries against large datasets.
Fluent in Python scripting & C#, jQuery and .Net Web Forms (Nice to have).
3+ years of experience working with MS SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) including demonstrated knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices & procedures with the tool. Experience of cube building with MS SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) (Nice to have).
Demonstrated experience of various RDBMs reporting databases (MS SQL Server & MySQL) including knowledge of data modeling for reporting data warehouses such as star schema, snowflake schema designs.
5+ years of experience working in application development including demonstrated understanding of full Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
Demonstrated logical thought process through appropriate & inquisitive questioning.
Good understanding of IT operations including standards, protocols, methods & processes, ticketing systems, configurations.
Basic knowledge of Database Administration tasks & processes.
Proficient user of MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio).
Extremely keen sense of attention to detail, excellent listening and communication skills (verbal and written).
Eagerness to learn new tools, technologies, concepts as well as knowledge sharing within the team on your own experience.
Post-secondary education in computer sciences, engineering, social sciences or related fields.
Experience working in a related field or media planning related experience would be a great asset & will be beneficial in your application, but is not required.
Experience with Dashboards and Data Visualization Software (Tableau or Domo) would be a great asset & will be beneficial in your application, but is not required.
If you’re looking for a challenging and dynamic role in a fast-paced and innovative company, please apply through our website at http://mediabrands.com/careers . We truly appreciate everyone’s interest but only those selected for an interview will be contacted. We offer a competitive compensation package with excellent benefits and an extensive employee perks program. For more on IPG Mediabrands, please visit us at www.mediabrands.com.

Position Overview:
The primary role of the Analyst, Business Insights is to provide information, analysis, and insight to various stakeholders relating to revenue, sales order books, and inventory. The Analyst liaises cross functionally with Sales, Planning and Retail Specialist team members in performance of daily duties. Key activities for this role include development of new analytics, continuous improvement of existing structures, and maintaining the integrity of existing reporting.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop new analysis and capabilities (50% time)
Advanced Analytics
Statistical analysis
Predictive modelling & machine learning
New Tool Implementation
Engage with IT and third parties to implement tools
Identify and integrate capabilities of new tools for reporting, forecasting, and inventory management
Report Automation
Work independently & with IT to automate repetitive tasks
Build models to perform required calculations
Conduct continuous improvement activities (25% time)
Develop dynamic reports that are user-interactive
Define alternative reporting structures
Transition existing standard analysis to new tools and methodology
Maintain ongoing reports and troubleshoot issues (25% time)
Order book analysis
Open order reporting
Actual vs forecast performance
Variance investigation
Inventory analysis
Daily inventory management
Performance tracking vs budgets and driver analysis
Financial Reporting
Support quarterly reporting
Support latest estimate, budgeting, and long-range planning
Education, Qualifications and Experience:
University degree in the field of business, engineering, computer science or mathematics
1-3 years working in related field such as finance, analytics, or sales operations
Experience in retail/manufacturing and/or distribution environment strongly preferred
Experience with Microsoft AX or other ERP systems is an asset
Experience with Anaplan or other data modelling systems is an asset
Experience with Tableau, PowerBI or other data visualization tools is an asset
Experience with Python, R, or other coding languages is an asset
Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:
Independent thinker able to conceptualize, develop and implement processes as part of a team
Demonstrates sound judgment and problem solving attitude. Able to break down problems into meaningful parts and come to rational and well-thought out conclusions.
Able to plan and balance own daily project workload with ad-hoc requests
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills (modelling, data manipulation/transformation, pivot tables)
Capable of synthesizing insights from a variety of analytical dimensions and visually presenting then in a digestible manner
Demonstrates relationship building, communication, and presentation skills
Demonstrates attention to detail and accuracy
Working Conditions:
Office environment, requires ~5% travel to attend industry and technology conferences

$37.07 - $42.13 an hourReporting to the Supervisor, Spatial Solutions Services, the GIS Data Analyst is required to maintain and assist in administering the City’s Corporate GIS database (i.e. data entry, editing, manipulation and quality control). Performs information product generation tasks (i.e. queries, geo-processing, tabular summaries and reports), and provides customer service to internal staff and external clients. Assists in the development of methodologies for database input and maintenance by staff
QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS:
University Degree or College Diploma in Geographic Information Systems, Engineering, Land Surveying, Geography and Urban Planning or related disciplines including Library Science, Computer Science, Information Systems. Five (5) to seven (7) years of demonstrated experience and proven knowledge in mapping and spatial database analysis and user support, including practical experience working with GIS technology (Esri suite of products preferred), preferably in a municipal environment.
Must have knowledge of standards and methodologies for GIS data management including, integration, conversion, manipulation, transfer, compatibility, valuation, storage and maintenance, data security and quality controls for data entry to manage the data life cycle. Demonstrated experience and proven knowledge in designing and implementing spatial database technology, preferably in a municipal or related environment. Working knowledge and experience with a range of GIS products, processes, and principles (e.g. Esri ArcGIS), GIS databases (e.g. ArcSDE, Oracle 12c, SQL Server), GIS terminology, GIS methods and techniques, scripting languages (eg. FME, Python), cartography procedures, coordinate systems and projections, geo-spatial digital imagery, digital equipment (e.g. survey, GPS, data collectors) on-site users GIS and tool support and trouble-shooting, managing GIS software and databases.
Working knowledge of relevant legislation (i.e. Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act, etc), and procedures related to information management, data standards, intellectual property rights, data security, copyright license data sharing agreements and privacy to ensure data is maintained in a secure environment and that the City's interests are met and value gained.
Must have good attention to detail and demonstrate analytical, problem solving and technical skills to manage, maintain, update and prepare database records (spatial & tabular formats), manipulating, analyzing and managing tabular and spatial data; and to resolve technical problems and information requirements by gathering/analyzing data, selecting/designing desired file and record format requirements, documenting revisions undertaken.
Knowledge of project management methodologies, including capacity to monitor projects, track work and provide input into work planning; and working knowledge of office software applications (e.g. Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint) in support of communications, reporting, presentations and training.
Good written and oral communications skills including experience preparing reports, technical instructions, and data share agreements. Good interpersonal skills to effectively deal with requests and concerns of clients/partners.
Ability to work both independently as well as in a team environment, work under pressure and meet deadlines.

Overview

With 47 ports of call, 35 vessels, and more than 500 sailings every day, BC Ferries is the largest independently-owned ferry company in the world. Dedicated to safety, excellence, innovation, and people, we are committed to continuously improving the west coast travel experience of our customers.

SENIOR BUSINESS ANALYST
Victoria
As a Senior Business Analyst in our Financial Planning & Analysis department, you provide support to various levels of management and senior executives on the operating and capital financial and business activities of the company. Working both independently and as part of multi-disciplinary teams, you promote fiscal responsibility through financial planning, business analysis, capital project planning, and reporting according to company policies and procedures. You often work on multiple tasks and projects simultaneously with minimal supervision.

Your responsibilities may include assisting and advising in the development and analysis of annual budget and quarterly forecast submissions, individual business cases for capital and major operating projects, and monitoring and analyzing related financial performance. You support all levels of management on strategic corporate initiatives, regulatory applications, projects and operational issues affecting business units. You provide advice concerning corporate financial policies and procedures, drive process improvement, perform financial modeling, and ensure integrity of financial information.

The successful applicant will have a professional accounting or finance designation combined with three to five years of accounting and business analysis experience, or equivalent. This experience should include budget preparation, financial modelling, business planning and exposure to project management. You have a demonstrated ability to analyze complex issues and develop strategies for solutions, while considering the impact on customer service and corporate objectives. In addition, you possess excellent interpersonal and relationship building skills, oral and written communication skills, problem-solving skills, report-writing and presentation skills, and computer skills, particularly in spreadsheet software and data presentation. Occasional travel may be required.

Please apply by March 15, 2019.

We appreciate the interest of all applicants; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Imagine yourself as part of one of the most dynamic companies in the healthcare technology industry today! QHR Technologies is a division of Shoppers Drug Mart, a Loblaw Company. QHR is leading the way in Canadian healthcare technology, by providing solutions to assist healthcare professionals enrich their practices and improve the quality of care delivered to all Canadians across the country. We are looking for talented, inspired, and motivated people to join our incredible team and experience a workplace culture that stands above the rest! Competitive salaries and generous perks are just a few of the reasons that QHR has been voted one of BC's Top Employers and Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers for many years running.
Position Summary:
QHR Technologies Inc. is looking for a Business Analyst to work with internal and external stakeholders on a new consumer facing Health and Wellness initiatives. As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with Product Management, Design and Development. You engage with the Product Owner to help develop and understand User Stories and define the Requirements which make each User Story possible. You will ensure that needs are well communicated both verbally and in written documentation so that all parties involved have a solid understanding. You will work with the Solutions Architecture team to help understand and define the non-Functional elements of solutions and assist with UAT to ensure that what is delivered by Design and Development meets the user requirements that were defined up front.
Our products and services reach thousands of healthcare professionals and improve the quality of human health of millions of Canadians through technology, and together with our parent company, Loblaw Companies Limited, we want to make healthcare simpler, safer, more secure, reliable and efficient. Our end users come from many different user bases, including Healthcare Providers, Allied Health Professionals, Pharmacies, Patients, and Retail Consumers.
Help shape our next generation of products and change how Canadians manage their health and wellness!
Essential Functions:
Interviewing internal and external stakeholders for requirements
Analyze requirements and investigate impacts to customer workflows and operational goals
Document use cases, functional, non-functional, and transition requirements
Create visuals to convey flows, structure, context and other complex subjects in a more understandable format
Document User Acceptance Test requirements (e.g. test matrix, test scripts)
Manage User Acceptance Testing of product changes through to production roll out
Review and Contribute to internal and external product documentation
Manage conformance process for Partner Integrations with QHR Products or QHR Integrations with external environments as required
Provide product knowledge, training, support and expertise when required for Design, Development, Sales, Business Development, Implementations and Client Services.
Contribute to software design in collaboration with UX/UI design and architects
Qualifications:
Have 5+ years education or experience in Business Analysis and/or Software Design
Are strong at verbal and written communication
Have experience with Software Development processes (SDLC and Agile)
Have an understanding of systems engineering concepts
Have education or experience with Data Structures (Databases, XML, SQL)
Are positive, creative, and you enjoy a challenge

This position plays a critical role in investigating and resolving daily inquiries related to system errors, incorrect rates and rating variables.

Our Underwriting Business Analyst requires strong communication, an analytical nature, and problem-solving skills in order to effectively support administrative and operational functions, many of which are of a time sensitive nature.

Responsibilities:
Monitor, respond to, and investigate underwriting Q & A inquiriesInvestigate and report system errorsMonitor, investigate and correct GISA/IBC data reporting errors or problemsUpdate rate tables, including rate group tables and postal code tablesVIN Management (MTO, VINlink and exceptions)GAPI management (Monitor/Correct MVR and Auto Plus load errors)Monthly review of Canada Post data files to identify changes requiring rate table changesLiaise with industry data reporting contacts (i.e. IBC, FA, CGI)Assist with ongoing projects, enhancements and initiativesOther duties as assigned
Qualifications:
Minimum of three years insurance related experienceUniversity degree, college diploma, or equivalent experiencePrevious commercial underwriting experience preferredCIP designation preferredExcellent knowledge of RTM and Duck Creek Technologies systemsProficiency with Microsoft Office SuiteAbility to work well under pressure with minimum supervisionExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAbility to clearly describe a problem and its solution to stakeholdersStrong customer service skillsAbility to multi-task between a variety of tasks, and deadlines

job_title: Business Analyst Intern, Strategy & Corporate Development
job_description:
Mississauga, ONWhat we’re about


IMAX Corporation is one of the world's leading entertainment technology companies, specializing in immersive motion picture technologies. The worldwide IMAX® theatre network is among the most important and successful theatrical distribution platforms for major event Hollywood films around the globe, with IMAX theatres delivering the world's best cinematic presentations using proprietary IMAX, IMAX® 3D, and IMAX DMR® technology. The IMAX® brand is world famous and stands for the highest-quality, most immersive motion picture entertainment. As the IMAX theatre network grows, so does the visibility of the IMAX brand – a name that is unique in the entertainment business.
IMAX Corporation hires individuals with diverse talents and backgrounds who are creative, entrepreneurial, innovative and passionate. We offer a challenging work environment operating in a global context, a competitive compensation and opportunities for development and growth. By welcoming diversity and respecting the value of work and lifestyle balance, IMAX has earned a reputation as a preferred employer.
Required Skills
What you’ll be doing:


This Analyst will serve as a key member of the Strategy & Corporate Development team, supporting the group VPs in identifying, evaluating and executing high impact strategic growth initiatives. The individual will support cross-functional work streams aimed at aggressively growing IMAX core business while simultaneously working to grow the brand outside of the cinema


Provide project management support for various team initiatives, developing and monitoring cross-functional work plans, project timelines, data/resource requirements, and specific steps/benchmarks.
Create highly polished power point presentations to support internal and external team presentations
Conduct due diligence of externally sourced business opportunities including: business partnerships, technology acquisition and M&A.
Conduct market research, including market sizing, competitive benchmarking, and consumer research
Interface with other groups within IMAX and externally to collect and synthesize data
Perform detailed analyses to help filter, assess, and implement strategic opportunities
Support multiple work streams associated with strategic projects and ensure clear communication with all key stakeholders
Develop business cases in support of the corporate development opportunities being pursued
Develop, use and maintain comprehensive financial models that forecast revenues, operating expenses, capital expenditures and funding scenarios
Perform industry reviews and prepare periodic reports
Manage the day to day operations of the group and any other administrative tasks as required


What we’re looking for:


Bachelor’s degree in, business administration, engineering, finance, economics, or a related area
2+ years’ experience with top-tier management consulting firm, or high impact strategy/corporate development role
Advanced to expert level Excel and PowerPoint skills
Excellent analytical and financial modeling skills
Excels at delivering results in a highly ambiguous environment
Entrepreneurial mindset and pattern recognition capability
Interest in emerging technologies and trends in the entertainment space
Ability to think strategically, to anticipate and identify problems, and develop creative solutions.
Self-motivated, well-organized, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills



Required Experience
For consideration, please apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest in IMAX but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


IMAX is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Calgary, ABLOCATION: Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB)
JOB NUMBER: 27905

Why you should join us:
Are you an effective communicator with strong influential, persuasion and negotiation skills? Are you someone who easily builds trust and relationships across multi-disciplinary teams? Working closely with the Change Operations Team Lead, you will execute the IT Operations Change and Knowledge Management processes. You will ensure that Request For Changes (RFC) are accurate and complete in order to approve them, and that that process governance activities are actioned, while mentoring others on the process and toolset. You will also provide key input into service operations strategy and be responsible for identification and implementation of continuous improvement opportunities.
You will use your expertise to:
Coordinate the Change Advisory Board meetings between Suncor, vendors and change requestors, ensuring technical and business representatives are able to provide input to changes regarding risk, cross application/environment impacts, etc.
Manage RFC from receipt through to closure and ensure failed changes are identified to appropriate parties and that results are captured through either the Post Implementation Review (PIR) or Major Outage review process
Monitor the effectiveness of the change process and recommending process improvements
Measure and report against Change Key Performance Indicators (KPI's) to determine performance of the process and to indicate success and failure rate of changes
Gather requirements for tool component enhancements that support Change Management processes such as ServiceNow access, change matrices and approver groups, as well as risk calculators through regular reviews and updates
Provide governance of Suncor’s RFC approval and supports governance of the process (flagged, expired, comments, ratings, etc.) for multiple vendors and audiences
Coordinate the knowledge management process requirements for the IT Operations organization which develops processes and then facilitate departmental outcomes to meet business needs
Build dedication towards effective teamwork, communicate the benefit of Operations Services in support of overall operational excellence, and assist with the management of the Service Operations team and individual performance improvement through effective mentoring
We’d like to review your application if you have…
Must-haves (minimum requirements):
Five years of IT operations experience
Strong practical knowledge of ITIL and ITSM standard methodologies
The ability to communicate effectively through all channels, including assimilation of complex technical data into a visual dashboard, fit for executive presentation, and well-articulated problem resolution skills
Deep understanding of the vendor outsourcing model and industry best practices, and experience managing vendor relationships
A Computer Science degree or a Technical College diploma
Alignment with our values of: safety above all else, respect, raise the bar, commitments matter and do the right thing
Preference for:
ITIL certification
Experience working within IT Management
Experience leading a team of direct reports
Where you’ll be working, your work schedule, and other meaningful information:
You will work out of our Calgary head office, located in the Suncor Energy Centre at 150 – 6th Ave S.W.
Hours of work are typically a regular 40-hour work week, Monday to Friday
The position has an on-call component; with a scheduled 24/7 on-call and/or shift basis for after-hours support to ensure service level commitments are achieved
You will be required to have working knowledge of departmental Incident, Problem and Change Management procedures in support of operations activities
Why Suncor?
We are Canada's leading integrated energy company with a business portfolio that includes oil sands development and upgrading, offshore oil and gas production, petroleum refining, and product marketing under the Petro-Canada brand. Our global presence offers rewarding opportunities for you to learn, contribute, and grow in a variety of career-building positions. We live by the value of safety above all else – do it safely, or don’t do it. Our strong track record of growth and a focus on sustainability mean tremendous potential for the future. Learn about our mission, vision and values.
In addition to rewarding job opportunities, we offer an attractive employee package, including:
Competitive base salary, compensation programs, and an annual incentive program
Flexible benefits package
Rewarding pension and savings plans
Stay connected to us:
Follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter for the latest job postings and news
Join our Talent Community and sign up to receive customized job alerts
Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see what we’re doing in the communities we live and work in
We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected. We will consider accessibility accommodations to applicants upon request.
Please note that our job postings are typically open for two weeks, so don't delay, apply now.
