About Us:
SnapTravel is a conversational commerce (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AOFWv4REqls) startup, allowing millions of users around the world to book their travel over messaging.
We are working on complex problems within NLP (understanding and replying to ambiguous human messaging), Conversational Commerce (optimizing conversions and user behavior over chat) and Machine Learning (choosing the best hotel automatically from a large data set with complex market dynamics) to push the boundaries of tech and travel globally.
SnapTravel has a fast-moving & transparent environment where everyone works as a team with complete transparency. We value data-driven decisions and risk-taking actions that add value to both the user and the team.
About the Role:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our growing team, working within Operations & Global Supply! As a Data Analyst at SnapTravel, you will be responsible for using data to answer strategic questions and drive our business strategy and customer success. With a strong analytical and data-driven approach, you are an expert in quantitative analysis and will use your skills to help our team organize, visualize and understand large data sets relating to Customer Experience and Global Inventory/Supply. This is an exciting opportunity to take ownership in a role as you run deep-dive analyses, create regression models, build dashboards and reporting to drive business growth and draw strategic insights from product and user data.
Challenges You'll Solve:
Data-driven Culture: you will be an ambassador for our data-driven culture, taking data and using it to answer business questions and drive strategy & decision making for our Operations & Global Supply teams
Data Management: you will pull, clean and organize raw data to create models that depict trends in the customer base to improve forecasting activities
Visualizations: you will help us to see and understand our data in a way that makes sense, creating automated dashboards and funnels for various internal teams to communicate customer pain points and successes
Hard Questions: your quantitative analysis will be an integral part of helping us to answer the toughest questions in our business, such as:
Where in the operations and customer success funnels should we concentrate our efforts and our spend? Where can we improve the most?
What key insights can be drawn from our users and the way that they use our product?
How can we analyze and better understand our Global Supply, to ensure that our pricing and hotel rate availability is optimized against user demand?
What A/B tests, experiments and multivariate product tests can be used to explore new ideas, and how can they be effectively tracked, measured and monitored? When are the results statistically significant? When do we pull the plug?
About You:
You have at least 2 years of experience in a Data Analysis role, ideally from the eCommerce industry
You are outstanding at pulling, cleaning and manipulating large sets of complex data to turn them into stories that key stakeholders can understand
You are an expert at writing SQL queries & doing data analysis with Python and/or R, and know your way around visualization tools (Tableau, Periscope, etc.)
You are naturally curious, and have a solid understanding of common statistical methods and their real-world applications
Experience working with Operations and Customer Support is an asset, particularly around setting, tracking and monitoring SLA's and KPI's
What To Expect:
After applying, you'll receive an email with all of this info. So feel free to skip it for now.
Review - you'll hear from us within 48 hours of applying
Phone Call - a quick call to learn who you are (resumes suck, we want to know the real you!)
Assessment - a chance for you to tackle a realistic problem and show us how you manage, analyze and visualize data
Onsite Interview - 60-90 min onsite with our Head of Operations to present your case study and tackle a whiteboarding problem collaboratively
Final Interview - connect with one of our Data Engineers, more Q&A to ask us about SnapTravel; deeper dive into culture and team; meet the Cofounders
The Perks:
Compensation: top of market salaries and equity; full benefits package
Flexible Work Arrangements: work from home, work remotely, take vacation... do what makes sense for you. This includes a holistic Parental Leave policy.
Top Talent: work with the best in the world, including Engineers and Leadership from Google, Facebook, Wish, Twitter, Asana, YouTube, Uber and more.
Build Something Great: most importantly, build a product used by millions around the world - have ownership, have impact, and do great work.

Burlington, ONTransUnion believes in investing in the best people. Our dynamic and diverse environment values and promotes the growth of associates in their jobs, roles and careers. Our organization supports ambitious individuals who seek career satisfaction and development.

Who We Are
At TransUnion, we are dedicated to finding ways information can be used to help people make better and smarter decisions. As a trusted provider of global information solutions, our mission is to help people around the world access the opportunities that lead to a higher quality of life, by helping organizations optimize their risk-based decisions and enabling consumers to understand and manage their personal information. Because when people have access to more complete and multidimensional information, they can make more informed decisions and achieve great things.

Every day TransUnion offers our employees the tools and resources they need to find ways information can be used in diverse ways. Whether it is helping businesses better manage risk, providing better insights so a consumer can qualify for his first mortgage or working with law enforcement to make neighborhoods safer, we are improving the quality of life for individuals, families, communities and local economies around the world.

About the Team
Global Decisioning leverages industry data and analytics, coupled with our technology assets, to deliver decision sets, decision criteria and decisioning solutions that help our business customers achieve more. Flexibility, the desire to contribute and an entrepreneurial spirit are valued here. Other highlights include the business-casual atmosphere where our leaders are interested in removing obstacles to your success, making this a great place to grow in your career. We’ve been instrumental in winning important new business and more challenges are on the way.

What you will do

In this role, you will serve as a project manager and business analyst to deliver decisioning and fraud market initiatives on our client's industry leading decisioning platform.
We are seeking a technically savvy individual with the strong collaborative skills required to manage projects of varying scope and work with customers to elicit and document business and functional requirements.
This is a hands-on and fast-paced role where the incumbent will be a key member of the team working on a specific product, and will be responsible for configuring the customers’ requirements into business ready solutions. You will deliver projects on time and on budget, making modifications to project phases as needed to address changes or problems to original scope. You will drive projects to delivery by performing project administrative tasks such as: creating and maintaining project plans, completing project estimates, identifying and reporting action items and risks, project status reporting, meeting facilitation and preparation of meeting notes. You will facilitate meetings with customers to identify all details of business objectives and requirements. The output from those meetings will result in requirement documentation authored by you. You will lead collaboration to help identify creative solutions to meet customer needs and address problem resolution. You will configure, test and deliver decisioning solution requests (for new solutions as well as changes to existing) to customers in a timely manner ensuring that appropriate standards are followed and customer needs are met. You will work with the team’s development and quality assurance associates to ensure captured requirements are interpreted and delivered correctly. You will serve as a Subject Matter Expert and provide non-incident support to customers, sales and other team members.

What you will bring A minimum of 4 years of applicable business experience in IT / risk industry (credit or financial services background preferred). At least 4 years of project management experience, as a member of a project team with at least 1 year as a project lead. PMP designation is a preferred. A minimum of 4 years elicitation and authoring requirements as well as interaction with external customers. Technical proficiency and skill level to learn and undertake solution configurations. Excellent listening and communication skills coupled with a strong technical aptitude. Demonstrated flexibility in dealing with change and adversity. Practical understanding and experience in Agile methodology.

Accommodation is available, including for applicants with disabilities, in accordance with applicable laws.

Data Analyst

Manager, Data Governance & Data Analytics

Staff

Toronto

Contract, (12 Months)

 1435



Company Profile:

We are a member organization of GS1, the world’s leading supply chain standards organization. As a neutral, not-for-profit organization, we enable our more than 20,000 subscribers – organizations of all sizes from over 20 sectors across Canada – to enhance their efficiency and cost effectiveness by adopting electronic supply chain best practices.


What We Do:
We develop standards that improve the way that business is conducted and allow Canadian businesses to compete on a global scale.
We deliver implementation services that enable businesses to implement standards to achieve supply chain efficiency.
We educate industry on how to incorporate collaborative commerce tools and processes into their businesses through seminars, conferences, and published guides and standards.
Watch our video: GS1 Canada Overview (https://youtu.be/3__lBt8SLvw)

Who We Represent:

As a user-driven and governed organization, our subscriber base includes organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries and sectors located across Canada and around the world.

Keys To The Role
The Data Analyst will support GS1 Canada’s industry exclusive Dashboard. This includes weekly data processing and validation of master data files, quality assurance testing and ongoing product development and process optimization.

The Data Analyst also plays an integral role in supporting Industry Managed Services (IMS) with subscriber and service level reporting and analysis. Working closely with other analysts, the candidate will extract, process and summarize subscriber data and be instrumental in ensuring data quality and integrity throughout the process.

The Data Analyst will assist the Manager of Data Governance & Analysis to translate business requirements into technical and functional solutions that allow IMS to deliver value added services to existing subscribers and promote enrolment of new subscribers which support cost recovery in the not-for-profit model.

Duties and Responsibilities
Execute the refresh of GS1 Canada’s Dashboard – a portal used by retailers to evaluate vendor compliance to services essential for commerce.
Validate retail data against GS1 Canada registries for completeness and perform quality assurance prior to promotion to production
Transforming, validating and modeling data with the purpose of understanding and drawing conclusions.
Liaise with senior and executive level stakeholders to identify criteria for business reporting and execute the technical solution delivery.
Evaluate business requirements gathered from multiple sources and identify underlying business needs vs wants and work with Manager to prioritize development efforts.
Create reports that go beyond presenting the numbers, but tells a story about the data being evaluated.
Validate system integrity through report generation and analysis from various internal databases as required (i.e. CRM, ECCnet Registry and Item Centre).
Assist with conducting full lifecycle data analysis and evolving analysis and reporting capabilities.
Champions initiatives to enhance data quality by identifying opportunities for continuous improvement and efficiencies in reporting, analysis and/or product development
Establish a brand identity by standardizing report processes and generating output with consistent results, accurate information and quality fit and finish.
Engage with Data Governance to document and maintain procedures for data management and reporting standards;
Ensure ongoing understanding of relevant emerging technologies and services provided by GS1 Canada.
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience
University degree or college diploma in business or a related area of study, with a focus on problem solving, analytics/mathematics and critical thinking
A minimum of 2-3 year’s work experience, preferably in data management and reporting capacity
Background in business intelligence (BI) and familiarity with master data management highly preferred.
Ability to analyze, understand and effectively communicate/confirm business reporting requirements, technical design and implementation
Meticulous with high attention to detail
Proven ability to apply critical thinking. Able to read between the lines to extrapolate requirements not explicitly written or identified and anticipates next steps
Takes pride in their work and validates with vigour to ensure accuracy and correctness
Displays passion and optimism; inspires respect and trust; exhibits confidence in self and others
Demonstrated ability to interact in a professional and efficient manner
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with ability to positively influence others to promote engagement
Able to speak and present to stakeholders at all levels
Strong organizational focus, with demonstrated analytical, problem solving and planning skills
Demonstrated and proven high level of proficiency with MS Office (Excel, Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint) with preference given to those with advanced expertise in Excel and familiarity with MS Access or other relational database systems
Working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamic CRM would be an asset
Exposure in coding SQL and/or VBA is desired
Proven ability to work on multiple projects, multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
Entrepreneurial spirit suited for fast-paced, results-based environment, requiring flexibility to ever-changing needs

Toronto, ONFor 35 years, Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) has helped innovative companies and their investors move ambitious ideas forward, fast. SVB provides targeted financial services and expertise through its offices and innovation centers around the world. SVB is currently growing into Canada to better service the booming Canadian tech and life sciences industries.

As the market leader in providing financial services to the world’s most creative tech and life science companies and investors, SVB has exposure to vast amounts of data covering the breadth of the startup and VC landscape. While data has been integral to SVB’s growth over the past 30+ years, we’re placing an even greater emphasis on being a data-driven organization by establishing the Analytics & Sales Operations team to support all sales focused aspects of our banking practice.

As part of a growing team in the Canadian market, this position offers you the opportunity to apply analytical skills to the private, venture-backed innovation ecosystem and gain a comprehensive understanding of the industry through the firm’s positive relationship management network. It is an opportunity to collaborate with Senior Management, drive the execution and recommendations of sales and market analysis, and work cross-functionally within the organization.

Research and profile targeted prospects, reporting and analyzing portfolios, identifying and aggregating current SVBFG relationships, and identifying cross-selling opportunities for the sales teams to execute.
Develop and drive the performance reporting and tracking of sales team performance and key metrics related to client acquisition, pipeline, product penetration, referral channels, etc.
Seek out areas of operational improvement and recommend development of more efficient and automated portfolio management and prospecting.
Report and synthesizing market trends.
Lead ad hoc business analytics requests as part of strategic initiatives.
Identify opportunities to use proprietary datasets and external company data to extract valuable insights and present these findings to key stakeholders, along with useable data to execute.
Where applicable, take responsibility for the maintenance and accuracy of company data within SVB’s data warehouse, CRM systems and other repositories.
Lead long term projects to improve the underlying data architecture and sales operations.
Establish relationships and information flow across groups within SVB.
Responsibilities:
Prospecting: Prospecting the market opportunity including tracking, reporting and catalyzing sales team’s action on leads, identifying trends to understand client share of early stage fundings and tracking activity of top Accelerator & Incubators to provide recommendations to the channel strategy.
Reporting and Analysis. Own monthly goal reporting and analysis; provide key insights to the sales team to be actioned. Develop dashboards for process flows such as referrals, market share and pitchbook prospecting.
Thought Leadership. Provide thought leadership such as content for events and speaking engagements. Craft internal sector and subsector insights reports.
Lead ad-hoc activities including analytics to support strategies and initiatives, partnering with Marketing, IT, Credit, and piloting process changes.

You will ideally have a combination of consulting experience, strong data analytics background and good interpersonal skills. Experience in forecasting, planning and reporting are an asset. Additionally, you will have the following:

Bachelor’s Degree

Adept at working with a distributed team
Client service oriented, with the ability to partner with individuals at all levels

Analytical mindset
Forecasting skills
Detail oriented
Ability to find opportunities to be pursued

Toronto, ONTemporary, InternshipAbout EPL
At EPL, we quantify changes to the use of our earth’s resources, so we can help our clients make better decisions for our world.

We help our clients improve both their environmental performance and their bottom line while at the same time providing independent, impartial strategic guidance. Our clients include some of the largest public and private companies in Canada, collectively representing approximately 2.5% of national electricity use.

We have built our reputation on doing things really well. We have a bright, talented, and engaging team with a lot of passion for what we do: helping large energy users across North America reduce their energy/carbon footprints and quantifying energy costs.

The Role
We are looking to bring aboard a high energy intern to join our Toronto office. We are open to considering a student entering their last year of study or a new grad as there is a possibility the opportunity may evolve into a permanent position. The opportunity represents a paid work-term beginning May 6th and concluding at August end.

This person would be given the opportunity to contribute in several areas across our business and teams. They will gain broad exposure to what we do and work alongside some of the best minds in the industry. A steep learning curve is anticipated.

Possible initial areas for contribution include:

Provide support on energy & water benchmarking, building certification (LEED & BOMA), and emissions/utility reporting projects.
Continuously work with utility providers to maintain accurate billing and consumption data.
Load data from multiple sources into our system; manage data flow and address issues.
File management responsibilities including downloading data and scanning documents.
Be directly involved in other miscellaneous office & operations tasks.

About You


We seek an intelligent and dynamic individual with strong problem-solving skills capable of handling a wide variety of technical challenges. High energy levels and a team-based approach are of great value; just as important is a determination to overcome obstacles.
Nominally, we seek a 3rd year student or spring 2019 grad (university or college). We are open to students or a new grad from environment & applied sciences, sustainability, data analytics, business admin, and engineering programs.
Passion for data (analysis & management) and intermediate proficiency in Excel are required; experience with SQL is a bonus.
It is important that the applicant can communicate succinctly and clearly (verbally and in writing).

Burnaby, BCData Analytics Analyst - (19000073)
Description

Move, Build, Grow your career!
As the premier global asset management and disposition company, Ritchie Bros. helps thousands of people around the world buy and sell heavy equipment, trucks, and other assets every month. With our multiple onsite and online selling platforms and commitment to first-class customer service, Ritchie Bros. is trusted worldwide for making buying and selling easy, efficient, fair, and transparent. If you’re an innovator with an entrepreneurial spirit, we want you to join our growing team – employed in a wide variety of positions from sales to operations to corporate functions – as we transform the global used equipment market.
Join us on our journey and move forward with us, build your success, and grow your career.
We’re looking for a Data Analytics Analyst to join our team in Burnaby, BC.
The Opportunity:

Our team of Analysts act as a support partner to the various business groups by providing objective and fact-based analytics to deliver deeper understanding of drivers of performance and the impact of different courses of action. Candidates will demonstrate a bias for action, present very strong analytical and problem-solving skills, be personable and have effective written and verbal communication skills.


In this role you’ll:
Act as an analytics partner for different business units and functional teams within the organization
Translate business questions into specific requirements and then deliver meaningful insights through a combination of expert technical skill and deep understanding of the business problem
Proactively identify solutions for improving the effectiveness of business activities within sales, marketing, and auction operations (Ritchie Bros. live and IronPlanet online)
Execute analysis of the company’s customer and business data, including predictive modeling, forecasting and statistical analysis.
Independently execute complex analysis - structuring analysis, executing analysis, synthesizing results, presenting results
Lead / take ownership of data related products - e.g., building report dashboards to support the business and /or close support of business line analysis
Routine reporting - Support regular monthly business reporting requirements
Assist our Data Management department with identifying and prioritizing business needs
Presentation of analysis - convene groups & teams to collaborate on a cross cutting issue or question
Independently execute complex analysis - structuring analysis, executing analysis, synthesizing results, presenting results
Lead / take ownership of data related products - e.g., building report dashboards to support the business and /or close support of business line analysis
Routine reporting - Support regular monthly business reporting requirements
Assist our Data Management department with identifying and prioritizing business needs
Presentation of analysis - convene groups & teams to collaborate on a cross cutting issue or question

Here’s what you bring:
 Bachelor’s degree in marketing, MIS, economics or similar
At least 3-5 years’ experience in a related role or industry
Expert MS Office skills (Excel, Access, VBA)
Proficiency with relational databases and SQL
Experience with data visualization tools (Microsoft BI, Tableau, etc)
Ability to work collaboratively with others to explore novel solutions for business stakeholders
Ability to synthesize their own and other’s thoughts into crisp / effective communications
Enthusiasm for trying new approaches and or developing creative solutions
Comfort speaking out in larger groups

This job will require you to:
Very limited travel may be required


What We Offer:

Our success is built on the drive and dedication of our people. As we grow around the globe, there will be many opportunities to advance your career – we’ve proven this throughout our 60+ years in business. And, we'll take care of you along the way. Here’s how:
Base salary + performance bonus
Comprehensive medical and dental benefits.
RRSP and an Employee Share Plan, both with company match.
Ongoing training, professional development and tuition reimbursement.
A multi-award winning LEED gold certified facility, in an exceptional park-like setting, featuring:
A subsidized, multi-award winning childcare centre.
A subsidized cafeteria, dry cleaning services, and free parking.
A workout facility, featuring advanced gym equipment, bike room, shower and changing facilities, and nutrition and fitness programs.
Proximity to miles of Fraser River walking paths, plus shops, restaurants and services.

Calgary Recreation’s Golf and Sport Development (GSD) division provides affordable, quality golf services and city-wide sport opportunities to citizens. Reporting to the Lead of Sport and Business Development, the Business analyst will support division strategy and policy development while also contributing to enhanced service delivery and business performance. Utilizing strong analytical skills with a clear understanding of operations, practices, research and strategies the Business Analyst will work as part of team to identify areas of improvement and implement creative solutions to achieve business goals. The successful candidate will be results oriented possessing highly developed reasoning skills along with a keen sense of financial and social return on investment and an aptitude to identify and execute innovative ideas. Primary duties include:
Responsible for pricing strategies as well as developing, implementing and leading projects that optimize revenue, increase site utilization and broaden the market for GSD services.
Identify opportunities, options and recommendations for the GSD leadership team based on engaging staff and outcomes of detailed data analysis. The incumbent will also provide input supporting strategy and policy development as well as workflow and service delivery improvements.
Evaluate the feasibility of potential opportunities (products and services) by assessing revenue and expense implications, defining operational impacts and articulating social benefits.
Identify, prioritize, plan and monitor GSD data collection and research needs while assuring coordinated approaches and alignment with corporate initiatives. Recommend appropriate frameworks, tools and approaches enabling the division to respond to customer needs and a changing environment.
Responsible for the creating and disseminating strategic insights, reports and presentation materials to assist in decision making and used to effectively communicate information to a broad range of audiences.
Develop and sustain strategic working relationships with internal stakeholders as well as external industry peers such as sport properties and associations.
Qualifications
A degree as well as competency in core aspects and techniques of business analysis, and a minimum of 3 years of relevant and practical experience; OR
A completed 2 year diploma (Business, Business Analysis, Recreation/Sport Management/Golf Course Administration related disciple or equivalent) as well as competency in core aspects and techniques of business analysis and a minimum of 5 years of relevant and practical experience.
Advanced experience using Microsoft Office Suite for data analysis, presentation and documentation.
Access to personal vehicle for occasional business use.
Preference will be given to candidates that are familiar with business intelligence and reporting software used to build reports and dashboards.
Success in this position requires strong problem-solving, market analysis (including identification of trends, benchmarking, and performance measurement); leadership, interpersonal and advanced communication skills.
Pre-employment Requirements
Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.
Union: CUPE Local 38

What we need.

Inbox Marketer offers value by telling our clients’ customer stories. We need a highly skilled and passionate Data Analyst to dive into the data in order to bring that story to life.

What you can bring to the table.

Your experience will allow you to provide insightful analysis for our Operations, Client Management and Strategy teams by integrating data from multiple data sources (email deployment platforms, applicable data marts/data lakes, web analytics, APIs, etc). Your knowledge of automating tasks will prepare you to find process efficiencies and improvements. We can rely on you to recognize and communicate issues or critical risks that would negatively impact project objectives. You are highly organized, creative, a problem solver, naturally curious and self-directed.

 You’re someone who can perform statistical analysis, score data, model data, cluster data and create test plans for data. You can develop interactive dashboards, analytical reports, and present clearly and effectively both internally and for clients. You have a general understanding of the role of digital marketing and how our campaigns serve to achieve overarching business and marketing KPIs.

 Our clients are EVERYWHERE!

And we mean that. We don’t specialize in servicing one industry. Where’s the fun in that? Our clients are some of the biggest brands in Canada and the US and are within nearly every industry: telecommunications, energy, retail, grocery, financial, not-for-profit, sports, and entertainment. Each company comes with its own challenges, and we’re up to solving them. That’s why we’re looking for bright minds just like you!

Marketing experience
Customer relationship experience

Expert level Excel skills

Experience with data visualization tools (i.e. Tableau, Pentaho)

Toronto, ONJOB SUMMARY
The role of Specialist, Business Systems Integration covers Shop Floor inventory/production bar-code labelling, scanning using Eagle RF Express in conjunction with QAD EE (and MFG/Pro), and oversees a QCE (QAD Cloud EDI) communications subsystem for all EDI traffic and trading partners. As a Tier-1 Automotive Supplier, AGS requires robust and stable data transactional systems connecting the Plant manufacturing locations with a central, Corporate-managed Cloud-based QAD EE 2017 ERP system. Support of the Eagle labelling, scanning, and transactional subsystem requires some on-the-ground shop floor work for requirements gathering, solutions assessment, project planning and deployment, plus on-going support. Oversight of the EDI transactional subsystems requires coordination and planning of new requirements, such as Trading Partner set-up and configuration, knowledge of basic EDI transaction types and standards, management of the selected Cloud-based EDI vendor, and Plant operational support.
MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Shop Floor Data Systems (Eagle RF Express)
Research, understand, plan, document, and implement barcode label standards as per AiAG, GM, FCA, and other customers
Manage and maintain WIP and FG barcode (2D, 3D) formats and data content in conjunction with QAD EE (and MFG/Pro) ERP environments
Interact with all AGS (and Tiercon) Plants to understand Plant operations, assess and prioritize shop-floor labelling and scanning opportunities, plan and coordinate projects, and actively deploy and support solutions, working with Plant Materials/Quality/Production staff and Corporate ERP and IT staff
Safe Operations on the shop floor of automotive manufacturing Plant environments (i.e.; awareness of and compliance with Plant Safety rules and PPE requirements)
EDI (Electronic Data Interchange)
Facilitate and coordinate general EDI requirements and support between AGS (and Tiercon) manufacturing Plants and QAD Cloud EDI hosting team
Understand basic and intermediate EDI data transactions, with the ability to lead problem determination, coordinate new or changed data map requirements, monitor data flow/transactions, and integration with QAD EE (and QAD MFG/Pro).
Provide level-2/3 support between Plant manufacturing teams and liaison with other IT and/or external EDI services provider
Monitor GM, FCA and other customer and supplier EDI standards and requirements
EMPLOYMENT REQUIREMENTS
Strong working knowledge of Eagle RF Express and/or other shop floor labelling systems
Experience using and knowledge of ERP & MRP systems, with a very strong preference for QAD.
5 years+ manufacturing shop-floor support experience
Good understanding of business processes within the automotive industry
General knowledge of IT systems and networks
Strong skills for requirements gathering and analysis, prioritization, project management, support
Strong communication, writing, and documentation skills
Occasional travel to Plants within Southern Ontario and Michigan, US (Detroit area), as required for requirements gathering, project management and deployment, Plant support

ABOUT US
Day after day, our teams forge close connections and learn from one another. The result has been a culture that supports progress and one that we are proud to say provides for meaningful, sustainable and rewarding careers.
If you're searching for an organization that will offer a dynamic and rewarding career then AGS could be the perfect fit! You will have exposure to many different and interesting disciplines, plant operations, and a variety of internal and external stakeholders. You will always be surrounded by passionate and enthusiastic coworkers all working towards shared goals.

ACCESSIBILITY STATEMENT
AGS Automotive Systems welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

job_title: Business Analyst, Enterprise Data Program (12 month contract)
job_description:
TemporaryBusiness Analyst, Enterprise Data Program (12 month contract)
The opportunity
As a Business Analyst, you will be passionate about implementation, support and improvements of data systems that enable corporate functions such as market & credit risk, collateral and liquidity, capital markets trading and portfolio management, private capital, performance measurement and regulatory compliance.
You will play a key role underlying all initiative delivery. Your responsibility is to understand, document and facilitate agreement on requirements, approaches, specifications and decision variables that enable the delivery of appropriate solutions to achieve the business and project goals.
Who you'll work with
You will be joining the Business Analyst team. In this dynamic role, teamwork will be the key to your success, working with other solution teams including: Relationship & Application Management, Project Management, Solutions Engineering, external vendor consultants and QA on a dynamic portfolio of initiatives that encompasses production support, small & medium improvements and projects. The ultimate goal is to deliver on business needs and provide customer value.
Additionally, the Business Analyst elicits client needs for information and functional capabilities. You will document requirements, develop functional specifications and ensure requirements traceability as part of delivering application and information solutions to internal business partners.
What you'll do
Engage business clients to elicit business requirements and understand objectives
Produce business analysis related documentation, including (functional and non-functional) requirements, current and future state processes and workflows, and solution specifications to a high quality standard
Produce business requirements for data, identify data sources and deliver data specifications
Work with data vendor manager to establish agreements for new external vendor content
Document the flow and transformation of data from suppliers through data repositories and to end user datamarts/applications
Work with business and solution teams to ensure that solutions being delivered meet business intent and provide business value
Work with QA teams to develop test plans and ensure they understand the business requirements and are able to test solutions appropriately
Engage business clients and oversee User Acceptance Testing
Reference and apply our internal Delivery Framework in the context of delivering of business analysis functions and materials
Participate in the initiation and planning of projects - including facilitating the definition of objectives, scope, and WBS as well as provide work estimates
Provide coaching, professional guidance and support to Business Analyst peers and co-ops, as required, to foster professional development
Contribute to the operation and improvement of the delivery team
Exercise appropriate judgment in identifying and calling out risks and issues
Build proven partnerships with Business management and staff, Client Relationship and Application Managers, Project Managers and other key partners.
What you'll need
University degree or equivalent experience (Business/Finance, Financial Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering)
Having additional certifications such as CFA, Certified Enterprise Data Professional, Certified Business Analysis Professional, Process improvement methodology accreditation or Accounting certification would be an asset
Minimum 4 years’ experience for business analysis in the institutional investment industry
Solid understanding of various asset classes including Equities, Fixed Income, Options, Futures, FX and Swaps
Ability to prioritize, coordinate and complete tasks to meet deadlines
Superb communication skills (written and verbal)
Ability to work independently and in a team environment, collaborating effectively with business, delivery and technology partners
Experience collaborating with project delivery and technology teams to deliver solutions that tackle business problems and meet business requirements
Experience in translating business requirements to technical specifications
Ability to build and maintain strong working relationships with multiple levels of clients, team and partners
Robust understanding of agile and waterfall project management delivery methodologies and the difference between needs and wants
Enthusiastic customer service focus
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience in planning and leading UAT
Experience with the following technologies (in order of priority) is an asset: PL/SQL, MS SQL Server Databases, Bloomberg, Markit EDM (Cadis), SimCorp Dimension, Charles River Development, Findur, Oracle EDQ (Datanomic), PowerBI
What we're offering
Pay for performance environment that offers competitive salary and incentives
Numerous opportunities for professional growth and development
Guaranteed retirement income through a defined benefit pension plan
Discount programs including Edvantage and Perkopolis

Requisition ID: 57940
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
Overview
In this role you will build and maintain the firm’s Capital Markets RiskWatch (RW) data and feeds for a variety of market risk, credit and counterparty risk and trade floor risk management systems and consumers.
The team is responsible for sourcing financial product data from a 50+ front-office and back-office systems into a centralized data repository, mapping sourced data to risk models and ensuring that pricing/valuations are as expected for downstream risk systems and data consumers.
You are also expected to have a good understanding of risk management and risk pricing models for the majority of the main capital markets products, basic principles of data management, business analysis and a thorough familiarity with SDLC. As part of onboarding new source systems’ data and maintaining current data feeds, the candidate is expected to create/modify risk model and product specifications to ensure correct pricing, perform a variety of data validation and testing to ensure data quality and manage relationships with the source system teams and downstream data consumers.
What we are looking for?
In this role we expect you to;
Use product knowledge and understanding of financial modelling to validate the pricing of a wide range of financial product
Within the context of the project, lead discussions with business partners (market risk, credit counterparty risk, trade floor risk) to better understand the business requirements and to determine potential impacts on the project scope and objectives, and to modify the requirements management plan, if required
Determine the best approach for eliciting, analyzing, validating, and prioritizing requirements to ensure that the necessary information is captured from the relevant stakeholders to address the business needs
Ensure all necessary stakeholders are engaged in communications between the Information Technology (IT) project team and the business to help identify who should be involved in the identification and development of the requirements
Participate in the development of strategic and tactical IT plans to help inform future project work of the direction of the business
Are you the right person for the role?
You Have;
A Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline and 3+ years of business analysis/risk experience OR a bachelor’s degree and 5+ years business analysis/risk experience
A good understanding of risk valuation models for a wide range of financial products
Solid knowledge of a wide range of financial products including swaps, bonds, FX products, commodity products and equity derivative
Knowledge of RiskWatch or of another risk system a plus
Solid business understanding and knowledge of the use of technology and applications in business
Understand and be familiar with the application of techniques associated with data modeling, process modeling, and user-centred design within the context of the organizational standards
Solid communication skills
Advanced writing and documentation skills
Advanced problem-solving and analytical skills
Advanced understanding of Excel
Knowledge of SQL, Python (or any other scripting language) a plus
What’s in it for you?
The opportunity to join a forward-thinking company surrounded by a collaborative team of innovative thinkers.
A great opportunity to leave your “stamp” as we are undergoing multiple exciting and forward thinking initiatives.
A rewarding career path with diverse opportunities for professional development.
Internal development to support your growth and enhance your skills.
A competitive compensation and benefits package.
An organization committed to making a difference in our communities– for you and our customers.
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto
As Canada’s International Bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. We are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

Waterloo, ONAthena Software is hiring a Senior Business Data Analyst to join our expanding team!

Athena makes Penelope, a case management software system for social service agencies and non-profits around the world. We have hundreds of clients on five continents - we estimate that more than 20,000 people use Penelope every day, and that our clients help over 1 million people each year.

About Athena

We are a group of 85, with employees located in Canada, United States, Australia, and the United Kingdom.

Our product is a unique, flexible and comprehensive solution for social service agencies, and this spirit is also reflected in our company culture of collaboration and commitment to community.

At Athena, we promote a team atmosphere, and believe very strongly in fostering a true work / life balance. Our company is owned and run by people with families - we know how important it is to spend time away from the computer and phone, and we hope you feel the same way.

What You’ll Do

As Senior Business Data Analyst, reporting to the Manager of Tailored Services, you will work with Athena Software’s clients and product team to develop common reporting data sets for Athena’s market sectors as well as custom client reports. You will tailor solutions to meet these needs by querying a Penelope (PostgreSQL) database, creating custom views and functions to facilitate updating and designing reports and creating data visualizations and/or data exports in multiple formats.

You gather and document requirements, and provide informed quotes for estimated effort.
You write SQL queries and create visual representations of data in third party tools such as Excel, Tableau, and XML.
You communicate with Athena’s clients regarding process and change requests, understanding the business issues and data challenges of their organization and industry.
You liaise with project and business leaders to interpret analytical requirements.
This position is permanent, full-time, and located in our Waterloo, Ontario headquarters.

Who You Are

You are a problem solver by design; analytical and client-oriented, you possess at least five years related experience in Mathematics, Computer Science, or Programming.

You have experience creating dashboard reports in Tableau (a Tableau certification is preferred).
You have strong knowledge of SQL and relational database management systems, with experience in querying databases with complex relationships between tables.
With outstanding written and verbal communication skills, you are able to succeed in a dynamic, driven environment, trail-blazing creative solutions to complex challenges.
You are able to learn new applications swiftly, independently, and with confidence.
You have expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel.
You have an Undergraduate University Degree or equivalent experience in Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science or Programming
Does this sound like you? If so, please apply with Resume and Cover Letter to the link provided.

Markham, ONCOMPANY:

Doxim is a leading provider of Customer Engagement Software solutions for Financial Service Organizations. Our software helps financial institutions transform their client experience, communicate effectively throughout the client lifecycle and improve cross-sell and upsell activities that drive increased wallet share. Doxim’s SaaS Customer Engagement Platform addresses key digitization challenges, from automated client onboarding, through improved, personalized communications to anytime, anywhere content access, tailored to a clients’ channel preferences.
With 7 locations across the US and Canada, we are growing very fast, and seeking this role to help drive and accelerate our growth.

JOB DEFINITION:

As a Business Systems Analyst, you are expected to be an advanced professional in the systems & process design and implementation space and have experience on low, medium and high software implementation projects. The Business Systems Analyst will work with clients to understand their financial technology needs and identify opportunities to improve the document output for their end clients. You will solicit, understand, and document business requirements, processes and workflows developing both written and visual depictions of requirements and process flows.

You will work closely with business stakeholders to ensure the integration of business and functional requirements into plans.

Key Responsibilities:
Work independently with minimal supervision, establish priorities, and use strong communication, analytical and problem solving skills to add value to each project,
Participate as part of a team with targeted deliverables, working on initiatives designed to improve processes, systems, and applications which support our key businesses
Develop technical requirements through business requirement gathering techniques to understand scope, functional & non-functional relationships, dependencies, risks, and facilitate the communication between business and technology areas
Lead client requirements discussions, including but not limited to:
 Data mapping, logic and business rules
Cheque matching when applicable
Complete a handover to development including well documented and clearly defined requirements that satisfy client business needs Assume an ownership role, on behalf of the client to ensure deliverables meet business/end-user requirements Build and maintain positive working relationships by effectively communicating and sharing knowledge with your team/peers Continuously enhance knowledge/expertise in own area and keep current with leading-edge technologies trends/developments and develop expertise in analytical tools and techniques that can contribute to effective solution development/delivery Scope change requests (add, change, move requests) Assist with enforcing project goals and direction in order to support the strategic business objectives Ability to take ownership and lead by example Travel 25%

Business Skills:
Strong analytical, problem-solving, negotiation, and decision-making skills; able to evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, and decompose high-level information into requirements.
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) with the ability to adjust communication style to present technical and non-technical information to a wide variety of clients with differing levels of knowledge.
Solid client relationship management skills with the ability to elicit requirements through effective interviews and requirements gathering workshops, and motivate stakeholders towards a goal or to reach consensus
Ability to create requirements document in an environment with some ambiguity or unknowns and get them signed off
Strong ability to work independently and meet project timelines, and drive stakeholders to delivering within determined timelines
Strong ability to recognize gaps, risks and issues in a timely manner, so as to raise them and participate in discussions on how to manage them
Ability to identify and effectively resolve problems creatively and collaboratively with diverse stakeholders
Ability to produce quality documentation/reports for internal clients
Excellent ability to present information (e.g. requirements documents, diagrams) to senior management in a manner that is clear, concise and open
Very strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to build effective working relationships, solicit co-operation and resolve conflicts with a variety of stakeholders both internally and externally
Ability to successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously
Excellent organization and time management skills
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in business, computer science or a related equivalent with excellent knowledge of BA tools and techniques.
5+ years of experience in the Business Systems Analyst field
Working knowledge of Project Management Methodology
Experience within a software or ECM company;
Strong MS Office and Visio skills

Exposure to the financial services industry
Experience in the software industry

Ideally a Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP)

As part of the hiring process at Doxim, job candidates MUST complete The Predictive Index® Behavioral and Cognitive Assessments. Please set aside 5-10 minutes for the Behavioural Assessment completion, although you have unlimited time to complete the assessment once it is started. The Predictive Index Behavioral Assessment does not measure intelligence, education or experience. It simply measures work and communication needs. Please use the link provided to take the assessment.

https://assess.predictiveindex.com/zPE96

Once you have completed the Predictive Index Behavioural Assessment you will be sent an email containing a link to complete The Predictive Index® Cognitive Assessment. The Cognitive Assessment is a timed assessment that includes Verbal, Numerical and Abstract Reasoning questions. Respondents are instructed to answer as many questions as possible in the allotted 12 minutes. The score of the PI Cognitive Assessment is a scaled score based on the number of correct responses and is a measure of general cognitive ability, or the ability to quickly learn and grasp new information. Please set aside 12 uninterrupted minutes for completion and complete within 48 hours. The Predictive Index Cognitive Assessment does not measure intelligence, education or experience. It simply measures a person’s capacity to learn, adapt and grasp new concepts.

Doxim company encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Applicants with disabilities may notify us of any accommodations needed to support your participation in the recruitment process. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying. Please be aware that only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted for this position.

Working within our Strategic Plan, Cambridge Connected, and committing to our values of Integrity, Respect, Inclusiveness and Service, the successful candidate will work together to help the City of Cambridge achieve our vision: A place for people to prosper – alive with opportunity.

Job Profile

Reporting to the Manager of Business Systems GIS Development Services, within the Technology Services Division of the Corporate Services Department.
What you will be doing

We are looking to hire a talented Business System Analyst who will play key roles in supporting SAP enterprise system. The successful candidates will participate in identifying, evaluating and developing systems and procedures that are efficient and meet user requirements. Using creativity and problem solving, individual will look at the big picture and provide ideas and recommendations, ultimately developing detailed business requirements, system documentation, workflow procedures, and data modeling. Additionally, you will learn business unit needs and translate these and work with development team members to deliver new solutions and applications and/or enhance current systems.
Education

Undergraduate Level - Four years or equivalent in Computer Science or Similar

Experience and Knowledge

Five years of related work experience along with the knowledge and skills related to:
Performing business process analysis and providing appropriate system solutions by identifying, validating and documenting client requirements.
Preparing detailed functional specifications for customized development activities including reports, interfaces, conversions, enhancements and forms in coordination with HR and Payroll.
Facilitating workshops to collect business requirements. Interprets those business requirements in configuring SuccessFactors and SAP HCM to properly work with other corporate applications and to HR support processes
Configuring SAP HR / Payroll modules in S4 HANA and FIORI to meet business objectives
Configuring and supporting SuccessFactors suite of products that includes Employee Central, Onboarding, Recruiting, Compensation, Learning Management System, Performance and Goal
Supporting daily operations that includes troubleshooting and resolving technical issues related to HR activities such as Recruitment, Payroll, Time and Attendance, etc.
Writing test plans, participating in functional/integration testing and supporting testing activities with the business and third party vendors
Participating in the development of training materials and delivering training where required.
Strong Knowledge of SAP ERP, ABAP, Basis, Security, SAP HANA, SAP Process Integration (PI).
Strong working knowledge of integration between Employee Central and SAP S4 HANA
Coordinating and assisting in development of BI reports including management of the security
Ability to work effectively as a team member and work collaboratively with others in a multidisciplinary team.
We will ask you for these items if you are hired

Proof of your current and valid certificate(s) and/or educational qualifications.

Worker Health and Safety Awareness Training Certificate from the Ministry of Labour

Valid G driver's license.

Your compensation

This position is within Grade 12 of the inside workers union salary schedule and has an annual salary range of $83,096 to $88,318. We offer a comprehensive benefit package and are an Ontario Municipal Employees Retirement System (OMERS) employer.
Hours of work

The current regular hours of work are in accordance with the collective agreement, however currently are 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 pm. (35 hours per week).

Toronto, ONPermanentHelp us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast

dates back to

1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

Our Merchandising team is responsible for connecting our quality products and services with our customers. The team uses planning frameworks and tools to provide recommendations that will ensure financial results and provide decisions on key inputs such as point of sales forecasts.

What you’ll do

The Category Business Analyst plays a direct role helping equip Canadians to live life to the fullest every day, by managing vendor processes, examining new and existing product lines, and performing analysis that better prepares us to meet the evolving needs of our customers.

You will support Category Business Managers in creating a compelling and relevant assortment by providing robust analysis and key insights that strengthen the brand with our customers and that deliver against the category level objectives and financial goals. You will inspire the Canadian Tire customer experience with your passion for continually improving processes and product lines, helping us be there for Canadians when they need us.

To excel as a Category Business Analyst, you will be creative and highly organized with a passion for delivering results. You will be responsible for:

Growing your merchandising category by providing support to the Category Business Managers by driving operational excellence accurately and on time

Demonstrating competency in organization, analytics, collaboration and communication

Leading the flawless execution of the line review process and assortment updates

Ensuring timely and accurate product information management

Coordinating samples with vendors in support of various CTR requirements

Acting as a point of contact for our vendors and third-party suppliers on day to day activities and program set-up

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

Our best Category Business Analysts are progressive thinkers, with solid experience in retail merchandising/buying, and managing cross-functional partnerships. This group is masterful at project coordination and planning, and have highly accomplished quantitative, problem-solving skills. To be successful in this role, you should have an analytical mindset with a strong understanding of utilizing data in order to create recommendations. Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with both internal and external clients is required. A solid understanding of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint is an asset.

About Canadian Tire Corporation

Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of

Canada’s Top Employers

.

To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on

The opportunity


As an Experience Management (EM) Analyst you will be responsible for supporting the Canadian Experience Management team by creating reporting and commentary around deployment; entering and ensuring accuracy of data in our resource management system; supporting projects and initiatives in the Advisory practice and capacity management optimization. You will receive regular supervision on a day-to-day basis to set appropriate priorities.

Your key responsibilities

Act as a subject matter resource on Experience Management tools/enablers
Create routine reports using existing templates that show utilization performance, availability forecasts, and variances between actual and forecasted utilization
Create/maintain accurate client-serving profiles in EM systems (i.e. roster updates, new hire records, etc.)
Partner with Talent/HR on headcount reconciliation and with Learning & Development to ensure schedules accurately reflect learning assignments and maintain relevant reporting
Assist with deployment activities by conducting skill and bio/CV searches that focus on matching project need(s) with required skills, development opportunities and project risk
Assist with the creation/maintenance of accurate personnel and client project schedules
Partner with deployment EMs to proactively identify resources that will become available in short term (i.e. next 2-3 weeks)
Partner with deployment EMs to proactively monitor and highlight unassigned resources in order to minimize unassigned time
Demonstrate effective teaming with Canadian EM team by proactively/creatively responding to analytics requests
Participate in ad hoc projects as required (i.e. task forces, reporting, process improvement committees, training manuals etc)
Identify ways to improve Experience Management processes and contribute to EM team initiatives
Participate in the orientation of new hires by providing an overview of the Experience Management function and operating model
Partner with the Talent Team (i.e. HR) on Performance Management initiatives
Actively support Experience Management and EYU enablers including Retain/ARMS; My Competencies; EY Discover; Mercury, etc.
Work with peers across the Americas Advisory EM by contributing to EM priorities; task forces; and/or projects


Skills and attributes for success
The individual in this role must have strong reporting, deployment and collaborative attributes.
To qualify for the role you must have

1-3 years of experience in a professional services firm desirable
Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Excel skills
Proficient in other Microsoft applications
Strong analytical skills, with attention to detail
English language skills - very strong written and verbal communication
French language skills a plus
Proven client service focus, with an ability to resolve issues quickly, with a sense of urgency
Strong problem-solving skills
Flexible in adapting to constantly changing priorities
Outstanding teamwork and interpersonal skills
Confident at working independently and a self-starter
Adept at handling multiple tasks with strong organizational skills
What working at EY offers


At EY, our Total Rewards package supports our commitment to creating a leading people culture - built on high-performance teaming - where everyone can achieve their potential and contribute to building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. It's one of the many reasons we repeatedly win awards for being a great place to work.


We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:

Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
About EY


As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. Recognized as one of Canada's top employers, EY continually strives to be a great place to work and with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.


If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.


Make your mark. Apply today.


EY is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

job_title: Business Analyst - MBovis - Hamilton or Christchurch
job_description:
Hamilton, ONContractThe opportunity:

We are seeking a Business Analyst for a two year fixed-term role to assist with the eradication of the cattle disease Mycoplasma bovis. You will be working as part of a diverse team seeking to eradicate Mycoplasma bovis from the dairy and beef industries across New Zealand. The role has an operational focus and will assist in developing our operational data and information sets for management.

AsureQuality has been contracted by the Ministry for Primary Industries to implement all operational tasks associated with eradicating the disease. A new business unit has been established and operations are implemented via four regional offices. We are now seeking someone to ensure that service delivery targets are being met across all regions, and that the appropriate resources are in place. Working with the Operations, Technical and Compliance Managers, you will be developing reporting systems for the field operations, sizing up specification changes, providing monthly reports and assisting with resource supply and demand modelling. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst to join our team and assist with the analyzing and implementation of systems and processes that will ensure a streamlined operation for the wider business unit.

About you:

Ideally you will have a Tertiary qualification in commerce or senior management, with proven managerial experience. You will be knowledgeable in people management and employee relations also. You will have experience in scenario planning or workload assessment and be proficient in data analysis. Previous experience with Primary Industries and an understanding of the dairy or beef industries would give you a distinct advantage. You will be able to think outside the box, challenge ideas and be able to work independently and also as part of a team.

About us:

AsureQuality provides biosecurity surveillance and response services to help protect New Zealand against exotic pests and disease incursions. We have a long history of working with MPI, successfully managing, developing and delivering capability and responding to incursions.

Join us today!

job_title: Junior Business Analyst, Accounting and Finance
job_description:
Toronto, ONIf you're looking for a workplace where employees are passionate about their work environment, then read on. What sets Equitable Bank apart from other companies is its culture. We celebrate and embrace the fabric of diversity, the employee engagement process and collectively take pride in our business successes. Our commitment to our customers, our partners and our employees creates a stimulating and exciting atmosphere that generates innovative products and outstanding service quality.

Equitable Bank is Canada's ninth largest independent Schedule I bank, serving Canadians coast to coast. It offers a diverse suite of residential lending, commercial lending and savings solutions, including high-interest savings products and GICs. Through its proven branchless approach and customer service focus, Equitable Bank has grown to approximately $25 billion in assets under management. Most recently, Equitable Bank launched a digital banking operation, EQ Bank, and introduced the EQ Bank Savings Plus Account. Equitable Bank currently employs over 600 employees across the country.

Within Equitable Bank's Core Lending business, Single Family Lending Services funds mortgages for owner-occupied and investment properties across Canada, while Commercial Lending Services provides mortgages on a variety of commercial properties on a national basis.Equitable's Securitization Financing business originates and securitizes insured residential mortgages under the Canada Mortgage and Housing ("CMHC") administered National Housing Act.Equitable Bank also offers a range of deposit products including short-term, long-term and Cashable GICs, available in non-registered or Tax Free Savings Account ("TFSA") across Canada. And it offers a High Interest Savings Account, available from authorized investment advisors through the FundServ network.

Equitable Bank is a growing Canadian financial services business and a wholly owned subsidiary of Equitable Group. It was founded in 1970 as The Equitable Trust Company.

Job Title: Junior Business Analyst, Accounting and Finance
Department: Finance and Accounting
Reports To: Director, Finance Projects & ICOFR

Purpose of Job

A member of the Finance Projects team, the Junior Business Analyst represents the team on SIT PPlus and other system enhancement projects to ensure accurate, timely and relevant financial accounting and reporting processes. The candidate will work closely with the Accounting and Finance and Business Analysis teams, as well as other departments, to assist with production support, testing, roll out of upgrades & enhancements, and to document system processes.

Main Activities:
1. New Projects (20%)
Assist with status reporting, change control, issue and risk management, quality assurance frameworks, artifact review, sign-off and archiving, regulatory compliance
Document requirements, write test cases and execute testing to ensure delivered solution results match expected outcomes
Track project milestones
Ensure project issues and risks are identified, quantified, managed and tracked

2. System Enhancement Projects (40%):

Conduct interviews to understand business requirements and system capabilities
Document requirements and write test cases to ensure requirements are met
Evaluate current processes and recommend changes for improvement
Develop and execute test plans in order to roll out new enhancements

3. Production Support (20%):

Provide support to the SIT PPlus user base by troubleshooting system issues
Track financial system-related issues (e.g. general ledger, transaction processing, or system reporting)
Determine the root cause of core system issues, i.e. system limitation/configurations, user training, or process & controls
Assist with technical and/or qualitative analyses to diagnose identified issues and develop recommendations to solve them with applicable resources
Analyze data and financial/operational processes to identify, research and provide recommendations
Execute project plans to remediate identified issues

4. Documentation (20%):

Responsible for maintaining up-to-date documentation of processes & functionality as well as end user manuals

Knowledge/Skill Requirements:

Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate clearly and concisely with Accounting and Finance, Business Analysis and IT teams
Understanding of financial accounting and reporting systems with relevant experience performing system enhancements, upgrades, troubleshooting issues, and system implementations
Good understanding of technology from network, file system, database to software development concepts
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or Business Administration
Strong understanding of Accounting & Financial reporting concepts, preferably completed/working towards an accounting designation
Proactive self-starter who is eager to learn and can work independently
Experience in re-structuring processes to enhance efficiency & controls
Proficient user of all MS desktop tools, specifically Excel, PowerPoint and Visio
Detail oriented and an analytical mindset
Experience using databases (i.e. SQL) is an asset
Familiarity with banking operations and term deposit & mortgage products will be a definite asset

Equitable Bank is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. All candidates considered for hire must successfully pass a criminal background check and credit check to qualify for hire. While we appreciate your interest in applying, an Equitable recruiter will only contact leading candidates whose skills and qualifications closely match the requirements of the position.

Required Skills, Knowledge and Experience

Owned or contributed to business requirements definition for data-centric projects
Defined data-specific needs and characteristics, as derived from business requirements
Worked with business and source system stakeholders on defining approach and content for data sourcing
Perform advanced data discovery and profiling, in order to establish suitability to meet needs
Understanding of key Data Quality (DQ) concepts and how to apply them to the process of data acquisition and integration
Ability to contribute toward overall data integration / data movement design at a high-level
Hands on Project delivery experience
Strong SQL Skills: ANSI SQL, T-SQL, DB2 SQL
Understanding of DW and Database concepts, with proven ability of applying them in practice to a solution
Demonstrated experience in owning and documenting the following deliverables, in addition to be able to explain when they are needed and why:
Source system extract specifications
Functional specifications
Data transformation specifications, which include design-level details for aspects such as: surrogate key assignment, change data capture, etc.
Fine grain data mappings with complex transformation rules
Contribute to data model design
Proven experience in providing direction & support to offshore delivery teams
Demonstrated ability in working with and supporting project delivery team members (Business Analysts, Business Stakeholders, Data Architect/Modelers, QA Analysts, Report Design Developers, PMO/PM, Audit Governance and Infrastructure Security)
Self -starter, with excellent communication to both business and technical audience
Ability to work under pressure, often in a self-supervised capacity
No GTA travel limitations
Willing to work overtime as required

Desirable Skills and Experience

Producing report design specifications
Supported Project Manager with estimations, dependencies, resource allocation
Certifications (e.g. CSC, PMP)

Education

Bachelor Degree in Computer Science and Engineering

Toronto, ONSummary

As a member of CBRE’s National Research team, the primary role of this position is to design, develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analysis tools and other strategies in support of the firm’s commercial real estate market database. Working with the Research team and other departments, the candidate will produce marketable products using CBRE's proprietary data.

Key Responsibilities

Participates in the design, development, testing, maintenance and implementation of databases.
Develops tools and drives efforts to better support research and insights capabilities.
Working with management to prioritize business and information needs and seeks out and presents new opportunities for producing marketable data content.
Provides quality assurance of data sets and implementation of data quality controls.
Collaborates with the various service lines within CBRE including Valuation and Advisory Services, Leasing and Investment Brokerage, Finance, and Digital & Tech.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Requirements

Bachelor's degree, preferably with emphasis in Computer Science or related field.
Data project experience with creation, development, and/or delivery of final products.

Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and Access, including VBA and Python programming.
Ability to analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations.
Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, concise terms.
High-level experience in methodologies and processes for managing large scale databases.
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.
Understanding of best practices for data governance.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Team Player. Ability to cross-collaborate with various departments and team members.

Basic knowledge of financial terms and principles.
