understand the business to be able to contribute to solutions that enable the

information streams; and are proficient in the utilization of appropriate
tools, models and techniques as part of the requirements gathering process. Successful candidates will have experience in
fulfilling their role in both waterfall and agile environments.

Successful candidates will have experience working in large,
complex programs. Candidates will need to demonstrate experience leading other
team members including other Senior Business Analysts on the overall direction
and approach to business analysis. The successful candidates will also need to
demonstrate an ability to work across multiple projects within portfolios and
have evidence of experience in supporting teams moving to an operational model.

Acts as a liaison between the development group and business
units for the development and implementation of new systems and enhancement of
existing systems.

and recommends appropriate systems alternatives and/or enhancements to current
systems.

translates them into documentation for changes or enhancements to business

Delivers documentation for client validation to support
approval processes and to the technical project members to deliver the solution

strategy and approaches

changes or enhancements to business processes, data/information, and
information systems

and technical support services as an application subject matter expert

Works closely with the project manager, delivery manager,
and/or Product Owner(s)

Qualifications

Screening Criteria

Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Management
Information Systems, Business or Accounting

At least 7 years of experience in business system analysis

Education and/or Certification in Business Analysis from a recognized
college, university or organization

Experience and knowledge of information/data management
concepts including: metadata management, data quality, data mapping and
modeling, and data architecture

Demonstrated experience working in large complex programs,
being involved in multiple projects simultaneously, leading other team members,
including other BAs and Senior Business Analysts on the team, and leading
multiple streams of work

Experience and/or certification in Agile, Scrum Master or
Hybrid IT delivery methodology

Assets

Strong experience with Adobe Experience Manager (AEM)

Formal business analyst training in Adobe Experience Manager
(AEM)

following industries/areas of specialization:

TFS and/or VSTS 2013 or higher

Visio

and French)

Brantford, ONInvestorCOM is a leader in providing financial technology and outsourcing services to Canada’s largest banks, asset managers, insurance companies and investment dealers. Our innovative FinTech solutions help our clients meet their growing investor communications, regulatory and compliance obligations. InvestorCOM has locations in Toronto and Brantford, Canada and serves over 50 enterprise clients.

About the Role

Reporting to the Supervisor, CCM Business Operations, the Data & Project Analyst is responsible for managing client data projects with a specialty in InvestorCOM publishing projects through the data onboarding, document composition and filing stages leveraging InvestorCOM's automated publishing solution, while also interacting and supporting our clients directly as required.

The Location

The role is based in our Brantford Office, with some travel to our Toronto, Ontario office as required.

Responsibilities

The Data & Project Analyst is accountable for:

Preparation of digital versions of clients’ regulatory financial documents.
Acceptance and loading of client mailing data into systems for use in the CCM and CDM client projects
Problem solving of data and composition issues in client provided source files for the Publisher platform.
Onboarding new clients: thoroughly analyzing client data, finding and understanding business rules for data processing, document layout and creation of new documents in the Publisher platform.
Executing the established programming to manipulate client provided data and upload it to the Publisher database.
Proof document content against client provided source material.
Organization of large quantities of client spreadsheets in folders, following strict rules for folder structure and file naming conventions
Troubleshooting of final documents to determine most accurate and efficient method to correct missing data or visual anomalies with the documents
Communication with Project Coordinator who is responsible to ensuring all client activities are completed within the agreed upon, regulatory timeline
Participate in client meetings, as required
Respond quickly and precisely to issues with spreadsheet content or format to enable successful import into the Publisher system.
Working with the Publisher platform to update documents and assist clients with required updates on the self-serve platform
Document Publisher processes, update Publisher product manuals, training materials and other client support materials.
Education

University degree or equivalent (completed or in progress) a major asset.
Finance, accounting or financial industry‐specific education an asset.
Experience

Experience using complex Excel spreadsheets in the above situations, with knowledge of running and editing/maintaining complex formulas.
Experience in financial services, particularly the investment industry, is an asset.
Accounting or other finance experience valuable.
The successful candidate will have strong self‐starter and self‐management skills and attributes that will enable them to succeed in a hands‐off, results‐driven environment.
What You'll Bring to the Role

Extremely keen on investigative troubleshooting of data related issues with a strong desire to determine the solution and/or gain efficiencies in processes.
Excellent Excel skills and strong all-round Windows and Office skills.
Strong organizational skills.
Ability to perform tasks quickly and with attention to detail, while thoroughly following documented processes
Strong teamwork ethic AND individual work ethic
Excel in a fast-paced cyclical environments, using off cycle times for process documentation and improvement
Good verbal and writing skills.
Ability to excel in a lean environment with limited staffing resources.
Knowledge of /experience with VBA and SQL are valuable but not required.
Ability to read and understand French valuable but not required.
Hours of Work:

InvestorCOM hours of operation are 8:30am – 5:00pm Monday to Friday. Additional hours may periodically be required.

Working Environment:

We are a growing, highly entrepreneurial services company. The successful candidate will be a self-starter who will “own” operations, knows inherently what is required to be successful in the role and has the leadership skills to engage others within the organization to help drive our business forward.

What’s in it for you?

At InvestorCOM, we define our success by what we help others achieve. We were created to support our clients and through our products, services and solutions to protect and strengthen their brands. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. InvestorCOM offers:


An award-winning company: Employee Recommended Workplace 2018 & 2019; Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employer 2018; and Hamilton-Niagara Top Employer 2018 & 2019
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including, profit sharing, RSP matching program, group benefits and competitive compensation
Leaders who support your development through coaching and training opportunities
Work in a dynamic, collaborative and high-performing team
A strong focus on personal learning and development to help you reach your professional development goals
A platform to build strong professional working relationships with clients, fellow associate and management

Hi! We're ecobee.

We are pioneers and innovators in the fast-emerging connected home and IoT industries. ecobee products are beautifully designed and incredibly smart. They are connected devices which automate your home while helping you save energy and money. We're headquartered in Toronto, and play on a North American scale. We're growing. In fact, we're growing really fast. And, we're looking for great people to join our hive.

Your Impact:
This is an opportunity for you to understand ecobee's business, influence improvements, and shape the future of data-driven business decision-making and operational efficiency. In this role, you will be working closely with business users from almost all parts of the organization, collaboratively evaluating and prioritizing business problems, defining the data needs, and designing and delivering solutions that will equip stakeholders with timely information in a self-serve model.

Ways you can contribute day one:

Assemble and summarize data to generate sophisticated reports, as well as Tableau visualizations, which represent sales and operational performances of ecobee
Use scripting languages to create and maintain access to data from various sources – such as websites, relational databases, and local files – in order to enhance and simplify stakeholder access to information
Identify and define new process improvement opportunities, with a focus on implementing automated solutions in order to minimize manual ETL treatments of source data
Analyze business data to identify industry trends, opportunities, risks and best practices
Work with business leads and ecobee's management team to inform company strategy and investment

Our Requirements:

You have experience in a data analytics role with a focus on business strategy
You are an expert in Excel and SQL
You take your technical experience one step further, with a proficiency in Python and Tableau
Experience with ETL frameworks and/or statistical modelling software considered an asset
You pride yourself on being detail oriented and analytical
Strong presentation, reporting and communication skills
Just so you know: The hired candidate will be required to complete a background check.

What we are offering:

An opportunity to grow with a dynamic company, personal and professional growth
Truly meaningful work that affects our planet
Small collaborative teams where you can impact both product and culture
Learning opportunities supported by an education fund for every employee
Community support through our ecobee acts program

Are you the one we need? If so, we would love to hear from you.

Vancouver, BCRequisition ID: 13095

Company
The City of Vancouver is striving to become the greenest city in the world, and a city powered entirely by renewable energy before 2050. We are proud to be one of BC's Top Employers, Canada's Best Diversity Employers, and one of Canada's Greenest Employers. With employees that have helped Vancouver consistently rank as one of the world's most livable cities, the City values a diverse workforce which represents the vibrant community we so proudly serve.
Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.


Main Purpose and Function
The Business Process Analyst (BPA) provides senior management with objective and comprehensive business and process analysis of the City’s processes, systems, and resourcing. The BPA provides recommendations based on comprehensive analysis performed with a view to continuously improve business operations using Lean Six Sigma principles; and help sponsors, process owners, and end users implement lean initiatives. Recommendations made by this position result in changes in methods, processes, resources, and procedures that may impact operational areas as well as staffing workloads, working conditions, and changes in positions or staffing levels.

Key Contacts and Reporting Relationships
This position reports directly to the Manager, Continuous Process Improvement in Finance, Risk and Supply Chain Management and works closely with directors, managers and staff in Finance, Risk and Supply Chain Management as well as key business representatives across the City. Works with front-line supervisors, departmental subject-matter-experts, external vendors, consultants and other organizations.

Specific Duties/Responsibilities
Leads, consult and participate in business process reviews of City Business Units, including provision of recommendations for opportunities for improvement
Lead Lean Six Sigma projects, including facilitating Kaizen events and Rapid Improvement events, conduct value stream mapping and identifies relevant KPIs,
Develop future state recommendations and build implementation plans for optimizing business processes and value streams
The value streams and processes that the role will be working on will be cross functional in nature and require the candidate to engage a number of business units and departments
Collect and analyze data to complete a current state analysis and optimize solutions
Identify implications and make recommendations for changes in processes and procedures that may impact on operational areas as well as staffing workloads, working conditions, and changes to positions or staffing levels.
Prepares and conducts presentations to, and/or facilitates decision-making for Department Management teams, Division/Branch Heads, Project Steering Committees, and Business Unit Managers.
Teach, mentor and support the project application of Green Belt candidates
Other duties as assigned

Minimum Position Requirements
Education and Experience:
A related bachelor’s degree (i.e. Commerce, Business/Public Administration, Public Policy or Economics).
A minimum of seven years of proven experience in process documentation, business process reviews, and reengineering techniques. Training, experience and knowledge in quality improvement tools, techniques and methodologies such as Lean and/or Six Sigma.
A minimum of five years’ experience at management level within the public sector or a similarly large multi-stakeholder organization. Management experience to effectively lead a business consulting team. Demonstrated experience implementing a business process re-engineering change.
Lean Six Sigma and/or Business Analyst certification (IIBA) certifications preferred.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Detailed knowledge of business practices in effect at other local and more senior governments, and in private industry.
A thorough understanding of organization theory and design.
High degree of analysis using professional thinking.
Superior research and organizational skills.
Excellent verbal and written communications skills and presentation skills, across all levels of the organization.
The ability to think innovatively, solve complex problems and present solutions in clear and compelling terms.
Demonstrated ability to work with technical and non-technical staff.
Ability to manage change and assist people with adapting to change.
Ability to analyze and anticipate implications of system changes on work processes and procedures.
Ability to solve complex problems and build relationships.
Ability to build constructive and effective relationships at all level of the organization.
Ability to manage multiple priorities, large workloads and multi-task effectively.
High level of proficiency with MS Office applications.

job_title: ANALYST / SENIOR ANALYST, PORTFOLIO RISK MANAGEMENT
job_description:
The Analyst/ Senior Analyst, Portfolio Risk will be responsible for portfolio risk monitoring of BDC portfolios such as Financing, Growth & Transition Capital, Venture Capital, and Wholesale Financing. This includes providing high quality analyses on risk trends as well recommendations to senior management. He/she will act as an expert of available data and actively support the development of new risk measures.


CHALLENGES TO BE MET

Provide independent and effective portfolio monitoring, ensuring key risk issues are raised to management
Identify and analyze historical trends, especially in regards to key risk indicators such as delinquency, downgrading to impairment, provisions on credit losses, pricing, capital, risk mix and risk concentrations, etc.
Actively support the alignment with industry best practices, including the development of new risk analytics and new reports
Identify and develop means for extracting new data from the Bank’s various systems required to monitor portfolio risk and support the ongoing enhancement of risk aggregation and analysis tools
Participate in the development and enhancement of risk models, including PRM Analytix, to address required improvements and alignment with industry best practices
Respond to internal clients’ ad hoc requests by using relevant data available
Keep abreast of industry best practices, changes in BDC operations, product development and IT projects and recommend required changes to risk monitoring and reporting in order maintain an alignment with BDC’s strategies.
Provide value-added insight to senior management on risk trends and concerns.
Provide recommendations to support senior management positioning strategies that are in line with BDC’s risk appetite.
Coordinate the monthly and quarterly risk reports and act as a facilitator for team members in order to ensure high quality and timely delivery
Maintain strong collaboration and relationship with internal clients.
Represent Portfolio Risk Management team in various committees, advisories or working groups, supporting them while considering availability and capacity of internal resources.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline such as finance, accounting, economics, mathematics, statistics.
Preferred experience:
Analyst level: Relevant educational background, no experience necessary
Sr. Analyst level: Minimum 3 years of relevant experience in financial institution (lending, risk management, sales support)
Knowledge of corporate and commercial real estate lending
Experience in risk management within the financial industry is an asset.
Strong analytical skills and detail-oriented
Ability to organize and collate data for management reporting purposes
Strong ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines
Initiative & creativity
Good written and verbal communication skills
Knowledge of Microsoft Excel
Knowledge of databases structure and management (SQL, SAS, etc.) is an asset
Knowledge of statistical/numerical software; such as Matlab, VBA is an asset
Bilingual in both official languages

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

job_title: Business Analyst II - Purchasing & Inventory Management
job_description:
Burnaby, BCReady to create innovative solutions and best practices?

Join our team

Join a cutting edge Procurement and Inventory team responsible for getting the best from our vendors for our internal and external customers. We innovate by creating and executing initiatives that drive the best in class performance and practices for our vital infrastructure builds.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together
Create and implement vendor key performance indicators (KPIs) supporting 94+% on time material delivery of materials
Create and implement vendor KPIs supporting 80+% on price, to scope and on time delivery for services
Consolidate our vendor base for 4 categories
Increase purchasing policy compliance by 5%+ over previous year
Here's how
Analyze and update our category taxonomy in collaboration with team members and key stakeholders
Create and implement key performance indicators that drive improved performance by our vendors in both materials and services
Develop material rationalization, standardization and substitution strategies
Develop and automate tools and processes that support compliance with our purchasing policy
Implement supplier consolidation plans consistent with Procurement category playbooks
Maximise unit cost pricing by moving material demand between preferred suppliers
Qualifications

You're the missing piece of the puzzle
Bachelor Degree or higher in Supply Chain, Procurement, Business or related discipline
3+ years progressive experience in similar role with strong understanding of supply chain management concepts and best practices
Experience with post-award materials and services administration (includes key performance indicators)
Ability to create and implement improvement projects
Intermediate to advanced Excel
Proven track record to meet deadlines while handling shifting priorities
Self-motivated and ability to thrive in an ambiguous environment
Be able to informally lead and manage teams built of cross-functional team members with conflicting priorities
Strong presentation skills with experience presenting at a Director level
Great-to-haves
Experience with data analytics tools such as Domo, Tableau or Mini-Tab
Experience with SAP
Experience with category management

Build a meaningful career

At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.

Business Analyst
Health and Productivity Solutions
Markham, ON
Full Time Permanent

Reporting to the Director, Health and Productivity Solution Technology, the incumbent is responsible to provides business analysis expertise and deliver detailed requirements and specifications related to the proprietary application under the Health and Productivity line of business.

Responsibilities:
Works with internal business users and assigned project resources collecting and analyzing business requirements for project implementations, ongoing maintenance and system enhancements.
Produces detailed requirements and specifications, wireframes and models used by business users and development team.
Produces testing documents and test cases, and performs testing as required.
Supports systems development teams and business areas as required.
Continuously devises ways to improve team operations.
Builds knowledge of industry topics and trends through internal training, external training and self-study, as appropriate.
Performs other tasks and special projects, as required.


Qualifications:
5+ years of experience as a business analyst preferably in a technically-oriented environment and worked on technical assignments and/or projects
Experience in absence or disability management, group insurance, HR/payroll systems is an asset.
Demonstrated knowledge or experience in project management is an asset.
Solid understanding of The Software Development Life Cycle.
Demonstrated knowledge or experience with various analysis and techniques to write detailed specifications and requirements for software development.
Experience with and uses various visual modelling techniques that is appropriate for the type and scope of the assignment.
Understanding concepts in data modelling and relational database design.
Lead and collaborate with business Subject Matter Experts (SME), business resources, Project Managers, other Business Analysts, and developers to ensure that solutions are thoroughly though through and issues and risks are identified and resolved.
Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent time management skills and the ability to manage multiple assignments.
Ability to work independently, takes initiative, and exercise good judgement.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving and creative-thinking skills.
Exceptional customer focus and strong professional acumen.
Demonstrated knowledge of software development concepts (focus on internet applications and mobile applications).
Basic understanding of negotiation, conflict management and risk management skills.
Reliable, consistent, flexible and adaptable.
Experienced in estimating complexity, time and effort, planning and worked closely with Project Managers to successfully meet requirements and timelines.

The ideal candidate
You’re a patient listener. You understand very technical subjects, but can easily explain them in non-technical language. You’re not necessarily a developer, but you understand application development concepts and can easily engage in a technical discussion. You’re a problem-solver and capable of proposing options to support business decision making. You also have an interest to understand the industry and business processes of the department. You focus on understanding what the user really needs and design solutions that add value, are feasible and can be implemented within budget.

A typical day
You’ll meet with business stakeholders, developers and system architects to gather the information you need to create wireframes, process models and detailed functional specifications. You’ll investigate and research both new business issues and requests for changes to our systems depending on the nature of the request. Throughout the software lifecycle, you will support developers, IT QA specialists and business UAT resources to clarify requirements. Occasionally you’ll do the testing, too. As a change is rolled out, you’ll help your business stakeholders understand how it works and how to use it. At times may be required to work overtime, weekends and evenings to accelerate requirement timelines and support testing during system deployments.

Business Analysis

2 years of ongoing IT Business Analysis experience
University degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, or other related field and/or equivalent work experience

Knowledge of project management methods and practices

Experience working with developers and a high comfort level working in an Agile environment
Knowledge of MS Project with accurate time estimates and planning
Collaborative team player, who builds relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward
Strong analytical and communication skills
Ability to adapt in a fast paced environment
Experience working with retail systems for large enterprise or retail clients is an asset

Overview

Reporting to the Director of Asset Management, the Analyst of Asset Management is responsible for assisting in valuation of assets and the development, implementation, monitoring and maintenance of key performance metrics and analytical models for Centurion Asset Management Inc. | Centurion Property Associates Inc.

Responsibilities

Relationship Development

Develop and foster positive relationships with internal and external stakeholders including Third-Party Appraisers, Consultants, Mortgage Brokers, Lenders and Lawyers.

Fair Value

Work with Third-Party Appraisers and internal departments to conduct the quarterly fair value calculation for each fund. Verify abnormal variances and identify non-recurring incidences to produce a normalized income for the fair value calculation. Prepare the quarterly fair value variance spreadsheet for Management review. Develop calculation models for fair value as needed. Ensure that all deadlines and critical dates are met.

Investment Analysis and Financial Modeling

Assist with the implementation and maintenance of the business analytics platform. Monitor trends for business insights and key performance indicators. Identify variances to help maintain business efficiency. Monitor quarterly rental rate movements for the Centurion Real Estate Investment Trust. Assist in the development and maintenance of financial and valuation models, assisting in calculation verification. Assist in the disposition processes. Assist with the completion of the internal rate of return calculations on realized investments. Assist various departments in implementation processes for financial platforms or systems. Work closely with the Executive Management team, providing key analytical data on a regular basis.
Operational Efficiencies

Assist with monitoring and identifying areas of operational inefficiencies or variances for all funds. Investigate, follow up on and resolve any issues that arise.
Refinancing

Assist with the refinancing process by reviewing commitment letters, preparing the refinancing packages and providing the Director of Asset Management with updates as required. Keep track of and maintain the internal mortgage schedule, ensuring that all maturing mortgages are addressed within the established timelines. Ensure all documentation is up to date and filed correctly. Complete other tasks as assigned by the Director of Asset Management and/or the President | CEO.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in business, finance or accounting;
3-5 years’ experience in asset management with experience in the real estate sector considered an asset;
Exceptional interpersonal, oral and written communication skills with the ability to present ideas effectively to both individuals and groups;
Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills and a strong ability to multi-task;
Highly motivated and able to take the initiative required to excel in a deadline-oriented environment;
Strong follow-up skills with the ability to effectively resolve problems in a timely manner using relevant information, sound reasoning and common sense;
Excellent command of MS Office products: Excel, Word, Power Point; and
Pursuing the Chartered Financial Analyst designation considered an asset.
Centurion Asset Management Inc. | Centurion Property Associates Inc. is an inclusive and equal opportunity Employer. If you require a disability-related accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, please email us. We will accommodate your needs under the Ontario Human Rights Code.

job_title: Treasury Analyst, Derivative and Collateral Management
job_description:
Edmonton, AB$61,605 - $86,604 a yearReporting to the Director, Debt Operations and Corporate Finance, the Treasury Analyst, Derivative and Collateral Management is a middle-office position responsible for providing technical expertise in the areas of financial trade support, derivative evaluation, collateral settlement and risk reporting. This position is vital for ensuring that all derivative transactions are recorded and confirmed accurately. This role will evaluate, transact and monitor all daily collateral flow requirements between the Province, its provincial corporations and financial counterparties under existing Credit Support Annex (CSA) trade agreements, using current and future-state treasury system applications. Additional responsibilities include managing the trade confirmation process, completing calculations for net credit exposure and managing collateral positions, responding to and initiating collateral calls, recording and reconciling collateral trades, developing and enhancing related reporting, and acting as the subject matter expert for derivative administration and collateral operations.

To be successful in this role, you will posses a strong understanding of debt markets, financial derivatives, credit/counterparty risk management, portfolio theory and basic accounting principles. Experience in a capital markets, treasury and/or banking environments and/or knowledge of proper banking procedures (particularly with respect to security and payment settlements) would be beneficial. Exceptional interpersonal skills would be valuable as this role interacts with a variety of subject matter experts, many of which may have highly technical backgrounds and/or non-financial professional roles.


Qualifications

A university degree in Commerce or Business with a specialization in Finance or a degree in a related field plus three years related experience in a banking, capital market and/or treasury role is required.

Proven experience in developing financial valuation models is preferred.
Experience using an integrated treasury management system (software or platform) and/or working with electronic payment and financial data systems (such as Bloomberg), or other software solutions pertaining to collateral, asset or risk management operations, would be an asset.

Enrolment in or completion of the Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), or Certified Treasury Professional (CTP), or similar professional designation is an asset.


Competencies

Competencies are behaviors that are essential to reach our goals in serving Albertans. We encourage you to have an in depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process. The link below will assist you with understanding competencies:


http://www.psc.alberta.ca/Practitioners/?file=learning/apscompetencies/titlepage&cf=9

Agility: Ability to anticipate, assess, and readily adapt to changing priorities, maintain resilience in times of uncertainty and effectively work in a changing environment.

Drive for Results: Knowing what outcomes are important and maximizing resources to achieve results that are aligned with the goals of the organization, while maintaining accountability to each other and external stakeholders.

Develop Self and Others: A commitment to lifelong learning, and the desire to invest in the development of the long-term capability of yourself and others.

Build Collaborative Environments: Leads and contributes to the conditions and environments that allow people to work collaboratively and productively to achieve outcomes.

Develop Networks: Proactively building networks, connecting, and building trust in relationships with different stakeholders.

Systems Thinking: The work done within the APS is part of a larger integrated and inter-related environment. It is important to know that work done in one part of the APS impacts a variety of other groups/projects inside and outside the APS. Systems Thinking allows us to keep broader impacts and connections in mind.

Creative Problem Solving: Ability to assess options and implications in new ways to achieve outcomes and solutions.


Salary

$2,360.34 to $3,241.54 bi-weekly ($61,605 to $86,604 annually)


Notes

The Alberta Public Service is a great place to work!

About the role
Shopify is a fast-growing commerce company currently powering over 800,000 stores in more than 175 different countries. Merchants use our software to power their business across multiple sales channels, including web, and mobile storefronts, through social media and marketplaces, and in their brick-and-mortar and pop-up shops.
We are looking to add a Business Valuation Analyst, to our Strategic Expansion team. The Strategic Expansion team focuses on evaluating internal and external businesses, strategic identification and prioritization of new business opportunities, and developing intelligent perspectives on current and future opportunities.

About you
You have a degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or relevant direct professional experience;
CFA designation is a big plus (or getting close to obtaining it - think Level II and above)
You have seen a lot of deals in your time and you’ve built a ton of sophisticated models to back them up
You have a rock solid understanding of financial modelling and valuation analysis
You’ve been exposed to a wide range of industries (SaaS should be one of them but we want to hear from folks who have been involved in other industries as well)
You possess strong technical, analytical skills and computer skills (particularly, modelling in Excel and building presentations - in other words you can teach us a thing or two!)
Your ability to synthesize tremendous amount of information/data is something you take pride in
You’re independent, a self starter and you thrive in an ambiguous, fast paced environment
Here's some of what will keep you busy
Creating sophisticated financial models including business valuations, revenue/ cost projections for acquisitions and partnership scenarios
Drafting detailed valuation reports
Assisting in the preparation of presentations targeted at senior management
If this sounds like the perfect role for you, tell us why and make sure to address your cover letter to Lucas Matheson, Director of Strategic Expansion. As part of your application, walks us through the most complex model you’ve ever built and why you’re proud of it.
Please note that this posting will close on March 26th at 9am.

provide status updates and brief management; advise/guide summer students;Relationship management and consultation skills to: effectively liaise with internal and external stakeholders to identify needs/requirements, support contract negotiations, make recommendations on best software licensing terms and conditions, seek clarification/understanding on new licensing

Toronto, ONContractAbout Entertainment One
Entertainment One Ltd. (LSE:ETO) is a global independent studio that specialises in the development, acquisition, production, financing, distribution and sales of entertainment content. The Company’s diversified expertise spans across film, television and music production and sales; family programming, merchandising and licensing; digital content; and live entertainment. Through its global reach and expansive scale, powered by deep local market knowledge, the Company delivers the best content to the world.

Entertainment One’s robust network includes international feature film distribution company Sierra/Affinity; Amblin Partners with DreamWorks Studios, Participant Media, and Reliance Entertainment; Makeready with Brad Weston; unscripted television production companies Whizz Kid Entertainment and Renegade 83; live entertainment leaders Round Room Entertainment; world-class music labels Dualtone Music Group and Last Gang; and award-winning emerging content and technology studio Secret Location.

The Company's rights library, valued at US$2.0 billion (as at 31 March 2018), is exploited across all media formats and includes about 80,000 hours of film and television content and approximately 40,000 music tracks.


Position Summary
As a Business Analyst, you will join Entertainment One’s Information Technology team to ensure process mapping, requirement gathering, data analysis, relationship management, and project and/or operational support.
Responsibilities
Create and document Business Requirements, gap analysis and support documents for projects related to Entertainment One’s Strategic Initiatives.
Analyze and synthesize stakeholder requirements into actionable items.
Facilitate stakeholder engagement through interviews, workshops, meetings, and/or training.
Submit technology estimation (cost benefit analysis) documentation and provide to clients in order to facilitate feasibility assessments on project initiatives.
Act as a liaison between business and technology groups.
Provide initiative documentation as deemed necessary.
Ensure business and system requirements are documented in the form of detailed functional and non-functional requirements and business designs, which meet industry best practices and are consumable by clients, development and testing.
Provide operational support following the change management process.
Research existing policies, procedures, methodologies and systems that support the current state and identify changes needed to support revised processes. Work with business and process engineering to identify and build process improvements into design.
Utilize creative thinking to modify or select the most suitable procedure/approach that results in providing eOne with optimum solutions to business and technology challenges
Lead requirement gathering and other sessions with Stakeholders, to capture the requirements and specifications.
Using negotiating and facilitation skills, resolve issues across competing segments and channels to arrive at solutions that meet the needs of all stakeholders. Actively manage client expectations on the BA work package and the initiative overall where providing support.
Work with the technology team to ensure understanding of the business requirements, use cases and business designs, and obtain sign off on the various elements to ensure solution delivery is appropriate and meets the needs of the business.
Support the work packages for the Development, Testing, Communication, Learning, and Implementation teams by conducting walkthroughs, providing clarification and facilitating issue resolution.
Conduct user training.
Business Planning and Tracking - Meet business requests within budget, on time, and within acceptable quality levels. Manage assigned work packages against timelines and within scope and budget; make recommendations on corrective actions if work package deliverables are in jeopardy. Create change requests as required. Document and raise issues for resolution encountered during the requirements definition process.
Work for consensus and contribute to achievement of team/group goals.
Provide support in RFP process and vendor management.
Continuous Improvement - Work to provide continuous improvement of and ensure high level of quality in all deliverables, processes and procedures.
Communication - Create organized and professional presentation material for clients and partner stakeholders, presenting recommendations in a logical, articulate and influencial manner. Facilitate and lead discussions as required, preparing documentation to record discussion and follow-up actions.
Key Competencies
Passionate innovators, creators, collaborators, and leaders who will be delivering solutions that meet our internal clients' changing needs.
At least 5 years of Business Analysis experience.
Well-developed analytical skills with strong attention to detail.
Experience in business requirements documentation.
Experience in Use Case creation.
Strong multi-tasking and organizational skills.
Well-developed writing skills sufficient to create and precisely articulate requirements, ideas, and opinions.
A University degree in business and/or information technology (or equivalent work experience) is an asset.
Certified business analyst professional or equivalent work experience (preferred).
Demonstrated success in delivering initiatives across multiple business units in a matrix environment.
Extensive experience with all aspects of Requirements Management: Business Process Modeling, Use Case modeling, use case specifications, functional and non-functional requirements and interface design.
Demonstrated ability to build relationships, work collaboratively, and resolve problems with people at all levels in the organization, across lines of business and with third party vendors.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation and mediation skills.
Self-driven and someone who takes ownership.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
MS Visio experience.
MS SharePoint experience (preferred).
Previous Finance system implementation experience (preferred)
Break time: free snacks, winter holiday office closures, reduced hours in summerParty time: office bar carts, after work drinks, holiday and summer parties, and sometimes just because
Be inspired: regular film screenings, concerts, and opportunity to get involved in industry events
The office: modern facilities, in house screening rooms, more snacks, and swag
Build a better world: transcend entertainment to our corporate social responsibility activities. Plan a social event. Promote healthy lifestyles. Go green. Give back.
Grow: develop your career and shape your future

You met with a couple of new clients in-person to assist with their data analytics needs and supported the rollout of Tangam's software. You also quickly prepared high-quality business reports and created presentations aimed at clients’ upper management outlining the incremental revenue/profit and return on investment for their properties.
Based on client feedback and guidance from the Business team, you identified case study opportunities and used client data to demonstrate the benefits of Tangam’s software. These case studies were then released to the press and resulted in new sales.
You went beyond expectations and advanced your knowledge of analytics, operations optimization and data visualization. You shared your knowledge with the business analyst team, thus catalyzing process/technology changes that helped them be more effective in their careers.
We can’t wait until next year. Now back to today. If you’d like this story to be yours, apply now.

Who we are

Tangam is a small and rapidly growing company that is at the cutting edge of developing data analytics, operations optimization and visualization software. Our flagship product Table Games Yield Management (TYM) helps casinos to optimize their table games operations through effective resource allocation and staff scheduling. Our software takes the complexity out of data analytics and makes data understandable and actionable to ordinary users. Many large, medium and small casinos in the U.S., Canada, and Australia already use TYM successfully to enhance their business and better satisfy their patrons. Our patented products have won numerous industry awards and recognitions. We continue to push the envelope on what is possible in the area of data analytics and optimization software, and we are always seeking new talent to join us on our exciting journey.

Visit our website for more information.

Requirements

Good communicator. Strong written/oral communication. Ability to explain complex ideas and statistical concepts in a clear, concise manner. Proficiency in spoken and written French/Mandarin/Cantonese are all assets.

Data wizard. 2-5 years of experience in data analysis. Proficient with Excel, pivot tables and macros. Experience working with business intelligence tools such as Tableau, SAS and Cognos is an asset. Knowledge of relational databases with the ability to read and write SQL is an asset.

Educated. Undergraduate degree in Applied Mathematics / Statistics, Business, or Computer Science / Engineering with a strong mathematics background.

Must have no criminal record, and must be willing and able to travel ~5% - 15% of working time.

Experience with casinos is an asset.

Montréal, QCLockheed Martin Canada RMS Configuration and Data Management (CMDM) team is seeking Junior Configuration Data Management Analyst. This position will provide Configuration Management (CM) and Data Management support to multi programs. The Data Management (DM) discipline ensures the Contract Data Requirement List / Subcontract Data Requirement List (CDRL/SDRL) requirements are identified, recorded, assigned to appropriate disciplines, and tracked in accordance with DM Standards (Formal Data Management).

DM creates and monitors the CDRL/SDRL submittal schedule. DM resolves data issues, distributes schedule notices for pending data submittals to ensure on-time delivery and creates status reports for management review and action. DM reviews the deliverable program data to determine completeness and submits to the customer as specified in the contract.

The Configuration Management (CM) discipline works closely with the program execution and engineering teams to manage the technical baseline. CM tasking in this role will include the use of CM tools for configuration identification, configuration control, configuration status accounting, configuration verification and audits, product release and delivery and provide solutions to a variety of CM technical challenges.

Daily responsibilities include establishing and maintaining program CM systems, including the program documents and managing configuration baselines, ensuring all required process steps have been completed prior to release and documenting released configurations. Position requires great attention to detail with respect to managing hardware development environments and program technical data, understanding of ITAR processes and strong presentation skills. Candidate must be an advocate of continuous process improvements.

Toronto, ONWho We Are

Founded in 2010, BEworks is an unconventional management consulting firm that applies scientific thinking to transform the economy and society. Our team of experts in cognitive and social psychology, neuroscience, and marketing answer our clients' most complex business questions, execute disruptive growth strategies, and accelerate innovation. Part of the kyu collective of companies since January 2017, the firm's client list includes Fortune 500 companies, not-for-profit organizations, and government agencies. BEworks was co-founded by Dan Ariely, renowned behavioral scientist, Kelly Peters, the firm's CEO and BE pioneer, and top marketing scholar Nina Mažar.

Culture is Really Important to Us

We’re a small but mighty team that loves to work hard and play hard. We operate as a collective, bringing some of the best practices from academia to life in our day-to-day work. Our Think Tanks provide a forum for peer review; our academic advisors provide guidance on research directions and experiment design. Our ongoing “lunch and learns” include Visiting Scholars sessions with amazing scientists, our Lab provides a channel for the pursuit of primary research, and our collaboration framework provides an opportunity for the ongoing development of your scientific knowledge and skills.

Job Description

BEworks is seeking a Data Analyst who subscribes to the vision of the importance of scientific thinking and is keen to apply it to real-world challenges. In this position, you play a key role in the planning and delivery of the BEworks Method, which is a fusion of the scientific method with management consulting. As a Data Analyst, you are detail-oriented, meticulous, and an analytical team player. You ask the right questions, effectively communicate across teams, and want an opportunity to help shape what data can offer to our clients.

Main Responsibilities:

CONDUCT RIGOROUS SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH by…

Gathering, analyzing, and synthesizing existing scientific research, including insights drawn from BEworks’ proprietary IP database as well as the scientific literature

Critically evaluating existing literature to identify how the research can be applied to client contexts, as well as identifying any research gaps (i.e., what has not been studied before based on psychological concepts or behavioral economic theory)

SUPPORT MANAGEMENT CONSULTING PROJECTS by…

Evaluating client data, uncovering client assumptions, and understanding their knowledge, intuition, and priors; auditing their experimental capability

Supporting the design and execution of both large and small scale randomized control experiments

CONDUCT STATISTICAL ANALYSIS by…

Cleaning and sorting raw data for analysis

Assisting with conducting statistical analyses

Interpreting and translating results from experiment outputs

Investigating and learning new analytic methods that can be applied to experimental data

COMMUNICATE OUR INSIGHTS by…

Writing and communicating scientific ideas and summarizing experiments in a clear and accessible way

Preparing business proposals to emphasize scientific experimentation and the importance of behavioral economics

HELP US SOLVE PROBLEMS by…

Participating in group sessions where we tackle business challenges using behavioral economics tactics

Qualifications

A masters degree in any applied quantitative discipline (preference for candidates with knowledge in psychology (preferably social, cognitive, or consumer), marketing (consumer behavior focus), judgment and decision making, or economics

Strong background in statistical analysis and experiment design with the ability to handle and clean large datasets

Candidate must be able to demonstrate proficiency in R programming (proficiency in other languages i.e. Python, SPSS, etc. are beneficial but not strictly required)

Ability to create data visualizations

Ability to meaningfully interpret analyses to a business audience is a must

Demonstrated ability to interpret data from both RCT and quasi-experimental trials

Demonstrated ability to work with complex econometric models

We are looking for individuals who have:

A passion for empirical behavioral research and continuous learning

The ability and desire to work in a highly collaborative (and frankly, sometimes noisy) team

A willingness to go the extra mile

Obsessive attention to detail

The conscientiousness to be deadline driven, organized, and able to prioritize multiple competing responsibilities

Strong verbal and written skills

A willingness to travel

We welcome and encourage you to apply even if you do not think you might meet all the specified qualifications above. Though we thank you in advance for submitting your application, only qualified, selected candidates will be contacted.

You must be legally eligible to work in Canada to apply.
BEworks is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of the communities we serve. We are proud to be in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), 2005 and the Integrated Accessibility Standards Regulation. Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the recruitment and assessment (if applicable) process as required under BEworks' policies and procedures. Applicants must make their accommodation needs known when first contacted by the recruitment team.

Description

Business Analysis Sr Manager
Citi’s Trade & Treasury Solutions (TTS) is a leading provider of Cash Management, Treasury and Trade Solutions. With a global network spanning more than 100 countries, TTS has a global platform that is unique in the industry for its reach and flexibility. We provide clients with timely, accurate information and dynamic, web-based tools to effectively manage their financial positions, working capital, payment capabilities and view of their financial supply chain.
We are seeking a senior Business Analyst who can also lead a team of data analysts and business analysts who will be responsible for build out enterprise and conformed logical models on Citi's Big Data and GIW platform that houses our TTS products.
The ideal candidate should be:
Technically astute, well organized, proactive and be comfortable discussing issues with business and technical users at all levels
He/she requires exceptional communication skills across both technology and the business and will have a high degree of visibility.
The candidate must have strong motivation to lead and be successful in their endeavors, great teamwork and team building skills, mentor junior resources and have sound character and interpersonal skills

The ideal candidate will be dependable and resourceful software professional who can comfortably work in a large development team in a globally distributed, dynamic work environment that fosters diversity, teamwork and collaboration. The ability to work in high-pressured environment is essential.
Key Responsibilities:
Overall responsibilities include leading the team of data analysts and business analysts working on creating conformance models on the Vanguard platform across various TTS products.
Should be able to understand the functional flows, complex calculation logic and data flow across various systems and products within TTS Data & Analytics platform
Review, analyze, and interpret Business Requirements Documents (BRD) and providing feedback on key functionalities and technical feasibility
Develops, writes, and communicates business requirements and functional specifications for the implementation of business solutions.
Experience in writing & reviewing functional requirement document specification and data dictionaries to clearly articulate requirements and mapping of data elements to UI elements.
Being the interface between the Product stake holders and technical team and should be able to bridge any gap related to requirements
Work with stakeholders for requirement scoping, preparation of product backlog and work with Scrum master / project manager for defining sprint backlogs
Lead & work as product owner with Scrum teams for various streams and provide valuable inputs to deliver increment releases for given application / product
Responsible for key process improvements in business analysis space
Create business model and logical data models for cash management products.
Reverse engineer the business model for the Cash management products on existing applications.
Adhere to the requirements processes as well as SDLC to gather, write and maintain FRDs. Conduct FRD walkthroughs for multiple teams (Development, Quality Control, User Acceptance Testing, Training, Market Readiness and Operations) to explain new and enhanced functionality.
Develop prototypes and Business Use Case Scenarios to facilitate the gathering and documentation of requirements
Partner with the business and technical teams and create and maintain the Functional design for the various modules in the platform.
Work with cross functional teams across multiple countries and time zones
Follow the SDLC process established in the organization and create and maintain all relevant requirements artifacts

Qualifications

Required Skills and Experience:
At least 10+ years overall IT experience in Financial Services with 6+ years’ experience as business analysts or data scientist
Experience in leading team of business analysts and data scientists would be preferred
Must have hands-on experience in developing writing, and communicating business requirements and functional specifications for the implementation of business solutions.
Expertise in creating data models, process flows and sequence diagrams are must.
Expertise to create and interpret SQL queries and related software (SQL Developer,Toad).
Experience with Oracle, SQL server, Database concepts, ETL processes, reporting tools .
Some experience with Hadoop, HDFS. Impala and any other bid data platforms is an asset.

Experience in managing communications across business and technology stakeholders at varying levels across a medium to large scale enterprise

Experience in supporting external clients which includes attending calls, conducting product demos and help triage client issues
Non-technical knowledge, experience, and skills (leadership, management) is required
Excellent planning, organization and prioritization skills to meet ever changing demands of delivery stream
Bachelor’s degree (in Science, Computers, Information Technology or Engineering)

Position: IT Business Analyst and Coordinator – SAP Project

Reports to: Director of Information Technology

Location: This role is based at the corporate office in Toronto
Role Overview: As part of a small team, this hands-on role will be reporting to the Director of IT. The IT Business Analyst will coordinate project administration and activities, basic support on the SAP S4 platform and relay all business requirements between business stakeholders and the project teams.
Responsibilities

Champions and drives proposed system development or business process resolutions
Support the resolution of reported problems, maintain issues logs and track project risks and opportunities
Prepares and presents Change Request and other enhancements to be carried out in the SAP system
Display constant improvement through efficiencies, automation and innovation – to be measured and reported on at least on a quarterly basis;
Upto 20% travel required, and
Other duties, as assigned
Qualifications
Undergraduate Computer Science degree or equivalent;
5 - 8 years of Business Analysis experience.
Strong foundational and fundamental knowledge of SAP S4/HANA including Fiori, FICO, PM, MM and HR mini master
Basic level understanding of SAP configuration for above modules as well as sound understanding of SAP standard functionality
Active Project Management certification
Strong data management and data analysis skills.
Proficiency in MS Office Suite and Visio.
Ability to create clear and coherent written materials, synthesize information into succinct, concise and logical summaries and reports, and draw conclusions from information.
Demonstrated experience with Program Management Lifecycle methodologies.
Exceptional customer and service focus; sensitive and responsive to end-user satisfaction and self-motivated;
Exceptional communication and documentation skills;
Detail-oriented with outstanding ability to follow-up with multiple simultaneous issues

Who we are
Although not a household name, State Street is one of the world’s largest and most important financial services institutions, providing round-the-clock services to the global investment community. We touch $33 trillion in assets every day and are the world’s third largest investment manager with over $2.8 trillion in assets under management. To do this we manage as much data as one of the internet giants on nearly as large a technical footprint.
In 2018, we launched one of the industry’s largest technical transformation projects, in effect building a new bank from the ground up. This project isn’t greenfield in the way most banks claim projects are; we’ve started with a blank sheet of paper both operationally and technically. We’re using the same technologies that Silicon Valley giants are using: use of multiple public clouds, building our own private cloud to achieve even better performance, transforming our industry through distributed ledger technology and machine learning.
This isn’t a traditional banking role. This is a chance to push your technical skills with people more comfortable in a technology firm than an investment bank, though solving real problems that affect anyone with any form of savings worldwide (not just trying to get people to click on ads).
What you will do
As a Jnr. Business System Analyst, your deep understanding of ITIL based processes system coupled with public cloud provider APIs enable you to design solutions enabling seamless interactions across the key SDLC ‘moments of truth’. You will be a key influencer in shaping the end to end ‘NoOps’ flow using cutting edge perspectives from our patent holding architects, process specialists. In addition, you will help shape the toolchain needed to deliver the desired experience. This role will require critical thinking necessary for diligent research into inherent tradeoffs around feasibility, cost, compatibility, etc.
Collaborate with product owners, scrum masters and architects in refining stories for proposed epics
Define end user ‘journey maps’ through process specifications and key interaction points, using ITIL processes to aid alignment with public cloud based capabilities
Map capabilities needed for journey mapping to application components and define approach for managing interim workarounds and process exceptions
Write design specifications with input from developers to aid configuration and development in a verifiable manner
Develop test cases to aid in verification of enabled processes
Who you are
General knowledge of agile software development concepts and processes (e.g., scrum, Kanban, etc.)
Understanding of DevOps principles (e.g., continuous integration and continuous delivery concepts)
Familiarity in journey mapping concepts and developing processes flows focused on addressing prioritized pain points
Ability to clearly translate business requirements into technical requirements
Ability to analyze and document complex business processes and propose redesigns or areas for improvements
Demonstrated ownership of test plan development and iteration-level testing
Understanding and comfort with the latest technologies used in the development, testing and monitoring of custom applications within a cloud environment
Bachelor’s degree in a Computer Science or related field
Our promise to maintain an environment where every employee feels valued and able to meet their full potential infuses our company values. It’s also part of our commitment to inclusion, development and engagement, and corporate social responsibility. You’ll have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you. Join us.

Financial (Data) Analyst – Business Data Analytics| Financial Planning & Analysis


Financial Planning & Analysis

FP&A is responsible for planning and managing lululemon’s overall financial performance. We are an amazing team of passionate, active and dedicated leaders who are counted on as a key business partner in strategic and operational decisions. We provide a tremendous opportunity to learn about the various operations within lululemon, working often in cross-functional teams on a variety of projects. You will be able to add value immediately, see the big picture, and develop a business and finance skill set that you can leverage in your future roles within the organization. We are a stand for high quality work, driving high quality results and living a high quality life.


Summary

Reporting to the Manager of Reporting & Analytics, FP&A, the Financial (Data) Analyst – Business Data Analytics is responsible for financial performance analysis of the North American selling channels. Working with large amounts of financial and operational data from multiple data sources, he/she turns complex statistical observations into succinct and clear messaging for senior leadership. The Financial (Data) Analyst proactively identifies performance trends, business insights and solves questions from senior leadership in an objective and timely manner. Additionally, he/she is responsible for providing analysis and insight into day-to-day operations and strategic priorities, through financial modeling, business case support, analytics & reporting.


Key Responsibilities of a Financial (Data) Analyst – Business Data Analytics
 Perform quantitative analysis of business performance, using SQL, MS Excel, OLAP cubes, Qlik, Power BI and other tools Provide deep dive analyses to explain changes in trend and translate results into actionable insight Leverage quantitative methods to improve accuracy of financial forecasts Perform financial modelling/simulations, sensitivity analysis, hypothesis creation and testing in data models that are easily understood and replicated Create management reporting, presentations, dashboards and business commentary Provide quantitative support and analytical leadership to the North America FP&A team


Skills, Experiences & Educational Requirements
 4+ years of Finance / FP&A experience with a focus in advanced quantitative methods. Bachelor’s degree in Commerce, Business Administration, Statistics, Business Data Analytics, Engineering or a related field MBA, CFA or CPA is an asset. Management Consulting or Investment Banking Analyst experience is an asset. Highly proficient with MS Excel, including pivot tables and complex logic-based formulas. Hyperion, Oracle or large financial planning software knowledge is a plus. Demonstrates strong communication skills / can present to functional teams and management. Can distill and summarize large and complex data sets in a simple and concise way and present it clearly without losing sight of the big picture. Able to work with limited direction, can understand and link strategy to the underlying drivers of the business. Extremely organized, thorough and takes pride in quality Strong analytical and problems solving skills Proven ability to prioritize and handle multiples task in a time sensitive manner. Excellent team player as well as the ability to work independently.


NOTE: Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest. lululemon is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. This Equal Employment Opportunity policy applies to all practices relating to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, discipline, transfer, termination and all other terms and conditions of employment. Burlington, ONAbout the Role

L3 WESCAM Service Operations team is looking for a new member to drive the development and delivery of process and technical solutions. The ideal candidate will be responsible for the leadership of projects to develop and/or implement new tools and processes to improve the management of customer repairs and material forecasting. This individual will play a hands on role working with cross functional teams to facilitate workshops, capture business requirements, create functional specifications and prepare gap analysis.
As part of this role, you will become a subject matter expert of ERP system and key tools. This role will allow you to continue to develop your Business Analytics, Project Management and technical skills.

About L3 WESCAM
At L3 WESCAM, we develop the most advanced and complex optical and sensor systems for global defense and military sectors, Homeland Security, Search and Rescue and Airborne law enforcement. From long-range covert surveillance missions to search and rescue operations, our MX-series systems, and the mission systems solutions they are a part of, produce stabilized high-magnification electro-optical and infrared images from airborne, marine and ground based platforms, enabling our customers to see farther and react quicker.

L3 WESCAM offers a culture of true innovation and collaboration, and above all - work that you can be proud to be a part of. What we do protects and saves lives around the world. To experience more, go to http://www.WESCAM.com

Learn more about what we do…

Analyze business processes and synthesize complex information into clear process models and process documentation
Lead workshops to gather requirements and convert into use case, training instructions and departmental practices
Provide support for project management and report weekly updates to the management team

Create project business cases – by interfacing with the management team – to analyze processes, determine project scope, define resource, budget, timelines and document the deliverables
Work with users, management and other business units to investigate issues and make recommendations and implement required changes
Recommend and maintain business system user procedures, system documentation, and standard work instructions to maintain Quality documentation
Develop strong working relationships with the Customer Service, Service Center, Supply Chain, Materials, Quality and Finance teams
Develop functional software design documents and work with developers in production of technical design documents
Ensures the technical design conforms to functional requirements
Participate in System Integration testing and User Acceptance testing with the business users to ensure a high quality delivery of software updates and process changes
Provide status reports to the executive sponsor or other stakeholders as required
Skilled troubleshooting experience to diagnose the root cause of an issue and make recommendations

#LI-GDD

Strong knowledge of Lean Manufacturing concepts
Experience in gathering requirements for and understanding complex work flows across multiple departments
Strong analytical problem solving and investigative ability
Strong written and verbal communication skills

Life at L3 WESCAM

About L3 Technologies

L3 Technologies is a prime contractor in Command, Control, Communications, Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (C3ISR) systems market and a leading provider of a broad range of electronic systems used on both military and commercial platforms. Our customers include the U.S. Department of Defense and its prime contractors, U.S. Government intelligence agencies, the U.S. Department of Homeland Security, allied foreign governments, domestic and foreign commercial customers and select other U.S. federal, state and local government agencies.
Organized into 3 segments – Electronic Systems, Communications Systems and Intelligence Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) Systems – L3 Technologies employs over 31,000 people worldwide with reported 2017 sales of $9.6 billion.

job_description:
Toronto, ONHello, it’s a new day, and it’s time to answer the call to elevate your career and make life accessible for all.
Our purpose is to make life accessible
Our compassion and knowledge set us apart. With kindness and expertise, we support individuals by delivering the right mobility, accessibility, personal care, and daily living solutions. We believe that providing people with comprehensive solutions empowers and fulfills us all.
Our role is to care
As we strive to expand our reach and clients we care for, we are adding individuals to our teams who embody kindness, collaboration, and respect. If you want to help our clients experience their most vibrant lives while growing your own career in a nurturing, learning-focused and supportive environment - you will love being part of Motion.
Who we are
Motion is Canada’s leading provider of comprehensive and customized mobility and accessibility solutions for a wide variety of clients from children to elderly adults. Built on professional expertise and personalized service, we are proud to have served our clients for over 30 years. Whether a client is being fitted for equipment for the first time, is in need of an equipment repair or looking to upgrade their solution, our teams across Ontario, Alberta and B.C. are ready to apply their knowledge with the utmost of care and compassion. To learn more about how Motion is working to make life accessible, visit motioncares.ca.
Who we need
Reporting to the Director of Business Improvement, we are adding a Business Analyst to our team. This is a greenfield opportunity to scope out new projects and play a critical role on a new team created in response to a company-wide, cross-country reorganization. This is the chance to introduce and implement a process driven mindset into the organization and establish a culture of continuous improvement. Your work may include:
The simplification and standardization of inventory management and baseline inventory practices.
Development and implementation of an effective inventory control strategy to minimize waste and inventory variances.
Development of nationwide KPI’s for inventory and warehouse management.
Design, creation and implementation of documentation including warehouse SOP’s, processes and policies.
Who you are
You want to join a national organization undergoing an exciting period of transformation. You want to spearhead change initiatives resulting in significant business improvement and customer satisfaction. You are drawn to the bigger cause of Motion and want to be part of making life more accessible.
You are a clear and effective communicator with a passion for continuous improvement. You believe in the power and efficiencies of Lean processes. You are entrepreneurial and creative. You are an inquisitive and high-energy team player who takes a strategic approach to managing and driving change.
What you will do
Lead and implement key strategic projects, focusing on Inventory and warehouse management. You will own and drive improvement projects with the goal of improving quality, reducing costs, increasing productivity and improving cycle time by reducing wasted time, rework, etc.
Inventory & Analysis. Every mobility device we process is custom to our clients, as a result we rely on our warehouse to play an integral role in keeping our operations running smoothly. Work closely with the regions and head office to perform analysis of our inventory and ensure we are utilizing our inventory effectively, purchasing the right equipment, maintaining solid inventory data.
Be a role model. You will exemplify excellence in continuous improvement (CI). You will identify opportunity, develop sustainable targets and embed practices within the business. You will work with leadership to create an environment for learning, team goal alignment and accountability removing barriers to these objectives.
Report. You will liaise with finance and other members of the organization in assessing, tracking and reporting the financial benefit of a project. You will provide management with project status updates, feedback, and appropriate reporting on key responsibilities and objectives.
What you bring
The education. You have a Bachelor Degree and possess practical financial and business acumen.
As the Expertise, you also have demonstrated success in:
Inventory reduction best practices.
Project management.
Business optimization and process improvement.
Business transformation.
Continuous improvement process- in quality, sales, distribution and operations.
Cost savings.
The technical skills. You are comfortable using the Microsoft Office Suite of products; data analysis and tools.
The analytical and collaborative approach. You can foster a positive working environment, encouraging adoption and buy-in of continuous improvement initiatives. You have outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal, and can relay complex concepts to audiences at any level, gaining trust and nurturing a collaborative team approach. You are comfortable providing feedback and following through to track improvement.
Some travel within Canada may be required (less than 10%).
Progressive experience (2 - 8 years) willing to hire a junior to more seasoned professional provided that individual has some logistics, manufacturing or material handling experience.
Why join?
At Motion, we’ve undergone a recent transformation, and we think that’s exciting. With a strong reputation as experts in our field, we’re turning inwards to foster a culture of belonging, giving and strength. Joining us now is a chance to be part of that momentum; an opportunity to make an impact in people’s lives and help create a company environment you believe in.
Thank you for taking the time to consider joining us. If you want to be part of our team, express your interest here.
Motion is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please contact us.

Miller Thomson LLP is one of Canada’s fastest growing national business law firms, with offices located in Vancouver, Calgary, Edmonton, Regina, Saskatoon, London, Kitchener-Waterloo, Guelph, Toronto, Markham, Vaughan and Montréal. We are seeking a Business Analyst to join our Toronto office. This is a great opportunity to join our Information Technology team!
In this role, you will be tasked to:
Work with technology partners (i.e. Solution Designers and Architects) to research and analyze current state system capabilities and define technology solutions options and recommendations.
Define, document and translate business requirements into detailed functional specifications (System Requirement Specification, Requirement Package), taking into account non-functional requirements.
