Participate in quality management reviews, including designs, prototypes and other requirements work products.
Work closely with stakeholders to determine solutions, assess impact to existing work processes and systems, and pinpoint how to manage integration.
Provide operational and process-related analysis and support.
Respect existing processes and standards including requirements management and project management disciplines, technology delivery and business technology architecture, escalating issues as needed.
Gain knowledge in own area, stay abreast of technology trends and developments, develop expertise in Legal Services, applications, infrastructure, analytical tools and techniques, business domains and their products and services.
Coach new or less experienced colleagues and serve as a reference point throughout requirements management life cycle
To be successful in this role, you possess:
3+ years of experience as Business Analyst or Business Systems Analyst preferably in a Legal setting
Ability to develop and maintain a product roadmap
2+ years of experience with SQL or other data analysis and querying tools
Strong analytical skill set - have the ability to transform business logic described in business requirements into use cases and the ability to trace and analyze data back to its origination.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Expertise in managing various stakeholder expectations in delivering solutions to meet business requirements
Commitment to applying sound knowledge of business technology delivery practices and standards, including design, development, testing and project management.
Sound knowledge of system analysis process and techniques, as well as system components, functionality, interfaces, data flows and business rules.
Ability to contribute to specialized project activities of low to moderate complexity (which will involve developing user requirements), while working under management guidance and supervision.
Technical Expertise:
Experience with Agile methodologies and tools such as JIRA
Experience with cloud services like AWS or Google Cloud
Proficiency with PowerPoint, Project and Visio
Write and execute MS SQL queries

job_title: Fulfillment Analyst (Logistics and Vendor Management Analyst)
job_description:
Fulfillment Analyst (Logistics and Vendor Management Analyst)
Continuously drive Operations department forward towards business results, customer experience, and departmental efficiencies through a high focus on innovation and data analytics. Manage key performance indicators, recommend process improvement proposals, and own the change management. Drive the logistics and vendor management area of the business towards targeted results, particularly in the areas of: (1) vendor management and engagement, and (2) distributor rebate program administration and management.
As our Fulfillment Analyst, you will:
Identify, manage, and improve departmental key performance indicators
Be accountable for compilation and delivery of business performance scorecards
Work with business owners to implement recommendations
Act as primary conduit between Fulfillment Management and Business Development with major distributor partners for in-between activities and interactions across spectrum of vendor types
Responsible for RFP issuance, analytics, evaluation, and recommendations
Responsible for vendor program viability and feasibility assessments
Provide recommendations and enact both tactical and strategic decisions in accordance to overall vendor sourcing strategy
Be point person for vendor engagement activities such as business reviews, presentation preparation, etc.
Provide analysis of business trends, customer experience, and propose strategic recommendations
Build strong business relationships
Continuous learning and self-development
Identify and implement process improvements while continuously seeking opportunities to innovate
Track and report on status of all improvement initiatives
Document and maintain department risk management processes/policies
Maintain and create policy and process documentation and report to management and administration
As our ideal candidate you’ll also have:
Post-Secondary Degree
1 year of relevant experience
How Do We Hire Great People?
We believe in matching the right people for the right role. Once you’ve applied for a position, our team of Talent Advisors will review your resume and application against all open roles at Softchoice. We also keep in mind any future or upcoming roles you may be a fit for. As part of our selection, onboarding and development process, we utilize tools to help us better match candidates with our roles.
Applying for a role at Softchoice is not complete until you have completed both the formal online application and the Predictive Index tool (PI). Completing the PI tool will take no more than 10 minutes of your time.

If we see a match with your skills and our open roles, we will reach out to you to schedule time to talk so that we can learn more about you and you can learn about us. Only those candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted directly. However, we will retain your application on file and would be pleased to contact you if further opportunities arise.

Prepare time and cost estimates for completing projects.

Problems lack prior definition. Positive, enthusiastic attitude, self-motivation and strong work ethic.

job_title: Professional Services Business Analyst - System Analyst
job_description:
Tier1 is a rapidly growing Fintech organization focused on global relationship management. As partners in innovation, Tier1 continually engages with our clients and industry partners to help envision the future state of capital markets and bring it to life. Our culture centers on collaboration and intellectual curiosity. Our dynamic team brings together expertise spanning capital markets, product management, technology and other corporate disciplines to ensure our clients can optimize their client relationship data and translate it into greater engagement and efficiency. We deliver the tools, connectivity, and workflows to power collaboration, transparency, and communications between capital markets participants.

In all that we do, we put our clients’ needs first, working closely to proactively address their pain points and help them clear the path toward opportunity, efficiency and profitability.

Technical Business Analyst - System Analyst

We are currently looking for technical business analysts to join our Professional Services team to serve as a Tier1CRM evangelist to a growing list of customers. Our Professional Services team is responsible for all aspects of an implementation from requirements gathering to end user training. As a technical business analyst, you will be involved in all these exciting activities such as: participate in or lead workshops with our customers to gather requirements for their Salesforce & Tier1CRM implementation, configure Salesforce & Tier1CRM solutions to meet those requirements, deploy changes into sandbox and product environments & run training sessions on how to use Tier1CRM products.

Primary responsibilities include:

Work with project managers to lead workshops with the customers to gather requirements
Recommend solutions to meet customer requirements by leveraging Salesforce & Tier1CRM best practices
Participate or lead efforts to develop and execute testing, training, and documentation
Participate in or lead deployment of Salesforce & Tier1CRM changes to sandboxes or production environments
Assist customers with their data analysis, data migration, and reporting requirements
Analyze root cause of issues to ensure a permanent resolution is implemented
What we look for:

At least 2 – 5 years of experience in a software development company or a bank/investment bank, preferably with CRM experience or Salesforce experience
Salesforce.com Administration Essentials for New Admin (ADM 201) Certification or prior Salesforce work experience
Degree in computer science/engineering/mathematics/business
Excellent oral and written English communication skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to explain complex topics in simple terms to project stakeholders
Be able to learn quickly with minimum guidance
Write simple SOQL queries or Apex triggers
Experience working in an agile environment
Knowledge of the capital markets industry
May require up to 25% travel to United States, Europe, APAC
What we offer?

Competitive salary
Career development & growth at Tier1CRM
Health and dental benefits
Corporate discount for Goodlife Fitness
Exciting social & fundraising events (departmental & company wide)
Tier1CRM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to equal treatment of all employees without regard to race, national origin, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, physical or mental disability or other basis protected by law

Vancouver, BCContractSince 1992, Saje Natural Wellness has been passionately helping people live healthier, happier and longer lives. Our 500+ products are all 100% natural, and sold exclusively on our eCommerce channels and in our expanding number of experience-based retail locations throughout North America. Saje’s goal is to connect people with the healing power of plants by using ingredients sourced straight from nature.
We have been ranked by Canadian Business and PROFIT as one of Canada’s fastest growing companies. With this awesome growth, we are looking for enthusiastic, wellness-minded A-players to join our team and share in our passion for spreading wellness around the globe.
Come join a culture that fosters people, wellness, and of course, awesomeness!
Are you ready for your #dreamjob?
Description
Are you super passionate about both retail and data? Are you excited to support awesome Saje growth through new technologies? If so, this may be your #dreamjob!
We are looking for an awesome Business Intelligence & Data Analyst to join our team and support our plans for establishing our Business Intelligence and Customer Master solutions. This position is being offered as a 6-month contract role with expectation of extension as further project phases are initiated.
Saje has launched a program to build a cloud based data warehouse/analytics platform which will integrate across all key systems. As part of this exciting program we will also be improving our capabilities to manage and capture Community Member (customer) information in support of providing outrageous service.
Responsibilities
Use your extensive BI and data project experience to help shape project scope, approach and solutions
Assume ownership of technical work packages from inception to delivery. Work packages will span the data architecture from source system data extraction through to BI report/dashboard delivery
Provide technical expertise on investigating data issues and make recommendations on system or process improvements to mitigate data issues
Be a point person for day to day questions around Saje data and reports. Provide guidance to Saje users on information availability and how to best utilize BI capabilities
Build strong partnerships with technical partners to lead the development of new technical components and perform user acceptance testing
Design and develop end user reports and dashboards using tools such as Power BI, Excel, and SSRS
Applicant Requirements
5+ years Business Intelligence and Data experience specifically on data focused projects such as BI, Data Warehousing, Analytics or Master Data Management
Ability to solve problems quickly, think creatively and thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
Strong personal leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate at all levels of the organization with clarity and precision
Ability to work independently while maintaining strong communications with stakeholders
Passionate about fostering cohesion and motivation amongst cross-functional teams
Solid knowledge of Business Intelligence and Data Warehouse concepts and practical applications
Demonstrated capability to assume different roles as required (E.g. Requirements gathering, development, testing)
Expert level SQL query development skills
Strong proficiency with Microsoft Power BI and/or SSRS
Experience working in a cloud based environment such as MS Azure is an asset
Key Relationships
Reporting to the Director of IT, Business Intelligence

What we hope you will achieve......(circa 2020) one year from now...

Your potential story, one year from now…We’d like to thank you for your contributions providing business consulting and data analytics services to clients that helped the company achieve a consecutive year of triple digit sales growth, two more industry awards, and record customer satisfaction levels. Here are some of your contributions as a member of our ever-growing business team:

You mastered the Tangam analytics and visualization software and independently constructed valuable customer-facing presentations. You used your superior data analytics skills to create recommendations on how clients can improve their operations. You have enabled clients to optimize their game mix, table spreads, schedules and general operations to increase their profitability by 10% - 15%. You supported several successful timely rollouts of Tangam’s software along with the Account Managers and Applications Engineers.
You statistically analyzed clients’ databases with internal tools to understand their patrons’ behavioural and business volume and product performance patterns. You then shared and discussed insights with the Account Managers, and contributed to recommendations on how to configure Tangam’s software based on these findings.
You met with a couple of new clients in-person to assist with their data analytics needs and supported the rollout of Tangam's software. You also quickly prepared high-quality business reports and created presentations aimed at clients’ upper management outlining the incremental revenue/profit and return on investment for their properties.
Based on client feedback and guidance from the Business team, you identified case study opportunities and used client data to demonstrate the benefits of Tangam’s software. These case studies were then released to the press and resulted in new sales.
You went beyond expectations and advanced your knowledge of analytics, operations optimization and data visualization. You shared your knowledge with the business analyst team, thus catalyzing process/technology changes that helped them be more effective in their careers.
We can’t wait until next year. Now back to today. If you’d like this story to be yours, apply now.

Who we are

Tangam is a small and rapidly growing company that is at the cutting edge of developing data analytics, operations optimization and visualization software. Our flagship product Table Games Yield Management (TYM) helps casinos to optimize their table games operations through effective resource allocation and staff scheduling. Our software takes the complexity out of data analytics and makes data understandable and actionable to ordinary users. Many large, medium and small casinos in the U.S., Canada, and Australia already use TYM successfully to enhance their business and better satisfy their patrons. Our patented products have won numerous industry awards and recognitions. We continue to push the envelope on what is possible in the area of data analytics and optimization software, and we are always seeking new talent to join us on our exciting journey.

Visit our website for more information.

Requirements

Good communicator. Strong written/oral communication. Ability to explain complex ideas and statistical concepts in a clear, concise manner. Proficiency in spoken and written French/Mandarin/Cantonese are all assets.

Data wizard. 2-5 years of experience in data analysis. Proficient with Excel, pivot tables and macros. Experience working with business intelligence tools such as Tableau, SAS and Cognos is an asset. Knowledge of relational databases with the ability to read and write SQL is an asset.

Educated. Undergraduate degree in Applied Mathematics / Statistics, Business, or Computer Science / Engineering with a strong mathematics background.

Must have no criminal record, and must be willing and able to travel ~5% - 15% of working time.

Experience with casinos is an asset.

Build a meaningful career

At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.

Business Systems Analyst
Implementation
Markham, ON
Full Time

The successful candidate
Above all else, you’re a critical thinker. You focus on understanding problems and identifying user needs. Whether writing or speaking, you communicate clearly and precisely. You’re highly analytical and enjoy digging into details. You see how business and technology intersect. You can participate in technical discussions and can understand technical subjects, but can easily explain them in non-technical language. You thrive in situations that demand pragmatic and creative problem solving.

Work with internal business partners, developers, UI and UX designers, and clients to collect and analyze requirements for ongoing maintenance and system enhancements, including new builds or re-designs of proprietary in-house systems.
Support teams responsible for gathering client implementation requirements by explaining core system functionality and configurable options.
Write user stories, and work with Health & Benefits line-of-business Product Owners to prioritize changes and groom the backlog.

Review testing documents and test cases, and perform some testing as required.
Support systems development teams and business areas as required.
Think continuously of ways to improve team operations.
Build knowledge of industry topics and trends through internal training, external training and self-study, as appropriate.
Perform other tasks and special projects, as required.
Requirements
Minimum 3-5 years of experience in a technically oriented Business Systems Analyst role.
Experience with Agile projects using the SCRUM process framework.
Understanding and application of UI design principles.
Understanding and application of UX concepts.
Experience drawing process models based on the BPMN 2.0 standard.
Understanding of Service Oriented Architecture.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent time management skills and the ability to manage multiple assignments.
Ability to work independently, take initiative, and exercise good judgement with very little supervision.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving and creative-thinking skills.
Experience in Group Insurance administration or with HR, billing, and payroll systems an asset.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst - Yield Reporting & Analysis
job_description:
Use your analytical acumen & creativity to create better outcomes for our business and customers

Join our team

Small Business Solutions (SBS) is a marketing environment like no other at TELUS!

The SBS Wireline Product and Pricing Team leads all the pricing initiatives targeting the small business space across Canada. In addition to pricing, we are also the guardians of end-to-end customer experience for the products that we manage. We are a high-performing team who values diversity of thought and experience to stay connected with our customers. We are small and nimble which offers us the ability to work across many functions and realize unparalleled professional growth.

SBS is a tight-knit group. Working in our team will give you the opportunity to learn about all aspects of our business – not just Marketing. We value our team’s engagement and connect through collaborative workstyles, team events both local and national, and giving back to our communities through volunteer activities. We are a team that strives for top-notch customer and business outcomes, but also balance that with team member engagement and flexibility.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together
Help create great customer experiences by helping to deliver every sale to install
Help us grow our sales channels and rep engagement by ensuring that all orders get fulfilled
Improve profitability by improving efficiency and 15% increase in sales yield through our D2D channel
Here's how
Use data to drive insights, and identify areas of opportunity
Collaborate across functions and rally teams to positive outcomes
Facilitate process improvement
Roll up your sleeves to catch orders before they fall-out
Qualifications

You're the missing piece of the puzzle
A recognized collaborative team player with excellent interpersonal, negotiation and communication skills
Passionate ability to lead through influence and rally a team toward a common goal
Proven analytical ability and strong business acumen who is respected for your ability to translate large volumes of disparate data and information into clear findings and business cases
Strong analytical and problem solving skills and able to generate multiple solutions to any problem
Excellent time management and business analysis including quantitative and qualitative analysis
Moderate to advanced Excel skills with the ability to identify trends and dig deeper (eg. Vlookup)
Experience using visualization software such as Tableau and Domo
Energetic self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, sometimes ambiguous environment and driven by wanting to create an exceptional customer and team experience
Great-to-haves
Cross-functional knowledge (eg. BCX, Consumer, etc.)
Experience developing requirements for automated reporting

At KF Aerospace we work with a variety of business systems including an ERP, BPMS, OCR, business intelligence, document management, and various other supporting and integration systems. The Business Systems Analyst is responsible for working with each of theses systems to configure, develop solutions, and troubleshoot issues.

In addition, the BSA will gather requirements, collaborate on designing solutions, assist the business with ad hoc requests, and create documentation.
Duties and Responsibilities
Learn to operate, troubleshoot, configure, and manage a variety of applications and business systems.Investigate and troubleshoot application and system related incidents to resolve issues or manage escalations.Collaborate in the development and testing of applications and solutions.Assist the business with ad-hoc system related requests: data extractions, uploads, bulk manipulations, and automations.Work with stakeholders and team members to gather requirements and then collaborate to design solutions to meet those requirements.Look for and identify opportunities in the business for possible improvements.Write or update documentation to support both end-users and internal users.
Required Certification, Education, Experience or Skills
Certification or degree in a related field or equivalent work experience.Two or more years of experience in an equivalent role.Experience with SQL and relational databases, preferably SQL Server.Exposure to the following would be an asset: corporate ERP systems, BPMS, business intelligence, document management, OCR.Exposure to programming and developmental best practices would be considered an asset.A proven track record of strong technical, analytical, and communication skills.
BENEFITS
Medical and Dental CoverageHealth Spending AccountDisability, Critical Illness, and Life InsuranceEmployee & Family Assistance ProgramEmployee PensionPersonal Time Off and much more

Business Analyst, Coporate
The opportunity
As a Business Analyst, you will be focused on the analysis, implementation, support and enhancements of systems that enable and improve enterprise service management functions for Corporate and Enterprise Operations customers.
You will play a key role underlying all initiative delivery. Your responsibility is to understand, document and facilitate agreement on requirements, approaches, specifications and decision variables that enable the delivery of appropriate solutions to achieve the business and project goals.
Who you'll work with
Joining the Business Analyst team in this dynamic role, collaboration will be the key to your success, working with other solution teams including: Relationship & Application Management, Project Management, Solutions Engineering, external vendor consultants and QA on a dynamic portfolio of initiatives that encompasses production support, small & medium enhancements and projects. The ultimate goal is to deliver on business needs and provide customer value.
What you'll do
Engage business clients (Product Owners) to elicit business requirements and understand business objectives
Produce business analysis related documentation, including (functional and non-functional) requirements in the form of stories, current and future state processes and workflows, and solution specifications to a high quality standard
Accountable for conducting analysis with appropriate detail and quality for discussion with Service Owners or Process Owners to validate performance against Service Level Agreements, identify process opportunities and business decision support

PURPOSE
Reporting to the Strategy and Business Performance lead for our direct and partnerships businesses based in Aviva’s Digital Garage. Working closely with the senior leadership team to provide visibility and actionable insights into the underlying drivers of end-to-end business performance to enable effective decision-making and to ensure alignment of strategic investments.
Please note that this role will require some travel to our Markham location office.
ACCOUNTABILITIES
Leads the end-to-end analysis of business performance of the direct and partnership businesses understanding the financial, trading, claims, marketing, and customer drivers and their contribution to overall performance.
Monitors and tracks performance issues and proposes remediation actions for adoption to business owners.
Works closely with the data team lead to build out a roadmap and develop key BAU business reporting.
Contribute to the development of interactive/dynamic dashboards.
Works closely with the change delivery team to track the impact of changes in product, system or delivery on performance.
Leads prioritization of incoming data requests for the team and manages outcomes with business leads.
Using various analytical tools and data sets, you will build predictive models on potential outcomes of business plans and & forecasts based on current performance indicators.
A large part of this role is to design, implement, and maintain analytical reporting and visualization that tells the story of what is happening, why it is happening and provide actionable insights to the leadership team. As a key team member, you should be able to leverage your experience in business intelligence & data automation to help senior stakeholders understand the performance in a proficient manner.
Provide ad hoc analysis, insight to support strategic initiatives and internal projects.
Actively collaborate with finance, claims, operations, marketing, underwriting and business leaders to enhance corporate reporting.
REQUIREMENTS
EDUCATION
Post-secondary education
EXPERIENCE
Insurance/banking/financial services/consulting background an advantage
2+ years’ experience in a business performance/analytics role
3-5 years industry experience
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
This role requires an individual with strong analytical and communication skills, a strategic thinker. An ability to think outside the box with a big picture mentality
This role requires an individual with an insatiable desire to probe, question, validate and challenge the ‘why’.
The ability to understand and connect large volumes of data and analyze the different data sets to find patterns, trends, and insights to capture a good view of business (Sales, Product, Operations etc.) performance that result in actionable outcomes.
Experienced in subjects such as performance management, balanced scorecard, project management, trend analysis, dashboards, and business process improvement
Superior interpersonal skills with the ability to build relationships with business functions, executives and business partners, as well as leveraging the data extraction skills within the team
An advocate for change and new ways doing of doing things – challenge the status quo.
Additional Information
Aviva Canada is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities during all phases of the hiring process including the application process. If you are selected for an interview and require an accommodation, you are encouraged to advise the Talent Acquisition Partner who will consult with you to determine an appropriate accommodation.

Job Description
CRM Business Analyst
Reporting into the Manager of Business Insights & Analytics, the CRM Business Analyst will be the “go to” individual contributor for the Individual Insurance CRM (Salesforce.com). He/she will be responsible for CRM projects, enhancements, maintenance and best practices.
This is an exciting new role within the Insurance organization.
This unique and critical role will appeal to those individuals with a real passion for enhancing how the Insurance team currently uses the CRM. He/she will recommend best practices and improvements, and work with IT to implement technological improvements, with the intent of increasing the effectiveness and improving the overall user experience.
Key Accountabilities:
Administration and Maintenance of the CRM System – 45%
First line of support and troubleshooting for Insurance CRM users, escalating when necessary to the appropriate CRM IT Team.
Conduct ongoing needs assessment interviews with various partners to clearly understand how the system is being used
Work with Head of Sales Strategy to understand the overall sales objectives and how the technology can be enhanced to better support the objectives
Act as a central information resource to internal and external business partners.
Participate and represent Individual Insurance in multi-functional CRM meetings
Transfer knowledge to the Insurance team through coaching and consulting.
Actively work with the wholesalers to understand their needs and introduce solutions to make them more efficient and effective
Review CRM enhancement requirements with the requestor to ensure a full understanding of the needs to deliver the solution in an accurate and timely manner.
Management of inquiries received from the various internal/external Clients.
Develop and enhance controls as required including security models, user profiles and sharing rules.
Creation of change management plans for new releases, including communication strategy, training, timing of release and benefits to partners.
Project Management – 25%
Collect and prioritize all incoming requests for the Individual Insurance CRM.
As applicable, liaise with other lines of business within Manulife on new projects, initiatives and training.
Participate and help drive projects that support CRM enhancements.
Represent and advocate for the needs of the Insurance organization on new CRM projects and enhancements.
Liaise with Salesforce IT to coordinate system releases/implementations.
Work with business partners to strategically prioritize backlog.
Execution of test plans and ensuring that the delivered solution is working as understood and no additional impacts to the CRM have occurred
Take a leadership role in prioritizing enhancement requests.
Data Integrity and Management – 30%
Load and update mass data as required
Engage in weekly and/or monthly standard processes that keep the CRM updated and accurate (e.g. territory changes, wholesaler updates)
Actively monitor data for cleanliness and data integrity.
Qualifications
Minimum of 3 years’ experience in CRM administration, business analysis and development.
Knowledge of Salesforce (including Apex, VisualForce, and Visual Workflow) is highly desired
Superior analytical and negotiation skills.
Strong awareness of the Insurance wholesaling processes as it pertains to financial advisors.
General business knowledge as well as knowledge of mainframe/datasets and other reporting tools.
Solid understanding of the upstream admin systems and downstream impacts to other areas.
Experience using PMF project management framework is an asset.
Experience with Agile Management Frameworks such as Scrum and Kanban is an asset.
Excellent organizational skills.
Ability to multi-task with proven customer service and coaching skills.
Proven communication skills (both verbal and written) combined with sound decision making skills.
Flexible, creative and responsive to customer needs and to miscellaneous assignments as assigned.
Attention to accuracy and detail is critical.
Excellent PC skills; knowledge of PC-Based software (Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Windows).
Solid team player with a high commitment to quality work and service.
Highly motivated and driven, able to work with minimal supervision.
Ability to work directly with senior management contacts within Manulife and sometime with external partners and suppliers (as required).
Ability to develop positive internal business relationships and contacts.
Key Problems/Challenges:
Adapt to new requests and rapidly changing business requirements.
Keep current and adaptive to new technologies in a rapidly growing environment.
Multiple tasks with high volume and competing priorities.
Manage changing priorities and effectively handle a diverse workload.
Provide exceptional service in all business relationships while maintaining integrity and accuracy.
Maintenance of secure CRM functionalities and quality of data are critical to ensure continued business operations

If you are ready to unleash your potential it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.

About Manulife

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. We operate as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2016, we had approximately 35,000 employees, 70,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 22 million customers. At the end of 2016, we had $977 billion (US$728 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made almost $26 billion in payments to our customers.


Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 100 years. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.

New Westminster, BCTemporary$64,199 a yearWork Arrangements
This temporary, full-time (35 hours per week) position is available from February 18, 2019 to March 27, 2020.

The anticipated hours of work are Monday to Friday 9:00am to 5:00pm. The work hours may change based on operational requirements. Modified or flexible schedule may be considered.

Occasional travel between campuses may be required, as will occasional evening and/or weekend work.

What Douglas Offers
DO what you love. Be good at it. That’s how Douglas College defines a great career. It’s a philosophy that resonates through our classrooms, our offices and our boardrooms. It inspires our students and drives us to make Douglas College one of BC’s Top Employers. We love what we do. And we’re looking for passionate, motivated people to join us in making one of Canada’s best colleges even better.

The Role
The Business Systems Analyst works across departments and teams to scope, to design and deliver enterprise technical solutions that support the business vision of the College. They perform as a solution specialist; they find solutions to business problems by maximizing the use of features in our current technology and minimizing creation of special cases and once-only custom solutions. They focus on gathering requirements and converting this into the architecture and design that will provide the solution. They perform as a technical solution architect pertaining to the College’s enterprise architecture

They perform as a development team lead; as such, they provide guidance to the development team to deliver on the design of the solution. They ensure that the development team delivers the correct solution in a timely manner. They ensure that the designs are reusable and fit in the broader enterprise architecture of the College. They ensure the effective use of internal and external resources.

They provide exceptional client-centered service on a consistent basis to all stakeholder groups.

Responsibilities
1. Provides leadership and supervision to appropriate team members and external resources.
a. Supervises coding and release of code into production. May need to write code when necessary.
b. Applies the BCGEU Collective Agreement to the daily decision-making, including but not limited to scheduling work hours, vacation and overtime.
c. Participates in hiring and evaluations as assigned, including providing orientation and ensuring the provision of appropriate training and professional development.
d. Provides input into staff job descriptions.
e. Manages the work queue, assigns work and manages the velocity of work done.
f. Collaborates with manager to ensure adequate coverage for areas.

2. Designs and leads the delivery of technical solutions to support the College’s business vision.
a. Conducts business analysis planning and monitoring.
b. Performs requirement gathering, management and analysis.
c. Collaborates across departments and teams to develop Application solutions.
d. Facilitates workshops to gather both functional and technical requirements.
e. Develops documentation of plans and designs from interviews with users.
f. Researches and analyzes existing practices and procedures.
g. Creates test plans and conducts system testing.
h. Participates in code deployment.
i. Plans and assists with user training for Application solutions.
j. Researches and recommends tools, strategies, methodologies and priorities involving the technologies utilized at the College.
k. Helps developers and project managers in design, planning and leading the project.
l. Liaises with vendors for technical and project related issues.
m. Performs some of the duties of the team members when required.

3. Performs other related duties.
a. Provides information, technical assistance and support to users.
b. Attends internal and external meetings.
c. Creates and maintains system documentation for technical and non-technical users.
d. Delivers training to users and peers in software functionality and business processes.
e. Keeps current with technology trends and best practices.
f. Maintains a high level of technical currency and competency by presenting and attending courses and training activities; reviewing professional publications; participating in professional societies.

To Be Successful in this Role You Will Need
A Bachelor’s Degree in Computing Science. Management Information Systems or equivalent IT Program from a recognized post-secondary educational institution supplemented by a minimum of three years’ relevant experience in programming and analysis, utilizing structured programming techniques or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Should have the following Skills:
o Analytical and problem solving skills to generate new ideas, to solve problems
o Decision-making skills
o Acquire the knowledge of applications in the organization
o Earn the trust of stakeholders
o Ability to, quickly, acquire good industry knowledge that the organization/department is in.
o Operations Analysis
o Quality control Analysis
o Good personal organizational skills
Proven experience in:
o Project management methodology.
o Facilitation, and in a leadership role (formal or informal).
o Creating use cases, data models, and other skills to get information from the users.
o Promoting process improvement
o Several programming and scripting languages such as SQL, PL/SQL, Java.
o Change management, version control (experience with GIT an asset).
A demonstrated ability to:
o Work independently with minimal supervision.
o Establish priorities and achieve deadlines.
o Establish and maintain application specific documentation and operational procedures.
Requires, excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, teaching skills (to communicate issues and requirements)Must be engaged and a team player, be able to work with different personalities (good interpersonal skills), display professionalism, develop and maintain professional relationships, and be reliable.Requires a strong technical background, keeps current with technology and is committed to a variety of learning opportunities.Proven record of continual training, upgrading and/or certification, of programming tools, business functions and of emerging technologies.

PermanentUniversity Health Network (UHN) is looking for an experienced professional to fill the key role of Learning Management System Analyst in our Organization and Employee Development Department.
University Health Network (UHN) is Canada’s leading research hospital. UHN encompasses Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto Rehabilitation Institute and the Michener Institute of Education at UHN. The breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise has made UHN a national and international resource for patient care, research and education. UHN consists of 16,000 employees, more than 1,200 physicians, 8,000+ students, and many volunteers. It is affiliated with the University of Toronto and educates thousands of healthcare professionals that work in Canada and around the world.
As a member of the UHN eLearning team, the Learning Management System Analyst acts as the global system administrator for the Learning Management System (LMS) to ensure that it meets the priority needs of UHN.
Responsibilities:
Maintain the smooth configuration, implementation and operation of the Learning Management System.
Remain current with the systems’ functionality and how it can best serve the organization’s current and future needs.
Support integration with the HRIS relational database and ongoing data migration (user data and training content).
Participate in the creation, documentation, and training of LMS system standards, policies and procedures.
Plan and initiate system changes, configuration and updates; perform regular system audits to ensure data integrity and content storage compliance.
Act as the escalation landing point for all LMS end users, including learners, managers, supervisors, and training administrators.
Analyze stakeholders’ business processes and workflows and translate them into system functionality to help align organizational needs with existing system features.
Build simple and complex learning activity structures including ILT courses, curricula, learning plans, and configure eLearning content for upload.
Consult with stakeholders to determine reporting needs and analyze system capabilities to meet those needs.
Create, maintain and update reference materials for learners, administrators, managers, and other stakeholders to enable accurate and knowledgeable use of the LMS.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or formal technical education in a related field.
Minimum two (2) - five (5) years LMS administration and operation experience required ideally with experience serving as LMS Global System
Administrator experience on SumTotal LMS an strong asset.
Proven experience and knowledge of SCORM, AICC requirements and configuration and APIs.
Solid knowledge of corporate learning platform systems, system configuration, implementation, program design and development.
Strong consultation skills are required in order to pre-qualify vendors, systems, and software in order to meet the changing and diverse needs of the organizations’ audiences.
Negotiating skills to build consensus on a common set of requirements from all stakeholders.
Innovative, analytical, and creative thinker who is comfortable researching, testing and deploying new solutions, and technologies.
Knowledge of Microsoft SQL language and Business Intelligence Development Studio 2008 required.
Intermediate experience with MS Office suite including Access and Project.
Advanced Excel skills required for creating reports.
HTML and knowledge in Web design is an asset.
Familiarity with HRIS systems, VIP system experience would be an asset.
Ability to work effectively with people at all levels of the organization as well as with vendors, IT and external stakeholders.
Strong customer service, consultation, and technical education skills required.

Toronto, ONJob Description
Mackenzie Investments was founded in 1967 and is a leading investment management firm providing investment advisory and related services to retail and institutional clients. The company has $60 billion in assets under management, and as part of IGM (a subsidiary of the Power Financial Group of Companies), is the largest independent asset manager in Canada, with $140 billion. We are committed to the financial success of investors, through their eyes.

Our Vision
Everything we do starts with the needs of investors, whether they are saving for a child’s postsecondary education, setting money aside for the future needs of a family member with a disability, or funding their own retirement. In fact, our focus is summed up in our Vision statement: We are committed to the financial success of investors, through their eyes.

Our Values
Our growth and success are the direct result of our employees, and we strive to create a workplace supported by the following core values: Creativity and Innovation, Strong Decision Making, Collaboration, Courage, Honesty and Integrity, Confidence and Pride.

At Mackenzie Investments you can Build Your Career with Confidence by:
Changing the Game: We have a vision and a strategy that will challenge the way business in this industry is done and help Canadians be successful in the ways that mean the most to them.
Making a Smarter World: We believe in continuous learning, understanding what is most important and sharing the benefits of that knowledge.
Being Proud: As a part of our team you will do some of your best work, develop some of your most valuable skills and give back in ways that make a difference in the lives of Canadians.
Joining an Unstoppable Team: We build teams that look out for each other, ask the best of each other and deliver the finest work.
Learning and Growing: We offer an environment where you can indulge your curiosity to learn; getting the challenges and feedback you need to refine your skills and abilities.
Thriving in a Supportive Environment: We have created a workplace where your efforts and career are supported by your team and your leader.

The Corporate Solutions Technology department within Mackenzie Investments is accepting applications for the position of Data Systems Analyst. Reporting to the Manager, Systems Analysts & Architecture the successful candidate will be part of a small/agile team working with the Investment Management Division.
The Data Systems Analyst maintains a “business perspective” through all phases of the project and works with the entire IS project team to assist in the planning, designing and launching of new solutions in support of our growing business needs.

What we are looking for:
2+ years of experience working with business principles and different types of business data.
Post-secondary degree/diploma in a related discipline (Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or Information Systems Management).
Technical expertiseregarding data models, database design development, data analysis and reporting tools.
Knowledge of and experience with reporting/ business intelligence software (Tableau), databases (SQL, MongoDB), programming (Python, SQL).
Analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.
Understanding of IS Methodologies, processes and practices.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Planning and organizational skills with the ability to adapt to change and perform effectively under pressure.
Primary responsibilities will include but not limited to:
Liaise with business stakeholders to understand business objectives to design the solution that will meet their needs.
Elicit requirements from business stakeholders through interviews, workshops, business scenarios, and user stories.
Analyze system data requirements and model the data design to deliver to business requirements.
Design data acquisition and storage techniques for data from primary or secondary sources.
Query and review large data stores to understand the transactional information and business rules that govern the data. Identify outlying data patterns and data cleanliness issues for resolution.
Investigate and respond to data issues raised by business stakeholders.
Document the system specifications for the software development team.
Ensure the quality of the solution by testing the development results meet the business requirements.

GEEP (Global Electric Electronic Processing) is a global leader in the electronic asset management and end-of-life electronics recycling. Identify and analyze opportunities for improved efficiency/profitability
Complete adhoc financial requests

Participate in training as required and apply knowledge gained through training on the job

 Bachelor’s Degree in business, Economics, Finance, and/or Accounting

CPA designation or in final stages of completion
3 to 5 years of equivalent work experience required

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS • Assist in guiding the company’s financial strategy by developing models to predict key metrics such as volume, share of market and profitability • Support decision making by tracking and presenting the performance of the business and provide insights to senior management and regional/global planning teams • Analyze data from a variety of sources to understand industry trends and competitor activities and develop strategies to address them • Actively participate in designing solutions by modelling financial scenarios to drive business decisions. • Prepare presentations for senior management on market trends, business performance, and financials and tell a story through data and analytics SKILLS REQUIRED • Undergraduate university degree (recent graduate) • 1 -3 years of relevant work experience • Experience working with quantitative analysis • Advanced knowledge of Excel required (i.e. advanced formulas, Pivot tables, Macros) • Strong analytical, communication, organizational and problem-solving skills • Comfortable working with large data sets. WHAT WE OFFER We offer the opportunity to join a global business leader where you can grow in a wide range of business functions. We are Rothmans, Benson & Hedges Inc. Philip Morris International’s subsidiary in Canada -an International Fortune 500 Company. Today we are Canada's second largest tobacco company. In addition, RBH Inc. was awarded Top Employer for 2017 & 2018. We currently employ over 700 people throughout our six corporate and sales offices and our factory. Our parent company PMI is one of the world’s leading international tobacco company. In addition to the manufacture and sale of cigarettes, PMI is engaged in the development and commercialization of Reduced-Risk Products (“RRPs”). RRPs is the term we used to refer to products that present, are likely to present, or have the potential to present less risk of harm to smokers who switch to these products versus continued smoking. PMI has a range of RRPs in various stages of development, scientific assessment and commercialization. WHAT ARE WE DOING? At RBH we are currently disrupting our industry and going through a transformation. We are looking to a new vision, one which will help all smokers lead a smoke-free future. In doing so, we are commercializing an RRP product that uses a technology whereby it heats tobacco rather than burning it. We are really excited about our product, as we hope you will be too! We are looking for a candidate who shares a passion for our vision and is looking to build a career with an international company. Work with business and technology stakeholders to ensure alignment between business needs and technology projects, assets and services
Facilitate discovery sessions, brainstorming and business requirements gathering. Evaluate business requirements, data models, system requirements and vendor analysis when recommending solutions

Recreate steps taken by user to locate sources of problems using journey mapping, etc.
Capture and document business requirements, convert them into functional requirements, and identify use cases for approved projects working with business stakeholders, technical teams and vendors
Ensure solutions delivered meet expectations as well as interact with the stakeholders to simplify existing processes and streamline information flow
Participate in the coordination of upgrades and rollout of applications ensuring end user and stakeholder engagement throughout planning and implementation
Conduct business impact assessments. Plan change management activities with the business to encourage adoption by end users and high utilization of the solution. Participate in initial training sessions related to solutions when required
Document current and future state business processes, automating where appropriate
Identify gaps between business needs and deliverables
Develop recommendations to resolve gaps
Make recommendations to the business on how they can optimize their project deliverables to better achieve their objectives
Communicate regularly with business stakeholders to provide updates on key enterprise projects
Other duties as assigned
QUALIFICATIONS:
5+ years of experience in a similar role (Experience with Tour Operator/Airline/Hotel systems preferred)
Degree in a related discipline would be an asset (e.g., B. Com, B.Eng. B.Sc.)
Experience in business analysis, systems analysis, requirements definition and deployment of business requirements to information systems
Working knowledge of capturing business needs and developing business requirements and functional requirements documentation
Strong analytical and problem solving experience to deal with complex business problems
Proven ability to integrate perspectives across many functions and generate solutions
Strong organizational skills with an aptitude to juggle priorities to meet strict deadlines
Sense of initiative, self discipline and proactive thinking
Proven ability to work well under pressure and with minimal supervision
Strong interpersonal skills; must be a team player with solid relationship management skills and a customer centric approach
Advanced communication and facilitation skills
Strong technical aptitude combined with solid business acumen
Highly developed skills with MS Office, Access and Visio. Working knowledge of XML, API’s, SQL and HTML would be an asset
Flexibility and willingness to work extended hours on occasion
ENVIRONMENT AND SCOPE:
Fast paced, deadline oriented work environment
Able to work and share responsibilities within a team environment
Open concept office environment
Sensitive to deadlines

1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

Our Merchandising team is responsible for connecting our quality products and services with our customers. The team uses planning frameworks and tools to provide recommendations that will ensure financial results and provide decisions on key inputs such as point of sales forecasts.

This role will support the Kids department driven by seasonal demands of the business.

What you’ll do

The Category Business Analyst plays a direct role helping equip Canadians to live life to the fullest every day, by managing vendor processes, examining new and existing product lines, and performing analysis that better prepares us to meet the evolving needs of our customers.

You will support Category Business Managers in creating a compelling and relevant assortment by providing robust analysis and key insights that strengthen the brand with our customers and that deliver against the category level objectives and financial goals. You will inspire the Canadian Tire customer experience with your passion for continually improving processes and product lines, helping us be there for Canadians when they need us.

To excel as a Category Business Analyst, you will be creative and highly organized with a passion for delivering results. You will be responsible for:

Growing your merchandising category by providing support to the Category Business Managers by driving operational excellence accurately and on time

Demonstrating competency in organization, analytics, collaboration and communication

Leading the flawless execution of the line review process and assortment updates

Ensuring timely and accurate product information management

Coordinating samples with vendors in support of various CTR requirements

Acting as a point of contact for our vendors and third-party suppliers on day to day activities and program set-up

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

Our best Category Business Analysts are progressive thinkers, with solid experience in retail merchandising/buying, and managing cross-functional partnerships. This group is masterful at project coordination and planning, and have highly accomplished quantitative, problem-solving skills. To be successful in this role, you should have an analytical mindset with a strong understanding of utilizing data in order to create recommendations. Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with both internal and external clients is required. A solid understanding of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint is an asset.

Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. POSITION OVERVIEW: In conjunction with the Manager, Customer Loyalty & Acquisition, the purpose of this role is to drive business results through the development and execution of data analytics designed to meet the evolving business needs. He/she will support the CRM team through the development and delivery of data driven insights that drive engagement, acquisition, loyalty, retention and revenue.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

Liaison with retail, brand, product, sales, aftersales and service to support campaign requirements, identify/recommend key campaign target audience selection including prospect and/or customer data using data-driven insights including loyalty, lapsed clients, behaviour and demographic patterns, to ensure optimized customer journey and response rates.
Utilizing the campaign management tool, set-up of acquisition and retention campaigns; data selection criteria based on the customer journey, segmentation and behaviors; generation of campaign lists; campaign deployment tasks.
Conduct multi-variate testing and A/B testing to measure effectiveness of strategies and refine them as needed.
Translate customer data into insights, which will form a strategy to meet business needs and improve customer acquisition, growth and retention.
Be able to generate insightful PowerPoint presentations based on the findings and effectively communicate them to any business audience
Responsible for running adhoc data queries, list pulling, data compliancy, and reporting.
Serve as the key analytics / business intelligence contact
Using our CRM database and BI tool, you will analyze and report on corporate and business KPIs, highlighting actionable insights - successes, trends and opportunities. Maintain formal process to update and share findings with marketing team and business stakeholders.
Create reporting on analytical insights and campaign performance, identify opportunities and recommendations for CRM to scale its conversion and retention functions, and recommend improvements on strategies used by our marketing and sales team across their campaigns.
Develop reporting BI dashboards to provide insights and visualization into customer, channel and campaign performance based on existing and new KPIs, historical performance, as well as ad-hoc reporting by marketing managers and stakeholders.
Act as project lead on key database enhancement projects including gathering and translating business requirements, data integration, and testing.
Support manager with continuous innovation in CRM initiatives, marketing tactics to acquire and nurture prospects to conversion along the customer journey.

REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

3 -5 years of relevant experience in the same or similar positions.
Completion of an undergraduate degree. ... or an equivalent combination of experience and education.
Strong analytical and data mining capabilities with proven experience in business intelligence tools (i.e. QlikView, Tableau, SAS BI, TIBCO).
Solid SQL skills is a must
Hands-on experience with campaign lists and deployment (including email campaigns).
Experienced with SAS campaign management tool (CI and SAS Enterprise Guide (EG) is an asset.
Experienced with Qlik business intelligence tool is an asset.
Effective project management, business analysis and database marketing skills. Attention to detail, strong oral and written communication skills and a get-it-done attitude.
Experienced in sharing insights using story-telling skills.
A self-starter who is tenacious and creative in finding ways to get things done
Independent, strategic thinker
Excellent problem solving-skills
Minimum of 3 years of CRM / database experience
Automotive industry a plus

Seeking an analytics, data, and optimization maniac for digital products!
We are a digital product consultancy that plans, produces and manages digital products for clients, who operate in a diverse and broad range of industries and digital product types. The Digital Product Data Analyst collaborates closely with the Product Strategy and Product Management disciplines. You will participate in digital projects as the measurement, analytics and engagement expert. You will be responsible for selecting, configuring and harnessing a wide range of analytics and engagement tools with the goal of optimizing and improving the performance of each digital product. You will be a trusted advisor on each client's business and report how Apply and the products we manage are meeting client KPIs and ROI.

This is a full-time, permanent position.
WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING
Measure, monitor, predict
Develop and implement analytics instrumentation strategies to measure and predict product KPIs.
Visualize, simplify ,and communicate data that helps product managers and client stakeholders make the best choices for their digital products.
Educate and support colleagues, internal partners, and clients in their use of data to answer business questions.
Continuous product improvement
Using various traditional and non-traditional tactics, such as A/B testing, predictive technologies (AI, machine learning), to achieve improvements in the areas of acquisition, activation, retention, referral, revenue.
Partner with product managers by providing actionable insights, and follow-through on the measurement of the impact of the recommendations, showing visible results for our clients.
Consulting and business development
Provide support to business development and engineering teams on business analysis, technology approach, analytics and engagement solutions.
Continuously share the latest trends and understanding of analytics and data science techniques, tools, approaches, methodologies, and solutions.
Identify emerging technologies related to digital product management; provide guidance on whether the company should adopt and implement them.
YOUR QUALIFICATIONS
3-5 years working experience with digital analytics, product marketing and engagement tools (such as Mixpanel, Google Analytics, Leanplum, Optimizely for A/B Testing, MailChimp, HubSpot, Zapier)
Consulting, agency, or professional services experience a must
Experience connecting multiple data sources to construct a 360 degree understanding of digital product performance
Experience working with Business Intelligence Tools an asset (i.e. SQL database, Google Data Studio)
Experience using predictive (AI/ML) methods an asset
Committed to using methodical approaches to problem solving
Proven data instincts and clear understanding of the common pitfalls of digital analytics
Performance and results-oriented
Perceptive, a creative enthusiast, have a great sense of empathy for customers and users
Appreciates the importance of effective communication and presentation skills
Genuine passion for digital strategy and digital products
Takes initiative and proposes new ideas and solutions before asked
Flexible and productive when juggling multiple priorities
Highly collaborative; team player
LIFE AT APPLY
Educational opportunities across the entire company, and within your area of expertise
Robust Medical, Optical, Dental, and Extended Health Benefits plan
Regular team and company events (curling, karaoke, escape rooms, and more!)
Flexible vacation policy
Regular team and company meals
Growth in your role alongside the company's growth

Apply is a digital product studio started by Blast Radius and Atimi executives, Gautam Lohia (https://ca.linkedin.com/in/gautamlohia), Chris Coghlan (https://ca.linkedin.com/in/ccoghlan), and Scott Michaels (https://ca.linkedin.com/in/scottmmichaels).

Important messages
Although women make up 60 per cent of all graduates in Canada, they are still underrepresented in IT positions globally and seem to be declining – according to the Canadian Labour Force Survey, women represented almost 30 percent of the IT workforce in 2011, whereas they represented just slightly over 27 per cent in 2016.

The Government of Canada would like to help attract and develop women to grow their careers within the technology landscape, with jobs and opportunities for career advancement across a broad range of specializations, throughout Canada and internationally.
The Government of Canada offers meaningful and influential careers with opportunities to work on social, technological and economic topics that matter to Canadians. We also believe in continuous learning through onboarding, on-the-job training, coaching, mentoring, interdepartmental placements, and other opportunities. We offer a collaborative and horizontal work culture facilitated by the Government’s digital collaboration tools.

The technology industry needs more women – submit your application today!

Support a leading edge talent and learning environment that is adaptable for the enterprise applying best practices, measurement effectiveness and impact on performance

Mississauga, ONJob Summary
This position is responsible for the extraction, analysis and reporting of key data from all INVIVA and Specialty Prescription Services (SPS) pharmacy systems, including but not limited to, ISched, Salesforce Kroll, Shipmate, CMSV2, Cisco and Workforce management tools. This position will also use all available external resources to identify key trends within the infusion and pharmacy business landscape. In addition, this role is responsible for the preparation and maintenance of both the INVIVA and SPS dashboards on a national level and ensuring key trends are identified and reported to the Senior Team of both businesses. The role is responsible for identifying and monitoring business needs and determining system based solutions to the business problems.
The position will be responsible for acting as a bridge between business process and system management that will ensure a safe and well-structured database repository of all business related functions and associated reporting needs
This position has the capability to add and delete users in the INVIVA and Pharmacy systems under the direction of business leaders. This position will also have the capability to add or modify programs within system databases to ensure the data model for extraction of data is consistent.
Section A – Specific Responsibilities
Extraction and Analysis of data from all systems utilized by pharmacy (SPS) and INVIVA: Develop and utilize a process of inspecting, cleaning, transforming, and modeling data with the goal of discovering useful information , suggesting conclusions, and supporting decision making of National operations and management teams on a monthly or more frequent basis as required by the business.
Assess current reporting capabilities as well as determine reporting/data gaps and develop and or leverage reporting solutions to provide meaningful data and analysis to business leads.
Responsible to engage key stakeholders (Business Leaders, Finance, Programs) to determine and execute on reporting needs.
Responsible for development, maintenance and ongoing improvement of the INVIVA and SPS Performance Dashboards with regular reviews and presentations to the Leadership Teams on developing trends.
Integrate the data from the systems that is closely linked to operations and business requirements in order to formulate reports on Key Performance Indicators for the INVIVA and Pharmacy businesses on a schedule.
Under the INVIVA and Pharmacy leadership, responsible for software database administration including but not limited to: monitoring and managing user access, managing profiles of all physicians, nurses and clinics, managing all billing related activities set in the system
Collaborate all levels and departments within the organization to ensure business needs are met as well as evaluated regularly for continuous improvement.
Responsible for on-time, accurate reporting to finance for all information used for INVIVA and SPS manufacturer billing and vendor payment.
Set-up Medical Covering Physicians in INVIVA software.
Continue to understand the business data and reporting needs and the behavior of the software in order to deploy it and to troubleshoot problems.
Section B – Main Responsibilities
Data extraction, analysis and reporting from all key systems and software utilized by both businesses.
Monthly invoicing for all INVIVA Programs including accrual process, customer invoicing, physician payments and any other revenue related activities
Demonstrate the ability to adapt and influence the teams in order to effectively lead and manage change.
Identify and coordinate activities with staff and senior management, while collaborating with other department Managers to share information formally and informally.
Follow all McKesson Canada Guidelines, Policies and Procedures as they relate to general policies, IT policies.
Section C – Key Requirements
Degree or diploma in business administration, data management/System administration or equivalent.
5 or more year’s previous operational and system experience, in a clinical and/or pharmacy setting preferred.
Proven leadership abilities.
Strong communication skills, able to manage client relationships with a proven track record of exceptional customer service.
Strong computer skills including Microsoft Office and reporting analytic tools.
Able to identify key issues; creatively overcome internal challenges or obstacles.
High level of integrity, confidentially, and accountability.
Sound planning and execution skills, as well as be able to think on your feet.
Working knowledge of business and/or regulatory requirements with respect to this business.

WHAT DO YOU VALUE IN A CAREER?

At Agnico Eagle, our values never waver. We believe in trust, respect, equality, family and responsibility. Why? Because they express who we are and they have helped us succeed in business for over 60 years.

WHAT DOES AGNICO EAGLE VALUE?

We value you – your unique set of skills and experience. We value your willingness to build those skills and make a meaningful contribution to our company. And, we value your commitment to treat every person on our team with respect, helping us to operate safely, protect the environment and make a positive contribution to our local communities.

ABOUT OUR OPERATION

When hiring we look at your credentials, but what about ours? The Harvard Business Review ranks Agnico Eagle as one of the world’s 100 best-performing companies; we are included in the FTSE4Good Index, which ranks companies on their environmental, social and governance (ESG) performance; and have been recognized as one of the Best 50 Corporate Citizens in Canada.

We employ over 9,000 people worldwide, with operations that span the globe. Our people enjoy exciting international careers as miners, geologists, environmental managers, financial analysts, community advisors and so much more. We operate with the highest performance standards, with minimum environmental impacts, and within accepting communities.
We are committed to developing the next generation of leaders as we enter one of the most exciting periods of growth in Agnico Eagle’s history. Will you join our team?
In compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, Agnico Eagle Mining (AEM) is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities. Accommodation is available, upon request, for candidates participating in the recruitment process.

YOUR NEXT CHALLENGE:

Description:
The Senior Data and Reporting Analyst will work at our corporate head office in downtown Toronto and assist in the cleanup and maintenance of our HR Master Data shared across multiple HR applications. The role is critical in bringing and maintaining consistency of HR data management practices across the organization.

Reporting to the HR Systems Manager, the Data and Reporting Analyst will collaborate with the HR Regional team, the Corporate HR team and the HR Systems teams to lead and deliver the HR data integrity project. The project will be run in 3 phases and the key responsibilities by phase outlined in the following responsibilities.
Responsibilities:

Phase One: Discovery and Analysis

 Interpret national/provincial/federal regulations to determine implications to current HR data management and reporting practices.
 Identify system and business logic rules in data management to identify data quality gaps and business impacts. Collaborate with stakeholders and subject matter experts to elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes (e.g. client onboarding), policies, systems and data management practices.
 Audit existing data to identify issues related to accuracy, completeness and integrity. Interpret data issues to identify corrective actions for reporting practices.
 Identify opportunities to standardize and centralize HR data.

Phase Two: Data Cleaning and Data Management Standards

 Design the New Data Management and Reporting Practices to ensure HR Data integrity, accuracy and completeness.
 Seek out industry trends to generate and recommend alternative approaches to managing workforce related data and reporting.
 Test new data flows and remediate issues.
 Data Error Resolution by responding to, correcting and identifying the root of data errors - work with the Data Stewards (local payroll and HR use) to ensure HR data integrity, to clearly communicate errors, resolution procedures and new data management practices.
 Train Data Stewards in the application of the new data management practices, if needed.

Phase three: Maintenance of data - execute and optimize Data Management practices

 Support regional team in the maintenance of the data management practices. Serve as a Data Governance & Management communication point of contact to all stakeholders.
 Run bi-weekly Data Audits and correct triggering practice.
 Collaborate with stakeholders and subject matter experts to optimize the data management practices.
 Document finding regarding data challenges and corrections needs.

And all other ad hoc duties as assigned.

WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED

Qualifications:

 5+ years of experience on HR related projects with data impact.
 5+ years of experience as a Data Reporting Analyst
 Excellent working knowledge with MS Office applications (MS Excel in particular) and Visio.
 Knowledge of database principles and SQL language
 Strong organizational skills, prioritization and results orientated to handle multiple tasks/projects and to work independently.
 Good interpersonal skills and ability to work in a multinational organization (Canada, Mexico, Finland, Sweden).
 Systematic thinker, data and analytical abilities.
 Strong mathematical and literacy skills, complemented by excellent visual accuracy skills, accuracy and attention to detail.
 Experience with data manipulation, data transfer automation, analysis and reporting.
 Ability to interface with management, users, and information technology professionals to solve complex business problems.
 Availability to travel in Canada and abroad.
 Languages: English (mandatory). French, Spanish or Finnish an asset.
Knowledge of:
o HR data concepts as they pertain to all HR processes and impact in other corporate processes (Accounting, Maintenance, Health and Safety, etc.).
o Process and data analysis practices and guidelines.
o Internal audit methodology and practice.
o Global HR processes, practices and technologies.
 Experience in:
o Previous experience using HRMS mandatory. Previous work with JD Edwards is an asset.
o Project Management or Change Management practices.
o Data mapping and data integrations between multiple systems.
o Data audits against multiple/complex criteria.
o Analyzing complex data from multiple perspectives and providing optimization recommendations.
