Job Description
IBM is seeking a Risk Analyst to strengthen the IBM Algo Risk Service and Data Management Teams.

IBM Algo Risk Service on Cloud offers hedge funds, asset managers, pension funds and other buy-side organizations access to an award-winning web-based portfolio construction, financial risk management and reporting service without the costs or challenges of an in-house deployment. Offering bundled data, it provides a wide variety of simulation-based risk analytics that enable portfolio managers, traders, risk managers and senior executives to take a proactive approach to financial risk oversight and investment decision making.

The Role

Risk Analysts work in a multi-disciplinary group (business leads, technical consultants and core Development teams) to support the IBM Algo Risk Service on Cloud framework or to assist in Data Quality and Validation. This framework involves data, analytics and reporting services that employ Risk Analytics Algo One applications. Working from an existing legacy platform, consultants assist in the transformation to a dynamic and flexible Cloud based risk service integrated with a proprietary Data Service.

Our team works collaboratively and members are encouraged to explore and develop unique ways to solve challenges employing advanced quantitative finance techniques. Projects require individuals who are able to research and experiment to develop new ideas and solutions. Working with an open and constructive mindset, guidance and feedback is available from the broader group.


Responsibilities :
Provide subject matter expert advice to internal and external audience for risk management topics including financial markets operations, product valuation methods, scenario based risk analysis and risk reporting standards.
Own functional projects related to feature extensions including interaction with development team (team & core), research and client service teams. Involves independent scope setting, task determination, priority setting and development support
Consulting with sales and pre-sales to present Service capabilities to prospects. Identify and fill gaps where necessary.
Investigation of data sourcing, transformation and storage for use in the risk management process. May involve extensive communication and negotiation with external vendors.
Investigation and remediation of client support issues (3rdlevel support).
Work with Development team to improve the core software offering.
Competencies and Skills :
Theoretical understanding of financial economics, mathematics and statistics.
Practical knowledge of financial markets and risk management standards.
Practical knowledge and experience around financial instrument valuation methods and (stochastic) scenario generation techniques.
Strong research and problem solving skills.
Familiarity with data science languages such as R or Python.
Written and oral presentation skills. Must be able to convey complex ideas to a functional and technical audience.
Technical aptitude including use of computer networks, Linux operating system and client/server applications.
Education :
University degree in the field of Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics or other quantitative discipline.
Advanced degree in Financial Engineering or Mathematical Finance is beneficial.
CFA, PRM or FRM designation(s) beneficial.
**NOTE: the successful candidate will need to work from our 185 Spadina Ave office on a regular basis**

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

At least 5 years of relevant experience in the financial industry working with front or middle office portfolio risk management systems.
Experience in an advanced technical environment – collaborating on or writing scripts or code, integration, testing and deployment.
Experience with financial market data such as Reuters, Bloomberg or Interactive Data applications.

Preferred Tech and Prof Experience

N/A

job_title: DIGITAL DATA ANALYST (DIGITAL AND DATA SCIENCE)
job_description:
DIGITAL DATA ANALYST (DIGITAL AND DATA SCIENCE)

POSITION CODE: 2019-079
LOCATION: The Globe and Mail, Toronto
SALARY: Commensurate with qualifications and experience

POSITION OVERVIEW:

The Analytics team at The Globe and Mail is looking for a Digital Data Analyst with strong fundamental skills in data analysis and visualization. This role will be instrumental in helping us make sure that everything we do is informed by data. The primary responsibilities for the analyst will be to model large volumes of data to design and implement custom reports and dashboards, and perform complex ad hoc analysis using raw data to extract useful insights and identify key trends.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analysis: Modeling and interpreting large volumes of data, identifying trends and extracting insights. Reporting the results and insights back to the relevant stakeholders.
Data Visualization: Create, maintain, enhance and automate various dashboards and reports that provide insights into user behaviour while keeping in mind business needs and goals.
Requirement Gathering and Documentation: Assist with documenting data sources, relationships between data entities and business concepts, and methods of calculation and measurement while understanding stakeholder needs.
MUST HAVE QUALIFICATIONS:
Quantitatively focused bachelor’s degree with at least 3 years of experience working as a Data Analyst
Experience working with Level of Detail, Table, and Window functions in Tableau.
Experience working with analytical (OLAP, HTAP, etc.) databases (Teradata, Snowflake, BigQuery, etc.)
Command of analytical SQL (ex. Window Functions & Frames, Group Sets, Cubes, Rollups, etc.)
Experience with of at least one of the following: Python, Scala or JavaScript.
Knowledge of inner workings of various web analytics tools (i.e. knowledge of beacons, data processing and enrichment)
Comfortable working in a ‘self-serve’ capacity as a data analyst (i.e. retrieving and modeling your own data when so required).
Experience gathering stakeholder requirements with a demonstrated ability to get to the bottom of specific business rationale
Clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
Ability to thrive in fast-paced environment with tight deadlines
REQUIRED TECHNICAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Data Visualization skills and at least a year of experience working with Tableau
Working knowledge of web analytics tools such as Omniture or Google Analytics
Good understanding of SQL and relational databases.
Working knowledge of JavaScript, CSS, HTML
Knowledge of statistical analysis methods
Experience deploying tracking via Tag Manager(s)
OPTIONAL BUT DESIRABLE SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Experience working with AWS
Experience working on Linux systems (shell scripting, vi, cron management, etc.)
Experience using Git
Experience with managing Analytics and Marketing tags (via a tag manager or inline)
Experience in directing and teaching non-technical stakeholders on use of analytics tools

At L3 WESCAM, we develop the most advanced and complex optical and sensor systems for global defense and military sectors, Homeland Security, Search and Rescue and Airborne law enforcement. What you’ll do
Manage utility data through ECAP (i.e. EnergyCAP - energy management software used for utility bill & greenhouse gas tracking, analysis, reporting, auditing and benchmarking) to assure accuracy of utility data

Produce benchmarking reports for different types of buildings, not only for TCH buildings but also against other similar buildings across GTA
Analyze trends in utility consumption and rate changes
Provide utility cost variance analysis
Conduct site visits to investigate abnormal consumption patterns identified to save on utility costs
Other duties assigned by the Manager, Business Analysis

Demonstrated time management skills with ability to work on multiple tasks

Job Description Summary
Reporting to the Manager, Global Services Canada BRM, the Business Technology Analyst will lead and manage IT business analysis for Global Services initiatives in Canada and will be based out of the Mississauga head office. Collaborating closely with Canadian regional, functional and business stakeholders, the Business Technology Analyst is accountable for working with various groups to elicit, gather and define business requirements, and analyze, define and recommend functional solutions. Other primary responsibilities include defining implementation approach, functional testing and change management planning. This associate is also responsible for driving and supporting various digital transformation efforts in the Canadian region. This role will challenge the associate to think outside the box, interact with new technology, and use BD innovation solutions to advance business capabilities in the organization.
Job Description
Excited to grow your career?
We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
Our people make all the difference in our success.
BD has a strong presence in Canada, with four locations and more than 640 employees in the region. As the head office for Canada, the Mississauga location employs Corporate Shared Functions and eight Business Units.
Reporting to the Manager, Global Services Canada BRM, the Business Technology Analyst will lead and manage IT business analysis for Global Services initiatives in Canada and will be based out of the Mississauga head office. Collaborating closely with Canadian regional, functional and business stakeholders, the Business Technology Analyst is accountable for working with various groups to elicit, gather and define business requirements, and analyze, define and recommend functional solutions. Other primary responsibilities include defining implementation approach, functional testing and change management planning. This associate is also responsible for driving and supporting various digital transformation efforts in the Canadian region. This role will challenge the associate to think outside the box, interact with new technology, and use BD innovation solutions to advance business capabilities in the organization.

Responsibilities:
In collaboration with Functional, Business and Global Services partners, define, document, analyze and prioritize existing and emerging business requirements.
In collaboration with stakeholders, drive consensus and approval of requirements and proposed solutions.
Provide subject matter expertise in the design of business processes and system integration and use of innovation technologies that will support BD’s digital transformation
Partner with the Business Process Network and Process Managers to help drive digital initiatives, while maintaining and promoting end to end process integration as well as identification and understanding of key areas of change impact. Support the change readiness to adopt digital process initiatives.
Partner with stakeholders and Global Services teams to drive exceptional customer experience:
Process mapping and modeling (as-is/to-be)
Master data guidance and integration
Project execution, business acceptance of solutions
Change management- impact analysis, readiness, and effectiveness
Cutover, go-live support
Facilitate knowledge transfer to stakeholders, super users, business users
Design and develop solutions leveraging low-code/no-code platforms.
Become a subject matter expert in Global Services processes and aid regional stakeholders traverse the global process landscape (Idea to Realization, Infrastructure Tower Lead collaboration, Incident and Request Management)
Skills and Competencies:
Demonstrated involvement in all aspects of the Software Development Life Cycle
Proficiency in IT portfolio management processes and business case development required
Project management skills a plus
Demonstrated end-to-end business process thinking; knowledge of present or “as is” processes and ability to lead improvements that will constitute a desired “future state”
Customer centric focus and global orientation
Adept at working within a complex virtual team environment; ability to lead and influence teams both directly and indirectly
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to influence outcomes and gain team member and stakeholder buy in
Consulting mindset
Experience and Education:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or other relevant degree
Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience
Intermediate knowledge of IT project and portfolio management principles and methodologies
Experience with ERP (i.e. SAP, Oracle) and CRM/Commercial enablement solutions such as Salesforce.com, Contract Lifecycle Management
Knowledge of data warehouse concepts including: data modeling, data quality, ELT\ETL, reporting, analytics, designing and developing Data Visualizations (intermediate to advanced experience with MS products, Qlik View and/or Qlik Sense is an asset)
Experience with SharePoint workflow development is considered an asset
Proficiency in SQL including the use of SQL editors, stored procedures, and optimizing SQL statements.
Programming experience will be considered an asset: VB.NET, C#, Java, Python, SQL Scripting
Automation and/or data lake experience will be considered an asset

Job Summary
Under general supervision, the Senior Business Systems Specialist is responsible for/involved in all aspects of the life of a specific system/application. May include: evaluation of system enhancement requests, requirements development and documentation, testing and implementation; production support/troubleshooting, maintenance of system documentation, training responding to customer concerns and communicating results. The Senior Business Systems Specialist is responsible to assess and communicate impacts of changes to the application or system domain. The Senior Business Systems Specialist possesses strong knowledge of a particular business capability, product or system domain. Utilizing knowledge of the business and the specific application(s), identifies system opportunities to support business needs. May specialize in a particular technology or skill. This job typically does not lead others., but may act as a team lead coordinating multiple change requests or large enhancements. The Senior Business Systems Specialist may provide limited coaching to less experienced team members.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
Production support/troubleshooting: Facilitate troubleshooting and defect resolution. This includes requesting resources, migration through environments and ticket management. Effectively communicates status of enhancements, change requests and defects. May manage change, defect and enhancement request process and assignment of approved work. Documentation and Training: Maintains documentation of current state systems. Assists in development of training materials and business implementation/transition activities. Evaluates requests for projects and enhancements. May make recommendations for operational process improvements and/or system enhancements. Elicits documents and validates requirements for change requests and enhancements to capabilities, products or systems. May act as project manager for enhancements or new functionality. Helps identify appropriate subject matter experts and stakeholders to participate in requirements sessions. Utilizes business and system knowledge to support business needs. Applies knowledge of a particular business capability, product and/or system domain and communicates impact of changes to current state business process, products, data, feeds and systems. May provide input into departmental or divisional planning process. Provides subject matter expertise and capabilities to Business and IT Projects. Simultaneously support multiple projects as assigned. Performs other duties as assigned. Perform other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications
High school diploma or equivalent required. One year of experience supporting business technology systems required.

Education, Work Experience & Knowledge
Bachelors degree in Business, MIS, or other related field preferred. Three years of experience supporting business technology systems preferred.

Job Specific & Technical Skills & Competencies
Business Perspective (Intermediate): Uses knowledge of internal and external factors impacting the property casualty industry to make decisions. Technology (Intermediate): Uses, leverages and maintains proficiency with corporate and job specific technology as it evolves (e.g., hardware, software, business unit applications and systems tools). Analytical Thinking (Basic): Identifies current or future problems or opportunities, analyzes, synthesize and compares information to understand issues, identifies cause/effect relationships and explores alternative solutions to support sound decision making. Relationship Management (Basic): Seeks out, builds, fosters and maintains productive relationships, networks or alliances to meet goals and achieve results. Communication (Basic): Demonstrates effective verbal, written, and listening communication skills. Facilitation (Basic): Uses and adjusts style and technique to assist group process and understanding. Teamwork (Intermediate): Works together in situations when actions are interdependent and a team is mutually responsible to produce a result. Conflict Management (Basic): Brings conflicts into the open and resolves them collaboratively. Change Management / Resilience (Basic): Remains energized and focused in the face of ambiguity, change or strenuous demands. Risk Taking (Basic): Identifies, assesses, manages and takes intelligent risks to attain objectives.

Licensing or Certificates
None

ABOUT VEGA
Vega is a high-growth, natural health food and supplement company on Profit Magazine’s Profit 100 list of fastest growing companies the last five years with a passion for people. Our premium, award-winning brand is at the forefront of the plant-based, whole food revolution. Vega has been named one of the Best Workplaces in Canada and has been recognized as one of the Best Workplaces for Women. We honor a triple bottom line approach to business placing emphasis on people, planet and performance. Join a great team atmosphere with a driven, vivacious group of people.

OVERVIEW
An exciting and challenging position exists as a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst at Vega’s head office in Burnaby, BC. In this role, you will be responsible for ongoing corporate reporting across several data sources. Reporting includes measuring and monitoring our brands and relevant competitors’ performance through in-depth analysis of large amounts of data using a data warehouse, syndicated databases and reporting tools. As part of the BI team, the analyst will work cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, and Finance to assist with forecasting, promotional assessment, and preparation of presentations for multiple uses. The BI Analyst will provide support to senior leadership on projects such as pricing, customer presentations, market trends, & promotional analysis.

You take customer service seriously, but still have fun at work with your Vega team. You show initiative in everything you do and are always looking for ways to improve. You are open to new ideas, and you know that feedback from others helps you grow and allows you to thrive. As a performance-driven individual, you create solutions for your team and show up every day ready for a new adventure. You believe in contributing to culture – not just talking about it – and you live (and love) the Vega culture: health, fitness, and striving for always better.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Be the expert in syndicated and point-of-sale (POS) sales data for Vega (IRI, SPINS, Nielsen, Stackline, RetailLink)
Timely and accurate pulling of ongoing corporate reporting data, manipulation via Excel, and publishing of reports
Analyze, with high accuracy, large datasets in order to report on trends in both Vega and our competitors’ products
Work with the sales, marketing, and finance teams to assist on promotion assessments, customer performance, and recommendations
Work with IT to make improvements in our data warehouse and develop reports and dashboards in Tableau that will highlight trends and provide visualizations to be used by senior management as well as customer facing presentations
Assist in creating monthly presentations specific to market trends and customer performance
Educate the marketing, sales, and finance teams on customer and market trends through monthly presentations
May be required to assist in other areas not specifically outlined in this job description
SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
Undergraduate degree preferred
2-3 years of CPG or Category Management experience will be considered a strong asset
Experience in data analysis & marketing analytics
Experience working with syndicated POS data is preferred (IRI, SPINS, Nielsen, Stackline and RetailLink)
Strong Microsoft Excel and Powerpoint knowledge a must
Experience with reporting tools, Tableau experience a strong asset
Ability to effectively communicate complex ideas to internal stakeholders across sales, marketing, and finance
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Strategic thinking skills
Detail oriented, highly organized, and able to work independently
VEGA Must-Haves

You have an unrelenting desire to achieve
The outdoors isn’t just the place between your car and house
You have a sense of humor and passion for health and wellness
You love to have fun, but take your responsibilities seriously
You live the Vega brand
Benefits of Working for VEGA

Competitive compensation plan
Open Book Management
Annual Bonuses
Alternative refreshment options that go beyond coffee
On-site kitchen with in-house Vegan Chef offering plant-based food and snacks
An optional plant-based lunch program
In-house gym and meditation room
Dogs in the office – Woof!
Bi-Monthly product to try so that you can perform at your best and promote the Vegatopian lifestyle
MSP – 100% coverage
Employee assistance program (EAP)

job_title: Supply Chain Analyst, Materials Management Department
job_description:
Toronto, ONAPPLICATIONS ARE INVITED FOR THE POSITION OF

SUPPLY CHAIN ANALYST

MATERIALS MANAGEMENT DEPARTMENT

Non-Union Level 10 - $59,143 - $73,928


CRITERIA FOR AN INTERVIEW ARE AS FOLLOWS:

Three-year College Diploma in Business Administration, Finance or Material Management, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
Minimum two (2) years of related experience in a complex public purchasing and/or accounting environment
Certified Supply Chain Management Professional (CSCMP) designation and/or Certified Purchasing Card Professional (CPCP)
Experience with data analysis and research
Proficiency with Microsoft Office and advance level computer skills in spreadsheets and computerized financial/purchasing systems
Strong personal and communication (oral and written) skills
Knowledge of SAP Materials Management Module an asset


MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Reporting to and under the direction of the Manager of Purchasing, the Supply Chain Analyst will develop data reporting and financial analysis in identifying cost savings opportunities and streamlining processes. Duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:

Research best buying practices and recommend innovative approaches to the acquisition of goods and services
Evaluate and monitor vendor performance system/vendor score card to identify cost savings opportunities
Review and oversee the procure to pay process of all card programs
Evaluate the P-card process and recommend changes to optimize the effectiveness of the card and rebate programs
Develop metrics program to report Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and statistical reporting
Analyze transactions, data, and reports to ensure compliance to policies and procedures
Analyze reports on spending trends, leading to recommendations on future program improvements
Provide functional expertise in investigating system issues and processes and recommending changes
Analyze SAP purchasing/financial data to inform system contract needs for the organization
Analyze purchasing data of existing system contracts to determine utilization, compliance and necessary changes to contracts
Analyze and inform contract process for cost savings
Proactively solicit supply trend data from business sources and prepare analysis
Tender/Purchase approvals for up to $5,000.00
Requesting/assigning staff to perform MIGO/reverse MIGO and authorizing as required
Perform other duties as required or assigned

Barrier-Free Recruitment

The TCDSB is committed to creating an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process. Please inform the Human Resources department, at the time of your application, of any requirement for accommodation in order for us to assess all candidates in a fair and equitable manner. Documentation to support the accommodation may be requested as required prior to the implementation of the accommodation measures.
Interested applicants are asked to submit a completed résumé, cover letter, and any related educational documents, and reference letters, no later than Thursday, March 28, 2019.


Applications are to be submitted online through Apply To Education.


We thank all applicants, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.


Please note, candidates selected for an interview will be required to provide original applicable education documents.

Together, we help empower you to achieve what’s important in your life.


What’s the job?
Does working on complex programs with ambiguous solutions seem to characterize your Business Analysis experience? If you are passionate about bringing together people from different perspectives and shepherding the solution to achieve business goals, this may be the perfect fit for you. This role plays a key role in the execution of strategy by understanding project goals, implementing business processes that effectively leverage technology and using mechanisms to monitor and manage business progress.

What you’ll get to do:
Support the development of the application roadmap that drives business value and leverages technology investments
Support the development and deployment of organizational metrics to monitor performance
Document current state and create future state solution that articulates the people, process, and technology required
Perform data analysis, identify the gap(s) in organizational capabilities and develop roadmap to solve the business need
Design business process and configure user applications to solve business need
Explore and capture business and stakeholder requirements
Create, execute and facilitate organizational change management plan
Engage with cross functional teams and work with subject matter experts to create effective solutions

Who are we looking for?
To answer that question, we are looking for someone who has a passion for change and who can effectively navigate that, sometimes bumpy, terrain. Moreover you can see the big picture and can effectively communicate that vision to your business partners to secure their support.
Your resume lists a minimum of 6 years’ experience of technology implementation experience as a stream or project lead.
Your Business Administration or Information Technologies degree proudly hangs on your wall and you have a thirst for always learning something new.
You have proven your excellent comprehension of information systems technologies and application architectures in your previous work experiences
You bring experience in Software development and/or software applications management
In your current role you’ve demonstrated your excellent organizational change management skills and you’ve effectively applied your knowledge of tools, concepts and methodologies.
You have hands-on experience with the development, delivery and facilitation of training curriculum
Over the years you’ve refined your writing skills, including the design and completion of professional reports and documents
Experience in financial institution an asset so you can bring an in-depth understanding of banking business models and the regulatory environment and during this time you learned about banking e-systems such as internet online banking, mobile banking and mobile payments
CPA, MBA, CCBA, CBAP, ACMP, Lean Six Sigma Certification an asset. Comparable combination of experience and education will be considered


Why join Coast Capital Savings?
We don’t mean to toot our own horn, but…
We improve Canadians’ financial well-being through providing simple financial help.
Employees do what’s best for our members. Every day.
We believe in being a great corporate citizen so we invest in our local communities by donating our time, money and expertise.
Our employees take advantage of the many opportunities to grow their careers.
Employees love having a cool place to work, which includes wearing their jeans on Fridays & Saturdays and being recognized with a virtual (and, at times, an actual) high-five.
Our inspiring leaders help our employees develop their talents and encourage them to be their fabulous selves.
We have a unique culture where we take our business seriously, but ourselves, not so much.
In 2017, we earned double kudos by being named one of BC’s Top Employers and one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies – two of the nation’s most coveted business ads, may we add.


Does this position inspire you? If so, apply today at Coast Capital Savings.

PermanentHelp us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

The mandate of the Credit Card Operations Delivery team is to provide CTFS with a vendor management and delivery competency for TSYS and Acxiom, as well as be a liaison and escalation point between those vendors, the CTFS Business areas and IT.

The emphasis of the Senior Data Analyst is to increase the benefit CTFS realizes from its investment in data and analysis while managing risk and cost. The strategy is to focus on improving operations, analytics and reporting.

Reporting to the Manager – CRCD, the Senior Data Analyst is responsible for actively managing data as a corporate asset for CTFS. Success in this role will yield highly available data sources which offer an exceptional degree of reliability, consistency and trust for our analysts and for data-driven decision making within CTFS and other areas within CTC. This would be achieved through (but not limited to) excellent requirement elicitation, solid Information Management processes and procedures, and Best Practices in the areas of Data Quality, Operational Efficiency and Vendor Management.

What you’ll do

Manage day to day Acxiom and TSYS relationship

Project Lead on new initiatives – build and execute critical path

Drive efficiency and effectiveness, issue resolution

Analyze/understand data from various sources/vendors, transforming this raw data into useful information and Data Mart Development

Recommend and facilitate decisions related to process and design, risk and contingency strategies

Provide leadership/consulting in best structuring of data

Develop and maintain internal process documentation, including architecture, policies and procedures, as they relate to data analysis and reporting

Develop and maintain Best Practices in Information and Vendor Management

Develop data quality standards

Ensure high degree of accuracy and trustworthiness within the data

Manage/Liaise with vendors and stakeholders to support the data needs going forward

Present/gain approval from key stakeholders for proposed solutions/plans

Demonstrate personal commitment to self-improvement and growth

Demonstrate leadership and teamwork skills

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

Inclusive leaders who build and develop teams that effectively anticipate and respond to disruption, while consistently delivering strong performance

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

Established experience in effective Vendor Management

Strong analytical capabilities and skills required to provide efficient and effective solutions

Strong technical experience in programming, querying data, data models, database design

Solid SAS, SQL and Unix skills with demonstrated ability to develop and learn

Advanced technical skills, knowledge and experience in use of PL/SQL and Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Word)

Deep working knowledge of Data Warehouse/Data Mart design and development

Ability to work with large and diverse sets of data

Ability to take initiative in recognizing data issues/concerns or areas where improvements could be made

Demonstrated planning, report writing, presentation and communication skills

Strong attention to detail

Established experience in effective Vendor Management

Ability to build and maintain professional working relationships (both internally and externally)

Excellent time management, organizational, change, and priority management skills

Ambitious self-starter with the ability to work independently or on cross-functional teams

Demonstrated ability to balance multiple priorities and react to changing environments to meet deadlines

About Canadian Tire Corporation

Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Top Employers.

To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on LinkedIn.

Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. Job Description

The Data Analyst works with corporate data assets to ensure accuracy and integrity of all recorded data. They collaborate with key stakeholders throughout the organization to understand their unique business processes and related source systems. Upon gaining an understanding of this, the Data Analyst is responsible for independently producing assignments in alignment with our objectives of data quality, organization, analysis and reporting. You will take into consideration the company’s commitment to our seven Core Values such as Sustainability (people, the planet, and profit) in the planning and implementation of all actions related to your area of responsibility.
Perform detailed analysis of company data sources to identify, model and understand our how it flows and supports business decision making
Work with key stakeholders to identify, create and deliver reports and dashboards according to requirements. Make recommendations on opportunities for continuous improvement
Develop an enterprise data roadmap for established company-wide data principles and integration of data assets into the corporate data warehouse
Support the development and maintenance of a data dictionary and business glossaries
Identify data discrepancies and quality issues. Work to ensure data consistency and integrity of all corporate data
Support and participate in the Enterprise Information Governance and Master Data Management programs
Participate in data related discussions with stakeholders across the company
Remain current with new developments in data management practices and technologies to support and improve data management services
Maintain strict data confidentiality by analyzing and mitigating data security risks
Follow and adhere to all given instructions including work procedures, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP)
Strictly adhere to and observe all safety policies as outlined in the company policies and training sessions
Other duties as assigned

Requirements

Technical
Bachelor’s Degree or Diploma in a scientific field of study, preferably computer science, database design, programming or business and systems analysis
Minimum of five (5) years' working experience in data analysis including database development, data modeling, relational and dimensional modeling and information management and analytics
Working knowledge of PowerBI or other Business Intelligence (BI) tools
Ability to produce information products for clients with a variety of BI tools
Proficient in writing optimized SQL queries, including all features up to SQL 2017
Awareness of industry trends and best practices in data mining, data analysis and dashboard design
Experience in Human Resources (HR) and financial systems, specifically HR Analytics would be considered an asset
Attributes
Excellent analytical skills with highly developed problem-solving ability and the ability to break problems down to bring clarity to complexity
Good communication skills and a collaborative approach, able to work in cross functional teams to achieve results
Self-motivated and proactive attitude, actively identifies opportunities to add value to the company
Ability to work on multiple projects at the same time and prioritize tasks
Interest in people data and/or HR information systems

With 47 ports of call, 35 vessels, and more than 500 sailings every day, BC Ferries is the largest independently-owned ferry company in the world. Dedicated to safety, excellence, innovation, and people, we are committed to continuously improving the west coast travel experience of our customers.

SENIOR BUSINESS ANALYST
Victoria
As a Senior Business Analyst in our Financial Planning & Analysis department, you provide support to various levels of management and senior executives on the operating and capital financial and business activities of the company. Working both independently and as part of multi-disciplinary teams, you promote fiscal responsibility through financial planning, business analysis, capital project planning, and reporting according to company policies and procedures. You often work on multiple tasks and projects simultaneously with minimal supervision.

Your responsibilities may include assisting and advising in the development and analysis of annual budget and quarterly forecast submissions, individual business cases for capital and major operating projects, and monitoring and analyzing related financial performance. You support all levels of management on strategic corporate initiatives, regulatory applications, projects and operational issues affecting business units. You provide advice concerning corporate financial policies and procedures, drive process improvement, perform financial modeling, and ensure integrity of financial information.

The successful applicant will have a professional accounting or finance designation combined with three to five years of accounting and business analysis experience, or equivalent. This experience should include budget preparation, financial modelling, business planning and exposure to project management. You have a demonstrated ability to analyze complex issues and develop strategies for solutions, while considering the impact on customer service and corporate objectives. In addition, you possess excellent interpersonal and relationship building skills, oral and written communication skills, problem-solving skills, report-writing and presentation skills, and computer skills, particularly in spreadsheet software and data presentation. Occasional travel may be required.

Please apply by March 15, 2019.

We appreciate the interest of all applicants; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

As part of our Americas Business Intelligence Team, the Data Reporting Analyst is responsible for assessing business analysis needs including gathering requirements, analyzing source system data, and developing proof-of-concept data models and visualizations. In addition, the candidate will dig deep into company data to uncover insights and information to help drive profit, process improvements and best practices.


Duties and Responsibilities

Designing and developing enterprise-wide data analysis and reporting solutions (as opposed to reporting silos)
Converting functional requirements into technical solutions
Analyzing data from multiple internal and external sources
Helping visualize technical data in a way that is meaningful to business decision makers
Understanding, interpreting and applying business rules to ensure a high level of data integrity and consistency
Engaging and consulting with team members on new data, business needs and opportunities to improve system effectiveness
Scrutinize and assemble raw data from multiple sources, generate reports, automate best practices and build dashboards that facilitate efficiency, profit gains and productivity
Work with operational stakeholders and the project management team to assess needs and document requirements
Testing, reconciliation and validation of data and coordination of UAT for production-ready products
Recommendations on process changes and best practices
Skills / Experience

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience with SQL and dimensional modelling
Experience with data transformation/ETL and proof of concept development
Experience with tools such as Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI or other visualization and analysis tools
Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to develop relationships at all levels
High level of commercial acumen and professionalism
“Agile” in both personality and development philosophy – a high degree of flexibility and the ability to deal with change and a high-pressure work environment
A team-focused individual that enjoys collaboration and can “leave the ego at the door “Highly creative and outside-the-box thinker who believes “it’s always possible”

The Registrar’s Office (RO) is involved in all aspects of academic life, including marketing for undergraduate student recruitment and admissions, enrolment, examinations, development and application of academic policies, and convocation. This position supports the systems-based processes for these activities and drives continuous improvement through systems development projects.

The Business Systems Analyst (Analyst) provides functional business analysis and project leadership in systems development related to student information systems (SIS) of the University, while supporting major, more complex business processes within their portfolio. There are several critical aspects of support including provision of accurate and timely data to support the Registrar’s Office units and staff and faculty to facilitate and enhance decision-making, strategic planning, and communications. This role is forward looking and is regularly assessing the current and future technology needs of RO stakeholders in order to meet and exceed their expectations.
Responsibilities
Functional Leadership in Business Analysis and Development
Provides business analysis for new problems or changing processes (may be introduced by legislative or policy changes)
Works closely with stakeholder groups (faculty, staff, students) to understand and interpret diverse requirements for new developments and/or improvements to existing processes; stakeholder needs
are often conflicting requiring careful facilitation and negotiation
Identifies and/or verifies user needs; creates user stories and test scenarios for large development projects
Undertakes research of new tools and functionality to support registrarial activities across the campus; engaged with implementation of these tools (setup/configuration, development, testing,
training)
Functional project leadership role in systems development, working in partnership with IST and other departments on development projects
Functional leadership for system upgrades, enhancements, and fixes—research, identification of test scenarios, and quality assurance—and assuring that stakeholder needs are met
Expertise and Leadership in Complex Processes and Operations
Resource and source of expertise and technical support on SIS functionality within assigned portfolio; liaises with other departments and users across campus such as Faculties, Graduate Studies and Postdoctoral Affairs, Centre for Extended Learning, IAP, Finance, Cooperative Education, Housing, and many others—as well as staff in the Registrar’s Office
Responsible for configuring and running complex processes that frequently require manual adjustments, including the setup, maintenance, and optimization of large processes (e.g., Academic Progression, Academic Advisement, scheduling classes/exams, etc.)
Accountable for system configuration maintenance and functional setup
Responsible for understanding the implications of security as related to developments
Identifies errors, trouble-shoots, and problem-solves related to processes and functionality within the system
Provides data analysis as appropriate, directing solution design of end-user reports, technology solutions for operational problems, and production of reports and queries
Delivers ad hoc data as requested (e.g., research requests from faculty, Office of Research, external parties)
Client Relationships and Support
Builds and maintains effective working relationships with stakeholders within the RO and across campus, often acting as a liaison between functional and technical requirements
Monitors relevant business processes and stakeholder use of systems to identify opportunities for business process improvements
Develops and maintains procedures and user documentation; takes a lead role in the planning and delivery of training workshops to both internal and campus wide staff
Responsible for training staff on new business processes and monitoring accuracy of system coding and business processes of existing practices
Participates in various working groups and project teams, frequently including IST, GSPA, CEL, and Finance, as a partner in service excellence; in this context, seeks opportunities for shared services,
collaboration, efficiency, and support; supports alignment of conflicting needs and priorities across business units

Portfolio: Student Awards and Financial Aid (SAFA)
Accountable for the accuracy of financial aid reports and integrations
Leads the preparation of operational and business procedures to support the ongoing policy requirements as they relate to financial aid
Develop and modify queries in response to policy changes
Responsible for accurate set up and disbursement of funds through financial aid authorization and disbursement processes
Create student budgets, maintain set up tables and complex budget formulas that will ensure accurate budgets are built for all undergraduate and graduate students
Design, test and implement a set of institutionally defined rules to create financial aid packaging for students
Analyze and disseminate complex government reports to extract data required for the setup of OSAP data elements, table views and data transfers to the SIS
Responsible for ensuring accurate data and set up criteria are in place within the SIS and the Ministry’s (MAESD) Bursary Recording System
Develop and maintain an effective process for monitoring student funding eligibility and changes to need assessments; make adjustments to bursaries using sound judgment
Analyze and interpret the University’s tuition structure and the MAESD Tuition Fee Framework for the creation and maintenance of cost code tables, cost sheets, and program information
Responsible for creating and managing the content of the SAFA office web site
Other
May be called on to support exam, convocation and other Registrarial event support
Performs other duties and assists with special projects as assigned

Undergraduate degree required, or equivalent education and experience

2 years student information system experience including configuration and setup of processes, quality assurance and testing of new functionality
Extensive experience in working with queries and relational database tools

Data

Burnaby, BCWho We Are


Interfor is a growth-oriented lumber company with operations in Canada and the United States. We have an annual production capacity of 3 billion board feet and offer one of the most diverse lines of lumber products to customers around the world.

What We Offer

Interfor is where excellence meets opportunity. We invest in your success by positioning you alongside the best people in top quartile mill facilities located in great communities across North America. In the past decade, we’ve infused close to $1 billion into modern facilities and systems that employ the latest technologies.


Interfor is one of the largest lumber companies in the world and we’re growing in exciting directions. Come be a part of our success.
We are currently recruiting for a Business Systems Analyst for our Metrotown office in Burnaby, BC. The Business Systems Analyst will investigate, develop and maintain the application layer of Interfor’s information systems. They will evolve the current application systems procedures and work with the Architect group to design information systems solutions to help the organization operate more efficiently and effectively. They will work collaboratively with users, technical peers, software vendors and managers and participate in projects to create a stable, scalable, and enterprise environment. The Business Systems Analyst will overlap both business and technical issues.
What You’ll Do
Analyze and design solutions for internally developed and vendor supplied systems
Work with stakeholders to throughout the organization to capture a comprehensive set of business objectives and requirements and gain a full understanding of current business processes, documented into business requirements, business process flows, etc.
Develop in-depth knowledge of Interfor’s enterprise ERP/Accounting system and evaluate business processes against standard functionality.
Work with architects, developers and vendors to translate business requirements into technical requirements (functional requirements, requirements traceability matrix, system requirements, test cases, etc.).

Accountable for MS Dynamics 365 for Operations ongoing maintenance, upgrades, end user access, and configuration.

Work with Program Director and Service Delivery Managers to analyze and validate the business needs of project stakeholders.

Participate in Project Intake Phase to help develop appropriate time and cost estimates for discovery and high-level requirements definition.
Contribute to the technology roadmap for selected business applications and systems.

Post-Secondary education in Computer Science, Business Administration, or related field or equivalent working experience.
3-5 years’ Technical Experience in implementing/integrating/supporting ERP or financial applications; specifically, Dynamics AX7/365
Experience in Solution Development Life Cycle, including; design (creating functional/technical specifications), test scripts and other system administration, and support documentation.
Knowledge of general finance and accounting guidelines and principles.
Experience in gathering and analyzing business requirements; ability to read and write user documentation as well as strategic technology documents; ability to understand and interpret business processes, workflows, and systems to identify solutions or opportunities for application improvements (e.g. utilizing application functionality or improving application system performance); ability to leverage application/technology functionality to resolve complex business issues. This will include using out-of-the-box functionality as well as custom-developed functions from previous implementations.
Demonstrated proficiency in performing product evaluations, product selection, integrating infrastructure components and developing reusable set of application services to be used across a suite of applications.
Proficiency in developing SQL queries and extracting data from databases, and understand complex database schemas and database objects.
Experience working in a tiered service delivery framework (e.g. Tier 1, Tier 2 and n-Tier support levels) environment.
Experience working in a multi-client environment.
Proven track record of service delivery, client/customer focus and relationship management.
Ability to assimilate, analyze and facilitate information sharing.

Excellent interpersonal skills.
Excellent organizational, planning and time management skills.
Excellent analytical, problem solving and decision making skills.

This is a permanent position be carried out at our client’s location in Downtown Toronto.

APPLY NOW:

Systematix is one of Canada’s largest privately owned National Consulting and Resourcing firms. With offices across Canada, we provide the highest caliber consulting solutions to a diverse client base that includes all levels of Government and all private industry sectors.

At Systematix, we bring people and projects together!

Montréal, QCPermanent Position
Life at Cirque is about sharing our passion and about creating wonder with talented colleagues, all the while delivering at the highest quality in a fast-moving environment. Boldness and curiosity are a part of our DNA and hopefully a part of yours too. Together, we work hard, juggle priorities, shift trajectories, have loads of fun and, above all, dare to reinvent ourselves and meet new challenges.

As an ambassador of Costume Workshops, you assist operations by developing, supporting and contributing to the evolution of the various reports and technological solutions artisans, professionals and managers use to reach their objectives.

You will be known for:
Ensuring the stability and accessibility of operational and management reports, as well as monitoring the report update process;Developing and implementing improvement initiatives to help create new reports or information systems that meet business needs;Actively participating, in collaboration with your colleagues, to the technological upgrade process and the optimization of all information systems and reports under your purview;Providing support to artisans, professionals and managers at the Costume Workshops with regard to the information systems under your purview;Ensuring the sustainability of implemented solutions using the technological means at your disposal for development and documentation.

We want to meet you if you have:
A college or university degree in information technology;4 to 6 years’ experience in a similar position;Proficiency with the Microsoft development environment (.NET, SQL, VBA, C# and Azure);Experience with the MS Power BI data visualization tool, an asset;Experience with the REACT framework, an asset;Fluency in French and English.

Cirque du Soleil Entertainment Group is much more than just a show: it’s also you. At the centre of Cirque's creative energy are talented people with a passion for challenging their own limits. You will love to:
Make a real visible difference in what you do;Learn and grow within our international environment;See our shows and contribute to their success;Eat at our cafeteria and discover its gourmet menu;Host meetings while watching artists in training;Work out at our gym or play volleyball on our outdoor court;Take public transit or to park at the Cirque’s expense;Grow your kitchen garden;Recall our legendary parties;Get involved in our community.

Reporting to the Supervisor, Reference and Outreach, this position will take a support role in the provision of reference services including delivery of online reference services and the coordination of social media initiatives to enhance customer experience and engagement at the Archives. The primary functions associated with this position include, but are not limited to the following:

Provides information in response to both internal and external requests.
Develops and maintains data sets including, but not limited to business, economic activity and real estate indicators.
Inputs reports, documents, proposals and correspondence as required by the Unit.
Compiles information packages and other direct mail activities in support of Unit's activities.
Supports senior staff with special events and activities, coordinating seminars and meetings and attending functions as required to provide on-site assistance.
Establishing and maintaining filing system for Unit.
Answering telephone and written inquiries from the public and city staff.
Providing cover off on telephones for Division Staff as required.
Develops and maintains databases of programs, services, facilities, and political representation.
Reports on demographics and related statistics on subjects.
Develops, designs, and updates social media, and web pages.
Updates and maintains directories, statistics, and communications used by all levels in the division including management staff.
Responds to business-related requests for information both from internal and external sources.
Compiles and analyzes surveys used by the division for Performance Measures purposes and for other internal monitoring procedures.
Maintains a filing system of business related statistics.


Key Qualifications


Your application must describe your qualifications as they relate to:

Post-secondary education in archives or library science or a related discipline, or the equivalent combination of education and/or experience.
Experience in a customer service environment dealing directly with the public and staff through multiple channels (i.e. in-person, by telephone, in writing, and via social media).
Experience in providing reference services ie, identification of resources to members of the public.
Experience in researching, compiling, analyzing and reporting data for divisional performance measures.
Experience using social media to increase public engagement and outreach.
Experience using various software applications i.e. Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), databases, Outlook, Adobe, Hootsuite, etc.
You may also have:

Ability to work collaboratively as part of a team and establish good working relationships with staff at all levels in the organization as well as external clients.
Ability to take initiative and identify opportunities for researcher/user engagement for the enhancement of services and programs.
Excellent analytical, interpersonal, and problem solving skills.
Ability to manage and develop relationships with customers and partners.
Ability to perform multiple tasks and work effectively, in a fast-paced environment.
Attention to detail and the ability to complete data entry.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Interest in and understanding of Toronto history, municipal government, and archival research.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.
Knowledge of purchasing, financial and administrative policies, procedures, and practices.
Ability to exercise good judgement and discretion, including sensitivity to public-sector information access and confidentiality requirements, and political neutrality.
Ability to work overtime as required.
Ability to lift/move boxes up to 30lbs in weight.
Ability to work under minimum supervision.


Equity, Diversity and Inclusion:


The City of Toronto is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment where all employees and members of the public feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the public and the communities in which we live and serve.

Job Title: BUSINESS ANALYST, VARIOUS PROGRAMS

Requisition #: 081620

Job Location: Canada-British Columbia-Burnaby

Department: Payroll

Job Type: Temporary, Full Time

Start Date of Employment: 22-Apr-2019

Work Days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri,

Hours of Work: 0830 - 16:30

Work Site: 1795 Willingdon Avenue, Burnaby

Job Summary:

The Business Analyst is responsible for leading various projects and business operational processes and ensuring that all related applications are meeting the business needs of BCCSS and its Health Authority customers for a designated portfolio. The Business Analyst provides statistical performance reporting and application support of its business process and information management systems. The Business Analyst reviews, evaluates and recommends improvement and standardization of business processes and ensures effective utilization of systems while maintaining internal controls and safeguards. Other responsibilities include troubleshooting of assigned business processes and applications and conducting training for staff on the functionality of the business process and systems utilized. The Business Analyst works with the Information Management/Information Technology (IM/IT) staff responsible for the technical functions related to system applications.

Duties/Accountabilities:

Participates in systems development and maintenance by developing and analyzing key performance indicators, identifying needs and defining system requirements, creating project work plans and assisting the team in system development, implementation, documentation, interfacing and maintenance within established policies and guidelines in accordance with the BC Clinical & Support Services (BCCSS) strategic plan.Leads report development based on needs of users including BCCSS executives as well as agency management staff. Fulfills external reporting requirements and financial statements. Performs data gathering and analysis for the function to facilitate operational activities.Reviews process and or systems use, identifies needs and makes recommendations for reallocation or acquisition of systems or equipment to ensure appropriate utilization of computerized and manual systems as well as other departmental/divisional resources. Ensures internal controls are maintained.Reviews, analyses and evaluates Current State (As Is) and Future State (To Be) business processes, systems and user needs. Provides recommendations for process improvement for the function and works with staff and managers to evaluate alternative procedural and systematic solutions which most effectively meet needs while maintaining acceptable business standards.Provides user orientation and training based on system and process changes. Develops and maintains reference documentation such as workflow charts, user instructions, manuals and reference materials on business processes, policies and procedures.May be required to provide input into the development and submission of the annual operating budget and capital planning requirements; monitor expenditures, identify variances from approved budgets, generate financial impact summary reports and recommend corrective action.
Qualifications:

Business Analysts in Accounts Payable will require a level of education, training and experience equivalent to a degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or Business Administration including enrollment in a recognized professional accounting program (CA, CGA, CMA).

Business Analysts in Accounts Receivable and Payroll will require a level of education, training and experience equivalent to completion of a recognized professional accounting designations such as CA, CGA, CMA, supplemented by related Information Systems courses.

Business Analysts in Records and Benefits will require a level of education, training and experience equivalent to a degree in Human Resources, Business Administration or related discipline

All positions working under this job description will require a minimum of five (5) years of recent related experience in a large organization with an emphasis on financial systems and reporting. Extensive experience with complex computer systems, project planning and control and experience

All positions working under this job description require superior analytical skills including the ability to comprehend complex issues and related data/information and present information in concise meaningful ways. Demonstrated ability to carry out business process mapping and fit gap analysis. Ability to explain complicated technical issues in non-technical terms and in a non-technical manner. Customer focused with ability to facilitate and encourage cooperation between diverse operational groups and skill sets. Highly developed communication skills, verbal and written, with the proven ability to resolve conflict effectively, negotiate desired outcomes, and problem solve. Ability to work under pressure and multi-task without direct supervision. Demonstrated administrative, organizational, and work planning skills. Demonstrated ability to productively use word processing, spreadsheet, and database applications.

$30.86 - $34.19 an hourSystems Programmer/Analyst 2 - Business Systems
Hours of Work: Full-Time Position; Days
Wage: $30.858- $34.194 per hour
Union: CUPE
In accordance with Article 9.05, where the previous incumbent returns to this position within the thirty (30) day trial period this position shall be deemed not vacant and the posting will be cancelled. Should the vacancy be cancelled, applicants to this posting shall be notified.
PRIMARY FUNCTION:
Works with the client and/or project team to establish project scope and objectives. Develops the work plan and resource plan for small to moderately complex information systems projects. Conducts analysis and prepares detailed specifications related to system implementation. Designs, codes, configure, tests, debugs and documents system applications. Capable of working on all phases of systems analysis, development, delivery and support. Works under general supervision of the Manager and with the technical direction of more experienced analysts.
Within this role the employee is accountable for contributing to the delivery of the Kingston General Hospital strategy. As an employee, one must demonstrate an awareness of and be responsible for actively promoting and supporting patient and family centered engagement and care in all we do.
PRINCIPLE RESPONSIBILITIES:
Project Tasks : Executes detailed application system tasks for all phases of the systems development lifecycle and application administration: problem definition, feasibility study, analysis, outline design, detailed design, implementation, and maintenance. For example:
Acts in conjunction with the client to establish the project and produces the statement of requirements.
Works with the client and/or team to define what constitutes a solution to the opportunity/problem and produces a logical model of the solution. Conducts workshops and presentations to validate business processes and system solutions with the functional area and/or the user community in conjunction with the project team members.
Determines ways of implementing a solution and makes recommendations based on analysis
Produces detailed system and technical design specifications
Develops system deliverables such as configuration setup, programs, enhancements, reports, forms, interfaces, and conversions required for the system solution. Ensures that proper quality, integration and standards in relation to development objects are maintained.
Creates the unit test plan and executes unit testing; works with the project team to identify mission critical business process scenarios; identifies transactions and data to be tested; manages expected results versus actual results; assigns follow up tasks to re-configure and retest; tracks error resolution.
Works to provide application administration system monitoring /tuning and configuration; application instance maintenance; installation of notes; data management / optimization; application architecture; general application administrative tasks
Assists in end user documentation, training materials development, and training
Project Management: Evaluates opportunities and establishes objectives and scope, in conjunction with the client. Develops the project work plan and resource plan working with the Project Management Office (PMO), and is responsible for the detailed planning, coordination and ultimate outcome of the project.
Production Support : Provides production support and on-call service as required; coordinates problem resolution related to production system issues or errors.
Education : Maintains a good working knowledge of KGH applications and their interrelationships with other systems; maintains knowledge of technological advances; maintains knowledge of how the hospital conducts its business; acts as trainer and mentor to junior IM staff.
Other: Develops and documents procedures, guidelines and project communications for IM; identifies opportunities for improvement in hospital operations; participates in staff performance evaluations. Provides other duties as assigned in support of the IM business systems.
Workplace Health & Safety : Adheres to the worker responsibilities as set out in the Occupational Health & Safety Act, hospital safety policies, and dept/unit established procedures at all times. Where possible, take corrective action to address a hazard, otherwise report the unresolved hazard, dangerous circumstance, unsafe situation to self, other co-workers or the community, to their supervisor. Should the employee suffer a workplace injury or illness, he/she will advise their supervisor; actively participate in identifying and resolving the underlying cause(s), and participates in early and safe return to work as per Workplace Safety & Insurance Act.
Workplace Conduct: Understands and is familiar with all pertinent KGH policies and procedures including those relating to workplace conduct. Complies with the KGH Commitment to uphold the Workplace Conduct and Reporting of Inappropriate Conduct policy and behaves in a manner that is consistent with the guiding principles and expectations.
QUALIFICATIONS:
University Degree in Computer Science, Health Informatics, Commerce or related discipline or Equivalent combination of education and experience.
3 years systems development experience in a corporate systems setting including 2 years recent experience in the development and support of business systems applications within large-scale commercial systems.
Knowledge and application of project management methodologies.
Knowledge and application of the principles of systems development methodology.
Good communication skills in both written and oral forms as demonstrated through preparation of technical, training or project documents and presentations to IM staff.
Ability to lead technical project teams.
Ability to identify issues relating to systems development, systems operation or project completion and provide solutions.
Ability to prepare/implement plans, designs or specifications in accordance with established departmental standards.
Excellent prioritization and organizational skills as demonstrated by the ability to manage own time and successfully complete multiple tasks or projects assigned simultaneously.
General Functional knowledge plus two or more years’ experience in technical maintenance of enterprise business system applications i.e. fully integrated solutions like SAP, Oracle E-Business Suite, PeopleSoft, etc This includes, but is not limited to, the functional areas of:
HCM (i.e. personnel administration, personnel development, personnel time, employee scheduling, and payroll);
Finance and Controlling;
Sales and Distribution (SD) - Billing and Receivables;
Supply Chain Management (SCM) (i.e. Inventory, Purchasing, Accounts Payable, and Supplier Relationship Management (SRM));
Clinical (i.e. Patient master data, case, visit, encounter, movement, and service / procedure / provider / diagnosis information);
Decision Support Systems/Data Warehousing i.e. SAP BI, Cognos, Informatica
Mobile Enterprise Applications Platforms (MEAP) i.e. SAP MI, Oracle MEAP
Knowledge of HL7 Clinical Document Architecture (CDA) and HL7 Reference Information Model (RIM).
General Functional Knowledge of Graphical Design concepts and software i.e. CorelDRAW, Adobe Photoshop.
Knowledge of Portal technologies i.e. SAP Netweaver Portal, Microsoft Sharepoint
Knowledge of Database Management Systems (dbms) and relational database concepts in a client server environment, including knowledge of SQL.
Understanding of Object Oriented programming concepts and at least one Object Oriented programming language.
Knowledge of Web technologies and Web applications.
Knowledge of MS-Office products (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Access).
Proven ability to attend work regularly.
Satisfactory criminal reference check required.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
The applicant must be able to meet the physical demands of this position.

Job Title:
Salesforce Business Analyst

Salesforce Business Analysts are tasked with providing consistent client support throughout the implementation lifecycle. The Analyst provides a balance of functional and technical expertise and supports the Solution Architect in facilitation of analysis and design sessions with the client. The Analyst then implements the design using Salesforce declarative configuration and supporting the functional requirements for any further development required outside of declarative configuration.

The Analyst presents complex information equally well to a C-level audience or a developer community, and has hands on experience implementing Safesforce.com functionality and can act as a knowledgeable liaison between technical teams and business stakeholders during the implementation phase.

Analysts can also support internal practice development efforts as needed, providing input on industry based expertise and idea generation for Slalom intellectual property.

Responsibilities:
Typically provide full time support throughout the implementation lifecycle as a key member of the implementation teamSignificant involvement in the Analysis phases of the implementation, collecting and documenting functional requirements, and understanding and possibly re-defining business process based on the capabilities of the platformWhile the Solution Architect maintains primary responsibility for the system architecture and design, the Analyst will support the design efforts by documenting suggested data models, technical process flows, integration, and migration specificationsPrimary resource responsible for all declarative configuration within Salesforce.com including security and sharing, object creation and definition, workflow and validation, approval processes, etc.Responsible for the creation of all requirements and process documentation including functional requirements, business process requirements, technical design document, integration specifications and data migration specificationsResponsible for successful completion of unit and function testing as well as all supporting documentation required for the Validation phase (i.e. test plans, test scripts)Responsible for supporting the client through User Acceptance Testing and any support for defect management during UAT processInvolved in all aspects of Deployment phase including migration of configuration/code, production data migration, and interface go-liveTypically, responsible or heavily Involved in the creation of end user and administrator training material, as well as potentially delivering end user training

Qualifications:
3-7 years of related experienceKnowledgeable on the following CRM Business Processes (Sales, Marketing Automation and Strategy, Service/Call Center, Custom Application Development using the Salesforce platform).One of the following certifications: Certified Salesforce.com Sales Cloud Consultant, Certified Salesforce.com Service Cloud Consultant.

Slalom is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Slalom Welcomes And Encourages Applications From People With Disabilities. Accommodations Are Available On Request For Candidates Taking Part In All Aspects Of The Selection Process. Please Let Me Know If You Require Accommodation At Any Point During The Process.”
