Location: Toronto, ON, CA
Requisition ID: 6112

A Career in Beer….

Our purpose at Molson Coors is to delight the world’s beer drinkers. We are the world’s family brewer, brewing and selling our beer for over 350 years around the world.

We are Talent Brewers - we believe in our brands and our people, we believe that a truly inspiring and diverse place to work is a must. We want you to join our team of passionate self-starters who believe the world is full of untapped opportunities. So, if you get fired up about making a real difference as part of a winning team like we do then we want to hear from you.

The Headlines

The Revenue Operations Analyst provides price strategy, price analysis, assortment strategy and promotional effectiveness expertise while working closely Regional Sales teams and Brand Marketing to bring a fact-based highly analytical approach to the business. The role is also a key point of contact between the business partners (MRK, revenue Management, Finance, Distribution…) and the liquor boards for new SKU registration and listing, pricing and all other matters.

The Responsbilities:
Analysis and Recommendation of Action Plans to grow Net Sales Revenue/Hectoliters, and share based on customer, consumer and competitiveness insights in areas of Price, Promotion and Assortment for Key Accounts, Independents, On-Premise and Western Regions
Development of Recommendations /Business Cases leveraging consumer, customer and competitive learnings to grow Net Sales Revenue and Net Sales Revenue/Hectoliters including GPIs, LTOs, new packs
Performs Price/Promotional post-mortems and ROI analyses making recommendaitons for improvements
Weekly management of changing pricing/promotional conditions incl. government
Execution of Price, Promotion and Mix actions, incl. review and alignment with sales, DP, Finance, Brand and Legal
Extensive knowledge of the liquor control and licensing regulations in each province including buy sell agreements, food primary and liquor primary guidelines. Interprets and understand liquor board’s communications and communicate to key business partners impacts timely.
Build and support relationships with all internal and external customers to support our goal to be the customer preferred supplier
Maintain master data files ensuring high quality data and information.
Submit and track approvals as per policy for Audit and SOX compliance purposes.
Build pricing reconciliations and actionable insights for 3rd Party retail coverage

Work Perks You Need to Know About

Opportunity to work for a global brewing company that is part of the Canada's Top 100 Employers
We play our part to make a difference – from charitable donations to our employees hitting the streets together to build parks – giving back to the community is part of our culture and who we are.
We take people development seriously offering growth opportunities through talent and development programs and career planning
Opportunity to take part in industry-leading Beer Education. Our employees become Certified Beer Enthusiasts, and we offer an in-house training program that includes everything from brewing techniques to beer tasting and food pairings
Access to the things that help to make us an Employer of Choice such as employee events, beer allotment, Employee Assistance Program and innovative open concept head office
Participation in our Total Rewards program which includes; competitive base salary, incentive plans, annual merit review, health, dental and pension benefits
Work within a fast paced ever evolving global company, meeting passionate colleagues and partners with diverse backgrounds, experiences and needs

The Other Qualifications!

University Degree in Finance or Analytics
3+ years CPG or similar industry experience in Category Management, Revenue Management, Commercial Finance, Marketing or Sales
Strong analytical skills, ability to uncover shopper and/or consumer insights to develop revenue generating ideas
Ability to translate pricing and/or promotional strategies into actionable plans
Strong communication, negotiation and/or presentation skills based on a solid understanding of working with sales / marketing
Leadership and strategic thinking
5+ years of experience with demonstrated success preferred in the following:
Analysis, working with insights and developing recommendations
Pricing, Promotional and Mix Analytics & Insights
As part of the recruitment process, the candidates will be required to provide consent to complete a criminal background check.
At Molson Coors we seek diversity. Differing perspectives lead to challenging the expected, which keeps new ideas bubbling up. We’re an equal opportunity employer and invite applications from candidates from all backgrounds, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic. We take pride in celebrating our unique brew.

AN EXCEPTIONAL AREA!
The Eastern Townships, located at the very south of the province, shares a border with the United States over close to 300 km (186 mi). The charm comes on thick as you forge your way into this paradise of mountains, hills and valleys. The architectural heritage, evidence of the Anglo-Saxon legacy, has transformed the towns into the most picturesque of places. 80% of the territory is covered by forests. Come the fall season, an abundance of colour covers the branches. To the sheer delight of outdoor enthusiasts, four national parks, including Parc national du Mont-Orford, and many other natural areas provide their share of activities, no matter the season: hiking, biking, camping, skiing and so much more. A favourite vacation destination, the Eastern Townships offers a good selection of B&Bs and inns, not to mention spas and health centres. Agritourism completes the region’s circle of charm, with five different circuits exploring vineyards, orchards, country-style dining, terroir delights and sugar shacks. In fact, the region counts several vineyards, all very different from one another, such as the Vignoble Le Cep d’Argent where you can discover the pleasure of their palatable wine.

Reporting to the Director of BizTech Operations, the Business/Systems Analyst studies business composition, processes, and informational needs of an organization with the goal of developing solutions to enhance effectiveness of company application systems and Electronic Data Platforms. This includes analyzing user requirements, processes, procedures, and problems to automate or improve efficiencies, drive user adoption, increase system capabilities, workflows, and scheduling. the role provides ongoing technical sustainment and training for transaction processing modules that include manufacturing, distribution, finance, and inventory, resolving break/fix issues to ensure orders are successfully processed and accurate. The incumbent is a key resource in mid to large-sized projects, and responsible for ongoing continuous improvement. This individual participates in the implementation of policies, procedures, and documentation that are consistent with company enterprise goals, industry best practices, Health Canada regulatory requirements, and GxP quality standards.
Role and Responsibilities
Identify projects requirements by interfacing with production teams, analyze operations, determine project scope, document results, document process flows, create procedure manuals for the functions performed.
Facilitate technical meetings to define solutions, functional specifications, implementation plans, effort, identify resources, and schedule activities.
Contribute to the development of methods to improve business processes, reduce risks, increase controls and/or increase customer satisfaction.
Develop solutions, workflow charts and diagrams, study system capabilities, analyze alternative solutions, prepare system specifications.
Develop project estimates by identifying phases and elements, personnel requirements, costs, ERP implementation, support and development.
Develop and maintain systems by researching and resolving problems, working closely with IT and Finance teams to maintain system integrity and security.
Maintain service quality levels by establishing and enforcing organization standards.
Communicate information effectively to customers, collaborate with other department managers and technical staff.
Maintain issues log, release log, and decision/approval log.
Understand business unit workflows and how to use technology solutions to support.
Manage requirements traceability information and track requirements status throughout the project.
Organize and manage reports, generic inquiries, establish naming conventions, report commissioning and ongoing management.
Decompose high-level business and user requirements into functional equivalents, specified in an appropriate level of detail suitable for daily use by system operators.
Ensure data quality, develop and publish enterprise data standards including a common business vocabulary, transformation rules, and related enterprise consistent specifications.
Provide business process improvement, ERP adoption and training, isolate and escalate application incidents and problems.
Follow established GxP quality principles of change control, document control, CAPA, and systems validation.
Participate in third-party vendor relationships, SLA’s, and contract negotiations.
Develop and maintain expertise through professional development opportunities and personal studies off-hours.
As needed availability for on-call resource evenings, weekends, and statutory holidays.
Qualifications
University degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Technology, or an acceptable combination of education and experience.
At least 3+ years of direct work experience as a Business/Systems Analyst in an ERP environment, with progressively increasing responsibilities.
Experience with Acumatica ERP and SDLC framework are assets.
Proven ability with Microsoft Office applications, particularly Excel advanced functions.
Strong analytical skills, with a thorough understanding of interpreting customer business needs and translating them into application and operational requirements and/or process workflows.
Experience with project delivery framework, application development, and/or program management experience.
Effective time management, task prioritization, and ability to consistently meet deadlines.
Able to work independently or as part of a team. A proven self-starter and highly motivated to make proactive changes.
Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills, and highly analytical aptitude.

Job Summary
The Solution Development – Student Life Cycle unit of the Information Technology Services department requires a Business Analyst for a term to commence immediately and conclude December 2020. This role will elicit business needs and requirements to support ongoing development, upgrades and new capabilities for the administrative systems which support the student experience from admission to convocation and beyond. In this role, you will collaborate with business stakeholders and end-users to optimize business processes, and liaise with other business, system and programmer analysts to effectively connect a vast array of IT systems and tools with the users that need them.


As a member of the Student Life Cycle business analysis team, you have an eye for process improvements and recognized skill at implementing new applications and assisting clients to adapt to process changes. You will use your research and analysis skills to bring value and understanding to process re-engineering efforts in an area that underpins current, prospective and graduating students’ interaction with the University related to admissions, academics and finances.


Guided by the new IT Services Operating Plan, you will have the opportunity to participate on a wide range of initiatives, from large-scale transformation to smaller initiatives. These initiatives could include digital transformation of administrative manual processes, implementation of new ERP functionality, government compliance assignments, integrations, resolving production issues.

If you embrace “the art of the possible”, if you are a gifted communicator, and if you enjoy the challenge of improving the way things are done, then consider joining our team as a Business Analyst.

Job Description
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Liaises with internal and external stakeholders to address information systems changes to meet current and future business requirements.
Researches, reviews, and analyzes the effectiveness and efficiency of existing processes and develops strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes. Facilitates business review sessions. Performs cost-benefit and return on investment analyses for proposed changes. Prepares written proposals of recommendations and presents to business stakeholders.
Elicits, edits, analyzes and documents requirements to ensure business needs are met; includes brainstorming, documenting and interface analysis, and conducting interviews, focus groups or requirements gathering workshops.
Creates business requirements documents to be shared with key stakeholders and project team members that include aspects of regulatory, business, end-user, functional or non-functional requirements and provides insight into both the current and future state requirements.

Uses structured analysis, including process models, data models and workflow models to support and enhance requirements, to document and communicate requirements and to organize information and recommendations into coherent ideas.
Completes detailed system functional specifications for reports, interfaces, conversions, modifications, customizations or extensions.
Creates multi-level test scenarios by designing test scripts, test plans and test scenarios that test outcomes to validate whether requirements have been met.
Collaborates with other members of the IT Services team to ensure requirements and specifications align with existing and proposed tools and systems.
Leverages business process re-engineering to identify problems and opportunities by using a variety of modelling techniques.
Collaborates with business owners, stakeholders and system end-users to encourage an understanding of the impact of report definition, application configuration and rules definition, workflow processes, and system enhancements on the quality of operations.
Identifies problems, performs detailed analysis, completes system failure investigations and provides recommendations for corrective action.
Supports business requirements and information needs by using query and reporting tools.
Maintains an understanding of data definitions, data usage within the administrative applications and data retrieval methods.
Ensures all changes to application configurations adhere to change management and security specification requirements.
Ensures service escalation issues, as assigned, are resolved within service standards.
Provides analytical support to the quality review process in keeping with established project and business analysis methodology.
Adheres to task and project deadlines; escalates potential delays to management and recommends possible solutions.
Updates technical and business knowledge to remain current on changing systems and business processes.
Provides occasional after hours, on-call support.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

University degree in computer science, information management or business administration combined with a minimum five years experience with administrative information systems (ERP/PeopleSoft experience considered an asset).
Advanced knowledge of business analysis discipline (CCBA or CBAP certification is an asset).
Minimum five years experience documenting business processes and with technical requirements analysis. Knowledge of activities, tasks, practices and deliverables associated with eliciting and clearly defining and documenting business processes/functions and process modeling/mapping.
Experience working with diverse groups of people, projects, and applications to identify and bring together multiple information sources in a clear, consistent, valid and understandable format.
Project management skills/certification considered an asset.
Experience using and implementing online applications.
Strong written and verbal communication and relationship management skills.
Consideration may be given to an equivalent combination of education and experience.

SPECIAL SKILLS:
Working with Others: actively seeks ideas from multiple sources for consideration to improve the performance of the team(s). Shares thoughts and information with all levels of expertise. Ensures that one’s own behaviour does not negatively impact others when faced with complex situations.
Inclusivity: welcomes an inclusive environment and coach’s others to address and support those who may feel vulnerable. Ensures the diverse group receives opportunities for fair treatment regardless of background.
Communication: takes a lead role to communicate to multiple audiences and easily explains complex information to ensure the message is understood.

Customer Service and Support anticipates current/future needs of the client/customer and proactively seeks to address them. Schedules periodic checks points to determine if they have additional and acts to address them.

Planning/Organizing: takes an active role in analyzing problems regarding resources/deliverables that may impact deadlines or standards and escalates for discussion and resolution. Plans medium-term requirements and provides insight into scope of potential problems and identifies possible solutions.

Continuous Improvement: leads a team(s) and together they identify ways to improve department processes, and quality of customer service. Solicits feedback from multiple sources to identify ways to become a more highly functioning team. Actively participates in continuous learning and sets the department standard.
Attention to Detail: actively works to address quality problems by sharing concerns with team and manager. Understands the details of the problem and identifies solutions. Seeks to understand the nature of (new/existing) assignments as it relates to own role and the expected results.
Adaptability and Support for Change: takes an active role to positively support team members through change. Supports change by generating new ideas and offering suggestions that will benefit the team.

DECISION MAKING:
Makes decisions regarding design, set-up and definition, and related aspects within functional area.
Makes decisions based on the results achieved through consensus building sessions, which have a direct impact on how requirements and deliverables are established.
Makes decisions on completeness of all related process tasks aligned with business unit priorities.
Determines type and level of information needed by management to support decision making, or if and when escalation is needed.
Determines most effective method and/or strategy to identify opportunities, risks, issues, assumptions and dependencies; presents information and gathers requirements when working with business owners, conveying potential impact of business decisions on systems and supporting processes.
Finds solutions to unanticipated problems within Support team parameters and determines how problem and recommended solution may affect information systems and/or business processes.
Determines appropriate strategy and content when developing training documents based on audience.
Provides recommendations to business representatives and other analysts.

Closing Statement
The University invites applications from all qualified individuals. Queen’s is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applications from women, visible minorities, Aboriginal Peoples, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity. In accordance with Canadian Immigration requirements, priority will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents.
The University provides support in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, including accommodation that takes into account an applicant's accessibility needs. Candidates requiring accommodation during the recruitment process are asked to contact Human Resources at hradmin@queensu.ca.

The Data Analyst will be articulate, analytical, and a team player who understands the power of data. Respond to ad hoc requests from various stakeholders, prioritizing tasks based on business value and urgency

Monitor, maintain, and leverage Vendasta KPI databases to surface timely business intelligence
Assist with data gathering strategies that align with company goals
Push requirements to Vendasta Business Intelligence teams to leverage their tech/strategy
Coordinate with management to prioritize business and information needs
Develop and implement databases and other systems that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Coordinate with internal teams to ensure that required quantitative data is accessible, reliable, and maintainable
Assist product teams with the interpretation of quantitative data to aid in decision making and strategic planning

Experience performing statistical analysis
Competent in cleaning and formatting data
Proven ability to analyze and model data

Familiarity with Google Cloud Infrastructure, App Engine, and tools (Bigquery, Data Store, Google Analytics, Data Studio, etc.)
Familiarity with databases and various querying techniques (SQL, NoSQL, API)
General knowledge of Python and agile development practices (would be considered an asset)
Knowledge of design principles and data visualizations
Awareness of key users to surface actionable insights (partners, local businesses, Partner Success Managers, Sales Reps, vendors, etc.)
Continuous learner with a drive to explore new technologies and processes
Analytical business sense as aligned to division strategies and goals
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Detail-oriented with a strong pursuit for truth and accuracy

Demonstrated success with business requirements analysis, group facilitation, gap analysis and process mapping and design as part of a business transformation
Key Responsibilities:
Formulates and defines systems scope and objectives through research and fact-finding combined with an understanding of applicable business systems and industry requirements
Develops or modifies moderately complex information systems. Includes analysis of business and user needs, documenting requirements, configuring and revising existing system logic as necessary
Competent to work in some phases of systems analysis and considers the business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
Develop solution expertise to be able to provide guidance and support to business users for both additional locations and improvements at existing sites
Support the engineering and configuration management teams from an IT delivery perspective
Lead enhancements and process improvement activities surrounding applications including but not limited to; Smart Plant Foundation, Smart 3D, SharePoint, and other shipbuilding specific applications
Manage relationships and establish trusted partnerships with associated business areas
To Apply for this Career Opportunity:

We appreciate your interest in our company! Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

All successful applicants must meet requirements for Canadian Controlled Goods Program (CGP), Canadian Government Security clearance, and U.S. International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR).

Here at Scotts Miracle-Gro there is no such thing as a typical day. Our culture is constantly energized by new and exciting growth opportunities and at a rapid pace. Every Associate plays an important role in providing innovative solutions for today’s gardeners and growers and contributing new ideas to improve operations. In our company you need grit, it is what we were founded on over 150 years ago and is what keeps us growing. Regardless of your level in the organization there is a platform for your voice to be heard and the ability to influence change. Family, community and hard working values are weaved into all that we do. Come grow with us, where we develop and nurture the next generation of leaders.
General Summary

The primary purpose of the Sales Operation Analyst is to drive category management principles through the application of strong data analytics and consumer insights, hence providing value added services to Scotts Canada Ltd.’s internal business. S/he will work closely with the Sales team to provide business intelligence through the cross analysis of multiple sources of data. S/he will highlight areas of opportunity/risk by combining consumer insights, POS & shipment analytics.
The secondary purpose is to support to Scotts National Field Manager and the Retail Field Sales Teams. S/he will ensure all tools, reporting and program details are available to the field to ensure smooth execution of all national programs at field level.

Key Work Performed

Retail Field Analysis/Support
Manage communication to the Field Sales Team which includes production and management of all processes (Google); production and consolidation of field surveys, maintenance of the 2 orientation sites, revisions to both SM and M&C manuals, and creation of bi-weekly retailer communications
Manage all POP materials and field sales equipment/tools to the field team including coordination and distribution of warehouse fulfillment (clothing/uniforms and swag)
Provide increased visibility through daily and weekly reporting tools to the field Sales teams based on customer specific data, POS trending and shipment analysis
Manage the VMI reports to ensure information is accurate and provide improvements to ensure the reports are providing all the details required by the field.
Analyze data to assist the field sales team in identifying business issues and opportunities and achieving specific account objectives.
Manage the communication to the Field Sale team which includes maintenance of the 2 orientation sites, both SM and M&C manuals, field surveys and bi-weekly retailer communications
Category Management/POS Analysis
Provide “business intelligence” regarding trending, shipments analysis and budget comparisons to all areas of the Scotts business
Act as a main liaison of information between all stakeholders in the organization and support on-going reporting and analysis to/for Senior Leadership
Maintain customized/standardized POS and shipment data reporting across all Scotts Business units
Act as an integral partner of the sales team by identifying and clearly defining the key category and customer opportunities/risks, that help shape retailer strategies and sales tactics
Use POS data to add intelligence to new products product introductions, customer insights, account comparison, and competitive analysis
Maintains this database and provides competitive information and research data for internal sales.
Review, monitor and access operational performance against forecast, budget and sales goals
Job Specifications (Minimum Requirements)

Skill Factors (education, experience, communication, technical, etc.)
Post-secondary Degree/Diploma
One year proven experience in category analysis/management demonstrating ability to perform responsibilities similar to the key performance work list above
Two year’s experience in Consumer Packaged Goods work setting
Superior communication and presentation skills in English reflecting the ability to communicate professionally with all levels of management
Superior proficiency in Microsoft excel, with the ability to navigate data through key strokes, and manipulate it via advanced formulas(CONTIF, SUMIF, RANK, FIND, CONCATENATE, REPLACE, VLOOKUP, MATCH, INDEX, LARGE, ETC) and custom number formatting
Proficiency in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint
Proficiency with Google, Survey Monkey, social media
Effort Factors (physical and mental demands)
Superior time management through multi-tasking and agenda priorization – ability to manage self, time and priorities and ensure all deadlines are met
Strong analytical skills – ability to syntheses and integrate learning from multiple sources and see the connection in data, trends, and events to generate insights
Must have strong decision-making and problem solving skills
Must have a sense of urgency and be deadline orientated
Demonstrates attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communications
Ability to work independently with little or no supervision, as well as in a team environment
Must exhibit original thinking, creativity and initiative
Physical is limited to those normally associated with other support positions in the company e.g. standing, walking and sitting, often for long durations at the computer
Working Conditions
Works the standard schedule of 37.5 hours per week; however, job requirements will include additional and/or extended work time as the business dictates
Works in a well-ventilated modern office with natural and artificial light exposure
Travel as required by the Company
Other
Complies with all Scotts policies and procedures including Health & Safety

THAT AN EMPLOYEE IN THIS JOB MAY BE ASKED TO PERFORM FROM TIME TO TIME

Burnaby, BCOverview
Cayenta Utilities is seeking talented, motivated Business Analyst to join our R&D team. Someone who can uniquely balance his or her business knowledge, technical skills and strong interpersonal skills. The Business Analyst will interact with our customers, third party software vendors, and our development teams to gather and document requirements, manage change to projects, provide training, and implementation support. The BA’s biggest responsibility is to understand what the customer really wants and to strive for total customer satisfaction.
Details
Assume Business System Analysis responsibility and solution ownership for projects and initiatives related to utilities (electric, gas, water), business process automation, and Smart Meter and MDM (Meter Data Management) solutions
Build and maintain highly effective relationships and become a trusted advisor with clients (business and process owners throughout the organization), partners, vendors, and internal team members.
Gather requirements, design and implement solutions using Cayenta Utilities application products
Serve as liaison between R&D and Implementation teams for requirements analysis, documentation and implementation
Oversee the implementation of new technology and systems as developed and deployed by R&D team
Conduct workshops and training sessions on new technology and systems
Collaborate with the development and QA teams to improve software quality
To meet this challenge you must possess a high level of initiative and energy as required to succeed in a fast-paced team environment, as well as several of the following skills:
Previous experience in the Utilities industry strongly desired
Experience working with Senior Decision Makers
Thorough understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle
Experience working with MS SQL and/or Oracle databases
Experience with bug tracking systems and planning tools such as Jira, Bugzilla, Portfolio
Experience in cost benefit analysis
Experience in business process modeling. Specifically, as a way of identifying potential opportunities for improvements or identifying failures
Accountability, respect, integrity and discipline are core values
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Strong problem-solving ability
Strong time management skills, and an ability to work independently, but most importantly as a team player
Ability to travel in North America up to 40%
Assets
University degree or college diploma relevant to business analysis or equivalent education and experience would be a strong asset
IIBA or other certification would be a strong asset
Experience in Cayenta Utilities application products would be a strong asset
Ability to lead, delegate and coordinate BA activities to service multiple projects
Demonstrated experience in applying business analysis best practices (BABOK)
Strong facilitation and presentation skills
Experience working with software built using JAVA, JS, UNIFACE or similar technologies would be an asset

The Group Creditor Project Delivery Systems Analyst is a key interface between various departments within the Group Customer business unit, in support of delivering projects driven by Group Customer. The role will also work closely with vendors as well as business partners in the Strategic Customer Marketing and Shared Enterprise Services when project delivery accountabilities and/or business value outcomes are shared.

The Systems Analyst will be responsible for collection, analysis and documentation of business requirements, needs and features, contribute to solutioning discussions and translate business needs and features into developer-consumable functional and non-functional requirements as an input to design, development and testing exercises associated with application delivery or configuration.

The successful candidate will develop a strong and deep understanding of Group Customer needs and how systems support the core business unit mission.

Accountabilities:
Works closely with cross-departmental staff to understand how systems are used to support business functions.
Works with cross-departmental staff and management to analyze how existing systems may be improved to better support their business functions.
Works with vendors and cross-business unit staff to deliver new systems and technology solutions.
In conjunction with development staff, is responsible to plan and analyze data structures for internal and vendor business systems.
Writes detailed functional and non-functional specifications for developing or modifying various systems.
Prepares detailed workflow diagrams to specify operations performed by equipment and system applications and operations to be performed by personnel in system.
Plans, prepares or contributes to technical reports, memoranda, and instructional manuals as necessary.
Responsible to support system upgrades and maintenance after implementation during the warranty period.
Enforce application delivery methodologies, specifications and standards associated with CEO/CFO delivery controls.
Provide technical documentation and analysis, help administer or contribute to training for users, and support end users during the transition to maintenance period.
Create use cases for testing, as part of the System Requirements documentation process and work with quality assurance resources to ensure understanding of the requirements and traceability of test strategies, plans and test cases back to business requirements.
Qualifications and Competencies:
Post-secondary Degree or equivalent experience in Information Technology.
10+ years of relevant experience or the equivalent in experience plus education.
Experience working with data, function and design of database applications supporting business functions.
Experience managing substantial, cross-departmental projects.
Experience working with outside developers, vendors and consultants.
Strong analytical, quantitative, problem solving, and organizational skills; attention to detail; and ability to coordinate multiple tasks, set priorities, and meet deadlines.
Experience with requirements gathering and documentation of functional and non-functional specifications.
A self-starter who can work effectively as a member of a team or independently as the particular assignment requires.
Demonstrated analytical and computer proficiency necessary.
Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to build strong relationships with internal clients, and a successful track record of collaboration toward achieving objectives expected.
Strong technical skills in Microsoft office (excel, access, word, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks while meeting tight deadlines.
Excellent communication skills both orally and written as communication is internally and externally with clients.
Ability to work well in a team environment and independently.
Working knowledge of web development, master data management, identity and access management software and logical architecture.
Experience with development or translation of customer personas, journey maps and wireframe into functional and non-functional specifications.
Ability to provide shared leadership and oversight of a project team, alongside the Project Manager and Systems Architect and/or other Systems Analysts on larger programs.
Experience with agile project delivery.
Discover your opportunity….Apply today!

Winnipeg, MBWawanesa Insurance is a policyholder owned mutual insurance company that offers employees great stability and opportunity for growth.

We are currently looking for dedicated, driven, and enthusiastic individuals who thrive in an environment that welcomes change and are looking for an opportunity for diverse experience, advancement on a growing team.

Our Information Services team is delivering truly transformational change to both our business partners, and throughout our technology platforms. These initiatives have led to rapid growth and the need for new talent. If you’re interested in joining a team of motivated and skilled IT professionals, who are equipped with, and are actively working with today’s latest technology, consider this exciting Winnipeg-based opportunity!


JOB SUMMARY:
Working under minimal supervision, this job contributes to Wawanesa success by designing, documenting, testing and supporting system solutions to meet business stakeholder requirements.


JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Lead the analysis, design and documentation of both system and business requirements for application enhancements and projects.
Lead requirement sessions with business and system teams.
Communicate system solutions in business and technical terms.
Collaborate with multiple functions to ensure quality software.
Provide technical and business leadership for developers and Analysts.
Lead the resolution of system and business requirement issues.
Create test plans and estimates inclusive of evaluating and providing analysis on requirements documentation and identifying key areas of testing.
Lead changes to process and procedure improvements.
Follow established practices, processes and guidelines.
Maintain a high level of knowledge on current system standards and IS department established methodologies.
Perform other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS:

5 years’ experience performing systems or business analysis.
Completion of post-secondary degree/certificate or equivalent experience.
Advanced analysis and problem solving skills with the ability to prioritize a busy workload.
Advanced attention to detail skills to produce high quality deliverables that accounts for all areas involved.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner with style fitting for the audience and message.
Excellent planning and organizing skills, with the ability to develop and implement plans by prioritizing and multi-tasking.
Good leadership skills to provide support and guidance to team members.
Proven ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Demonstrable knowledge in agile practices, scrum, kanban and continuous delivery.
Experience in programming languages is considered an asset.
Knowledge and experience in insurance industry is considered an asset.
Experience with Business Intelligence tools (Tableau, Cognos, Crystal, or related. Microstrategy is preferred) is considered an asset.


Wawanesa provides its employees with a respectful, challenging and rewarding environment where they can maximize their potential while contributing to the company’s goals. Our employees are provided with highly competitive compensation packages (salaries, generous vacation allowance, leave top up, goal achievement plan, premium free benefits and a pension plan). Wawanesa provides a stable and rewarding environment for its employees in today’s challenging markets.

If you are interested in this exciting, challenging position with Wawanesa, please submit your resume and cover letter by clicking apply On-Line below.

PermanentFor over 70 years, and across six provinces we've been a leading diversified health services partner for individuals, plan sponsors, plan advisors and governments across Canada. We are proud to be a not-for-profit organization committed to giving back to the communities where we live and work. We support the health and wellness of our employees and their families with various wellness programs and resources to support their personal and professional growth.
We're a team of 1,900 colleagues dedicated to collaboration, innovation, customer service, and committed to work-life balance, community involvement and career development which is why Medavie Blue Cross is recognized one of Canada’s 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures.
Job Title: Business Data Technician

Department: Benefit Management

Competition: 4545

Internal/External: Internal/External

Employment Type: Full Time, Permanent

Location: Moncton, NB

Salary: Comprehensive Compensation

Reports To: Team Leader


The engineers of our benefit plan systems.

What’s in it for you?
A fast track to understanding how our business operates; a Business Data Technician is the ultimate technical guru who has a strong customer orientation and likes to connect the big picture to the tiniest details. Unknown to the world outside of insurance, this role is a great career for an individual with a technical, insurance or process engineering background.
What makes us a different kind of employer? In this role, it’s the opportunity to have exposure to every signal facet in our organization. Common goals and collaboration to deliver outstanding service is what our team is all about, we offer:
A diverse team of colleagues with multiple fields of expertise
A stimulating and flexible working environment
Comprehensive health and dental plan that is 100% employer paid effective on your first day
Emphasis on work life balance, providing wellness benefits, health resources and fitness center discounts
An organization where we encourage personal learning and growth
If getting involved in charitable causes is something you’re passionate about, we support and offer plenty of opportunities to give back

Your every day with us:
As a Business Data Technician, you will gain an understanding of our Group, Individual and Government client benefit plans, including how they are structured and managed from a technical perspective. You will interact with other key business areas such as Sales and IT and be responsible to install and manage client benefit plans effectively using our technology and your keen ability to see how elements of the plan design will interact in our information management systems.

What you need to succeed:
You are a good communicator – you are a clear, concise and friendly but know how to communicate to different audiences such as clients, members and internal stakeholders.
You have earned a post-secondary diploma or degree and/or relevant working experience in business, technology or engineering
You are a problem-solving master, you understand client needs and learn quickly how to get the best results
You are detailed oriented person, you like the little details with the big picture in mind.
You have been successful in roles that involve either detailed analysis, quality assurance or systems management
This role could be a good fit for someone in an HRIS, engineering/process management or IT analyst career path

We would like to thank all candidates for expressing interest. Please note only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Sysco is the global leader in selling, marketing and distributing food products, equipment and supplies to restaurants, healthcare and educational facilities, lodging establishments and other customers who prepare meals away from home. Role:
1- Year Contract
The purpose of the job is to monitor the profitability of each CMU account through margin analysis, pretaxes and reporting for evaluation of compliance with the Master Data Agreement
Role Responsibilities:
Monitor margins for CMU accounts weekly and report issues to the appropriate departments for corrective action.
Prepare, maintain, and verify records of monthly, quarterly and annual rebate information for customers and process accordingly.
Prepare, maintain, and verify records of monthly, quarterly Fuel Surcharge information for customers and process accordingly.
Prepare and analyze pretax reports for CMU accounts and advise RVPs of any opportunities or issues.
Perform pricing audits on CMU accounts to ensure accurate set up of components of the MDA and ensure system set up is accurate.
All exception reporting for CMU customers, work with National IT to develop any Work Requests required for IT platforms required between Sysco and CMU customers. This would include any testing for development and approval for implementation.
Maintain set ups required for any exception reporting through IDS to ensure proper tracking.
Administer Sysco Canada Intranet for the Business Development team and Multi-Unit Sales department. Maintain, collect and communicate CMU pricing and contract information by uploading and logging on Sysco Canada’s internet website.
Prepare and analyze RFP requests for new CMU business.
Prepare & analyze reporting for RVPs on any non-compliancy or opportunities with CMU accounts on a quarterly basis.
Qualifications/Skills/Job Requirements:
Bachelor degree or diploma in Business Administration or related field.
A minimum of three (3) years’ experience in an analyst role, with previous experience in the foodservice industry.
Advanced computer skills with proficiency in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Internet, and Intranet.

Works closely with the IT management team, support and customer care teams and other internal partners to satisfy all customer requirements.
Other duties may be assigned

Broad range of applications and technologies including Databases – SQL and Oracle, Business Applications - Microsoft Dynamics – Great Plains, Integration tools, Web Technologies, Infrastructure, Data Warehousing, ETL tools, Application Development and Change Management Tools, SOA Architectures, Web Application Development and Reporting.
Previous experience in the parking or banking industries is an asset but not required

What you will be doing
Reporting to the Manager, Business Intelligence, the Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for working with internal and external clients to develop reporting/analytics solutions in response to requests of a diverse scope. This individual will be accountable for the design, implementation and management of all aspects of the solutions, including interaction with the IT department to support development of the reporting/analytics tools necessary to accomplish the appropriate solution(s). The individual must be able to work independently and as a team member with minimal supervision while providing the necessary solution(s) to the client.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide project management for BI solutions for new customer implementations
Working with the development team and IT group to design reporting analysis tools for internal and external use;
Work with external and internal customers to gather comprehensive requirements and document them formally
Working with the technical team to establish protocols to extract data in a standardized process from a variety of data sources;
Good understanding and working experience of transactional and dimensional data models
Creating solutions for clients (internal and external) in a number of formats, including Excel, Crystal Reports, Business Objects Enterprise;
Analyzing large amounts of data to provide concise, targeted reports for internal and external clients;
Training of end users on the analytical tools developed by the Business Intelligence team;
Writing functional and/or technical documents
The Business Intelligence Analyst will also be assigned other duties and tasks as required from time to time and including possible travel (5%)

What your background should look like (minimum qualifications)
Bachelor degree or above qualification preferably in Information Systems, Computer Science or equivalent
Minimum 7 to 10 years of directly related experience in Business Analytics position(s);

Hi! We're ecobee.

We are pioneers and innovators in the fast-emerging connected home and IoT industries. ecobee products are beautifully designed and incredibly smart. We're growing. In fact, we're growing really fast. And, we're looking for great people to join our hive.

Your Impact:
We are looking for a driven and diligent financially-minded Business Analyst to support data driven decision making at ecobee. As a Business Analyst on our Strategic Analytics team you will have the opportunity to work with our management team and will be responsible for partnering with business leaders to drive insights and actions that can be leveraged to improve business performance.

The ideal candidate will be highly analytical and will play a supporting role by providing financial, analytical, and decision support across the organization. We are looking for a self-starter with exceptional analytical and modeling skills, excellent communication and interpersonal skills and can work with individuals and teams at all levels of the organization.

Ways you can contribute day one:

Support business leaders in preparing for monthly business reviews, including the maintenance of monthly P&L statements for each business function
Implement and maintain a financial analysis system, which models the impact that business decisions have on the company's future financial performance
Coordinate and lead the budget and forecasting process
Create ad-hoc analysis and models for business leaders that provide insights into areas of opportunity and risk that influence business strategies and investment decisions
Develop valuation models that are tailored to start up organization dynamics
Support the integrity of ecobee's data including customer, product, services and pricing information to ensure accuracy

Who You Are:

You have an educational background in Business, Finance or Accounting, ideally you have or are working towards your CPA designation
3 - 5 years of experience in Finance or Accounting
Highly organized with demonstrated problem solving and decision-making ability
Exceptional analytical and critical thinking abilities
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills, you have experience and are able to present to non-experts at both the management and non-management levels
Excellent knowledge of analytical tools (spreadsheets, relational databases, and statistical packages)
High level of proficiency in statistical analysis, research, data mining, and data querying in SQL
Proven ability to effectively handle and prioritize multiple and complex projects, adapt to changing priorities, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Just so you know: The hired candidate will be required to complete a background check.

What we are offering:

An opportunity to grow with a dynamic company, personal and professional growth
Truly meaningful work that affects our planet
Small collaborative teams where you can impact both product and culture
Learning opportunities supported by an education fund for every employee
Community support through our ecobee acts program

Are you the one we need? If so, we would love to hear from you.

Intent of the process
The advertisement is for the creation of an on-going inventory which management will access as needs are identified. During this period if an applicant is redrawn from the inventory the previous assessment will apply, this would include those who did not qualify. Job Purpose:
Enterprise AML Solutions (2nd Line) is responsible for transaction monitoring, name scanning, payment screening, rule management and case management for AML Risk. The Senior Analyst, AML Data Coverage and Analysis in Enterprise AML Solutions plays an important role in supporting data coverage analysis, coverage remediations and initiatives to enhance coverages for AML 2nd Line solutions/operations.
Key Accountabilities:
To perform regular data coverage assessments on AML Scanning and Monitoring for all jurisdictions/business units
To conduct business and data analyses to identify root causes for the data coverage gaps
To partner with AML 1st/2nd lines, Technology, Modeling and vendors on remediation and gap closure activities
To partner with Enterprise AML Data Team and Enterprise Data Office on data coverage gap closure activities
To support the development/enhancement/execution on AML data coverage governance processes
To support Enterprise AML Solutions BAU activities
To support AML regulatory and audit activities
To support other AML initiatives as required
Functional Competencies:
Working experience on delivering data-related project artifacts, including but not limited to, business requirements, data mapping, data profiling, business acceptance test planning, acquiring sign-offs
Strong hands-on knowledge on data analysis, using scripts/tools such as SQL, Python, R, Datameer
Data analysis experience in Hadoop and Cloud platforms considered as asset
Strong communication and influence skills

Equitable Bank is Canada's ninth largest independent Schedule I bank, serving Canadians coast to coast. It offers a diverse suite of residential lending, commercial lending and savings solutions, including high-interest savings products and GICs. Through its proven branchless approach and customer service focus, Equitable Bank has grown to approximately $25 billion in assets under management. Within Equitable Bank's Core Lending business, Single Family Lending Services funds mortgages for owner-occupied and investment properties across Canada, while Commercial Lending Services provides mortgages on a variety of commercial properties on a national basis.Equitable's Securitization Financing business originates and securitizes insured residential mortgages under the Canada Mortgage and Housing ("CMHC") administered National Housing Act.Equitable Bank also offers a range of deposit products including short-term, long-term and Cashable GICs, available in non-registered or Tax Free Savings Account ("TFSA") across Canada. And it offers a High Interest Savings Account, available from authorized investment advisors through the FundServ network.

Equitable Bank is a growing Canadian financial services business and a wholly owned subsidiary of Equitable Group. It was founded in 1970 as The Equitable Trust Company.

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst
Department: Tech Delivery - Enterprise
Reports To: Manager, Technology

Purpose of Job

The Senior Business Analyst (BA) will facilitate the identification and documentation of detailed user stories (functional requirements), process and system flows and contribute to the overall user experience, technical solution, and acceptance criteria for the company’s core banking platforms and interfacing applications. The BA will facilitate communication between the business and IT, soliciting input and expertise from business subject matter experts and technology teams. The BA will support testing phases as well as assist with project implementation. The scope of most initiatives includes multiple business stakeholders, and downstream systems and vendors. The BA will be a core member within a cross-functional Pod that deliver initiatives using EQB’s hybrid-agile methodology and tools. The BA will work with stakeholder groups across Product Management, Operations, Fraud, AML, and multiple Technology teams and suppliers. EQB is using the latest suite of Atlassian tools (JIRA, Confluence, and add-ons) for capturing epics, user stories, flows, technical design documents, testing, and sprint-based execution.

Main Activities:

Establish a plan for stakeholder workshops to capture and elaborate detailed user stories, by bundles of Themes and Epics.
Facilitate workshops to document customer / user needs, process / system flows, and end to end requirements as detailed user stories. User Stories will include key areas such as happy path experiences, alt/error flows, spec-by-example, acceptance criteria, and business value.
With cross-functional Pod and external supplier support, decompose user story and experience requirements by supplier. Establish and maintain traceability form the Bank’s overarching requirements to each supplier.
Drive and ensure sign-off of BA created artefacts across the Pod team and stakeholders.
Support cross-functional Pod and to create technical design documents, create acceptance criteria and testing artefacts, and story point estimation (where applicable).
Support ad hoc business and technical analysis requests to support main activities as required, such as API data maps.
Support daily stand-ups and project velocity reporting as required (ex: pace of writing & approving detailed user stories).
Work with Quality Assurance team by providing input into the test strategy, test scenarios, test data requirements and supporting user validation
Communicate changes to the requirements effectively and on a timely basis to delivery leads, project managers and other necessary stakeholders

Knowledge/Skill Requirements:

5 or more years of experience in delivering technology projects in a Business Analyst capacity or related role participating on full lifecycle project implementations
Deep understanding of Software Development Life Cycle concepts.
Experience with both waterfall and agile methodologies.
Business domain knowledge in Canadian Lending - Residential or Commercial, Term Deposits or Accounting and Finance is mandatory.
Good understanding of Compliance (FCAC) and Regulatory (OSFI, CDIC) regulations and policies
Extensive experience in web interface analysis and mapping documentation.
Good understanding of technology such as: online channels, real-time APIs, data storage / data bases, data domain models, UML, data mapping.
Proficient user of all Microsoft tools; Knowledgeable with Atlassian suite (JIRA & Confluence).
Post-Secondary education, preferably in Technology related fields
Additional desirable skills include:
Experience with OneSumX
Experience with mortgageHUB
Experience with Portfolio Plus

Equitable Bank is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. All candidates considered for hire must successfully pass a criminal background check and credit check to qualify for hire. While we appreciate your interest in applying, an Equitable recruiter will only contact leading candidates whose skills and qualifications closely match the requirements of the position.

Vancouver, BCJob Description Summary
The Data Analyst is responsible for data analysis, reporting and warehousing, in addition to being engaged in all aspects of the different business areas within STEMCELL. You will also be responsible for providing actionable data to operating departments and will be an integral part of helping establish and grow a new business intelligence platform.
Job Description
Duties and Responsibilities
Works with internal business areas to define business data modes and reporting requirements.
Perform complex data analysis that requires critical thinking and report development activities, such as the creation of SQL queries in order to extract data for reports.
Contributes to the development of the IT strategy via critical assessment of emerging data management technologies and gaining a deep understanding of STEMCELL’s business processes and tools.
Design and implement report templates using MS Excel and/or Google Sheets, including the ability to develop scripts for those tools.
Assist in the training, support, maintenance, and ongoing administration of reporting applications.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of delivery and operations within reporting and data warehousing.
Collaborate with cross-functional team members on features, design and implementation.
Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related discipline.
Experience with business intelligence reporting tools - SAP Business Warehouse (BW) or BusinessObjects (BOBJ) preferred.
Experience with data visualization and reporting software. Familiarity with Microsoft Access a plus.
Experience writing SQL statements for Oracle and MS-SQL.
Familiarity with the R scripting language.
Familiar with ERP and manufacturing systems - SAP preferred.
Familiar with issue tracking systems - JIRA preferred.
Excellent communication skills (verbal, written) both in one-on-one and in a group setting including presentation skills in front of development and business areas.
Excellent problem-solving with a keen attention to detail.
STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.
This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities.

Create an account by selecting the create account button. You will then be asked for your email and to create a password. Your Password must be eight characters long, contain at least one special character, one capital letter, and a number.Once you have created your password you will be asked to upload your resume. Thank you for your interest in STEMCELL!

$72,444 - $94,964 a yearScope

Open competition


Closing Date

April 3, 2019


Classification

Program Services 4


Ministry

Labour


About Us

Each day in Alberta, more than two million people go to work and fuel Alberta's economic engine. The Ministry of Labour provides supports to meet the needs of both employees and employers. Our work focuses on building a skilled workforce for the jobs of today as well as tomorrow, and maintaining safe, fair and healthy workplaces. To learn more about the ministry, please click here: http://work.alberta.ca/


Qualifications

University graduation in a related field (such as, but not limited to Social Sciences, Business, Public Administration, Economics or Statistics) combined with a minimum of four years' progressively related experience is required. Master's degree preferred. Equivalencies will be considered based on one year of related education for one year of related experience, or one year of related experience for one year of related education.

Preference will be given to candidates who have demonstrated experience leading and managing the development and implementation of statistical/analytical services and those with an econometric background. Demonstrated experience in quantitative and qualitative research methodologies, statistical analysis methods, indicator development, evaluation and socio-economic research are considered assets.


Competencies

Competencies are behaviors that are essential to reach our goals in serving Albertans, and the foundation for our talent management programs, including hiring decisions. We encourage you to have an in depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process. The link below will assist you with understanding competencies:

http://www.psc.alberta.ca/Practitioners/?file=learning/apscompetencies/titlepage&cf=9

http://www.psc.alberta.ca/learning/apscompetencies/apscomp-self-assessment-questionnaire.pdf

In this role, you will contribute to our team by demonstrating the following behavioral competencies:

Agility
You anticipate, assess, and readily adapt to changing priorities, maintain resilience in times of uncertainty and effectively work in a changing environment.

Drive for Results
You have a strong commitment to initiate and champion quality products and continuous improvement.

Develop Self and Others
You understand the strengths and development needs of yourself and actively participate in personal and professional development and mentoring opportunities.

Build Collaborative Environments
You collaborate and negotiate with other departments, jurisdictions and levels of government to ensure outcomes and data are shared with the intent of improving program results.

Develop Networks
You lead, build and maintain relationships with individuals and teams from a wide range of business units and governments.

Systems Thinking
You are able to influence partners on the value of evaluation and to link the evaluation of operational programs to strategic goals.

Creative Problem Solving
You have significant organizational and coordination skills and the ability to proactively assess unit contributions, identify areas of highest need, and to develop short and long term plans that deliver results.


Salary

$2,775.64 to $3,638.48 bi-weekly ($72,444 to $94,964 annually)


Notes

The Alberta Public Service is a great place to work! We offer:

Pension plan: http://www.pspp.ca/
Leadership and mentorship programs
Professional learning and development
Positive workplace culture and work-life balance

Ottawa, ONSpecial posting considerations
You must provide a cover letter that clearly expresses the basis of your professional and personal interest in the position of Business Analyst. Your letter should also provide concrete and detailed examples that clearly demonstrate how you meet the education and experience criteria listed under the Essential and Asset Qualifications. Failure to provide a detailed cover letter and CV will result in the elimination of your application from this process.
Job Summary

Who we are:
CIHR is the Government of Canada's health research investment agency. CIHR's mission is to support a healthier Canada by leading investment in innovative and collaborative research and helping to solve our health care challenges today and in the future.

Why work for the Canadian Institutes of Health Research?

The Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR) is dedicated to creating a healthy and stimulating work environment; promoting synergies and a collaborative culture across the organization, including with its institutes and external stakeholders.

CIHR is located in the heart of downtown Ottawa at 160 Elgin Street, close to transit and many shops and restaurants.

Intent of Process:
The intent of this process is to staff various term and indeterminate positions by creating a pool of pre-qualified qualified candidates to also staff future similar positions within CIHR with various tenures (assignment, specified period or indeterminate), various security clearance levels and bilingual linguistic profiles.

Job Summary:
Reporting directly to the Project Lead, the incumbent is responsible for supporting the business operations of an assigned set of funding related business systems and business processes; as well as supporting integrated projects to design, test, and assess the impact of business system changes.

The incumbent will be required to be collaborative while consulting extensively with multiple internal and external stakeholders, to achieve consensus. The outcome will be developing project work plans, documenting business needs, identifying issues and risks, and proposing mitigations to keep the project on track. Additionally, the incumbent will support and maintain change control procedures and makes recommendations to continuously improve processes and tools.

Our ideal candidate will be able to build relationships, manage multiple requests, and be innovative while working with our team to support the design, implementation, and continuous improvement of CIHR’s funding-related business systems and business processes that support the delivery of CIHR’s core programs and services.
Essential Qualifications

EDUCATION:
Bachelor’s degree from a recognized university or a combination of education, training and experience.

EXPERIENCE (generally acquired through a minimum of 2 years experience):


liaising with different stakeholders to support the planning, design, development, and testing of business system and process enhancements
preparing project plans, reports, briefing notes, and presentations that were widely distributed and/or presented to a variety of audiences and/or used to support organizational decision-making.
with business process mapping as well as capturing, scripting, and managing business requirements

KNOWLEDGE

Expert knowledge of business analysis, requirements capture and management, and requirements scripting and change control.
Expert knowledge of process design and management principles.

COMPETENCIES

Communication (Written and Oral)
Working with others (Collaborating, Relationship Management)
Adaptability
Planning and Organizing
Initiative
Critical Thinking
Judgement

Asset Qualifications

EDUCATION:

A graduate degree in either: the life/health sciences or in business.
Business Analyst training and/or certification.

EXPERIENCE:

manipulating and analyzing data and information.
health research.
using data visualization techniques and tools.
project management (using tools, methodologies and best practices).

Important Notes
1) The intent of this selection process is to establish a pool of pre-qualified candidates to staff future identical positions or similar positions within CIHR with various tenures (assignment, specified period or indeterminate)

2) Application must be received through the ATS (process number: J0219-0647)

3) Acknowledgement of receipt of applications will not be sent; we would like to thank all candidates who apply. Only those selected for an exam/interview will be contacted.

4) An interview will be held. A written examination may be administered.

5) CIHR is committed to the values and principles of employment equity. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity or testing, please inform us of accommodations (i.e., an alternative method of assessment, a technical aid, accessibility requirements, etc.) required at any stage of the assessment process, so that we can take the appropriate measures to facilitate your full participation.

6) From amongst those candidates that meet the essential criteria of education and experiences; CIHR may select a certain number of candidates that most closely meet the position requirements to participate in the next selection phase.

7) CIHR is a federal agency (separate employer) and does not fall under the Public Service Employment Act.
CIHR
The Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR) is the Government of Canada's health research investment agency. CIHR's mission is to create new scientific knowledge and to enable its translation into improved health, more effective health services and products, and a strengthened health care system for Canadians. Composed of 13 Institutes, CIHR provides leadership and support to more than 13,000 health researchers and trainees across Canada.

Burnaby, BCData Management Quality Assurance Analyst - (180000IW)
Description
Move, Build, Grow your career!
As the premier global asset management and disposition company, Ritchie Bros. helps thousands of people around the world buy and sell heavy equipment, trucks, and other assets every month. With our multiple onsite and online selling platforms and commitment to first-class customer service, Ritchie Bros. is trusted worldwide for making buying and selling easy, efficient, fair, and transparent. If you’re an innovator with an entrepreneurial spirit, we want you to join our growing team – employed in a wide variety of positions from sales to operations to corporate functions – as we transform the global used equipment market.
Join us on our journey and move forward with us, build your success, and grow your career.

Are you passionate about getting high quality data into the hands of business leaders? Does test automation make you excited to get up in the morning?


We’re looking for a Data Management Quality Assurance Analyst based in Burnaby, BC.
Reporting to the Data Management Program Manager, the Data Management Quality Assurance Analyst develops, establishes, and enforces quality assurance standards and measures for the Data Management Group. One of the primary responsibilities of this position is to develop, execute, and report on test cases from specified project requirements. Additionally, the incumbent is responsible for the coordination, execution and verification of testing procedures against Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) & Data Lake solutions. The incumbent ensures that all benchmarks are being met and reported accurately to the Program Manager.

The Opportunity:
Develop & Execute Test Cases and document results for data-oriented solutions (EDW, Data Lake, etc) including presentation layers (SSRS, SSAS, Tableau, etc)
Develop automated test scripts
Participate in work planning including calculation of testing estimates
Lead the development, establishment, and enforcement of quality assurance processes, measures and testing standards, providing QA expertise and support to developers and other QAs on team

Here’s What You Bring
Undergraduate degree in business, computer science or equivalent
5 years quality assurance experience in a data-oriented environment, including direct hands-on experience with ad hoc query programs, automated testing tools, and reporting software.
2 years working directly with relational databases and SQL, including the ability to write queries to validate data accuracy and quality. SQL Server experience would be an asset.
Tableau experience an asset


What We Offer:

Our success is built on the drive and dedication of our people. As we grow around the globe, there will be many opportunities to advance your career – we’ve proven this throughout our 60+ years in business. And, we'll take care of you along the way. Here’s how:
Base salary + paid overtime
Comprehensive medical and dental benefits.
RRSP and an Employee Share Plan, both with company match.
Ongoing training, professional development and tuition reimbursement.
A multi-award winning LEED gold certified facility, in an exceptional park-like setting, featuring:
A subsidized, multi-award winning childcare centre.
A subsidized cafeteria, car washing and dry cleaning services, and free parking.
A workout facility, featuring advanced gym equipment, bike room, shower and changing facilities, and nutrition and fitness programs.
Proximity to miles of Fraser River walking paths, plus shops, restaurants and services.

job_title: Marketing Intelligence Data Analyst (MIDA) - Apply by: Friday, March 29th
job_description:
CenterLine (Windsor) Limited is a recognized industry leader in manufacturing standard and custom
designed resistance welding, spot welding, arc welding and metal working equipment. We apply state of
the art technology to the design and manufacture of robotic weld lines, configurable fastener welders,
weld guns, cylinders, electrodes and other welding accessories. Our people are our key competitive
advantage in today’s global market. CenterLine (Windsor) Limited continues to evolve and diversify to
remain a valued partner to its customers and a respected member of industry. Our success is built on the
foundation of innovation, efficient design management, excellence and the guarantee of quality service.
CenterLine (Windsor) Limited requires a self-motivated individual to fill the position of Marketing
Intelligence Data Analyst (MIDA). The successful candidate will be responsible for all market research
tasks and processes that support CenterLine’s Sales & Marketing Strategy requirements. The MIDA will
use established industry best practices, tools, market knowledge, marketing experience and education to
perform all task and responsibilities of this role. This position reports to the Marketing Manager.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Identify, data mine and correlate existing company wide data to create effective measurement
processes that track sales and marketing effectiveness and provide actionable business
development insights.
 Develop, monitor and maintain market behaviour models for use in developing forecasts and data
sets for business development needs.
 Analyze customer sales and capability data from internal and external resources to classify and
measure customer needs and satisfaction for use in identifying sales opportunities, prospect
targets, new markets and market conditions affecting product demand.
 Collect, analyze and manage market data (competition, industry, emerging technologies, etc.) to
measure the market share, the effectiveness of sales and marketing strategies and to recognize
market developments impacting current corporate objectives.
 Effectively communicate research findings to the Management Team including; sales forecasts,
market trends, market profiles, customer profiles, competitor profiles and customer satisfaction
survey results.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
 Bachelor of Commerce degree (Marketing major)
 Market research and business management experience required
 Excellent quantitative skills that allow for successful measurement of markets, sizing and metrics
 Strong organizational and critical thinking skills
 Excellent oral, written, listening and optic skills
 Ability to multi-task and work with minimal supervision
Interested candidates should apply to careers@cntrline.com
In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Centerline Windsor Limited will provide
accommodations throughout the recruitment, Selection, and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities. If selected to participate in he
recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform the Human Resources staff of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may
require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.
