job_title: Business Analyst (Business Intelligence) – Information Technology Department
job_description:
YVR is made up of a team of diverse people who are working collaboratively to reach our goal of 29 million passengers by 2020! Safety is at the core of everything we do; we’re innovative, fun, and we invest in our people. We’re a BC Top Employer for 13 years standing, with high engagement scores, an abundance of learning and development opportunities, and a holistic approach to wellness! And we’re looking for someone to join our team.
We have an opportunity for a permanent, full-time Business Analyst in the Information Technology Department. Reporting to the Manager, Technology Services, the successful candidate will have a strong background in business intelligence (BI), reporting, data quality and data governance practices.
Key responsibilities include:
Provide subject matter expertise in core business intelligence functions (including but not limited to: process improvement, data mining, data gathering, data quality assessments, reporting, data governance, data stewardship, reporting and data visualization)
Manage and maintain all data governance related documentation such as data definitions, data models, business rules, security rules, and process maps
Coordinate with application business analysts and business owners to resolve of data integrity gaps and implement appropriate controls to mitigate future data issues
Build upon our newly established enterprise data governance implementation roadmap including delivery of strategic priorities for development of information-based capabilities
Roll out an enterprise wide data governance framework, with a focus on improvement of data quality and the protection of sensitive data through modifications to organization behavior policies and standards, principles, governance metrics, processes, related tools and data architecture
Define roles and responsibilities related to data governance and ensure clear accountability for stewardship of the company’s principal information assets
Serve as a liaison between Business and Functional areas and technology to ensure that data related business requirements for protecting sensitive data are clearly defined, communicated and well understood and considered as part of operational prioritization and planning

TITLE:
The BC Oil and Gas Commission (Commission) is the provincial, single-window regulatory agency with responsibilities for
regulating oil and gas operations in British Columbia, including exploration, development, pipeline transportation and
reclamation.
The Commission’s core roles include permitting industry activity, consulting with First Nations, ensuring permit holders
comply with provincial legislation and regulatory requirements and collaborating with partner agencies. The Commission
works in the public interest by protecting public safety and the environment, conserving natural resources and ensuring
equitable participation of regulated parties in resource development and production.
Job Overview
The Security & Emergency Management Summer Student position is entry level and developmental, designed to provide
the participant with experience in the planning, preparation and response to incidents and emergencies, practical
experience through the evaluation of emergency management exercises, and an opportunity to work with and learn
about other provincial agencies with incident response mandates.
This position will work with different business units to develop a broad understanding of all phases of oil and gas
operations throughout the lifecycle of a permitted operation. This will include opportunities to:
 Participate in the evaluation of emergency response plans and exercises,
 Participate in field and technical inspections,
 View the process of permit applications and conditions,
 Learn about compliance related activities, and
 Take on assigned special projects related to incident management and public reporting.
The position requires a high level of self-motivation and organizational skills, good interpersonal skills and a positive
attitude. Dependability and accountability are essential to work with Commission, B.C. Government Ministries, and
multiple stakeholders. Analytical ability and presentation skills are important in the creation of relevant reports and
presentations.
Accountabilities
Participate in the collection and analysis of industry and Commission data.
 Review industry reports, internal Commission reports, and all relevant file and permit information.
 Access the Commission database of incidents, GIS tools (for fires, wells, pipelines, and facilities) to assist in the
analysis and to compile relevant information.
 Understand, collect and organize relevant data.

processes and regulatory changes.

Toronto, ONThis is an exciting time to join the Great-West Life Assurance Company’s Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) group. The group is continuing to build its independent risk oversight function (2nd Line of Defence). The Enterprise Risk Management team is responsible for ensuring that appropriate risk management processes are in place and working effectively and that policies, procedures and standards concerning the identification, assessment, measurement, monitoring, and control of key risks are implemented across Lifeco. This is a new position. Senior Analyst, Enterprise Risk Management will play an important role in developing, executing and providing oversight to ERM Framework activities across the enterprise.

The Senior Analyst, ERM is accountable for supporting development, implementation, enhancement and oversight of operations within the enterprise Governance Risk and Compliance system and coordinate the Enterprise Risk Assessment process within the system. GRC is a cloud based system that allows streamlining and automation of risk identification, measurement, management, monitoring and reporting while ensuring appropriate governance and compliance with regulations. Enterprise Risk Assessment is an initiative designed to reengineer current Oversight Function BAU risk assessments into a streamlined Enterprise Risk Assessment process, develop a coordinated annual ERA calendar, and standardize current underlying methodologies into enterprise risk and control assessment factors, definitions, and thresholds. As a result, duplication of effort will be removed and deeper insights into the risk and control environment can be achieved.

This role will work with stakeholders from all 3 lines of defence to continue the enhancement of the enterprise risk management framework and reports into Director, ERM.

Accountabilities:
1. Provide administration of the enterprise Governance Risk and Compliance system
Periodic review/update of relevant GRC libraries
Assign GRC roles to Lifeco staff
Perform regular system access reviews
Support and educate Lifeco staff on the technical knowledge of the GRC system
Escalate technical concerns to vendor, as appropriate
Prepare and participate in the pre-go-live and go-live GRC activities

2. Support development and implementation of the Enterprise Risk Assessment (ERA) process in the Governance Risk and Compliance system:
Develop and execute ERA system training for regions, oversight functions and risk owners
Develop status reports based on risk assessment outcomes, pertaining to ERA process administration
Notify ERA risk owners and oversight functions of risk assessment scope changes
Report on any overdue/outstanding findings sign offs
Coordination/administration of GRC system access rights
Coordination of system library changes
Response to ad hoc enquiries re ERA and GRC
Coordination of ERA schedule with businesses, functions and regions
Incorporation of ad hoc assessments into annual planning
Sharing of the assessment calendar with stakeholders
Quality control of ERA data in the GRC system
Ensuring all oversight functions and regional representatives manage risk assessment administration appropriately
Periodic review/update of relevant GRC libraries

3. Contribute as a key member of the ERM team in ensuring the group adds value to the enterprise while operating efficiently and effectively:
Build effective relationships within the team and with stakeholders across oversight and assurance functions and the business
Bring new ideas and innovative approaches and actively share knowledge and experience to enhance the development of the team and its expertise
Develop and implement 2nd Line of Defence processes, procedures and other supports to achieve efficiency gains through alignment and economies of scales

4. Promote a strong risk management culture:
Support awareness of Great-West Lifeco’s risk taking philosophy, risk appetite, policy, authority structure, procedures and processes to ensure a common understanding of risk practices and risk exposures
Promote a strong risk culture through enhancing risk and compliance related communication and training both internally and externally
Continue enhancement of the enterprise risk management framework

Qualifications and Competencies:
At least 5 years of experience in increasingly responsible positions in consulting and / or risk management within Banking or Insurance
Experience in supporting complex, large scale projects
Technical experience with one or more GRC software (i.e. RSA Archer, MetricStream) is desirable; experience with SQL
Preference for candidates with a mixture of strong technical and risk methodology skills
Demonstrated ability to support large-scale enterprise projects
Strong relationship management, partnering and collaboration skills to be effective in influencing enterprise stakeholders
Ability to deal with ambiguity with limited direction and oversight
Strong project management skills with high attention to detail
Innovative problem solving skills and agile approach to project management
Demonstrated ability to aggregate and analyze quantitative and qualitative data
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to prepare communications and interact effectively with deal with subject matter experts and non- technical stakeholders.
Creative thinking, open mindset, ability to challenge status quo, focus on agile project delivery
Proficient in MS office, in particular PowerPoint
Undergraduate degree

Toronto, ONAbout EPL
At EPL, we quantify changes to the use of our earth’s resources, so we can help our clients make better decisions for our world.

We help our clients improve both their environmental performance and their bottom line while at the same time providing independent, impartial strategic guidance. Our clients include some of the largest public and private companies in Canada, collectively representing approximately 2.5% of national electricity use. We have built our reputation on doing things really well.

We have a bright, talented, and engaging team with a lot of passion for what we do: helping large energy users across North America reduce their energy/carbon footprints, and quantifying energy consumption and costs.

The Role
We seek a smart and passionate professional to join our Data Integrity and Support Team. You will be given the opportunity to contribute in several areas, with a view to growing into a larger role within EPL over time. A steep learning curve is anticipated. Initial contribution areas include:

o Support with ongoing maintenance of client and account info.
o Continuously work with utility providers to maintain accurate billing and consumption data.
o File management responsibilities including downloading data and scanning documents.
o Use data processing tools to maintain integrity of incoming data.
o Load data from multiple sources into our system; manage data flow and address issues.
o Stay on top of regular procedures to ensure nothing ‘slips through the cracks’.

About You
Intelligence and a commitment to team work are of great value; just as important is a determination to overcome obstacles and solve challenging problems. Excellent client service and relationship-building are critical to everyone’s role at EPL.

A post-secondary education (degree or diploma) is required. We are open to candidates from various programs of study, provided you are good with numbers, have an eye for detail, are organized, and can adapt well to shifting priorities and schedules.

Strong computer skills are required, particularly with Microsoft Excel. Base level experience with SQL is an asset.

Its expected that you can communicate professionally, clearly and efficiently; both verbally and using email.

What to expect
The success of our people drives the success of our company. We have found that exposure to different parts our business, systems, and processes is essential in developing our team members’ capabilities and careers. Each team member’s specific role evolves based on their interests, aptitude, and business needs throughout their careers with our firm.

Insured Benefits and Health Spending Account
Paid monthly transit pass

The Senior Business Analyst will work both independently and in project teams. Based on the assigned project(s), the designated Project Manager supervises the Senior Business Analyst on a day-to-day basis; however, the Senior Business Analyst formally reports to the Director of CCSO.
This position will support multiple projects within critical care, system programs and the incumbent may be assigned to other files based on organizational needs.
The ideal candidate possesses superior skills in research, analysis, stakeholder engagement, writing and project management to successfully deliver on designing, planning and executing initiatives related to the provincial Critical Care Strategic Plan.
Responsibilities include (but are not limited to):
Conduct health care and health system focused research including environmental scans, literature reviews, analysis and knowledge translation of quantitative and qualitative data and leading practice research.Coordinate stakeholder engagement activities, including agenda setting, preparation of materials for presentation/input, recording stakeholder feedback, synthesis of input to support completion of project deliverables.Developing process maps, models, plans and other documentation to help internal team and external stakeholders better understand core concepts related to deliverables.Plan and conduct in-person meetings, conference calls and webinars with relevant stakeholders.Draft and refine various policy documents and other publications, including briefing notes, strategy documents, toolkits and guidelines.Ensure timely, accurate and thorough completion of deliverables of assigned projects.Participate in all team meetings, working closely with the Project Manager and the team, to ensure teams are abreast of project performance and risks.Accountable for development and oversight of workplan activities.Other duties as assigned.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Education:
Undergraduate Degree required in Business or Health Administration, a healthcare profession, or related field or recognized equivalent.Regulated health profession designation such as registered nurse, physiotherapist, respiratory therapist is preferred.Masters of Health Policy, Health Science, Health Administration, Public Health, Business Administration or related field is desirable.Project Management certification or training is considered an asset.
Experience:
Three (3) to five (5) years of health care project experience is required.Experience developing business and technical documentation for public audiences, such as toolkits, policy guides, etc. is required.Previous stakeholder engagement experience is required.Quality Improvement or related experience is preferred.Experience working in a provincial organization is preferred.Nursing or other regulated health professional project experience with critical care and/or trauma and burn patient population is highly desirable.Solid foundation of project management knowledge and expertise preferred.Expert in Microsoft office applications, including MS Outlook, Excel, Access, Word required,Experience with Visio desireable.
Additional Skills/Abilities:
Excellent analytical, problem solving, and negotiation skills are required.Excellent organizational skills and an ability to monitor and ensure project deliverables are completed accurately and on time are required.Excellent verbal and written communications skills are required.Ability to take initiative and embrace challenges is required.Ability to work accurately under stressful conditions and to meet tight deadlines is required.Ability to work independently and as a team member is required.Computer literacy is required, preferably in a Microsoft Office environment, with an aptitude for learning new computer applications quickly.Adherence to confidentiality policy for sensitive data and information is required.Familiarity and experience working with various information systems and applications is required.Basic data analysis and reporting skills is required.Report development/validation skills highly preferred.Data Quality Improvement experience is highly preferred.Excellent ability to facilitate conversations, openness to various opinions, perspectives and input, ability to analyze and synthesize discussions into written documents and actions required.

Toronto, ONTemporaryJob Details
Description
Dream Office Management Corporation is looking for a Data Analyst.

Are data privacy and data protection topics that you are passionate about? Are you focused on securing user and business data using a variety of tools and technologies? Do you enjoy architecting solutions and implementing changes that will have a positive effect on our business, users, and stakeholders? If so, read on. We want to hear from you.

Who are you?

You’ll be part of our Infrastructure & Technology Operations group, which is focused on providing top notch computing services to Dream’s 1,000 employees. Working with the security, network, communications and support teams, you will be responsible for supporting our data privacy initiatives at our Canadian and International offices. You are not afraid of change and serve as a change agent. You will explore ideas and are always driving forward rather than settling for the status quo. You’ve worked in fast-paced environments and understand how to juggle big-picture thinking with day-to-day deliverables. You have experience understanding and articulating technology risk in a business environment, and working with a team to remediate those risks. You are respectful of current operating processes, but look to develop new ideas to bring better results. Still interested? Read on!


Who are we?

Dream Unlimited Corp. is a real estate investment, development and management company that creates value at every stage of the real estate cycle. Since the business was created in 1994, Dream has grown substantially, becoming one of Canada’s leading and most consistently innovative real estate companies with over $14 billion of assets. Dream Office Management Corporation provides technology, human resources, and facilities support to the Dream group of companies, currently 5 publicly traded entities.

While on the surface we may not seem that different from our competitors, it’s our attitude and approach that truly set us apart. We are guided by our entrepreneurial spirit; we seize unconventional opportunities and try new things, approaching every project with passion and purpose.

We care about our employees. We want everyone to have a rewarding career and to work and have fun with people they like, so we provide exciting work opportunities, open work environments, and fun events. Once you join us, it won’t take long to figure out why your colleagues like it so much here.


And the Infrastructure & Technology Operations team?

Our goal is to provide the best possible user experience by ensuring our users have the technical tools and infrastructure in place to perform their job functions efficiently. We are continually upgrading and driving our initiatives, processes and goals in order to respond to changes in our business needs and ensure that the appropriate infrastructure is in place to support the business.

We strive to stay at the cutting edge of technology to be prepared for Dream’s continued growth in the coming years. All we’re missing is an enthusiastic Data Protection Analyst – are you ready?

What will you do?

You will be responsible for the organization and privacy of data that our five business lines rely on every day. Here are some specifics of your role to give you some scope:

Work with the Manager, IT Security to oversee the ongoing development of the data protection strategy and implementation across all lines of business
Author and audit, privacy, security, and data protection policies
Implement technical standards / data protection frameworks such as GDPR, PIPEDA ,NIST, etc.
Translation of privacy legislation knowledge into technical solutions to protect the privacy of employee and customer data
Managing and auditing technology solutions that support data privacy
Conduct data and privacy risk assessments, and articulate the outcome as business risk
Perform data classification across a variety of system types and storage methods, including identification and tagging of both structured and unstructured data
Collaborate with both technical and non-technical teams in order to implement solutions and privacy controls
Monitor compliance of data privacy against best practices
Be available for inquiries from data subjects and business stakeholders relating to data protection practices, and data subject rights
Communicate effectively with all levels of the business
Create and maintain documentation that supports data and privacy activities
Be available after hours when needed to assist with incident response, should the need arise
Perform related duties and tasks as assigned by the Manager, IT Security


What type of experience do you have?

We’ve listed just a few select qualifications that we consider to be very important for this role. We can cover the rest when we chat.

Degree, diploma, or certificate in Information Security, Computer Science, or related discipline.
Minimum 5 years’ experience in an information security or audit role
Minimum 5 years’ experience with technologies that support data management (classification tools, Data Loss Prevention tools, data tagging tools)
Experience with implementation and use of data classification standards
Knowledge of organizational privacy controls
Experience with technical standards / data protection frameworks such as PIPEDA, GDPR, NIST, and ISO
Experience with both security and privacy risk assessments, with DPIA experience a plus
The ability to translate technology risk into business risk
A deep understanding of data classification, including identification and tagging of both structured and unstructured data
A strong track record of being able to interface and collaborate with both technical and non-technical teams to implement solutions and privacy controls
Experience authoring or auditing privacy, security, and data protection policies
Operational experience with incident response and breach notification processes
Experience in managing projects and large scale enterprise wide roll-outs.
A self-starter with the ability to work independently under minimal supervision.
Exceptional organization and time management skills.
Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment.
Strong change management skills; change agent
With your manager and the security team, you set clear goals and objectives, and then you and the team deliver!
Knowledge in the following is considered a significant asset, so let us know what you know!

Data collection, storage, and processing privacy best practices
Information security or audit certifications, such as CISSP, CISA, SSCP, CIPM
Experience with frameworks, such as ISO 27001/27002, NIST SP 800-37,
Experience with cloud email technologies (Office 365, Mimecast) and filtering mechanisms
Experience with document management solutions leveraging OneDrive, Sharepoint, and Teams
McAfee endpoint DLP experience a plus
Palo Alto Networks firewalls / SSL decryption and data filtering
Management and implementation of access controls
When you come in to meet, we’ll want to hear about your previous security and privacy, but also about your business interaction experiences. What are your strengths? What areas are you looking to grow? We’ll also be asking you to demonstrate your knowledge given various real world scenarios.

This is your invitation to make a difference. We’re looking forward to helping you grow.

Dream Unlimited is committed to workplace diversity and provides accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout our hiring process

Are you looking for an opportunity to make a difference managing a customer relationship management platform? Yes? Good. This could be a great opportunity for you. And us!

A Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent

Demonstrated experience presenting quality work
The ability to work collaboratively in a team environment

The ability to work under tight deadline pressures
Why Join Us?
Bond Brand Loyalty is proud to be recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies.
We’re 400(ish) people working tirelessly together to make the world a more loyal place. You’ll be joining a hyper-talented team with a galaxy of skill sets ranging from research to creative to digital and beyond. You’ll have an excellent opportunity to grow, learn and make an impact as we tackle some of our client’s biggest business challenges.
If you’re looking to build your career, build your skills and build bonds apply today! We're growing and have multiple roles available.
Bond Brand Loyalty welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Kabam is a world leader of massively multiplayer games for mobile devices. Console quality graphics and next generation technology are the hallmark of Kabam games. job_title: Senior Analyst, Finance and Risk Management
company_name: Central East Local Health Integration Network
job_description:
Ajax, ON$34.18 - $41.18 an hourResponsible for management of financial allocations to Health Service Providers (HSP), preparation of funding plans and recommendations. Provides advice to LHIN staff and management on financial and funding matters. Responsible for managing, monitoring and evaluating HSP financial performance in accordance with accountability agreements.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:

1. Supports the Mission, Vision, Values and Code of Conduct of the Central East LHIN.
2. Provides advice and input to the Director on the application of the provincial funding formula at the local level, funding of specific health sectors, and the financial implication of allocation decisions.
3. Contributes advice and input from a financial perspective to the development of health system and integration plans, and interpretation of system financial issues to the LHIN team.
4. Reconciles schedules, system level spreadsheets, and funding. Identifies issues and alerts Director of issues for resolution.
5. Implements the transfer payment transaction process and ensures that funding letters are prepared; monitors cash flows to HSPs in cooperation with the Senior Consultant and/or Director.
6. Performs report writing as appropriate including preparation of presentation materials on HSP financial performance and briefing notes for various audiences (Board of Directors, Senior Team, Ministry and HSPs) Team.
7. Reconciles Funding to Accountability Agreements and Ministry Funding Guidelines.
8. Reviews and analyzes local health system funding in accordance with HSP accountability requirements and preparation of annual and multi-year funding plans ensuring appropriate analysis of financial implications for planning, integration and allocation options or decisions. Flags issues and risks as necessary to Director.
9. Reviews quarterly and/or requested reports and evaluates financial performance monitoring tools are populated and distributed to appropriate parties. Compiles and analyzes financial data relating to HSP performance or accountability agreements.
10. Performs tracking of local health system funding in accordance with accountability requirements and initiative funding (e.g., tracking of reallocation strategy and urgent priorities funding, Health System Improvement Pre-Proposals).

11. Contributes to effective management of risk at the Central East LHIN by applying expertise/leadership in the identification, assessment and prioritization of perceived and/or actual sector risk situations.

12. Supports the annual audit and performs reviews.
13. Performs issues management role and prepares briefing notes in collaboration with the Director.
14. All other duties as assigned including where supporting Task and Working Groups provide secretariat support to the meeting and the Director.
Minimum Qualifications & Position Requirements:
Post-secondary education/degree in business administration, health planning, finance, research or equivalent experience. CPA is an asset.Minimum of 3-5 years’ experience.Some financial management experience including performing financial analyses with understanding of one or more health care sectors.Knowledge of performance accountability management and evaluation techniques – such as analysis of interpretation of data in one or more health sectors related to financial, administrative, or clinical performance.Ability to manipulate data using multiple tools and methodologies including ability to analyze agreement variance report or mitigation strategies.Understanding of the Ontario health-care system, its stakeholder, program and issues an asset.Interpersonal skills to communicate effectively with team members and health service providers as required.Some experience in risk management and demonstrated capacity to identify and respond quickly.Some understanding of provincial funding models in use across one or more health-care sectors and familiarity with government financial processes, policies and standards, as well as public sector and health care contracting procedures as asset.Familiarity with project administration/management and project management methodology.Experience in conflict resolution.Proficiency with PC-based hardware/software and inter / intranets.Strong teamwork and customer service skills.
Work Environment and Hours of Work:
8:30 a.m. - 4:30 p.m. Monday to Friday. Other hours as required to meet the needs of the organization.
Position Location and Travel:
This position location is within the geographic boundaries of the Central East LHIN with the requirement for travel to all eight (8) branches of the Central East LHIN region from time to time. A valid driver’s license and access to a vehicle is required.
Additional Information:
Candidates should submit a detailed resume outlining their skills, abilities, experience and qualifications.

There may be testing and/or an interview as part of the recruitment process.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA) and the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC). The Central East LHIN will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment, selection and/or the assessment process to applicants with disabilities.

If you require an accommodation in applying for a posting, please contact Human Resources.

What You’ll Be Doing

The Senior Analyst, Measurement & Insights will help to create Client Experience related reporting. identify analytics needs & lead the design, development and delivery of data driven insights and solutions to fill the needs. You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

Location:
489 King St. West, Toronto, Ontario, M5V 1K4
The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.
Why is this role important?
At Loblaw Companies Limited, our purpose – Live Life Well – supports the needs and well-being of Canadians who make one billion visits each year to our stores.
Ambitious, right?
We excel at challenging convention and pushing beyond the limits of what’s comfortable. Our goal is a relentless customer-first commitment. We analyze. We challenge. We connect. We are innovators. And what we are achieving is revolutionizing the retail and digital advertising industry. By transforming data into knowledge, we provide our partners a deeper understanding about their customers — who they are and what they are about.
Loblaw Media offers a new way to plan and deliver meaningful digital advertising to help consumer brands more effectively reach customers who will love their products. We use transaction-based insights from our online and bricks and mortar stores to target and measure campaign effectiveness.
Bringing our mission to life requires amazing people and the right workplace. We have a diverse team of experts who want to take ownership and make an impact. People who are energized by collaboration and passionate about solving complex problems. People hungry to venture well beyond their corner of the business to discover new products and new ways of doing things. We have gathered this cross-functional team in a unique and open loft-style space in downtown Toronto.
Your job description starts here, but it ends where you’re willing to take it…
Loblaw Media is hiring a Data Analyst with a background in web development. In this role, you will be using advanced techniques in obtaining and analyzing data so as to obtain information in a time-efficient manner; as well as be comfortable developing and supporting basic web interfaces that automate processes and display data. You will work closely with account management and execution teams and will prime data management along with data mining, modelling, manipulation, visualization, and reporting.
What You'll Do:
Responsible for the extraction and analysis of complex information from a variety of databases.
Develop capabilities to identify areas of opportunity and improve processes and efficiency on reporting.
Work with IT in terms of identifying opportunities to make key information more easily and reliably accessible.
Act as gatekeeper with regards to security and confidentiality of data obtained through all sources.
Translating business requests and questions into SQL logic. Business requests can be strategic nature or tactical focus, including but not limited to initiatives about in-store activities, CRM initiatives, marketing promotion, etc.
Extract, review and prepare sales and customer behavior data for analysis, reporting using SQL
Analyze data to help determine insights to solve business problems
Work collaboratively with Product, Sales and Marketing and Operations groups, on cross functional projects and initiatives
Support with designing and deploying advanced campaign performance reporting dashboards
Support with designing and delivering, and maintaining enterprise-wide / in-production analytic solutions
Troubleshooting issues related to data and analytics, including the management of ad-hoc reporting requests
Support with developing data driven insights and analytics presentations to internal and external stakeholders and partners
What You'll Bring:
Mandatory: Programming skills with Python. Optional: Scala or R.
Mandatory: Experience with Django Framework, HTML, JavaScript. Optional: React, Angular
University Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, and Mathematics is preferred
Experience with Hadoop and understanding of its components (HDFS, HBase, Spark) is an asset.
Data mining experience working with a large relational customer database
3 years experience in utilizing advanced SQL data extraction and manipulation tools (MS SQL, Unix, Linux, IBM Netezza, IBM DB2, Teradata).
Experience in BI platform (Power BI, Microstrategy, Cognos, SAS, etc)
Superb analytical and conceptual thinking skills; to not only manipulate but also derive meaningful interpretations from data
Ability to take initiative, multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment
Capability to liaise with all levels across the enterprise on projects and ad-hoc requests
Strong detail orientation is essential in this role
A Team player and self starter
Advanced MS Office skills (Excel, Word, Access)
How You’ll Succeed:
At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.
If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.
In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

Full time
Type of Role:
Regular

Supply Chain Analyst

Role: Supply Chain Analyst

Location: Toronto, ON

Company: Freshii HQ

Reports To: Manager, Supply Chain

The Supply Chain Analyst will act as a lead interface with partners, vendors, and distributors to provide support to the Freshii stores and to resolve supply issues relating to the supply of goods. This individual will manage internal data and analytics to make key decisions and works with our Franchise and DC community to provide daily supply chain support. The incumbent analyzes and monitors inventory levels and provides forecasts to ensure overall goals in service level, inventory investment, and purchasing compliance are achieved. Projects are technical, with a high degree of complexity across multiple teams, both internal and external, and across multiple platforms. The position utilizes continuous improvement principles to achieve key performance objectives in line with business growth expectation and drive the cost to service efficiencies. Supply Chain is a real-life environment where timely determination and execution of the appropriate response to change is daily work.

Responsibilities:

Own DC-level supply chain metrics and drive best practice to achieve KPIs such as case fill rate, delivery on time, forecast, and inventory obsolescence.

Proactively monitor and identify any gaps between supply and demand and create and execute timely solutions to avoid out of stocks (Medium to long term supply plans).

Reduce waste by managing inventory obsolescence.

Supplier Management, ensuring all forecast and supply flow requirements are executed to defined targets/standards

Work with suppliers on the availability of product, production planning and raw material lead times
Develop, execute and monitor the forecast and supply plan for new product launches, transitions, and promotions.

Liaise and communicate with DCs and partners regarding upcoming product launches, transitions, or product shortages.

Regularly monitor the orders of franchise partners to ensure 100% Supply Chain Compliance is maintained across the system.

Manage the listing of new vendors and items with DC’s

Build and maintain strong relations both with internal and external customers

Provide recommendations for the development and implementation of supply chain network changes and processes, which can enhance efficiencies, KPI’s and service for our partners.



Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in business or Supply Chain certificate (APICS or equivalent)

Knowledge of CPG (Consumer Packaged Goods), Retail or QSR Industry

2+ years of Supply Chain experience ( Supply Planning and/or Demand Forecasting, etc)

Lean Training preferred but not required


Competencies:

Strong customer orientation

Proven continuous improvement and project management skills

Demonstrated strong analytical skills

Have a good understanding of logistics and warehousing

Self-starter and driven for results

Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic environment with cross-functional teams.

Attention to detail with a strong ability to multitask

Excellent Communication Skills (verbal and written)

Ability to deal with complexity and ambiguity

Proactive, persuasive, influential and flexible attitude


Technical Skills:

Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel, Access and PowerPoint

We're looking for someone who can:

Lead meetings and facilitate conflict resolution, using tact and diplomacy
Ask pertinent questions, summarize and verify data, analyze technical, statistical and financial information, and make recommendations based on the information and data
Create and deliver presentations and communicate complex technical information (verbally and in writing) to a wide variety of audiences
Establish and maintain collaborative working relationships with individuals and teams, displaying professionalism, discretion, and patience

Your experience and educational background:
A bachelor's degree
A minimum of six years of experience in supply chain, procurement, or other business experience that includes the fundamentals of supplier relationship management, preferably in an IT environment
Specialist knowledge of service level management including contract elements, support, maintenance, pricing, and costing
Knowledge of IT functions including software, hardware, licensing, and support maintenance processes
Knowledge of project management principles and practices
Supply Chain Management Professional (SCMP) designation from the Supply Chain Management Association (or equivalent body from outside of Canada) is an asset
Proficiently use spreadsheet and presentation software

Who are we?
At WorkSafeBC, we're dedicated to promoting safe and healthy workplaces across B.C. We partner with workers and employers to save lives and prevent injury, disease, and disability. When work-related injuries or diseases occur, we provide compensation, and support injured workers in their recovery, rehabilitation, and safe return to work. We also work diligently to sustain our workers' compensation system today and for future generations. We're honoured to serve the 2.3 million workers and 231,000 registered employers in our province.
What's it like to work at WorkSafeBC?
It's challenging, stimulating, and hugely rewarding. Our positions offer tremendous diversity and excellent opportunities for professional growth. Every day, the work we do impacts people and changes lives. What we do is important and so are the people we do it for.
Our benefits
Being part of WorkSafeBC means being part of a strong, committed team. Along with a competitive salary, your total compensation package includes vacation, optional leave arrangements, health care and dental benefits, and contributions toward your retirement pension. As a member of our team, you'll have access to services and benefits that can help you get the most out of work — and life. Learn more about our what we offer.
WorkSafeBC is an inclusive and accessible employer committed to employment equity objectives and invites applications from all qualified individuals. Only those under consideration will be contacted. If you're unsuccessful, please accept our appreciation for your interest.
This position is restricted to those legally entitled to work in Canada.

Toronto, ONABOUT US

CI Investments Inc. is one of the country’s largest investment fund companies, managing over $80.5 billion on behalf of two million Canadian investors. CI is known for its innovation and ability to adapt quickly to the changing needs of Canadian investors. It provides employees with a fast-paced and challenging work environment with opportunities for advancement. CI is part of CI Financial, a diverse group of financial services firms.

POSITION: Business Systems Analyst II
LOCATION: Toronto (M5J 0A3)
STATUS: Full-time

JOB OVERVIEW

We are currently recruiting for a Business Systems Analyst II to join our Information Technology team. In this role, the successful candidate will be will be a highly organized and result-oriented team-player able to determine optimal solutions that are aligned with the business needs and systems architecture. This position requires a professional who is committed to providing outstanding business and systems analysis for wealth management systems used by the Private Client division

WHAT YOU WILL DO

Collaborates with project manager(s), other BSAs and developers to identify, to document and manage the business and system requirements/specifications for various projects that may be cross functional and technically complex.
Responsible and accountable for the business requirements/specifications to be complete, correct, consistent, concise, achievable and to obtain signoff from the business owners
Performs system analysis, including data analysis and data mapping, works in collaboration with the Development Lead on system design / architecture and articulates solution design in Technical Specifications
Provides support to the project manager/manager in developing and maintaining project timelines and project status
Develops test plans/strategies, prepares required test cases and expected results, and performs testing in collaboration with clients to ensure that initiatives being implemented are fully tested and meet the expected objectives.
Provides second level support expertise to first level support analysts in case of complex issues with existing processes and applications.

WHAT YOU WILL BRING

3 - 5 years’ experience performing business and systems analysis (min 3 years within the Investment Management industry).
Background in application development is an asset
College/University graduate in Business Administration, Computer Science or equivalent.
Excellent analytical ability, judgment and problem-solving skill
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Strong knowledge of investment and wealth management functions: portfolio management/administration, back-office, compliance, statements, billing
Strong SQL skills
Ability to rapidly acquire an in-depth understanding of existing system design and /or reverse-engineer existing process
Ability to be flexible and adaptable, handle multiple demands and competing priorities, adjust project deliverables as needed and timely communicate with Business and IT project stakeholders
A genuine interest in the investment industry and willingness to learn more about the business
Possess an understanding/experience of System/Software Development Life Cycle methodology
Ability to work independently and collaboratively as a team member
Good interpersonal and team skills

OFFICE CONDITIONS:

Normal office environment.
Occasional weekend work is required.

WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US

Our dedication to the Employee Experience at CI is aimed at supporting, empowering and inspiring our talented team through:

Recognition & Compensation
Training & Development
Health & Well-being
Communication & Feedback

job_description:
Vancouver, BCInternshipJob Field:
Facility/Property Management
Job Type:
Internship/Co-op
Length of Assignment:
Summary of BGIS

BGIS, A Brookfield Company, is a leading provider of real estate management services, including facilities management, project delivery services, energy and sustainability solutions, building performance management, workplace advisory and management, and real estate services. With a combined team of over 7,000 team members globally, BGIS inspires better business performance across its client's real estate portfolios by developing and implementing real estate and facilities management strategies. Globally, BGIS manages over 300 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia.

SUMMARY:

As part of the Analytics West team, you will be engaged and ready to support the Senior Manager, Strategic Information with data collection, data mining and analysis tasks, and will support data managers and analysts.

The Analytics team’s role is to address complex business problems using cutting-edge tools and techniques. Artificial Intelligence is a rapidly expanding field which is critical in enabling companies to remain competitive, or to differentiate themselves. The intern will have the opportunity to get immersed in various aspects of the Analytics and AI fields through the acquisition and analysis of data.

The co-op intern will be reporting to the Senior Manager, Strategic Information and will work cross-department on advanced analytics and data mining work. The student will be engaged in various stages of the end-to-end delivery of analytical models. A sample project may be supporting equipment behaviour overtime through work order analysis and predicting equipment failure. This role is an exciting opportunity for students interested in entering the field of Data Science/Artificial Intelligence/Analytics post-graduation.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Acquire data from internal and external sources
Extract, transform and clean data from internal data systems and from external data sources, including sensor data
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) on the data and identify areas for deeper investigation using tools which can handle larger data volumes (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, Access etc.)
Data Engineering – adding value to collected data by engineering features
Provide input and recommendations on in-house data management/ data governance
Highlight process improvement areas to enhance team productivity
Develop analyses to understand opportunity areas for further exploration, for example
Create dashboards for disseminate information to business audiences using tools such as PowerBI or Tableau
Partner with the in-house IT team to develop data extraction queries
Support data managers and analysts with analytical tasks
Presenting findings and recommendations internally

Mississauga, ONRole
Reporting to the Manager, Financial Planning, Budgeting and Purchasing, the Cost Management Analyst is vitally involved in preparing the Cost Management Program for the organization, focusing on the development of contribution margin for each line of business and overseeing the maintenance of the Activity-Based Costing system to meet the MOL requirements as changes arise. Working collaboratively across divisions, the Cost Management Analyst will analyze financial data to help answer key business questions, including how to better understand, create, and deliver value to the customer. The Cost Management Analyst will support key financial indicator reporting requirements to evaluate organizational financial performance as well as year-end preparation.
Key Responsibilities
Note: Percentages refer to approximate % of time spent on each area, over the course of a given year
1. Cost Management Activities And Internal Support & Administration (100%)
Prepares and performs cost management activities as per the direction of the Manager, Financial Planning, Budgeting and Purchasing, including:
Reviews all lines of business to determine their respective fixed and variable costs;
Coordinates the performance of pricing for all lines of business; collaborates with the client services department and IRPD department to recommend the pricing strategies for the organization.
Conducts contribution margin review for each major line of business for the organization (training, consulting services, product sales, safety group, system conference, regional conferences, strategic alliance, volunteer services, strategic support services (i.e. HR, IT and Finance), etc., and collaborates effectively with internal clients services and various levels of management to develop the appropriate benchmark of each contribution margin for all services.
Plans, gathers data, conducts and implements cost and time studies to analyse and establish benchmarking contribution margin on a regular basis to ensure the costs components are reflected at the current realistic and achievable levels.
Develop and maintain contribution margin tools related to the various lines of business for the Customer Acquisition and Retention division teams.
Reviews historical information for different revenue streams and provide analysis to set appropriate targets and goals for the organization. Reviews and monitors revenue generation and provides effective forecast of revenue generation on a quarterly basis.
Using activity cased costing, develop and analyze CM outputs and provides effective recommendations and plan of actions to improve cost management program, add-value for the end process/products, improve processes and determine the cost of customers and develop the pricing strategies
Develops and produces timely, quality reports on revenue, cost and contribution margin and profit margin analysis on a regular basis to support WSPS Senior Management Group's decision making process.
Act as a consultant to internal divisions on customer/contract profit and loss analysis for new/existing business.
Work with the product development team on various projects as the finance lead and various teams across the organization on cost reduction initiatives, including recommending ways to control costs within the budget and CM with the goal of achieving increased efficiencies.
Audit and validate the system data integrity for financial reporting purposes as IT system changes and upgrades are performed. Collaborate with IT and other divisions to investigate in any identified issues and recommend solutions in a timely manner to ensure the efficiency and accuracy of system generated reports.
Actively participates in departmental projects that contribute to the vision and mission of the organization by establishing appropriate Contribution Margin for each project.
Any other duties as assigned.
2. Contributes to a Healthy And Safe Work Environment (at all times)
Adheres to WSPS policies, procedures, process fact sheets, guidelines and business rules established in the WSPS Quality Management system which ensures the achievement of our quality goals.
Contributes to promoting a healthy and safe culture, and links efforts to the WSPS quality management system approach (Plan, Do, Check, Act, Continuous Improvement Cycle).
Acts as a role model internally and externally by demonstrating knowledge of health and safety and wellness practises.
Education and experience:
Post-Secondary University/College degree/diploma in Accounting or related program, or a related discipline with equivalent experience.
Enrolled at the mid to senior level towards achieving a public administration or finance degree (BA or BBA) or professional accounting designation program considered an asset.
5-7 years demonstrated experience in strong and effective financial analytical skills.
3 years demonstrated experience in cost management preparation techniques/modeling and analysis.
Proven ability to proactively identify risks and opportunities and recommend supported solutions where action is required to be taken or decisions need to be made.
Ability to handle sensitive financial information in strictest confidence.
Exemplary customer service skills, excellent organizational abilities, attention to details, accounting knowledge gained through experience and education, strong report writing skills, and verbal communication skills.
Project management skills, with the ability to lead multiple projects and work under pressure to meet tight deadlines when necessary.
Ability to work independently under minimal supervision as well as in a team environment to share/transfer knowledge.
High level of proficiency in applicable software programs such as Excel, Great Plains (including project accounting), Microsoft Dynamics (CRM), SalesForce etc.
Competent in using Windows, Word, Access, Power Point and Outlook programs.
Valid Driver's License.

Applicant Information
Deadline for Application: Thursday, March 28, 2019 @ 12:00pm (EST)
Applications are to be forwarded to: careers@wsps.ca
Complete application will include: Cover letter & Resume referencing the job title in the subject line
WSPS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, WSPS will provide accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process. If selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform Human Resources staff of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require.

At Cadillac Fairview, we are so much more than our properties. We are building leaders at all levels. We reward values-based behavior and superior results with a competitive rewards package that includes best-in-class benefits and pension. Cadillac Fairview is where you can make a difference, and where it all comes together.

Role Summary:
The Senior Business Solutions Analyst will play a pivotal role to ensure that the Information Technology team fully understands the strategies, objectives and detailed requirements from business stakeholders to provide technical solutions. This role will ensure that applications developed or maintained adhere to the requirements of the business and technology/quality standards. The Business Solutions Analyst will implement and maintain a set of standard practices and processes to guide how business applications are developed, managed, improved, and, when necessary, retire (application lifecycle management).

You will:
Applies business analysis methodology to elicit, analyze, specify, and validate the business needs from key stakeholders
Performs business analysis planning to outline the tasks and deliverables needed for the project and estimate the time required including the time of the business stakeholders involved. Considers:
Critical project characteristics such as the size of the project, the business risks involved, the number of interfaces the project will include
The processes that need to be adhered to for the project
The project methodology being used for the project, project roles and responsibilities, and what deliverables are required
Plays a pivotal role in ensuring IT’s understanding of business requirements
Thoroughly document and maintain business requirements
Applies business process design methodology to document business processes, analyze issues and opportunities for improvement, identify process performance targets, and redesign business processes, including cost-benefit and return on investment (ROI) analyses for proposed changes to aid management in making implementation decisions
Assists in Integration and Acceptance Testing, develops testing scripts/plans, supports the development of training and implementation material and works with the Solutions Delivery Team to coordinate implementation
Ensures the traceability of requirements through each stage of the requirements gathering process, mapping requirements corresponding functions in the solution
Works on multiple concurrent project types including: Cloud-Based solutions, custom development, and enhancements/support
Takes an enterprise view in recommending solutions that benefit the whole company, not just a specific business area
Contributes to managing the business relationship
Ensure corporate data is secured in accordance with IT security policies
Ensures appropriate technical documentation is created and maintained
Identify opportunities, risk and constraints for IT to enhance the business
Maintain a good understanding of the organization’s business units’ functions and processes

You have:
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:
Post-secondary education in the field of Business Administration, Finance or Information Systems
Minimum 5 years in Business Analysis
Knowledge of the property management industry and core business process and operations is an asset
Experience in conducting interviews and facilitating workshops to gather user requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios and other methods
Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, business process modeling/mapping, methodology development, and data modeling
Extensive practical knowledge in importing data for use in report software, spreadsheets, graphs, and flowcharts
Good technical knowledge of common programming languages
Good knowledge of application and network security best practices
Working knowledge of network and Windows operating systems
Working knowledge of network hardware, protocols, and standards
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office including Visio
Knowledge of ITIL Framework
Knowledge of project development methodologies including Agile
Solid knowledge on digital products including e-commerce, web and mobile
Experience in Master Data Management solution and Customer Loyalty program in retail space

CORE COMPETENCIES AND SKILLS:
Able to exercise independent judgment and take action on it
Excellent analytical, mathematical, and creative problem-solving skills
Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills
Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure
Strong customer service orientation
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment

Mississauga, ONImagine working in a place that offers great resources to help you achieve your greatest potential. At Foodbuy, our solutions strengthen supplier relationships, customize offerings, and lower purchasing and production costs. The purpose of this role is to analyze the business needs and product requirements of assigned sectors/ partners and units, and support the Field Implementation/ Account Managers in their implementation of programs and processes.
Why work with Foodbuy? We are a member of Compass Group Canada, the leading foodservice and support services company. We extend our value-driven purchasing service model to external clients who benefit from our negotiated contracts with manufacturers that support food and beverage and facility management suppliers.

Now, if you were to come on board as one of our Business Analysts, Customer Finance, we’d ask you to do the following for us:
Analyze data and information from multiple sources (e.g., product details, supplier listings, sector financial results) to determine business needs and product requirements, and create reports for further analysis, in order to identify opportunities for revenue growth
Manage and design reports identifying progress on KPIs and financial metrics
Support Managers and clients for assigned Foodbuy purchasing programs, including providing training on systems, administering processes, and serving as the first point of contact to answer inquiries and resolve problems

Assist various teams including Accounting, Category Development, Sourcing, and Foodbuy Member Development in ongoing projects, and in the development and implementation of new projects, to drive revenue for the business
Identify and rectify gaps in systems and communications content and recommend improvements to Foodbuy systems, strategies, programs, processes, system quality and compliance

The Business Analyst is a key member of the Finance team. You have or are pursuing an accounting or finance designation (e.g. CPA, CFA)
Lean Six Sigma Certification

Build relationships and communicate effectively with colleagues in all region.

The incumbent must be a creative, self-starting, results-oriented and highly motivated individual with very good analytical skills in order to apply this knowledge to assist in the resolution of complex business problems and work in an Agile Environment.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst (Data and Analytics - Cloud)
job_description:
The Senior Business Analyst for the Data and Analytics team will be focused on the cloud implementation and process for enabling the Cloud platform for the Data and Analytics team. They will work as a liaison with the a mix of technology, governance, infosecurity, end users and project delivery teams to elicit, analyze, communicate, and validate information related to supporting the cloud enablement for all parties. Collaborating with the management team and various technology partners, the Senior Business Analyst collects, clarifies, and translates information into requirements that drive the delivery of the end product for our partners. A successful candidate will be the champion of the technology, and be able to bridge business usage and technical feasibility.



ACCOUNTABILITIES

Identifies sources of requirements, possible interfaces, and affected Lines of Business based on high-level process description or scenarios in order to understand stakeholder needs
Gathers users requirements and documents them in high level and detailed requirements documents
Builds, sustains, and leverages relationships with individuals within his/her area of immediate responsibility when gathering, validating, and approving requirements to establish a comfort level in managing relationships and understanding business needs and assurance that a quality result will be delivered
Identifies inconsistencies and gaps within a business process description and collaborates with stakeholders to clarify and simplify complex processes
Facilitates requirements gathering sessions, including leading discussions, managing group dynamics, and maintaining group focus, to work towards accomplishing the stated goal(s) of the session within the context of the project objectives
Creates a requirements management plan according to the recommended practices of the organization so that activities and milestones of the requirements management team can be measured against the goals of that plan
Obtains solid knowledge of business functionalities, runs data analytics and data mining to verify and derive requirements
Adheres to and ensures that others adhere to the organizations Requirements Management Process to support the organizational standards and ensure consistency of deliverables
Provides clarification of requirements to other project team members to assist them in the creation of their specific project deliverables (e.g., assists the testing team in the creation of the Testing Strategy and Testing Execution Plan; provides clarification for developers who would create Design Documents; etc.)
Authors and executes SIT cases and participates in defect resolution processes as defects are found
Collaborates with various teams to run cross impact analyses
Supports users in preparation for UAT testing and throughout execution of UAT
Finalises test phase finding via Final Reports and gathers approvals for all documentation, PPQA, implementation, etc.
Supports production related inquiries as needed
Takes ownership on assigned tasks to delivery high quality product in efficient way
Qualifications
Knowledge:

Possesses a university degree/college diploma and/or 4 to 6 years progressive business analysis experience, supporting smaller to medium size projects
Possesses solid business knowledge in the Finance/Banking industry
Background in reporting tools a bonus (Spotfire, Power BI)
Prior experience working on cloud native platform (Azure, AWS) preferred
Strong Word, PowerPoint, and Excel skills
Knowledge of project and defect tracking systems especially Jira or HP ALM would be an asset
Experience of fast tracked Agile project delivery
Understanding of Databases and basic SQL knowledge

Skills:

Very Strong Communication skills – communicates easily with varying stakeholders (high level executives, technology teams, end users, project delivery teams) in controlled situations (e.g., one-on-one interviews, formal requirements gathering sessions, etc.)
Demonstrates solid writing and documentation skills
Possesses solid problem-solving and analytical skills
Works well both independently and in teams, comfortable leading less experienced business analysts
Displays good interviewing and facilitation skills
Solid understanding and use of tools associated with the role: Spotfire, Power BI

Heart and Stroke is a special type of organization. We're a foundation, a place that values championing health and has a bias for action as we tackle heart disease and stroke. Our mission is to promote health, save lives and enhance recovery. We do so by raising funds to support critical research, and by helping people reduce their risk of heart disease, stroke, and vascular cognitive impairment through risk factor awareness, promoting healthy lifestyles and advocating for healthy public policy. Six core values unite us: Champion Health, Practice Humility, Embrace Change, Drive Impact, Learn & Grow and Be Heartfelt.
Who we need
Reporting to the Senior Manager, CRM Solutions, we are looking for a Business Intelligence Reporting Developer to join our Information Management team. This is a chance to improve fundraising strategies, plan for future campaigns and forecast trends that will positively impact the lives of Canadians living with heart and brain disease. We need someone who is excited to develop a range of visual and text data outputs from ad-hoc queries and data exports as well as building standard reports which provide flexible program reporting, and campaign analysis to guide insights and decision making.
What's in it for you?
National impact. This is a chance to capitalize on over one million data points generated by our newly implemented CRM system that encompasses constituent and marketing campaign data from coast-to-coast.
Career development. This is an opportunity to build out your role and introduce processes and best practices for leveraging Business Intelligence tools and the data warehouse solution across a variety of Heart and Stroke data solutions. You will grow your collaborative skills working with portfolio managers to understand business requirements and how to best provide data reports that fulfill those needs.
Who you are
You want to bring your expertise in Business Intelligence to the nonprofit sector where you can make a tangible difference to the organization's success. You believe creating good management reports is exciting and you want a chance to leverage a vast amount of national data to answer the questions of a foundation. You want to be part of a team interacting with partners throughout the whole organization, bridging business and technology knowledge. You want an opportunity to help shape what business intelligence can offer to improve how the organization makes internal and external decisions.
How you will make an impact every day. You will focus on:
A Business Intelligence strategy and roadmap. You will:
Define and implement a plan based on intensive discussions with internal business groups; a deep understanding of data warehouse needs; the limits and strengths of the system; the vision and strategy of the foundation.
Work cross-functionally to establish priorities amongst multiple business partners and commitments.
Subject Matter Expertise. You will:
Develop close relationships across the foundation and position yourself as a trusted advisor and subject matter expert in the areas of business intelligence and data warehousing.
Work closely with Business Managers, Senior Business Analyst, Business Sponsors, IT/Apps Services and External Vendors to ensure accuracy and effectiveness of report delivery.
Translation and Integration. You will:
Translate high-level data requirements into solution architecture.
Produce technical and functional documentation.
Identify and analyze data sources and prospective data points for solution delivery.
Develop data services and frameworks to extract, load and transfer data into applications.
Automate procedures to streamline data integrations across the organization.
Report Development and Management. You will:
Design, develop and deploy new custom reports using MS Reporting Services or BI tools.
Evaluate current reports, modify and consolidate where appropriate.
Develop suitable outputs and formats such as extractions, reports, graphical, and pivots.
Perform quality control from unit testing, to end to end and user acceptance.
Develop Reports Catalogue from the end user perspective.
Data Warehouse Modifications and Maintenance. You will:
Support performance optimization and modification (cubes, dimensions, query objects) of BI data warehouse with the external provider.
Troubleshoot and support BI data warehouse environment with refresh procedures.
Assess and propose solutions to enhance the architecture of the selected BI solution.
What you bring:
The education. You have a degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
The experience. You have 3-5 years of information management experience supporting large database environments encompassing data analytics, reporting, and metrics. You have:
Strong analytical skills and ability to review and synthesize information.
Expertise in producing analytical reports, data visualizations, summaries, and recommendations.
The communication skills. You can seek out, build and nurture internal and external relationships. You can:
Translate complex business intelligence and data warehouse concepts for a non-technical audience.
Disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Present your findings and recommendations to audiences at any level.
The technical skills. You have expertise with:
MS SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), MS SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), MS SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS).
SQL Server query development and stored procedures.
Data warehousing and OLAP reporting.

Act as primary liaison for selected Programs/Departments for purposes of budget preparation, variance analysis, forecasting, business case development, reporting to internal and external stakeholders. Supporting effective decision making with the use of evidence-based analysis and identifying key opportunities and risks from ongoing operations and future planning. Financial analysis including return-on-investment, sensitivity analysis, rate/volume analysis, budget and business case modeling, scenario analysis, contribution margin, and fixed versus variable costing.
Reporting to the Director – Financial Planning & Analysis, this position will provide ongoing leadership and financial technical support, with the ability to take initiative and be proactive in owning projects and processes, and the ability to work independently without detailed instruction.

QUALIFICATIONS

experience including variance analysis, financial accounting, financial reporting, data interpretation, forecasting, planning and budgeting.Experience in a Health Care setting preferred.Advanced knowledge of spreadsheet analysis through the use of Excel.Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to translate financial and statistical information to stakeholders to assist their understanding and decision making requirements.Knowledge of the OHRS (MIS) Guidelines as prepared by the MOHLTC preferred.Experience with public speaking and presentations to all levels of staff.Experience with the development of financial models, workflow and analysis for business and process efficiency improvements.Must be knowledgeable of health care trends in Ontario.Must have access to a vehicle and a valid driver’s license as the incumbent will be required to attend regular meetings at the main hospital.Experience with performing statistical and financial variance analysis including use of benchmarking and comparative data from various sources such as MOHLTC and OHA.Experience with making recommendations to budget owners and management based on variance analysis, trending/forecasting, and risk management.Prepare and maintain budget process and files.Maintain chart of accounts for both internal management accounting/reporting and MOHLTC accounting/reporting.Prepare and submit quarterly and annual reports for various government agencies and for internal stakeholders in a timely fashion.Provide guidance to hospital staff on accounting and finance issues.Provide support in preparation for the annual audit, annual budget, quarterly reporting and forecasting.Analyze and reconcile capital expenditures including amortization of grants and donations.Provide support for month-end and year-end closing, including but not limited to reviewing accounts for reasonableness and posting journal entries.Other special projects and duties as assigned.Proven attendance record.Demonstrates understanding of contribution to patient and staff safety.Ability to perform the essential duties of the job.Demonstrates behaviours consistent with Mackenzie Health’s Commitment to Caring.Models behaviour that is aligned with the values of Mackenzie Health – Excellence, Leadership and Empathy.Commitment to providing an exceptional experience for staff and clients within a challenging and exciting health care environment.
