Toronto, ONJob Description

The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for working with Clients and Valtech Project Teams to drive the project vision, objectives and take ultimate ownership for delivering impactful Content Management and Digital Portal solutions with the project team.
 The BA works and negotiates directly with the client stakeholders to analyze and transform business objectives into a backlog of prioritized user stories based on market data, internal needs and business value. He/she then guides and supports one or more cross-functional project teams by owning the vision for a release, deciding the priority and details of features to build, accepting features after implementation, and accepting the release.
The BA must have experience in delivering web-based solutions of varying complexity, and must deeply understand the nuances of complex technical, user experience-driven web projects within the an iterative context. The BA must have a knowledge of data and content modeling.

Key Accountabilities :
Be passionate and knowledgeable about our products and the possibilities in our market; specifically around:
Content management and digital marketing platforms
Marketing optimization and automation
User experience and customer experience management
Customer and membership portals
Education, non-profit and B2B verticals
Generate ideas for how our solutions can make our customers more successful.
The Product Owner must have a knowledge of data and content modeling in a web context.
Collaborate deeply with the Scrum Master/Project Manager to continually manage scope, budget and expectations. Maintaining an intimate knowledge of the budget/scope burndown and its impact on release expectations is mandatory.
Works closely with the technical lead to define work for the developers via acceptance criteria on the user stories
Work with the client and project team to formulate a release vision and high-level epics
Constantly manage client expectations on release scope
Present and justify a product release to the project stakeholders.
Participate in project process including Release Planning, Sprint Planning, Backlog Grooming, Daily Scrum, and Sprint Review.
Work with customers and stakeholders to understand their needs and manage expectations.
Define and prioritize a backlog of work. Maintain a well groomed product backlog at all times.
Be the customer's voice and provide perspective on business value on a day-to-day basis.
Continuously evaluate and prioritize user stories based on market data and business needs.
Write user stories and acceptance criteria.

Qualifications

Must have experience having delivered implementations meeting typical web project success factors, including improved SEO, improved conversion and engagement, improved publishing workflow and internal visibility of ROI.
Prefers working in a highly collaborative environment.
Highly developed organization and time management skills.
Excellent interpersonal and client-handling skills.
Ability to contribute towards a team effort.
Ability to work with ambiguity.
Initiative and self-confidence, adaptable and able to cope with changing and evolving priorities while being able to identify new opportunities.
Excellent presentation skills.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
 Understanding of Agile methodologies (preferably Scrum) and knowledge of the full project lifecycle.
1+ years working on software projects following Agile methodologies
Nice to have experience with Digital Marketing/Content Management/Customer Experience Management solutions for public facing websites and portals (for example, Sitecore)
Additional Information

Some travel is required as part of this position.
We offer a chance to work with an amazing team, global clients, competitive salary, medical and dental benefits, life and disability insurance, as well as work from home options.
If you would like to join our growing company please apply today!

We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

*** We do not accept unsolicited candidate profiles from recruiting firms***

ABOUT TRIOVEST
Triovest is an entrepreneurial leader in institutional real estate creating sustainable places that enhance communities and enrich relationships. We believe that the quality of our people directly impacts the quality of our work, therefore we place a high value on attracting and retaining exceptional individuals. Triovest fosters a hands-on approach to value creation for our clients through innovation and collaboration. Our platform offers advisory and investment management services with over $10 billion in assets under management and $2 billion in development. From offices in each major market across Canada, Triovest combines local intelligence with deep expertise to drive superior returns.

The successful candidate will be expected to consistently conduct themselves in alignment with Triovest Core Values of:

Teamwork
We communicate and work together to offer excellent service to our investors, clients, tenants, colleagues and shareholders to achieve our goals. We do not let individual roles and responsibilities get in the way of team spirit and collaboration.

Results
We get the job done efficiently and take pride in the quality of the work we produce. We embrace service excellence, agility and innovation to deliver results and create value for our investors, clients, tenants, colleagues and shareholders. We respond to change in a positive way.

Integrity

Own It

Our Vision

Our Mission
We create sustainable places that enhance communities and enrich relationships.


POSITION OVERVIEW
Reporting to the Senior Manager, Information Technology, the successful candidate will fill the full-time position of Business Systems Analyst in our Toronto or Calgary office. Working in a team environment, the Business Systems Analyst (BSA) works closely with the business to understand their needs, opportunities and issues related to information technology, and delivers appropriate business solutions.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Ensuring processes and controls are in place for data management and maintenance.
Liaise with end users on business application support requests and enhancements.
Coordinate with third-party vendors to address system issues and implement fixes or enhancements.
Work with a collaborative team to identify solutions and best practices for continuous improvement, automation, and efficiencies.
Lead and facilitate business and system requirements sessions for company projects.
Contribute to project success by identifying and resolving issues, mitigating risks, developing change management approaches, and ensuring a successful adoption of new business applications.
Plan and support training activities for business applications and processes.
QUALIFICATIONS/ATTRIBUTES

Post-secondary education in the field of Business Administration, Finance, Management Information Systems or equivalent combination of training and experience.
Experience in the commercial real estate industry is considered an asset.
Experience with providing support to users and implementing systems conversions or upgrades as they occur (e.g. Yardi Voyager, JD Edwards, SAP, etc.).
Demonstrated abilities in Microsoft applications and Visio for purposes of documentation, process mapping, and project management.
Excellence in the following competencies: information seeking, listening, understanding and responding, analytical thinking, organizational skills, relationship management and time management.
Driven, resourceful and adaptable with an ability to build strong internal client relationships.
A dedication to providing exceptional service, every day.
The ability to adapt to change in a positive way and deliver successful results within a given time frame.
A team-oriented approach to meeting goals and objectives.
A willingness to admit mistakes and easily digest constructive feedback, using it as a learning opportunity.

SENIOR DATA ANALYST
Our Business Intelligence and Analytics team integrates data and develops modern reporting solutions, provides advanced analytics to all business units across the organization to generate insights and foster innovation.

As the Senior Data Analyst in this team, the successful candidate will possess very strong analytical skills and the proven ability to gather, view and analyze all forms of information in detail. You will work directly with the business stakeholders. The ideal incumbent will have excellent familiarity of data analysis processes and systems and outstanding interpersonal skills. Previous experience in Microsoft BI technology such as SQL Server, Power BI and Azure is required. The candidate will need to identify the business needs and requirements, process data from multiple sources, and deliver analytical results. You will be a key contributor who enables Aurora to make decisions by turning data into actionable insights. This position will be based out of our Toronto or Edmonton office.

We are looking for a highly motivated team player who is always able to deliver on time. Apply if you enjoy data and analytics, are innovative, love to advocate for change, and have the desire to develop strong working relationships with intelligent colleagues in a new and fast growing international organization!

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

Maintain strong relationships and work closely with stakeholders to ensure business needs are addressed. Collaborate in small groups to gather business information needs from various teams. Identify business objectives and process workflows, gather requirements from stakeholders, translate requirements into technical specification, create user stories.
Extract and merge data sets from multiple data sources. Perform data cleansing, transformation, exploration, analysis and visualization with Microsoft BI technologies. Build on-demand reports using Microsoft SSRS. Build dashboards using Power BI and deploy to Power BI Service.
Support day-to-day requests for data analysis such as decision support and KPI’s.
Use advanced techniques, conduct in-depth analytics for strategic initiatives as directed by the management.
Work side-by-side with the business stakeholders, iterate the analytical work in an agile fashion to deliver insights.
Participate in the Enterprise Data Warehouse development, enhancement and other projects as directed by the management. Support the team to design, build, test and deploy end-to-end, best in class BI solutions for self-serve reporting and data analysis.
Manage multiple project simultaneously while exhibiting professionalism to ensure an incredible stakeholder experience.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

A university degree or diploma in Computing Science, Statistics, Mathematics or similar disciplines plus 5+ years of work experience in Business Intelligence and Analytics.
Very strong experience in database systems including data warehouses and multi-dimensional analytic solutions. Very strong experience working with various data types.
Outstanding skills in Microsoft BI technologies including SQL Server, Power BI, Power Pivot and Azure environment. Excellent SQL skills to write complex queries involving multiple tables and develop stored procedures, triggers, user defined functions.
Proficiency in scripting and programming foundations. Knowledge of Python or R for statistical data analysis.
Knowledge of IaaS, PaaS or SaaS Cloud services such as Azure (preferred).
Experience with Google Analytics, ArcGIS.
Expert level skills in Excel and other MS Office tools.
Strong Agile project experience with proven ability to prioritize and manage time.
Demonstrated success with strategic analytical projects, working with various stakeholders across the business areas.
Demonstrated ability managing deadlines, workload, and multiple complex projects.

IHS Markit is seeking a senior analyst to join its Cloud and Data Center Research Practice. The analyst will work with a team of colleagues located across multiple locations in Europe, APAC and the North America. The successful candidate will be able to apply strong analytical and communication skills to develop a deep understanding of the fast-paced data center compute industry. They will develop strong relations with existing and potential clients, and produce high quality in-depth reports to support the critical business decisions of our customers. The analyst will also be required to do occasional domestic and international travel for research and business development purposes.
Description:
Support the research activities of the IHS Markit Technology Cloud and Data Center Research Practice, helping to define, drive, and evolve the coverage area and services
Produce high-quality and accurate market size, share, and forecast reports with rock-solid methodology for estimating technology adoption and vendor equipment revenue, providing short-term and long-term market analysis, fundamental market drivers, top players and market segment analysis, and product developments
Produce research notes providing regular written opinion for clients on hot topics in this space, including technology shifts, regional and vertical activity, key product announcements, M&As, and more
Develop and analyze survey research on important markets and technologies in data center computing, storage, networking and components, providing in-depth quantitative and qualitative analysis on trends, drivers, barriers, preferences, and strategies
Forge and maintain relationships with all players in the ecosystem, including equipment manufacturers, chip and component manufacturers, service providers, end-users, and investment analysts
Develop new research services to address an ever-changing and evolving market
Speak at conferences and present key data findings to customers
Forge and maintain relationships with the trade and business press, providing useful data and opinion in publications, raising awareness of our services and brand
Participate in social media, such as Twitter and LinkedIn, to engage with customers, journalists, and industry players, and to promote your knowledge
Regularly meet with key industry personnel to drive business development with clients and prospects and support IHS Markit account managers to grow data center computing research revenue
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in engineering , computer engineering, computer science or industry-related fields, required; graduate degree is a plus
Minimum of 5 years of industry analyst, product management, or corporate strategy experience related to data center computing
Expertise in data center computing, storage, networking and component technologies, services, vendors, service providers, enterprise users, data center operators, market drivers, and trends
Strong relationships with equipment manufacturers, software vendors, service providers, chip and component manufacturers, investment community, and other ecosystem players
Solid analytic, logic, and quantitative skills
Experience in segmenting, sizing, and forecasting technology markets
Polished and engaging written and oral communication skills, including public speaking
Microsoft Excel expertise
Understanding of questionnaire design and survey research methodology
Affinity for working on a dynamic and global team

Required Skills:
Proficiency with MS applications required (Excel, Word and PowerPoint); experience with databases helpful
Requires a keen attention to detail and highly effective organization and prioritization skills including the ability to stay on task and maintain focus in a fast-paced environment.
Requires demonstrated effective verbal and written communication skills, in English, in a deadline-oriented environment.
Must be flexible with the ability to work effectively and collaboratively with all coworkers around the world, and able to participate in group interactions with colleagues in a multitude of time zones.
Self-motivation and natural curiosity are essential

Company:
Opta Information Intelligence Corp.
Full-time Intermediate Data Analyst (Markham)
Job Description:
Reporting to the Manager of Business Systems, this person will be a key contributor to Opta’s big data and AI expertise. The incumbent will be responsible for building, analyzing, and reporting on large and sample data assets. Using his/her strong statistical techniques, will apply the right analysis strategy to deliver insight, relationships and repeatable queries or processes. Working closely with the Professional Services team, the individual will be responsible for the fulfillment of customer requests. The individual will work closely with Business Analysts to articulate production system requirements for Opta’s data assets. In addition, the individual will be responsible for sourcing, evaluating, submitting recommendations on data sources that support Opta’s data driven strategies and financial objectives.
Accuracy and attention to detail is critically important. The incumbent will utilize multiple technical tools on a daily basis. Technologies that will be used include Access, Excel, SQL and other similar related data management tools, as well as tools to build on data-mining and predictive analytics logic. The incumbent must have the ability to create worksheets, databases, basic program scripts / macros / select criteria to accommodate requests and evolving needs. This person will work closely with the IT, Operational, Professional Services, and R&D teams to deliver and optimize analytical products and solutions.
Key Responsibilities:
Review existing data and current techniques to ensure its integrity, identify new data management and translation methods resulting in data integration improvements.
Maintain and improve data integrity and accuracy of assets identifying ways to eliminate recurring data issues.
Working closely with the Opta’s Enterprise Data Architect, lead the maturity of the data governance process
Articulate data requirements for production systems
Load, validate, compile and analyze available data assets.
Produce reports based on business objectives and strategic requirements.
Engage with third parties in data acquisition and supporting sourcing decisions.
Aide in the setup, process improvement and maturing of an analytics practice with in the organization.
Prepare, coordinate and analyze customer data set and deliverables, working closely with the Professional Services team.
Work with stakeholders on strategic research and development of Opta’s product lines.
Provide summary reporting to management on his/her ongoing work, analysis and projects.
Education, knowledge and experience required:
Written and oral fluency in English.

Northbridge Financial Corporation is a leading commercial property and casualty insurance company that’s been helping protect Canadian businesses for more than 90 years. We’re 100% Canadian!

The Analyst, Data Governance is responsible for establishing and ensuring adherence to an enterprise data governance framework for data policies, standards and practices, both at the department and Business and Functional areas level, to achieve the required level of consistency and quality to meet overall business needs.
Do you have passion and curiosity for and about data? We are looking for a strong mix of skillsets, along with an attitude of relentless pursuit, problem solving and desire to learn!
What you will be doing:
Work with business subject matter experts and IT developers to gather business requirements for data definitions, and reference data.
Assist in the development, testing, and implementation of the associated data documentation, analysis, reporting, and process improvements
Assist in the roll out an enterprise wide data governance framework, with a focus on improvement of data quality and the protection of sensitive data through modifications to organization behavior policies and standards, principles, governance metrics, processes, related tools and data architecture
Make sure regulatory data is accurate and work with data stewards to correct existing data.
Work with other project streams to make sure data governance is adhered when rolling out projects
Work with data stewards to correct existing data
Perform special projects as assigned
Other duties as required

Bachelor Degree in a field related to data management strongly preferred
Accounting experience a strong asset
Minimum of 3 - 5 years in Data Analysis
Experience in the property and casualty insurance industry required
Experience in Data Governance is a strong asset
Familiarity with/experience within the P&C insurance industry and regulatory reports preferred (IBC and GAA)
Strong working knowledge of business operations, operational procedures, workflow and processing functions
Basic to Intermediate proficiency in SAS, Dbase
Basic to Intermediate proficiency/experience with SQL Server along with Data Profiling Skills
Advanced proficiency with Excel; Intermediate proficiency with Word and PowerPoint
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to build strong relationships at all levels
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities
Strong collaborative skills and an ability to build consensus
Team player, customer focused, adaptable/flexible
What sets you apart:
Ability to plan, organize, and manage multiple demands and changing priorities, and deliver results.
Ability to work successfully within functional and cross-functional teams.
Demonstrated proficiency and resourcefulness in identifying and analyzing relevant data and defining critical issues and alternatives within established guidelines.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Demonstrated presentation, listening and coordination skills.
Ability to work in a dynamic, self-empowered environment and team atmosphere requiring minimal supervision.
Demonstrated track record in meeting deadlines, and effectively handling multiple assignments and tasks with accuracy while under tight time constraints.
Demonstrated commitment to ongoing professional and technical development.

Job Description

The Legal Department has a newly created position of Junior Insurance Analyst, reporting directly to the Senior Manager, Insurance & Operational Risk.
The successful applicant will have strong analytical and communication skills. The position requires agile and independent thinking with a client service oriented approach. As an integral member of the Legal team, the successful applicant will be required to collaborate closely with multiple internal departments & external parties; manage tight deadlines and turn-around times for periodic reporting; and handle a variety of requests from our Canadian and US business units and other stakeholders.
The key areas of responsibilities of this position include:
Analyzing, manipulating, and presenting insurance data for internal and external clients
Maintain claims and loss tracking database and related reporting
Maintain an online filing system for claims management
Process and investigate reported occurrences for businesses in Canada and the US
Work closely with internal and external stakeholders including lawyers, adjusters, brokers and internal stakeholders, including those in the field
Coordinate and respond to undertaking requests from external counsel
Analyze insurance contracts and other documents (ex. leases, service agreements, contracts with insurance related provisions)
Partner with our broker and adjustor to manage insurance and claims programs, including renewal and midterm adjustments
Manage several ongoing projects simultaneously
Meet periodic deadlines for reporting and other requests
Understand contractual and compliance obligations
Fulfil requests for third party Certificate of Insurance
Identify and communicate potential risk/liability and other exposures
Conduct risk assessments and implement related risk control(s) to remedy or mitigate loss exposure
Identify potential risk improvement opportunities
Actively participate in preparation and analysis of renewal underwriting data as part of the insurance renewal process.
Complete ad hoc data requests and projects

Qualifications

A post-secondary education and 2-3 years of insurance or financial experience.
Solid analytical skills.
Excellent communication skills (both oral and written).
A strong understanding of Risk Assessment, Risk Control and/or Risk Financing.
Superior MS Office skills (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, OneNote).
Organized professional with an ability to multi-task and have exceptional time management skills.
Self-motivator with a positive attitude.
Fluency in French an asset, but not a requirement.
Additional Information

Location: Ottawa/Toronto
There is never a typical day at Accenture, but that’s why we love it here! This is an extraordinary opportunity to build a rewarding career at Accenture. Working in highly collaborative teams for world-leading clients, we’ll nurture your talent in an inclusive culture that values diversity. Whatever your work and life goals, we’ll help you achieve them. Sooner.

Join Accenture and thrive in a digitally-driven, innovation-led environment where you can help clients shift to the “New” using leading-edge technologies on some of the coolest projects you can imagine.

Accenture Technology provides cross-industry experts with the insights and management and technology capabilities to drive change for the world’s leading companies. Our Technology capabilities enable our clients to design and implement transformational programs across their entire organization to increase productivity and cost optimization.


WORK YOU’LL DO

Infrastructure Security professionals develop and deliver infrastructure security solutions including policies, procedures, tools and technologies to ensure that data stored in or transmitted via enterprise networks cannot be read or compromised by individuals with authorization, while still allowing authorized users to complete legitimate tasks.

The Data Protection Risk Management professional will develop and deliver solutions for evaluating enterprise IT security practices, identifying and mitigating risks, establishing security policies and practices, implementing controls, and educating stakeholders. Apply standards and best practices in infrastructure and application security.
Key Responsibilities
Working directly with clients and Accenture teams to create and maintain data protection components for client engagements.
Performing requirements analysis and developing security strategies for clients Performing security program assessments, documenting gaps, and creating strategic implementation roadmaps.
Ability to understand business direction of companies and create optimized security architectures to meet business needs and requirements.
Ability to create budgets, staffing requirements, and security direction for long term, 5-year strategies. Ability to translate technical requirements into business terms for executive stakeholders.
Ability to streamline security operations, while maintaining relevant compliance with legal, best practice, and regulatory requirements
Identifies, assesses and solves complex business problems for area of responsibility, where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.
Closely follows the strategic direction set by senior management when establishing near term goals. Interacts with senior management at a client and or within Accenture on matters where they may need to gain acceptance on an alternate approach.
Has some latitude in decision making.
Acts independently to determine methods and procedures on new assignments.

WHO WE´RE LOOKING FOR?
2 years of data protection Compliance, risk management and incident management experience
2 years of advance experience with Firewall Management, McAfee, Cisco Firepower FMC (Firewall Management Console) and IAM
Any Cloud Certifications would be an asset
Eligible for Security Clearance (resided in Canada for the past 5 years).Valid Secret Security Clearance would be an asset
WHAT´S IN IT FOR YOU?
Competitive benefits, including a fair and balanced parental leave policy.
At Accenture, we believe in bringing the best to our clients through continuous learning & improvement – from basic skills to industry-specific content – available to all our people.
Career coaching and mentorship to help you manage your career and develop professionally.
Performance Achievement – our performance management process that focuses on your strengths, progress and career possibilities.
Fantastic opportunities to develop your career across a variety clients.
Opportunities to get involved in corporate citizenship initiatives, from volunteering to doing charity work.
Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions — underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network — Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With 469,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.
To learn more about Accenture, and how you will be challenged and inspired from Day 1, please visit our website at accenture.com/careers.

Toronto, ONJob Description
The Financial Analyst is responsible for supporting the Revenue Management Team with all relevant cost, competitor, customer, and consumer information required to make forward looking decisions to enhance profitability for various McCain entities across the global network.

The Financial Analyst will have strong financial analysis and accounting skills. Responsibilities will include but are not limited to; the assembling of financial data, perform financial analysis and provide sufficient periodic financial information to support the planning and decision making processes that ensure profitability and sustainability of McCain Foods. This position will have regular interaction with other personnel in the corporate and operational groups.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Conducts pricing performance analysis for all commercial areas of the Company while developing recommendations that optimize McCain’s long term profitability.
Develop and maintain revenue forecasting and cost-to-serve models to support planning and analyze monthly/quarterly trends vs. appropriate benchmarks. Make value-added recommendations, and prepare ad hoc analyses as requested in order to facilitate the formation of sound business plans and strategies.
Creates/implements/performs various financial analyses including, but not limited to: product/customer profitability, key customers request, trends and drivers, pricing and promotion, and competitor benchmarking.
Stays current on market conditions and market pricing on competing product categories and develops recommendations to changes in business or product category pricing strategy.
Develop business cases around opportunities to continually improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the revenue management process.
Analyze and evaluate monthly, quarterly, and annual financial results in order to provide full understanding of such results. Assist in identifying opportunities and risks associated with such results and compare results to relative benchmarks.
Potential travel (no more than 10%) to various regions around to the global network to develop relationships, help with local audits and analysis, and drive revenue management success.

REQUIRED COMPETENCIES:

Strong results and action oriented (Initiative)
Strong business acumen
Influencing and leadership skills
Natural collaboration skills
Responsive and capacity to handle business pressure

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

Education: Bachelor’s Degree in the field of Accounting, Finance.
Experience: 1-2 years sales support experience preferred. Must be proficient in the use of computers for Excel, Microsoft Outlook, and PowerPoint Presentations, Data Base Management, SAP, Business Intelligence tools.

Excellent oral and written English communication skills and excellent analytical skills are required.

Important messages
We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you need to be accommodated during any phase of the evaluation process, please use the Contact information below to request specialized accommodation. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.
Assessment accommodation
When you apply to this selection process, you are not applying for a specific job, but to an inventory for future vacancies. As positions become available, applicants who meet the qualifications may be contacted for further assessment.
The first extraction of applications is scheduled for April 1, 2019. The subsequent extractions will take place on an "as and when needed" basis.
*** INSTRUCTIONS TO FOLLOW ***

You must submit a complete application, consisting of screening questions which clearly demonstrate how you meet the screening criteria (education and experience) and a résumé. The screening questions will be used as the primary tool in the screening process and the résumé will only be used to substantiate the information provided.

Please note that the screening questions may also be used to assess written communication.

Please note that point form, “copy and paste" from your résumé and comments such “refer to my attached résumé” will NOT be accepted. Failure to provide this information in the requested format will result in your application being rejected.

FOR EACH EXPERIENCE CRITERION, please provide concrete examples including the following MANDATORY information:

1. Name of the department or organization where the experience was acquired;
2. Title of the position occupied and duration (including dates) for which you exercised the functions;
3. Specific details of tasks, projects, or accomplishments demonstrating how the experience was acquired.
Intent of the process
A pool of partially or fully qualified candidates may be established which may be used to staff similar positions within the Department of Justice Canada with various tenures, language requirements and/or conditions of employment, which may vary according to the position to be staffed.

The positions are currently located in Ottawa, Ontario, but consideration may be given to staffing positions in Montreal, Quebec.
Positions to be filled: Number to be determined
Information you must provide
Your résumé.
In order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)
EDUCATION
ED1 - Graduation with a degree from a recognized post-secondary institution with acceptable specialization in economics, sociology or statistics.

Note: Candidates must always have a degree. The courses for the specialization must be acceptable and may have been taken at a recognized post-secondary institution, but not necessarily within a degree program in the required specialization. The specialization may also be obtained through an acceptable combination of education, training and/or experience.
Degree equivalency

EX1 - Significant* experience in the production, analysis and interpretation of complex data sets and statistics from various data sources.
EX2 - Recent** and significant* experience using advanced Microsoft Excel functions, such as macros and pivot tables.
EX3 - Recent** experience using advanced Microsoft Access functions.
EX4 - Experience in researching and organizing data and information in response to a variety of data and information requests, and preparing written summaries and recommendations.

“Significant” experience will be assessed in terms of the depth and breadth of activities, the complexity and diversity of the work handled, as well as the level of autonomy demonstrated.
** “Recent” experience refers to experience acquired during the normal performance of such duties for at least one year in the last two (2) years worked.

Do you crave the creativity and freedom of a startup but the stability of a large, established company? Are you seeking the autonomy to take risks, make decisions and drive business success? Do you want to accelerate your career to the next level?
Ingram Micro Cloud, a business unit of Ingram Micro, powers the world’s largest cloud marketplace, and is committed to helping our partners accelerate their digital business success by leveraging our hyper-scale platform technology, infinite ecosystem of cloud solutions from the biggest innovators in the tech industry, and go-to-market support and resources to drive adoption and growth. With proven proficiency in SaaS, IaaS, IoT, security, and XaaS technologies, we invite visionaries to join our team and make an impact on this fast-growing industry.
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
Maintain strong relationships and work closely with stakeholders to ensure business needs are addressed. Collaborate in small groups to gather business information needs from various teams. Identify business objectives and process workflows, gather requirements from stakeholders, translate requirements into technical specification, create user stories.
Extract and merge data sets from multiple data sources. Perform data cleansing, transformation, exploration, analysis and visualization with Microsoft BI technologies. Build on-demand reports using Microsoft SSRS. Build dashboards using Power BI and deploy to Power BI Service.

Toronto, ONTemporaryDream Office Management Corporation is looking for a Data Analyst.
Are data privacy and data protection topics that you are passionate about? Are you focused on securing user and business data using a variety of tools and technologies? Do you enjoy architecting solutions and implementing changes that will have a positive effect on our business, users, and stakeholders? If so, read on. We want to hear from you.
Who are you?
You’ll be part of our Infrastructure & Technology Operations group, which is focused on providing top notch computing services to Dream’s 1,000 employees. Working with the security, network, communications and support teams, you will be responsible for supporting our data privacy initiatives at our Canadian and International offices. You are not afraid of change and serve as a change agent. You will explore ideas and are always driving forward rather than settling for the status quo. You’ve worked in fast-paced environments and understand how to juggle big-picture thinking with day-to-day deliverables. You have experience understanding and articulating technology risk in a business environment, and working with a team to remediate those risks. You are respectful of current operating processes, but look to develop new ideas to bring better results. Still interested? Read on!

Who are we?
Dream Unlimited Corp. is a real estate investment, development and management company that creates value at every stage of the real estate cycle. Since the business was created in 1994, Dream has grown substantially, becoming one of Canada’s leading and most consistently innovative real estate companies with over $14 billion of assets. Dream Office Management Corporation provides technology, human resources, and facilities support to the Dream group of companies, currently 5 publicly traded entities.
While on the surface we may not seem that different from our competitors, it’s our attitude and approach that truly set us apart. We are guided by our entrepreneurial spirit; we seize unconventional opportunities and try new things, approaching every project with passion and purpose.
We care about our employees. We want everyone to have a rewarding career and to work and have fun with people they like, so we provide exciting work opportunities, open work environments, and fun events. Once you join us, it won’t take long to figure out why your colleagues like it so much here.

And the Infrastructure & Technology Operations team?
Our goal is to provide the best possible user experience by ensuring our users have the technical tools and infrastructure in place to perform their job functions efficiently. We are continually upgrading and driving our initiatives, processes and goals in order to respond to changes in our business needs and ensure that the appropriate infrastructure is in place to support the business.
We strive to stay at the cutting edge of technology to be prepared for Dream’s continued growth in the coming years. All we’re missing is an enthusiastic Data Protection Analyst – are you ready?

What will you do?
You will be responsible for the organization and privacy of data that our five business lines rely on every day. Here are some specifics of your role to give you some scope:
Work with the Manager, IT Security to oversee the ongoing development of the data protection strategy and implementation across all lines of business
Author and audit, privacy, security, and data protection policies
Implement technical standards / data protection frameworks such as GDPR, PIPEDA ,NIST, etc.
Translation of privacy legislation knowledge into technical solutions to protect the privacy of employee and customer data
Managing and auditing technology solutions that support data privacy
Conduct data and privacy risk assessments, and articulate the outcome as business risk
Perform data classification across a variety of system types and storage methods, including identification and tagging of both structured and unstructured data
Collaborate with both technical and non-technical teams in order to implement solutions and privacy controls
Monitor compliance of data privacy against best practices
Be available for inquiries from data subjects and business stakeholders relating to data protection practices, and data subject rights
Communicate effectively with all levels of the business
Create and maintain documentation that supports data and privacy activities
Be available after hours when needed to assist with incident response, should the need arise
Perform related duties and tasks as assigned by the Manager, IT Security

What type of experience do you have?
We’ve listed just a few select qualifications that we consider to be very important for this role. We can cover the rest when we chat.
Degree, diploma, or certificate in Information Security, Computer Science, or related discipline.
Minimum 5 years’ experience in an information security or audit role
Minimum 5 years’ experience with technologies that support data management (classification tools, Data Loss Prevention tools, data tagging tools)
Experience with implementation and use of data classification standards
Knowledge of organizational privacy controls
Experience with technical standards / data protection frameworks such as PIPEDA, GDPR, NIST, and ISO
Experience with both security and privacy risk assessments, with DPIA experience a plus
The ability to translate technology risk into business risk
A deep understanding of data classification, including identification and tagging of both structured and unstructured data
A strong track record of being able to interface and collaborate with both technical and non-technical teams to implement solutions and privacy controls
Experience authoring or auditing privacy, security, and data protection policies
Operational experience with incident response and breach notification processes
Experience in managing projects and large scale enterprise wide roll-outs.
A self-starter with the ability to work independently under minimal supervision.
Exceptional organization and time management skills.
Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment.
Strong change management skills; change agent
With your manager and the security team, you set clear goals and objectives, and then you and the team deliver!
Knowledge in the following is considered a significant asset, so let us know what you know!
Data collection, storage, and processing privacy best practices
Information security or audit certifications, such as CISSP, CISA, SSCP, CIPM
Experience with frameworks, such as ISO 27001/27002, NIST SP 800-37,
Experience with cloud email technologies (Office 365, Mimecast) and filtering mechanisms
Experience with document management solutions leveraging OneDrive, Sharepoint, and Teams
McAfee endpoint DLP experience a plus
Palo Alto Networks firewalls / SSL decryption and data filtering
Management and implementation of access controls
When you come in to meet, we’ll want to hear about your previous security and privacy, but also about your business interaction experiences. What are your strengths? What areas are you looking to grow? We’ll also be asking you to demonstrate your knowledge given various real world scenarios.
This is your invitation to make a difference. We’re looking forward to helping you grow.
Dream Unlimited is committed to workplace diversity and provides accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout our hiring process

Manage retail inventory flow and create store-specific distribution strategies to maximize store sales and SKU productivity.

Consolidate, analyse and communicate size and location based performance, including sales/inventory comparisons, seasonality and marketing impacts. Utilize analysis to identify profit opportunities.

Strong analytical skills and a thorough understanding of retail math.
Proficiency with MS Office Suite and familiarity with merchandising systems/applications.

Familiarity accessing data from a database structure.
SAP experience a plus.
Strong oral and written communication skills. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.
Ability to communicate effectively with different levels of the business via phone, written and in-person communication.
Ability to understand and use financial data, such as fractions, percentages, ratios, gross margin, net sales, etc., to make decisions and influence outcomes.
Ability to manipulate large amounts of data and create reporting tools from data.
Ability to work on several projects simultaneously.
Ability to successfully multi-task and problem-solve.
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Ability to think strategically, synthesize data, identify trends and recommend viable solutions.
Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals.
Ability to work on a cross functional team and be a part of a team atmosphere.

Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university.
A minimum 3 years of planning or allocations experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience with Merchandising preferred.

Heart and Stroke is a special type of organization. We’re a foundation, a place that values championing health and has a bias for action as we tackle heart disease and stroke. Our mission is to promote health, save lives and enhance recovery. We do so by raising funds to support critical research, and by helping people reduce their risk of heart disease, stroke, and vascular cognitive impairment through risk factor awareness, promoting healthy lifestyles and advocating for healthy public policy. Six core values unite us: Champion Health, Practice Humility, Embrace Change, Drive Impact, Learn & Grow and Be Heartfelt.

Who we need
Reporting to the Senior Manager, CRM Solutions, we are looking for a Business Intelligence Reporting Developer to join our Information Management team. This is a chance to improve fundraising strategies, plan for future campaigns and forecast trends that will positively impact the lives of Canadians living with heart and brain disease. We need someone who is excited to develop a range of visual and text data outputs from ad-hoc queries and data exports as well as building standard reports which provide flexible program reporting, and campaign analysis to guide insights and decision making.

What’s in it for you?
National impact. This is a chance to capitalize on over one million data points generated by our newly implemented CRM system that encompasses constituent and marketing campaign data from coast-to-coast.

Career development. This is an opportunity to build out your role and introduce processes and best practices for leveraging Business Intelligence tools and the data warehouse solution across a variety of Heart and Stroke data solutions. You will grow your collaborative skills working with portfolio managers to understand business requirements and how to best provide data reports that fulfill those needs.

Who you are
You want to bring your expertise in Business Intelligence to the nonprofit sector where you can make a tangible difference to the organization’s success. You believe creating good management reports is exciting and you want a chance to leverage a vast amount of national data to answer the questions of a foundation. You want to be part of a team interacting with partners throughout the whole organization, bridging business and technology knowledge. You want an opportunity to help shape what business intelligence can offer to improve how the organization makes internal and external decisions.

How you will make an impact every day. You will focus on:
A Business Intelligence strategy and roadmap. You will:
Define and implement a plan based on intensive discussions with internal business groups; a deep understanding of data warehouse needs; the limits and strengths of the system; the vision and strategy of the foundation.
Work cross-functionally to establish priorities amongst multiple business partners and commitments.
Subject Matter Expertise. You will:
Develop close relationships across the foundation and position yourself as a trusted advisor and subject matter expert in the areas of business intelligence and data warehousing.
Work closely with Business Managers, Senior Business Analyst, Business Sponsors, IT/Apps Services and External Vendors to ensure accuracy and effectiveness of report delivery.
Translation and Integration. You will:
Translate high-level data requirements into solution architecture.
Produce technical and functional documentation.
Identify and analyze data sources and prospective data points for solution delivery.
Develop data services and frameworks to extract, load and transfer data into applications.
Automate procedures to streamline data integrations across the organization.
Report Development and Management. You will:
Design, develop and deploy new custom reports using MS Reporting Services or BI tools.
Evaluate current reports, modify and consolidate where appropriate.
Develop suitable outputs and formats such as extractions, reports, graphical, and pivots.
Perform quality control from unit testing, to end to end and user acceptance.
Develop Reports Catalogue from the end user perspective.
Data Warehouse Modifications and Maintenance. You will:
Support performance optimization and modification (cubes, dimensions, query objects) of BI data warehouse with the external provider.
Troubleshoot and support BI data warehouse environment with refresh procedures.
Assess and propose solutions to enhance the architecture of the selected BI solution.
What you bring:
The education. You have a degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
The experience. You have 3-5 years of information management experience supporting large database environments encompassing data analytics, reporting, and metrics. You have:
Strong analytical skills and ability to review and synthesize information.
Expertise in producing analytical reports, data visualizations, summaries, and recommendations.
The communication skills. You can seek out, build and nurture internal and external relationships. You can:
Translate complex business intelligence and data warehouse concepts for a non-technical audience.
Disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Present your findings and recommendations to audiences at any level.
The technical skills. You have expertise with:
MS SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), MS SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), MS SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS).
SQL Server query development and stored procedures.
Data warehousing and OLAP reporting.

Legalization has opened up the recreational cannabis market in Canada, and the global demand for medical cannabis continues to expand. In this exciting new environment, Canopy Growth’s mission is to be the No. 1 cannabis company in the world. We’re looking for incredible people to join us on the journey.

The Company

With millions of square feet of licensed cannabis production and operations spanning five continents, Canopy Growth Corporation (“Canopy Growth”) is the largest legal producer of cannabis in the world. It is a listed company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (WEED), the New York Stock Exchange (CGC), and is part of the S&P Composite Index. Its wholly owned subsidiaries — including its flagship, Tweed, and international medical companies operating under the Spectrum Cannabis brand — are leading producers of legal, regulated cannabis.

Headquartered in Smiths Falls, Ontario, Canopy Growth recognizes that employees are at the core of its success, and takes pride in a corporate culture that emphasizes inclusiveness, collaboration, and diversity. Our employees come from a wide range of backgrounds, each bringing their own unique skills and talents to the table, working together to continue and increase our incredible momentum of growth.

The Opportunity

Canopy Growth is looking for a Regional Operations Analyst to join our team. As a Regional Operations Analyst, you will help lay the data foundation of the company to be data driven. You’ll have a chance to collaborate with various teams in the organization to understand different data and reporting requirements.

Responsibilities

Coordinate and standardize inventory procedures to ensure compliance and consistency across all sites
Provide support to the Supply Chain team to ensure sites are compliant with scheduling requirements, report any deviations.
Perform trend analysis to proactively identify deficiencies or opportunities that may arise
Provide data to sites to enable cost management and identify overspends and savings opportunities
Provide oversight to ensure adherence and compliance with production schedules
Support the Finance, Operations, and Grow departments by providing data when available
Support ERP Implementation
Assist with business improvement project initiatives
Other duties as assigned

Experience

Strong computer skills
Attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy
Analytical and able to understand P&L statements
Proficient in MS Office suite – particularly Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Interpersonal skills to include organization, coordination, facilitation and planning
Strong ability to multitask, work under pressure and meet timelines

Other Details

This is a full time position based out of Niagara-on-the-Lake, Aldergrove or Delta.

$72,444 - $94,964 a yearThe Policy Analyst is responsible for conducting research, analyzing data, and developing policy options required to develop the Department of Energy's upstream mines and minerals policies. The position plays a critical role in ensuring that policy options are well thought, relevant data are analyzed, all stakeholders are engaged, and research is properly conducted for policy and regulation development. The work environment is complex and the position must consider a wide variety of energy and non-energy issues affecting Alberta's mines and minerals royalty and tenure systems. This position leads and/or coordinates in-depth policy development processes and works with multidisciplinary teams.


This position will require strong verbal and written communication skills in producing briefings, presentations, cabinet reports, and communications materials on a broad range of energy-related issues. Your highly developed consultation/engagement, facilitation and interpersonal skills will help you coordinate working groups; liaise extensively with operations, legal, agencies and policy representatives; and participate on departmental, cross ministry, and industry committees related to energy development. The work undertaken by the Policy Analyst ranges from well-organized work plans to exploratory, emergent research and strategy development in the fields of energy information, policy, program, and regulations. Since the work covers the full range of Crown-owned mines and minerals, curiosity, mental flexibility, and interpersonal skills are fundamental attributes for the position. Communication, teamwork, and building relationships are essential for success. Having strong analytical and data processing skills are also a critical asset for this position.


The competencies that are critical for success in this role are:

Drive for Results - Knowing what outcomes are important and maximizing resources to achieve results that are aligned with the goals of the organization, while maintaining accountability to each other and external stakeholders.

Creative Problem Solving - Advanced problem solving and critical thinking skills are required to develop recommendations for management, founded on excellent research and analysis skills and the input of multiple stakeholders and/or data sources.

Systems Thinking - Ability to map and synthesize knowledge of Alberta Government business goals, economic and environmental policies, challenges, and potential roles for the Alberta Government and other jurisdictions to address these challenges.

Agility - Demonstrated ability to develop creative and durable recommendations to address complex issues involving multiple stakeholders with various responsibilities and areas of influence. Ability to work with minimal supervision is required


Qualifications

University degree in a related field (e.g., law, business, economics, finance, political science, engineering, or natural resources sciences) plus 4 years of progressively responsible related experience is required. Demonstrated experience with policy development and implementation OR demonstrated understanding of Canadian and global energy industries and systems is required. Project management experience and a related master?s degree will be considered as assets. Additional assets include a master's degree. Equivalencies will be considered.


Salary

$2,775.64 to $3,638.48 bi-weekly
($72,444 to $94,964 annually)


Notes

This competition may be used to fill future vacancies across the Government of Alberta.


How to Apply

Online applications are preferred. Applicants are advised to provide information that clearly and concisely demonstrates how their qualifications meet the advertised requirements, including education, experience and relevant examples of required competencies.


Note: As only one file can be uploaded, please ensure your cover letter, resume and any other related documents are submitted in one file. Please ensure that this document is saved using the following naming convention (Last name, First name_Job ID Number). Applicants who apply online will be able to track the status of this competition.

It is recommended that applicants who have obtained educational credentials from outside of Canada and have not had them previously assessed, obtain an evaluation of their credentials from the International Qualifications Assessment Service (IQAS) - http://work.alberta.ca/immigration/international-qualifications-assessment-service.html It is recommended that applicants include the assessment certificate from IQAS or any other educational assessment service as part of their application.


Closing Statement

We thank all applicants for their interest. All applications will be reviewed to determine which candidates' qualifications most closely match the advertised requirements. Only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.

If you require any further information on this job posting, please call (780) 427-2111. If this competition is closed as per the closing date noted above, please continue to check http://www.jobs.alberta.ca for a listing of current career opportunities with the Government of Alberta.

Please follow us on LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/government-of-alberta

Mississauga, ONRequisition Number: 36725
Job Description
Cintas is seeking a Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS) Business Analyst II to support the HR Department. Responsibilities include assting with the configuration and maintenance of HRIS for the US and Canada; managing the outsourcing vendors to ensure usability, availability and legal compliance; configuring and managing the system, defining and modifying business process flows, completing unit and functional testing and coordinating maintenance releases; assisting with resolution of issues; ensuring data integrity; driving improvement opportunities; ensuring the system meets the customer's business needs by providing internal consulting support and collaborating with external vendors. A successful candidate must be able to thrive in a fast-paced, complex environment with aggressive timelines.
Skills/Qualifications
Required
High School Diploma/GED; Bachelor's Degree in a business or technical field preferred
Minimum 3 years' experience in system configuration
Minimum 3 years' experience defining business requirements and developing/executing detailed test plans
Strong consulting and communication skills to provide recommendations and options to meet business needs
Project management skills to define a release schedule and lead others to meet key milestones and dates
Experience with interface files/data feeds
Proficiency with Microsoft Office with advanced knowledge of Excel

Preferred
Experience with Ceridian Dayforce application or other HR cloud solution
Headquartered in Cincinnati, Cintas is a publicly held company traded over the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol CTAS and is a component of both the Standard & Poor’s 500 Index and Nasdaq-100 Index.
Cintas Corporation helps more than 900,000 businesses of all types and sizes get READY™ to open their doors with confidence every day by providing a wide range of products and services that enhance our customers’ image and help keep their facilities and employees clean, safe and looking their best. With products and services including uniforms, mats, mops, restroom supplies, first aid and safety products, fire extinguishers and testing, and safety and compliance training, Cintas helps customers get Ready for the Workday®.
To support our growth across North America, we’re seeking driven professionals with ambition to move up within our company. Our professional culture, our dedication to our employee-partners and limitless career opportunities—these are just a few benefits we’re proud to offer. Our employee-partners know every job is critical, and that teamwork drives innovation. Let’s talk about how you’ll fit into our team and how your hard work will be recognized through competitive pay, world-class benefits and ongoing career development. Are you Ready™ for limitless opportunities at Cintas?

Nomis is seeking a high calibre Business Analyst to serve our growing client base of retail banks in the US, Canada and worldwide, in the area of pricing optimization of their lending portfolios. You will contribute to our client pricing engagements from "kick-off to go-live", including business consulting, requirements gathering, analytical and technical solution design, data pipeline configuration and statistical modelling, testing and validation, user training, and supporting customer adoption and insight generation as they "put rates in market" leveraging our proprietary software. We are seeking a candidate to work from our Toronto or San Francisco Bay Area offices.

Who We Are & What We Build

We partner with Banks and FinTechs on their journey to best-in-class pricing technology and analytics so that they deliver more value to their customers, employees and shareholders. Our top-notch people, proven technology, and innovative analytics are tackling big data challenges at banks and lenders every day. We deliver market-leading cloud-based Pricing & Profitability Management solutions and insights for the Banking & Financial Services industry leveraging cutting-edge behavioral data science. We are a Blue Chip venture-backed company with the vision to transform the consumer banking landscape.

Who You Are

Intensely curious, collaborative, structured and detail-oriented, you are a strong and credible client-facing business consultant and project manager, as well as an experienced hands-on data analyst and model builder. You are equally comfortable thinking through and communicating the big picture and the technical/analytical details. You have a keen understanding of financial services and have a demonstrable track record of translating business user needs into transformational analytical solutions that yield real business value. You have experience and skill working and effectively communicating with a wide variety of business and technical stakeholders (both vendor and client side).

Responsibilities

Consulting


Elicit business requirements from clients in a structured, collaborative way and translate into analytical/technical solution design.
Coordinate project teams (including vendor and client stakeholders) to keep projects on-time and on-budget, with high quality and customer satisfaction/retention.
Create and deliver impactful presentations to influence clients and facilitate team communications
Communicate pricing recommendations clearly, concisely and confidently to clients

Data & Analytics


Develop data pipeline and modelling specifications based on customer requirements.
Build, adapt and validate data pipeline and customer response models leveraging strong SQL, R, and Excel skills.
Develop expertise regarding the Nomis Price Optimizer (NPO) and its various analytical and technical components; apply this expertise to effective and efficient solution design and configuration based on a given bank's requirements.

Solution Design


Design and implement A|B test programs to prove product and pricing recommendations in market
Collaborate with internal teams to translate requirements into solution design, modelling plan and execution, software configuration, and timelines
Design and develop Tableau dashboards and reports that drive informed business decisions and measure performance
Identify insights, features, and enhancements to be productized by the development team

Desired Skills & Background


Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field
3+ years of experience in business and data analytics
Strong statistical skills and experience focused on business decision making and problem solving
Demonstrated skill and extended experience with R, SQL, Tableau, Excel, and PowerPoint
Exceptional problem solving skills, collaborative teamwork, intellectual horsepower, curiosity, initiative, and attention to detail
Strong communicator, persuasive presenter, fast on your feet, and innately organized
Ability to simplify complexity, in particular to communicate statistical and analytical concepts and findings to a wide range of business and technical audiences with appropriate levels of detail and emphasis
Sufficient interest and exposure to Java coding to engage with dedicated developers (be a good consumer of code)
Willingness to travel up to 30% of the time
Experience within banking and financial services sectors

A Canadian success story of 50 years, created by recognizing needs, building relationships and focusing on doing what’s needed for our patients and customers.
Shoppers Drug Mart is one of the most recognized and trusted names in Canadian retailing, with over 1,200 Shoppers Drug Mart and Pharmaprix stores in each province and three territories. We are one of the most convenient retailers in Canada, proudly serving Canadians who believe being healthy means looking and feeling good.
We are hiring an Analyst, Demand Planning
Reporting directly to the Senior Manager, Demand Planning, the incumbent provides analytical & executional support for the purchasing of promotional inventory by integrating sales plans created by the business and maintaining various scorecards that measure execution effectiveness, to drive continuous process improvement impacting service level, working capital and sales key performance indicators. Senior Cúram Business Analyst - Canada

Company Description
RedMane Technology Canada is an application software consulting and systems integration company in British Columbia, Canada. We deliver software solutions that improve the lives of people in need throughout Canada, the United States, and Caribbean by means of building new applications, implementing cloud and packaged systems, and/or modernizing legacy systems. We are focused on helping Indigenous communities across Canada use technology to transform how they support their most vulnerable citizens.
RedMane has earned an exemplary service reputation. Our primary objective is to ensure the solutions we design and implement meet or exceed the needs of our clients for their mission critical systems.
We are a problem-solving company. Technology is just our tool.

The Role
RedMane has several full-time opportunities for Business Analysts to join our team as we grow and take on more impactful Human Service projects across Canada. Candidates must have an interest in and an ability to learn a variety of technologies and ideally a passion for improving the lives of people in need. This is a great opportunity to join a company with a long and successful history of building and deploying business applications that make a difference.

Skills & Role Requirements
Lead requirement gathering sessions, develop requirements that support the collection, integration and transformation of large volumes of data with relational data structures ranging from simple to complex
Design complex SOA solutions using the WebSphere suite of products
Participate in systems analysis and gap analysis for building quality interfaces, analyze and modify existing programs, debug programs, write specifications, conduct code review for junior programmers, develop and execute testing
Analyze requirements and specify/implement necessary modifications using solid understanding of Cúram database design concepts including tables, fields, attributes and relationship cardinality to create application modules, consider security protocols, design solution strategies and enable interface mechanisms
Conduct planning sessions to identify interfaces that satisfy the business requirements
Participate in project planning with application owns, legacy technical leads, application leads, and IT management in building interfaces between applications
Provide status reporting, quality assurance monitoring and ensure adherence to procedures
Produce deliverables required in standard project development from functional requirements though final implementation and interface production support
Must have experience using Cúram Business Application Suite and WebSphere Suite
Experience in planning and leading JAD sessions and creating design documents
Excellent interpersonal skills
Cúram certification preferred
Understanding of design and development concepts and familiarity with design patterns and the SDLC
Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability and interest to learn about the human services domain.
Related university degree required.
Experience with database design a plus.

Required Qualifications
All professionals at RedMane are expected to possess these skills:
A strong ethical foundation, capable of thriving in an environment and culture where honesty, integrity, and accountability are core values.
A collaborative spirit, a team orientation, and a willingness and desire to contribute to the success of others.

Travel Requirements
The position offers the opportunity to travel, ranging from 35% to 75%. The position is based at our office in Burnaby, BC and our projects are located across western and central Canada and the United States, and the Caribbean.

We Offer You
RedMane has a great working environment, offering challenging and interesting work, a place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. A chance to make a significant contribution that will be recognized and valued. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge is the norm.
We believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career; we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen.
Market based compensation with a full range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, RRSP, and DPSP.

Toronto, ONWe’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com


What You’ll Be Doing

As an Intermediate Business Analyst, you'll be responsible for identifying, analyzing and conducting investigations of client transaction activity in order to determine possible fraud or unusual activity. As part of the Fraud Monitoring team, you'll be using your strong analytical skills and will be taking appropriate actions to mitigate losses on suspected fraudulent activity. You'll maintain superior customer service level in dealing directly with both internal and external clients.

How You’ll Succeed

Analysis - Exercise decision making skills while reviewing customer’s profiles, transactions, banking history and cheque images to minimize loss and protect CIBC and our clients privacy.
Collaboration - Interact directly with CIBC clients, branches and other stakeholders via telephone to communicate information relating to suspected fraudulent activity. Develop and maintain relationships with CIBC partners and other Client Account Management (CAM) teams to compile data, complete investigation, reach resolution and share best practices.
Data Collection - Compile data and investigate alerts/referrals to make recommendations and take appropriate action. Accurately document all actions taken including the resolution reached and the decision made by updating the appropriate databases for each file investigated.

Who You Are

You can demonstrate experience in COINS/ECIF, PRM, RCM, Netquery and Webview.
You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do.
You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.
What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan
What You Need to Know

CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

OMERS is one of Canada’s leading pension funds. We invest over $85 billion for more than 470,000 plan members and their families.
