Why LoyaltyOne?
Are you passionate about leveraging your analytics experience to help more than one hundred of the world’s leading brands improve marketing outcomes and deliver differentiated performance? Are you looking to build an extraordinary career and expand your analytics expertise in one of the most respected analytics companies in Canada? If so, join LoyaltyOne’s analytics practice to become a part of a team comprised of industry leading, business oriented analytics thought leaders. Our team translates data into analytics, insights, strategy and results for our clients. For six consecutive years, LoyaltyOne has been recognized by Hewitt Associates as one of the 50 Best Employers in Canada, demonstrating LoyaltyOne's continued commitment to providing a great work experience for its associates and a great service experience for its clients. Don’t miss this opportunity to take your career to a whole new level with LoyaltyOne.
About the Opportunity
The AIR MILES Reward Program Analytics & Insights practice is looking for a well-rounded Analytics & Insights Analyst to join our team in Toronto. We are looking for an analytics practitioner with a blend of proficient technical skills and strong business acumen. The Analyst plays an key role in the application & execution of consumer data and analytics to support the development of customer-centric business strategies and Loyalty Marketing for our clients.
Qualification:
Responsibilities
Subject Matter Expert in Loyalty & Marketing Analytics for the assigned client portfolio
Contribute to all phases of campaign management (ideation, planning, targeting, measurement, recommendation) with a focus in pre-analysis and post-analysis
Work collaboratively with internal and external business partners to understand external client’s business needs and maximize team impact
Work collaboratively with internal business partners to clearly define analysis / campaign scope, objectives, targeting & measurement strategy for client’s loyalty marketing initiatives
Conduct timely customer analysis and campaign measurement to identify opportunities for clients to maximize the use of AIR MILES Reward Program to drive incremental sales
Present analysis results and recommendations in business language in different forums/meetings
Automate and make process and tool improvement suggestions to drive operational efficiency
Balance the demands of multiple concurrent projects while maintaining a high level of diplomacy
Bachelor’s degree, preferrably in any of the following: Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Math
Problem solving skills coupled with the “can do” attitude
Hands-on proficient experience with SQL, Python, and Tableau an asset
Knowledge in direct marketing, campaign management, experimental design, customer analytics, CRM, segmentation, modeling
Retail and merchandising industry knowledge a definite advantage
A strategic/analytical thinker who can link assigned tasks to the bigger picture
Strong organzational, time management and communication skills (verbal and written)
About LoyaltyOne

LoyaltyOne is part of the successful Alliance Data family of companies that provide the full range of data-driven loyalty, marketing and credit solutions in more than 80 locations across the globe.

Working with more than 100 leading brands in the retail, financial services, grocery, petroleum retail, travel and hospitality industries to profitably change customer behavior. Through a team of businesses, including one of the leading coalition loyalty programs in the world, the AIR MILES® Reward Program, LoyaltyOne designs, delivers and manages a suite of services focused on consumer data, customer-centric retail strategies, direct-to-consumer marketing, loyalty consulting and more.

LoyaltyOne has broadened its horizons geographically by growing Precima in the European market. With the recent acquisition of BrandLoyalty in the Netherlands, LoyaltyOne has gained the expertise of a global leader in short-term loyalty campaigns, along with a client network that extends throughout Europe and Asia.

About ADS

Alliance Data® (NYSE: ADS) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. The Company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. Alliance Data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. An S&P 500 and Fortune 500 company headquartered in Plano, Texas, Alliance Data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. http://www.alliancedata.com/

job_title: Materials Management and Inventory Control Analyst
job_description:
Toronto, ONArray is transforming. Every day we become a stronger global company. With over 1500 employees and exponential growth, we are redesigning how we better serve customers and scale our business. We are building on strength acquiring new businesses and talent to increase our capacity and capability to innovate and accelerate rapid growth.
A leader in the retail display and in-store merchandising services industry, we work with top brands like Estée Lauder, Sephora, Ulta Beauty, and L'Oréal to name just a few. Experts in our field with over 35 years of experience, we are transforming our business process leveraging our in-depth industry knowledge and design innovation.
As we expand around the world, we are looking for critical thinkers who are data-driven and have a strong voice to help us steer towards the future and carry out our vision. Joining us now is a chance to lead our transformation, to make a mark and chart our future and your career.
Who we need
Reporting to the Chief Operations Officer, we need a Materials Management and Inventory Control Analyst to take on the role of a functional expert. Someone with deep inventory, warehouse, and logistics management experience to streamline, automate and document our processes in these areas.
What's in it for you
Exposure and growth. You want to be a critical player at a growing, global organization. You want to transition from a manager on the manufacturing floor into a process builder role at the corporate level. You want to be a key contributor and continue to grow your career, moving up to researching and implementing a new ERP system.
Impact and autonomy. You want a change in the pace of your work and a greater range in what you are working on. You want to design and rollout processes, not just execute them. This is a chance to build the perfect system based on your hands-on knowledge.
What our new Materials Management and Inventory Control Analyst will do:
Discovery. Work closely with the team to determine and analyze current needs, requirements, strategic goals, and existing processes. You will identify gaps and formulate insights to guide the business process realignment.
Design and configure. Lead the work on a collaborative team to define system specifications that meet their needs and align with the scope of the implementation.
Transform and optimize. Identify and apply industry best practices. Implement techniques that align and improve product quality across all facets of materials management (warehousing, inventory and logistics functions). Measurably improve process performance.
Collaborate. Partner with key stakeholders evaluating recommended changes in business processes that significantly impact the end-to-end-processes.
Analyze. Develop metrics for process measurement and identify future improvements.
As a Materials Management and Inventory Control Analyst, you have:
Direct Experience. You have 5+ years of progressive experience in Materials Management. You have expertise in the end-to-end manufacturing process from the bill of materials to end-product delivery. You have hands-on knowledge of ERP operations and procedures as related to inventory, warehouse and logistics management. You are familiar with enterprise business processes for a manufacturing business. You have expertise in process analysis, design and documentation.
Technical. You are proficient in the MS Office Suite including Visio. You have familiarity with Crystal Reports.
Interpersonal. Your communication skills - written, verbal, presentation - are outstanding. You are comfortable talking to teams from the manufacturing shop upwards to C-level executives. You have the confidence to take a stand, defend your decision and hear the opposition. You are naturally looked to for direction in a crisis, and you are comfortable facing adversity head-on.
The Array way.
Whether you are working in the engineering department in Long Island, the design studio in Toronto or around the world on the manufacturing floor, Array is a place that invests in our people and recognizes their success. We believe in open, honest communication and the input of all of our employees.
At Array, we foster a culture of mutual respect, innovation, collaboration, and pride. From encouraging calculated risks that lead to change to providing access to education, on-site learning, and the best technology and materials, we promise to provide a safe, creative, ethical and nurturing environment to build a dynamic career.
Diversity and Equal Opportunity Employment
Array is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

job_title: Internship Opportunity- Business Intelligence & Analytics Intern
job_description:
Markham, ONInternshipJob Field:
New Graduate / Student
Job Type:
Internship/Co-op
Length of Assignment:


BGIS is a leading provider of real estate management services, including facilities management, project delivery services, energy and sustainability solutions, building performance management, workplace advisory and management, and real estate services. With a combined team of over 7,000 team members globally, BGIS inspires better business performance across its client's real estate portfolios by developing and implementing real estate and facilities management strategies. Globally, BGIS manages over 300 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia.

SUMMARY:

As part of the BI & Analytics team, you will be engaged and ready to support the team with data collection, engineering, analysis and data mining tasks, to support cross-departmental analyses.

The Advanced Analytics team’s role is to address complex business and Financial problems using cutting-edge tools and techniques, including Artificial Intelligence (AI). AI is a rapidly expanding field which enables companies to remain competitive, and to differentiate themselves. The intern will have the opportunity to get immersed in various aspects of the Analytics and AI fields through the acquisition and analysis of data and supporting cross-department analyses.

The co-op intern will be reporting to the Associate Director, Analytics, and will work cross-department on advanced analytics and data mining work. The student will be engaged in various stages of the end-to-end delivery of analytical models, with a focus on financial analysis, the energy industry and operational improvement initiatives. Sample projects could include proving cost savings due to retrofits, building energy forecasts, and understanding market opportunities. The role will touch upon big data, creating dashboards and developing insights and recommendations through analysis. This role is an exciting opportunity for students interested in entering the fields of Data Science / Artificial Intelligence, Finance and / or Energy.

Key Responsibilities:

We are looking for a team player who possesses / is interested in developing exceptional analytical skills, is able to learn quickly, and is truly motivated by solving impactful business problems
Acquire data from internal and external sources
Extract, transform and clean data from internal systems and external data sources
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) on the data and identify opportunity areas utilizing tools that can handle large data volumes (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, R, Python, etc.)
Data Engineering to add value to collected data by creating features
Provide input and recommendations on in-house data management / data governance
Develop both simple and machine learning models to drive business success
Create dashboards to disseminate information to business audiences utilizing tools such as PowerBI or Tableau
Create presentation decks to explain analyses and recommendations
Partner with the in-house IT team to develop data extraction queries
Support Finance controllers and analysts with complex analytical tasks
Presenting findings and recommendations internally
Required Knowledge & Skills:

Recently completed, or working towards, a Master’s designation or university-level certification in Data Science, Analytics or AI
Academic or industrial experience with business intelligence tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau)
Academic or industrial experience with databases, analytic applications, and/or programming languages preferred (i.e. data modeling, SQL, Java)
Academic or industrial experience in advanced analytics tools, such as R, Python, SAS, SPSS, Microsoft Azure Machine Learning, etc.
Ability to tame and analyze large datasets and translate into actionable recommendations and meaningful stories
Technically and digitally savvy with an interest/passion in uncovering insights through analytics
Collaborator, learner and a go-getter with a positive attitude
Confident in oral, written, and interpersonal skills
Strong customer focus and a total commitment to customer satisfaction
Desired Knowledge & Skills:

For this internship opportunity, BGIS is most interested in students who are serious about venturing into the Real Estate industry
Ideal candidates would have a background in Finance, Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Analytics, or Engineering programs
Experience in the creation and use of big data environments is preferred
Recent graduates or undergraduate students completing their final two years are preferred

job_title: Operational Business Systems Analyst - 9 month Contract
job_description:
Toronto, ONTemporaryAbout the role:
In this 9 month Contract role, you will work independently on various projects and operational initiatives in support of Investment Management business. You will work closely with the business and Investment Operations team to deliver solutions involving various Investment Management systems, including Eagle Investment systems, Trade Order Management, Analytics and Fund/Investment Accounting systems, and any other interfacing systems.
Your Responsibilities
Facilitate with the elicitation, planning and documentation of (but not limited to) the following deliverables:
Current state analysis including full documentation of the current application state and operational workflow, file transfer processes and interfaces to third parties.
Recommendations on future state.
Detailed business and reporting requirements.
Functional specifications as a hand-off for development, including data mapping and interface requirements
Test strategy, test plan and test cases.
Scope documents and project objectives: based on both user needs and a thorough understanding of business systems, technology, and industry requirements.
Major features of the business systems from the perspective of the business owners and sponsors and in terms that are meaningful to business people.
Risk and risk mitigation plans.
Deployment to production plans, including change management procedures, SLAs (Service Level Agreements) and support documentation.
Facilitate the following activities:
Liaising and co-ordinating activities between the business areas, Investment Operations and external vendors to help translate requirements into specifications.
Translate specifications to define test plans and test scripts.
Execute testing across several environments, and work with users and development teams on issue identification and resolution.
Co-ordinate assigned project activities, provide accurate estimates in order to consistently meet the project deadlines with the expected quality.
Facilitate and lead sessions to gather and document functional and non-functional requirements
Analyzing and mapping of existing processes to future "to-be" processes
Working with vendors to provide appropriate requirements, use cases and specifications
Identifying areas of opportunity that distinguish this business and represent its core competencies. Some of these processes may represent opportunities for competitive advantage
Your Qualifications
Must have undergraduate degree
Preferable to have post graduate training in financial markets or investments, Canadian Securities Course, CFA, etc.
Must have a minimum of 7 years working as a Business Analyst
Must have Investment Management business knowledge
Working knowledge of General Accounting practices in particular Fund Accounting processes and methodology
Experience with Eagle Investment systems (Eagle PACE, Eagle Star and Eagle Datamart).
Must have experience with various systems supporting the Investment Management business, such as Bloomberg AIM, Market Data and Fund/Investment Accounting systems
Experience in writing SQL queries (selects, joins, groupings etc.).
Strong data knowledge, specifically in Financial Industry Security Master Data / Analytics Data.
Thorough understanding of security types, including derivatives, and associated data.
Able to work effectively with minimal supervision & adapt quickly to changing requirements.
Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills and proven documentation skills.
#INDS
No unsolicited agency referrals please.

Dorval, QCIt’s an exciting time at Innotech-Execaire Aviation Group. For more than 50 years, we have provided a full range of services for business and commercial aviation customers. Today, we are transforming and growing to meet the demand of OEMs, business aviation customers and airlines. We are a premier Canadian aviation company with an international presence!

If you’re looking for an opportunity to join and grow with a dynamic company, you will thrive at Innotech-Execaire Aviation Group!

Business Process Analyst

Reporting to the Vice President of Information Technology(VPIT), the Business Process Analyst is responsible for identifying and improving the outcomes of operational processes to increase efficiency and customer satisfaction as well as reducing cost. The candidate will also be responsible for leading continuous improvement initiatives for all departments in the organization, as well as evaluating, planning and implementing the improvements in the business processes and practices. Other aspects of the job include group facilitation, compiling and tracking data,preparing training materials and documenting processes.

The Business Process Analyst must be prepared to explain and defend any proposed changes to the current system.

Responsibilities
Identify, plan and implement key projects to improve quality, reduce cost, increase productivity and improve cycle time by reducing wasted time, scrap, rework, etc. resulting in significant business improvement and customer satisfaction.
Identify and facilitate process improvement projects, training/workshops to drive cultural change
Drive value stream mapping to define “As-Is Analysis” and the transition to Future State
Develop and conduct compliance audits, program evaluations and reviews to drive results with the fortitude to ensure change is permanent
Provide executive management with project status updates, feedback, and appropriate reporting on key responsibilities and objectives.
Receives input and coordination of information from various parties, and prepares and presents such information for management review.
Strong understanding of Continuous Improvement concepts, principles and practices.
Job requires a willingness to lead, take charge, and offer opinions and direction.
Support/change management plans and training plans to ensure new processes are implemented in an optimal fashion, supporting the organization through the various stages of change.
Work with the training department to develop training programs for the broader team related to the tools and solutions created.
Participate in training facilitation of key process enhancements where applicable.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree preferably in Industrial Engineering from an accredited University
3+ years’ experience in process improvements, cross-functional collaboration and workflow generation
Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written, problem solving and analytical skills
Strong leadership skills, ability to learn and apply new concepts and overcome obstacles with change
Strong work ethic that is able to work independently but also works well in team environment
Results driven with an ability to effectively multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Experience in Six Sigma, Reengineering or other Continuous improvement methodologies would be an asset
Technical Competencies
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft word, excel ,Visio and ERP applications
Lean Six Sigma Organizational training and certification would be an asset.

and a great dynamic team!

Position:

Solutions Analyst


Reports To:

Senior Vice President, IMS


Tier:

Staff

Industry Managed Solutions


Company:

GS1 Canada


Location:
Toronto


Status:

Full time

 1437


Key Role
The Industry Managed Solutions team requires a Solutions Analyst to assist in managing the ongoing growth and transformation of the team. The Analyst will play a critical role on the IMS team, helping to consolidate the various streams of data and information from throughout the organization. In addition, the Analyst will help create and maintain a comprehensive set of metrics and reports which will help describe the current state of the business, identify trends and measure key vendor performance. In addition to the data-oriented responsibilities, the Analyst will be required to conduct industry research, perform industry scans, partake in vendor reviews and assist in vendor selection.

In addition to these responsibilities, the Analyst will assist in the day-to-day operation of the department which will include managing the departments SharePoint site, assisting in budgeting, resource tracking and overall administration of the team.


Duties and Responsibilities
Develop and manage reports to identify trends and opportunities within key business areas
Collect, organize and maintain information from various sources throughout the organization (incl. subscriber feedback, business requirements, sector board feedback, etc) and deliver regular status updates regarding progress within various project assignments
Conduct industry research and communicate finding to leadership;
Manage departmental communication and document SharePoint site;
Act as a conduit between the Industry Managed Solutions team and other key stakeholder in the organization
Maintain key vendor information, and monitor reporting on vendor performance against service level agreements and Key Performance Indicators
Assist with budgeting, time tracking and general administration of the IMS team


Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Technology or Engineering
2-5 years of experience in a similar role
Experience with developing and managing reports, and conducting analysis to provide insights to team members and senior leadership
Strong analytical and statistical knowledge with an ability to combine quantitative and common-sense problem-solving skills
Ability to read, comprehend, summarize and report on various sources of information such as industry articles, websites, periodicals, etc. and present findings in a succinct and professional manner
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office suite of products; must have exceptional Excel skills and working knowledge of MS Access (or other database management system).
Understanding of simple programing languages (such as SQL, VBA, Python)
Ability to independently gain insight into and develop process / system changes and improvements.
Self-starter, able to manage and prioritize multiple complex tasks with minimum supervision and strong attention to detail
Desire to learn and succeed in a challenging fast-paced environment
Understanding of six sigma tools and methodologies would be an asset
Strong organizational, planning and time management skills
Strong work ethic, a high respect for confidentiality and sound professional judgment

Posted: 12/7/2018 12:04:45 PM

We currently have a temporary full time (1 year) opportunity for a Data Manager – Hematology Disease Site Group in our Clinical Research Programme, Odette Cancer Centre in the Sunnybrook Research Institute.
The Clinical Research Programme at the Odette Cancer Center (OCC) is part of Sunnybrook Research Institute’s (SRI) ongoing commitment to participate in innovative and high quality clinical research. Within OCC Clinical Research, the Medical Director, Manager and Business Analyst, work with 35+ physicians actively participating in clinical research and 33 OCC clinical research staff. Our programme is comprised of 10 disease site groups; Breast, CNS, GI, GU, Gynecology, Head & Neck, Hematology, Lung, Melanoma and Palliative.
Under the direction of the Disease Site Group Leader and Program Supervisor, the goal of this position is to support the Hematology Disease Site Group with the management of trials and patient-specific responsibilities. Primary responsibilities include obtaining and processing biologic specimens and the collection and entry of data into each trials data entry system. Additional responsibilities may include screening, review of the informed consent form with patients, assessment of eligibility, registration/randomization, collection and submission of patient data, monitoring / compliance, maintenance of a system to ensure effective data flow, monitoring of patients, collection of adverse events and communication of patient information to investigators in a timely fashion. The Data Manager (DM) will also liaise with clinical trial, institutional and study sponsor staff to respond to queries and facilitate monitoring and close out visits. Must be able to recognize adverse events (AEs), communicate AEs promptly to investigators and respond appropriately to protocol/patient focused care including reporting to appropriate parties. Overall responsibilities involve aspects of study activation, maintenance and closure.
Qualifications/Skills:
Requires the successful minimum completion of a Community College Diploma/ Certificate
Practical clinical trial experience an asset
Well-developed organizational and time management skills
In-depth knowledge of ICH guidelines and Good Clinical Practice an asset
Proven experience in processing and shipping blood samples an asset
Strong oral and written communication skills
Demonstrated accurate and efficient work habits with close attention to detail
Familiarity with medical terminology
Qualified candidates are invited to submit their resume and cover letter (in one document) quoting 183960 to:
Human Resources
Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre
To apply, please click "Apply for Position" near the top right corner of this page

job_title: Business Systems Analyst - Six Month Contract
job_description:
Calgary, ABTemporaryBusiness Systems Analyst– Six Month Contract

Vermilion Energy is currently seeking a Business Systems Analyst for a 6-month contract opportunity, scheduled to begin immediately. The Business Systems Analyst performs a combination of three functions: business analysis, systems analysis and project management. As a Business Systems Analyst, you will be responsible for managing the customer relationship between IS and one or more business areas, implementing upgrades and new applications, as well as supporting and maintaining a portfolio of existing applications.

Key Responsibilities
Managing the customer relationship between IS and specific business areas
Supporting, maintaining, enhancing and/or upgrading a portfolio of applications and related integrations
Analyzing current solutions, data, processes and work instructions, and designing and implementing applications and process improvements
Understanding and analyzing data and its applied use within the business area(s) for both current and legacy applications
Business area planning that includes integration of legacy systems, documenting business cases to justify new application investments, scheduling and management of application projects
Understanding system architecture for the applications within the portfolio
Developing reports, analyzing and responding to requests for data and new functionality
Troubleshooting and repairing problems that occur in the everyday use of an application
Developing and maintaining technical specifications and documentation


Essential Experience & Skills
Eight plus (8+) years’ experience as a Business Systems Analyst and Systems Analyst preferably in Land
Highly developed analytical skills;
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, organizational and interpersonal skills;
Experience with supporting land applications such as CS Land
Demonstrated proficiency in business modelling, process modeling, data modeling and effort/cost modeling and estimating;
Demonstrated proficiency with SQL and database query tools – SQL+ or PL/SQL;

25 York Street, Toronto, Ontario, M5J 2V5
President’s Choice Bank is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Loblaw Companies Limited (LCL) and was established to promote President’s Choice Financial services offered by strategic partners in all regions of Canada. Loblaws Inc. is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Loblaw Companies Limited (LCL). LCL is Canada’s food and pharmacy leader, with a network of corporate and independently- operated stores in communities across the country, employing close to 200,000 Canadians. PCF is an important business unit within LCL that manages and develops products and service programs to improve the customer experience, maximize value, and provide a platform to enhance customer insights and relationships. PCF’s vision is to provide superior value financial products to consumers.
As a Predictive Modeler within the PC Financial Product Management team, the successful candidate will primarily develop predictive models for all lines of business within PC Financial. As a trusted Advisor this role will be accountable for building partnerships with key business stakeholders to provide valuable insights, analysis and key strategic information.
What You'll Do:
Develop and implement statistical models for targeted cross-sell, acquisition and retention using machine learning techniques that include linear/logistic regression, decision trees and k-means clustering analysis
Maintain statistical models that optimize CRM communications through all channels
Track and monitor performance of models in production to determine degradation and the need for recalibration or redevelopment of models
Explore large amounts of structured and unstructured data to extract information, gain insight and derive variables to be used as inputs into models
Ensure models are accurate and supported by reliable data
Document and track all model changes and document in an orderly fashion
What You'll Need:
University Degree in applied statistics field (Operations, Research, Engineering, Mathematics or related).
Experience working with machine learning algorithms including linear/logistic regression, decision trees, k-means clustering analysis
Thorough knowledge of relational databases and data extraction/manipulation tools coupled with strong programming skills (SAS, SQL, R, Python)
Ability to take initiative, multi-task, work in a fast-paced environment, and able to learn independently
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication and presentation skills
Experience with Google/Adobe Analytics
Experience in Credit Card industry
Experience working with unstructured data in Hadoop environment

Victoria, BCContract Evaluation Analyst
Administrative Officer R24
An eligibility list may be established.

A great opportunity to take the next step in your career
RoadSafetyBC is the lead provincial agency for road safety and is responsible for setting strategic direction and establishing a provincial approach to road safety throughout British Columbia. RoadSafetyBC regulates drivers and operates a number of programs to help regulate the safe and responsible operation of motor vehicles in B.C.
As Contract Evaluation Analyst, you will analyze and evaluate the performance of RoadSafetyBC’s service providers, including the Responsible Driver Program (RDP), the Ignition Interlock Program (IIP), and Impound Lot Operators (ILOs). You will ensure quality performance, contract compliance, and provide recommendations to Executive members for improvements. You will work with the service providers for the RDP (an education and counselling program) and the IIP (a driver monitoring program which, through the operation of an interlock device installed in drivers’ vehicles, ensures drivers do not drink and drive) as well as the Tow Companies/ILOs participating in the Vehicle Impoundment Program to ensure the Province’s program requirements are being met.
The capital of British Columbia, Victoria is a beautiful city, with beautiful beaches and harbours, and a variety of provincial parks to explore. Located on Vancouver Island, Victoria offers a bustling downtown scene and has a wide range of restaurants and entertainment venues to choose from.
With over 200 different occupations available in 280 communities across the province, we offer exciting opportunities for your career. Come be a part of the BC Public Service, a Top 100 Employer that embraces diversity, health and career growth. For more information, please see What We Offer.
The BC Public Service is committed to creating a diverse workplace to represent the population we serve and to better meet the needs of our citizens. Consider joining our team and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.

We currently have an opportunity for a Regular Full-time Analyst, Imaging Informatics position inthe Medical Imaging department located at our Bayview Campus.
Summary of Duties
The Informatics team within the Department of Medical Imaging at Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre provides technical and analytical support to operational and clinical areas of the hospital. The focus of the Informatics team is to systematically support evidence-based process decisions and performance monitoring for the service provision of all our imaging modalities (including but not limited to ultrasound, X-ray, CT, MRI, PET, nuclear medicine etc). Informatics team also supports the medical imaging team with any IT related needs including managing PACS, RIS and other ancillary applications. The Clinical Analyst will report to the Manger of Informatics.
Job Duties and Responsibilities
Perform and present data analysis on multiple data sources for analytical and modeling purposes and evaluates key performance metrics and trends.
Develop models including data visualizations.
Perform data mining, such as anomaly detection, classification, regression, clustering, and summarization/recommendation analysis.
Identify opportunities and solutions to better meet business needs to drive performance and optimization
Validate the implementation of improvement solutions via data collection and analysis
Effectively communicate the findings and benefits to present to various stakeholders.
Provide support to the technical team to ensure daily operations in the department run smoothly
Qualifications/Skills
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Data Sciences or Healthcare Informatics
Preference for Master’s Degree in Engineering, Healthcare Informatics
Healthcare and/or clinical imaging experience is an asset
Familiar with informatics applications including PACS and RIS
Experience working with data related to LHIN, MOHLTC, CCO, ATC
Experience with languages; Python, PHP, Java
Experience with relational databases SQL, MySQL, Postgres
Knowledge of statistical modeling tools (e.g., SAS, R), experience with BI tools
Proficient with HL7 data exchange
Experience using simulation software (Simio, SIMUL8 or equivalent)
Experience with MS Office (specifically Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Strong project management, quality improvement and change management skills
Strong communication skills to deal effectively with stakeholders and the ability to work collaboratively in a team as well as independently

Human Resources

Job Description

The Cineplex Digital Media division of Cineplex Entertainment is currently recruiting for a Senior Data Analyst, reporting to the Manager, Research & Insights. The Research & Analytics team is a highly involved team of data professionals who love what we do! We are seeking a talented, enthusiastic and client-focused Senior Data Analyst to join our team.
The Senior Data Analyst oversees and conducts the conversion of data into insights that will lead to informed business decisions. As the Analytics team is small but efficient, he/she will work autonomously with Cineplex Digital Media’s top management and executives to present strategic insights that build a stronger company. The Senior Data Analyst will handle multiple simultaneous tasks and will be expected to remain effective and functional under pressure and aggressive timelines.
In this role you will apply your analytical talent to our rich data environment in order to build intuitive dashboards and insightful business reports. You’ll be an expert problem-solver, delivering insights about the business to a variety of audiences and answering tough questions in an intuitive and understandable way.

Qualifications

Education and technical skills:
Master’s degree in a technical discipline, such as Mathematics/Analytics
Relevant discipline in an undergraduate degree
Experience:
Technical fluency with SQL is mandatory, intermediate Python/R for data modelling is required
2+ years of B2C analytics and business intelligence experience
Superior quantitative analysis ability and experience including campaign design, measurement, data mining and predictive analytics
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as PowerBI and/or Tableau
Strengths:
Must be client facing, and a highly collaborative team player who can influence across and up without reporting line authority.
Intellectual curiosity and passion for digging into data and mining it for insights
Strong time management and organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and manage own workload while multi-tasking in order to meet deadlines.
Ability to create and deliver impactful presentations for different levels of audience across the organization
Key Responsibilities:
Be the Subject Matter Expert on all things analytics for CDM, own and be knowledgeable on CDM’s and Cineplex corporate’s database schemas and ways to manipulate this data to benefit our clients
Work alongside the technical support and operations team to drive operational efficiency and improve data quality
Design dashboards and reports, and create data visualizations to identify trends and drive business insights
Work with internal resources or vendors to conduct market research to augment insights drawn from the customer database.
Work on ad-hoc projects as specified by the Analytics team’s road map and its application to the Product team
Additional Information

Interested applicants please apply today.

job_description:
Toronto, ONAre you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.
Job Description
Manulife Real Estate is the global real estate arm of Manulife Financial Corporation with fully integrated in-house capabilities and 70 years of experience as an active investor, owner, developer and asset manager of commercial real estate. Diversified by both geography and asset type, the portfolio consists primarily of prime office and industrial properties, as well as select retail and multi-family residential properties, in key metropolitan centers throughout Canada, Asia and in the United States through Manulife's U.S. division, John Hancock. In addition to equity real estate, Manulife Real Estate manages the space requirements and own use facilities for Manulife’s operations around the world.
The Asset Management team is generally responsible for helping to add value to the portfolio through executing property-level strategies in collaboration with Managing Directors of Regional Offices across Canada and the United States.
Reporting to the Director, Asset Management, the Senior Business Analyst will be responsible for assisting the Director in preparing and providing analysis and insight to senior management. Specifically, regarding portfolio and asset specific performance, strategic initiatives of the general account and third-party fund businesses. As well as, ongoing new developments and portfolio repositioning, and ad hoc quarterly presentations, market research and analysis as needed.
Responsibilities
Work closely with Director and branch offices to provide direction for and oversight of business plans, budgets, forecasts, leases, renewals, analysis and approvals.
Prepare management reporting where currently lacking.
Implementation of capital review, parking revenue review.
Expense management; and coordination of allocation of expenses.
Coordinate with regional offices to coordinate total return for assets through the analysis of property efficiencies and identifying value-add opportunities for improved performance.
Involvement in coordination and strategy on developments.
Work on behalf of Asset Management team on accounting system integration.
Understand cash flow, distribution analysis and develop investment projections.
Work with director to assess impact of prospective tenant leases and capital improvement projects on building valuation.
Support LEED certification.
When required, provide pre-acquisition input and assistance in due diligence process, including review of financial and operational assumptions.
Other duties and special projects as required.
Qualifications
Post-Secondary education in Business/Finance/Accounting.
Minimum 4-7 years in a real estate leasing sales/finance/analyst role, preferably in the real estate industry.
Understanding of accounting concepts related to leasing, building expenses and capital expenditures.
Knowledge of real estate portfolio and administration, procedures.
Financial ability - development of financial reports, variance calculations, journal entries etc.
Ability to juggle competing priorities and work under pressure to meet demanding response times, all while paying strict attention to detail.
Skills in troubleshooting, understanding the theory of database systems and the ability to access building financials and information from accounting/real estate systems.
Good communication skills - verbal and written.
Strong analytical skills (both quantitative and qualitative).
Strong risk assessment skills. Ability to compile, monitor, examine, and audit various financial, performance, and/or data reports for accuracy, integrity, and conformance to performance benchmarks. Ability to draw conclusions and prepare written findings and presentations. Ability to evaluate and determine property valuations and asset performance under a variety of scenarios. Strong oral and written communications skills in order to present to and work with senior management and external clients.
Ability to juggle competing priorities and work under pressure to meet demanding response times, all while paying strict attention to detail.
Focused and self-motivated team player who balances independent thinking with the execution capabilities and core competencies of the rest of the organization.

If you are ready to unleash your potential it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.

About Manulife

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. We operate as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2016, we had approximately 35,000 employees, 70,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 22 million customers. At the end of 2016, we had $977 billion (US$728 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made almost $26 billion in payments to our customers.


Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 100 years. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.

Manulife is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization. It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request an accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

West Coast Reduction Ltd. is searching for an Information System Business Analyst to join our Vancouver Head Office team. Using innovative thinking, progressive processes, and modern facilities, WCRL’s 7 plant locations across Western Canada recycle inedible food by-products and create finished products such as protein meals and fats which are then sold to customers worldwide. As an integral part of a sustainable local food chain, rendering keeps energy in the system by creating high value products from materials that would be otherwise sent to land fill or compost. We deliver raw material containers to suppliers, ship products globally and offer storage, shipping, refining and blending services through a terminal located at the Port Metro Vancouver. Edmonton, ABYOU KNOW HOW TO BE flexible.
YOU KNOW HOW TO BE agile.
Posted: 2019-02-01

Closing: When Filled

Location: Edmonton South
ABOUT YOU
The Alberta Motor Association (AMA) is on the lookout for a passionate, resourceful Product Owner who is a great communicator, negotiator, and facilitator. You will be a part of the agile delivery team, responsible for gathering requirements from stakeholders, refining vision into clear functional requirements, user stories and acceptance criteria, rationalizing, planning, prioritizing and monitoring the acceptability of stories in a timely manner using the AMA Agile Framework and tools.
If you can focus on the objectives and functionality to be delivered for a feature and within a sprint, then we want to talk to you. You might just be the person we're looking for to join our team.
WHAT MOVES YOU
You're a spirited team player who excels in a fast-paced environment and thrives on challenge.
You manage your time as expertly as you manage your projects. Prioritizing, planning and organizing is part of your DNA.
You strongly believe there's no such thing as an insignificant detail — you keep at it until every 'i' is dotted and every 't' is crossed.
You have the natural ability to reduce a complex concept or task into something that is manageable and can be clearly understood and communicated.
You have an inquisitive mind and love coming up with new ways to tackle a challenge and digging deeper to find the perfect solution to increase value for your customers.
You never sweat deadlines — you've got mad time management skills, so you always deliver on time.
You work well on your own but also enjoy being part of a team.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Report to the Product Owner Team Lead.
Develop relationships with Business partners to understand their business and provide recommendations and enhancements to solve their strategic and operational needs.
Plan and prioritize stories within a sprint plan.
Participate in daily triage/scrum meetings to resolve issues, addresses changes and report on progress.
Work with scrum team members to ensure the sprints content produces a functional package to leadership and key stakeholders.
Communicate with other agile team members to resolve any issues before escalating to the Product Manager.
Decompose the features into user stories to support priority business value delivery.
Provide and analyze data for the Product Manager to make informed decisions, mitigate risks, or take other actions.
Evaluate a problem/opportunity from both a business and consumer perspective to determine the best resolution approach.
Gather business/user requirements to support the functional or business solution by conducting interviews, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process description, document analysis, uses cases, tasks, and workflow analysis.
Report sprint metrics to the Product Manager to identify any major issues by keeping the AMA tracking tool up-to-date and running metric reports required for regular status cadence meetings.
WHAT YOU'VE DONE
You have post-secondary education/certification, or you are actively pursuing it in an applicable functional or business designation for the specified content area of management.
You have minimum 3 years of industry/functional experience.
You have minimum 3 years' experience under your belt in participating on multiple teams.
You have a firm understanding of agile project delivery methodologies and a certification would be an asset.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

In this position you will be reporting to the Aftermarket Program Manager. As the Aftermarket Provisioning Analyst you will manage inventory and all associated processes in the Aftermarket Branch plants in order to support contractual requirements for spares performance and UTAS requirements for inventory control. Responsible for establishing provisioning and forecasting tools and methodologies, you will be required to data mine and analyze via Excel extracts from SAP.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop and implement Aftermarket inventory forecasting methods in support of Aftermarket material provisioning, sales, consignment and service bulletin campaigns
Prepare and submit recommendations for inventory provisioning accompanied with a detailed analysis of cost, sales potential, commercial liability (if any), and delivery schedule
Input Aftermarket inventory requirements to SAP, APO and drive delivery requirements with Operations and Supply Chain
Manage inventory transactions and modifications for Aftermarket materials at global spares warehouses
Identify requirements for Aftermarket materials as a result of engineering change board meetings and order/modify inventory as required
Support Aftermarket requirements for SAP transactional discipline and physical inventory counts
Manage Aftermarket inventory to achieve targets set by the division
Manage the Consignment Inventory process in SAP with suppliers, customers and with Procurement
Review customer requirements and coordinate alternative schedules, including interfacing with Program Management to verify required/promise dates and delivery commitments in support of Sales Orders
Manage on-time delivery to satisfy internal/external customer requirements
Provide regular performance metrics reflecting all functions shown above
Perform other duties as required

Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in relevant technical discipline
APCIS or CPIM certification preferred
2+ years experience in similar role planning, forecasting, inventory provisioning, in an aftermarket environment is required, (Aerospace preferred)
Demonstrated strong understanding of forecasting methods and statistical analysis
Demonstrated strong understanding of BOM (Bill of Materials) structure and function
Strong ability to navigate technical publications, engineering manuals and drawings
Proven knowledge of the relationship between inventory levels and service levels
Robust understanding of the business including procurement, production control, and manufacturing
Highly analytical and creative problem solving skills
Strong organizational skills
Demonstrated strong proficiency in SAP, APO and MS Excel is strongly preferred
UTAS Values including Ethical Behavior, Customer Focused Improvement, Accountability & Teamwork and Openness & Inclusion

Overview:

This opportunity is for an analyst that is dynamic and inquisitive and who is self-reliant but also able to benefit from the mentoring of senior colleagues. The successful candidate for this role will work with national caliber clients and business partners in the automotive leasing and remarketing sectors.


The Company:

Canadian Dealer Lease Services, Inc. (CDLSI) is an acknowledged leader in the Canadian automotive leasing service sector and is the exclusive leasing partner for several top automotive brands in Canada. CDLSI manages the Customer Service, Accounting, and End of Term (EOT) operations for our partner brands. Our EOT Remarketing group is exclusively responsible for the remarketing of vehicles returned by lessees at the end of their leases and works to get the best value for our supported OEMs and banking partner for these returned vehicles.


Description:

The open position will specialize in providing the business information and analytics for management to actively manage the end-to-end vehicle remarketing process. This will include quantification of key aspects of the vehicle return and inspection process, segmentation of on-line and physical auction results, and other associated processes. Solid analytic experience is a must for this role.

The successful candidate will work with several external partner companies and internal stakeholders. Large amounts of data will need to be intelligently processed to derive key business information in a timely enough manner to support active remarketing decisions by senior staff or the needs of other internal and external stakeholders. The best candidates for this role will have the ability to improve, if warranted, current internal processes and data stores and representations and also be able to work with external partners to improve their data and processes.


Skills & Experience:

The successful candidate will need to have practical understanding of analytic tools and underlying statistics involved. Experience can come from a combination of education plus exposure in a work environment. A minimum of 2-3 years’ work experience can come from a combination of academia, the civil service, or the private sector for transportation, banking, engineering and other business driven markets.


Tools utilized should include at least a few Excel, MS ACCESS, VBA, and other related applications. Ability to work with SQL queries is desirable but not essential. Strong communication skills (written and verbal) are a must.


Reporting Analyst Task Areas:
 Producing monthly, weekly, and ad hoc reports plus some daily reports
 Lessee and vehicle segmentation reports
 Early termination metrics
 Profit/Loss reporting to OEM
 Operational process reporting
 Input for database maintenance

· Various other types of proprietary reporting
 Contributing to ongoing improvements to reports, processes, and systems

CDLSI does not discriminate against applicants based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, or disability or any other status or condition protected by applicable law.

Your stakeholder management skills, as much as your knowledge of Information Technology (IT) policy best practices in the IT and government sectors, and project methodology, will drive your success in this permanent, full-time position as a Senior Policy Analyst, with the City of Toronto.


Reporting to the Manager, Strategy, Policy and Issues Management, you will play a lead role in developing and delivering the corporate IT policy program for the City of Toronto. As a Senior Policy Analyst, IT, you will use a best practices approach in providing leadership and coordination in the design, development, implementation, management, monitoring and evaluation of the divisional IT policy program.


Major Responsibilities:

Your primary responsibilities as Senior Policy Analyst-IT will be varied. Specifically, you will:

Implements detailed plans and recommend policies and procedures regarding program-specific requirements.
Manages the day-to-day operation of all assigned staff on a project basis, including supervising, motivating and training staff, as well as encouraging and ensuring effective teamwork, high standards of work quality and organizational performance, continuous learning and innovation.
Manages the design, development, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of IT policies.
Secures compliance with sensitive legislation such as privacy laws and with general information and technology “best practices” and strategies in knowledge and information management through the appropriate research, analysis and development of policies, standards and procedures.
Provides advice on complex and possible controversial positions to senior management and Council through the development of papers, briefing notes and staff reports.
Manages IT Policy processes in conjunction with Information Technology Subject Matter Experts across the City.
Plans and implements the City’s corporate IT Policy program based on “best practices” in the IT and government sectors.
Conducts “best practices” research on topical IT Policies and emerging trends and related issues affecting the City of Toronto’s architecture.
Provides professional IT consulting and advisory services to the City’s business divisions and other Information & Technology (IT) work groups, as well as eCity projects.
Provides advice to senior management through the development of position papers, strategies, briefing notes, presentations and staff reports.
Facilitates and negotiates agreement between and among various parties and stakeholders to achieve common goals for delivery of IT Policy processes across the organization.
Manages the relationship with internal and external stakeholders in order to benchmark the City’s standards, including standards and practices against external organizations, as well as to achieve internal consensus where needed.
Key Qualifications:

Your application for the role of Senior Policy Analyst, should describe your qualifications as they relate to:

Post-secondary education in Public Policy, Business Administration or a related discipline and/or the equivalent combination of education and/or experience with relevant information technology or business systems experience.
Considerable experience providing strategic advice, policy/program development, research and evaluation in a large scale public or private organization.
Considerable experience consulting and establishing effective working relationships with all stakeholders including clients, management and staff at all levels.
Considerable experience in the development and deployment of research methodology, and policy particularly in the analysis and assessment of a broad range of IT issues, trends and directions.
Considerable experience in project leadership by mediating, negotiating and facilitating projects and work teams.
Strong stakeholder management, partnership and relationship-building skills to initiate and nurture strong working relationships with colleagues throughout the IT Division, corporation and external community, to achieve mutual goals and objectives. Highly developed interpersonal skills and demonstrated proficiency in conflict resolution in complex, multi-stakeholder situations.
Strong oral and written communication skills to prepare and present detailed research proposals, methodologies, standards, project plans, and reports.
Superior project management and team leadership skills to provide project planning and leadership on concurrent standards development projects and to manage deadlines and competing priorities
Excellent strategic, analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
Strong analytical thinking skills to apply several analytical techniques to break apart complex problems into component parts, identify several solutions, and weigh the value of each.
Technical skills to operate various software programs to prepare own materials.
Ability to be strategic to understand and assess the external impact of trends and issues on internal standards and planning.
Knowledge and understanding of: Project methodology, IT governance structure, decision-making processes and service management (including COBIT and ITIL).
Knowledge of the City's legislative framework and decision-making processes would be an asset.
Knowledge and understanding of: IT standards (hardware, software, telecommunication, security, data, ISO, ANSI, IEC, IEEE, ISACC, INCITS, etc.) would be an asset.
Equity, Diversity and Inclusion:
The City of Toronto is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment where all employees and members of the public feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the public and the communities in which we live and serve.

If you are an individual who requires accommodation to apply to this position, due to disability under the Ontario Human Rights Code, please email us at application.accomodation3@toronto.ca, quoting job ID #2320757 and the job title. The City is committed to providing Code-protected accommodation throughout its hiring process. Please visit Hiring Policies and Statements for further details.

Job Summary
Who we are:

CIHR is the Government of Canada's health research investment agency. CIHR's mission is to support a healthier Canada by leading investment in innovative and collaborative research and helping to solve our health care challenges today and in the future.

Why work for the Canadian Institutes of Health Research?

The Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR) is dedicated to creating a healthy and stimulating work environment; promoting synergies and a collaborative culture across the organization, including with its institutes and external stakeholders.

CIHR is located in the heart of downtown Ottawa at 160 Elgin Street, close to transit and many shops and restaurants.

Intent of Process:

The intent of this process is to staff various term and indeterminate positions by creating a pool of pre-qualified qualified candidates to also staff future similar positions within CIHR with various tenures (assignment, specified period or indeterminate), various security clearance levels and bilingual linguistic profiles.

Job Summary:

Reporting directly to the Project Lead, the incumbent is responsible for supporting the business operations of an assigned set of funding related business systems and business processes; as well as supporting integrated projects to design, test, and assess the impact of business system changes.

The incumbent will be required to be collaborative while consulting extensively with multiple internal and external stakeholders, to achieve consensus. The outcome will be developing project work plans, documenting business needs, identifying issues and risks, and proposing mitigations to keep the project on track. Additionally, the incumbent will support and maintain change control procedures and makes recommendations to continuously improve processes and tools.

Our ideal candidate will be able to build relationships, manage multiple requests, and be innovative while working with our team to support the design, implementation, and continuous improvement of CIHR’s funding-related business systems and business processes that support the delivery of CIHR’s core programs and services.

EDUCATION:

Bachelor’s degree from a recognized university or a combination of education, training and experience.

liaising with different stakeholders to support the planning, design, development, and testing of business system and process enhancementspreparing project plans, reports, briefing notes, and presentations that were widely distributed and/or presented to a variety of audiences and/or used to support organizational decision-making.with business process mapping as well as capturing, scripting, and managing business requirements

If contacted in relation to a job opportunity or testing, please inform us of accommodations (i.e., an alternative method of assessment, a technical aid, accessibility requirements, etc.) required at any stage of the assessment process, so that we can take the appropriate measures to facilitate your full participation.

CIHR
The Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR) is the Government of Canada's health research investment agency. CIHR's mission is to create new scientific knowledge and to enable its translation into improved health, more effective health services and products, and a strengthened health care system for Canadians. Composed of 13 Institutes, CIHR provides leadership and support to more than 13,000 health researchers and trainees across Canada.

Analyste des activités opérationnelles (Inventaire)

Résumé du poste
Notre organisation :

Les Instituts de recherche en santé du Canada (IRSC) sont l’organisme du gouvernement du Canada chargé d’investir dans la recherche en santé. Ils ont pour mission de veiller à la santé de la population canadienne par des investissements dans la recherche innovante et collaborative qui permettra de relever les défis actuels et à venir en matière de soins de santé.

Pourquoi travailler aux IRSC?

Les IRSC ont à cœur de créer un climat de travail sain et stimulant, ainsi qu’à promouvoir les synergies et une culture de collaboration dans l’ensemble de l’organisation, y compris dans leurs instituts et dans leurs relations avec les parties prenantes externes.

Les bureaux des IRSC sont situés au cœur du centre-ville d’Ottawa, au 160, rue Elgin, à proximité du transport en commun, des boutiques et des restaurants.

Objectif du concours:

Ce concours vise à doter divers postes termes et indéterminés, en créant un bassin de candidats préqualifiés pouvant servir à pourvoir des postes similaires aux IRSC, mais dont la durée (affectation, poste de durée déterminée ou indéterminée), la cote de sécurité et le profil linguistique varient.

Résumé des fonctions:

Le titulaire du poste, qui relève directement du chef de projet, est chargé de soutenir les activités d’un ensemble de processus et de systèmes opérationnels liés au financement, ainsi que des projets intégrés visant à concevoir et à tester des changements aux systèmes opérationnels et à en évaluer l’impact.


Le titulaire devra avoir un esprit de collaboration et interagir régulièrement avec diverses parties internes et externes afin d’en arriver à un consensus. Leurs fonctions consisteront à élaborer des plans de travail, à définir les besoins opérationnels, à cerner les enjeux et les risques, et à proposer des mesures d’atténuation pour mener à bien les projets. Le titulaire devra aussi établir et tenir à jour les procédures de contrôle du changement et faire des recommandations par souci de constamment améliorer les processus et les outils.

Le candidat idéal sera apte à établir des relations, à gérer de multiples demandes et à faire preuve d’innovation en travaillant avec notre équipe afin de contribuer à la conception, à la mise en œuvre et à l’amélioration continue des systèmes et processus opérationnels liés au financement des IRSC, lesquels soutiennent l’exécution et la prestation des programmes et services de base de l’organisation.

Qualifications essentielles
ÉTUDES
Baccalauréat d’une université reconnue ou combinaison acceptable d’études, de formation et d’expérience.
EXPÉRIENCE (acquise sur au moins 2 ans)
travailler en liaison avec diverses parties prenantes à la planification, à la conception, au développement et à l’essai de systèmes opérationnels, ainsi qu’à l’amélioration des processuspréparer des plans de projet, des rapports, des notes d’information et des exposés qui ont été largement diffusés ou présentés à divers auditoires, ou utilisés pour soutenir la prise de décision organisationnelleconnaissance pratique de la mise en correspondance des processus opérationnels, ainsi que du recensement, de la définition et de la gestion des exigences opérationnelles

CONNAISSANCES
Connaissance approfondie de l’analyse opérationnelle, du recensement et de la gestion des besoins, de la définition des exigences et du contrôle des changements nécessaires.Connaissance approfondie des principes de conception et de gestion des processus.
COMPÉTENCES
Savoir communiquer (oralement et par écrit)Capacité de travailler avec les autres (collaborer, gérer des relations)Faculté d’adaptationSens de la planification et de l’organisationInitiativePensée critiqueJugement
Qualifications constituant un atout
ÉTUDES
Diplôme d’études supérieures en administration ou en sciences de la vie ou de la santé.Formation ou accréditation d’analyste de gestion.
EXPÉRIENCE
manipulation et analyse de données et de renseignements
recherche en santéutilisation d’outils et de techniques de visualisation des donnéesgestion de projet (recours à des outils, à des méthodes et aux meilleures pratiques).
Exigences linguistiques
Divers profils linguistiques (BBB/BBB, anglais essentiel)

Notes importantes
1) Ce processus de sélection vise la constitution d’un bassin de candidats préqualifiés afin de doter de futurs postes identiques ou similaires aux IRSC. Ces postes pourraient prendre différentes formes (affectations, postes de durée déterminée ou de durée indéterminée).

2) Les demandes doivent être présentées par l’entremise du système de suivi des candidats (SSC) (numéro du processus de sélection : J0219-0647).

3) Aucun accusé de réception ne sera envoyé. Nous remercions à l’avance tous ceux et celles qui auront soumis leur candidature, mais nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes retenues pour l’examen ou l’entrevue.

4) Les candidats devront passer une entrevue, et peut-être aussi un examen écrit.

5) Les IRSC souscrivent aux valeurs et aux principes d’équité en matière d’emploi. Si l'on communique avec vous concernant une occasion d’emploi ou un examen, veuillez nous informer de tout accommodement requis (c.-à-d. autre méthode d’évaluation, aide technique, aide à l’accès, etc.) à n’importe quelle étape du processus d’évaluation, afin que nous puissions prendre les mesures nécessaires pour faciliter votre participation pleine et entière.

6) Parmi les candidats répondant aux exigences essentielles quant aux études et à l’expérience, les IRSC pourront retenir les mieux classés et leur permettre ainsi de passer à la prochaine étape du processus de sélection.

7) Veuillez noter que les IRSC sont un organisme fédéral (employeur distinct) qui n’est pas régi par la Loi sur l’emploi dans la fonction publique.

IRSC
Les Instituts de recherche en santé du Canada (IRSC) sont l'organisme du gouvernement du Canada chargé d'investir dans la recherche en santé. L'objectif des IRSC est de créer de nouvelles connaissances scientifiques et d'en favoriser l'application en vue d'améliorer la santé, d'offrir de meilleurs produits et services de santé, et de renforcer le système de soins de santé au Canada. Composés de 13 instituts, les IRSC offrent leadership et soutien à plus de 13 000 chercheurs et stagiaires en santé dans tout le Canada.

Considérations particulières
Vous devez joindre une lettre de présentation qui illustre clairement vos intérêts professionnels et personnels quant au poste d’analyste des activités opérationnelles. Votre lettre doit également présenter des exemples concrets et détaillés qui montrent explicitement que vous respectez les critères d’études et d’expérience énoncés sous les rubriques « Qualifications essentielles » et « Qualifications constituant un atout ». À défaut de fournir une lettre de présentation détaillée et un CV, votre candidature sera retirée du concours.

As an Analyst a Strategy and Investment, you will be responsible for strategic innovation on behalf of our clients and the tactical execution to bring those strategies to life.
