Blacks Harbour, NBFinancial Business Analyst

Cooke is a global seafood company with operations in North America, Europe, and South America. Our company’s success is driven by our dynamic, highly-skilled and innovative management team, supported by dedicated employees who live in coastal communities and contribute to the local area’s economy and sense of community.

The Role:

As a result of our robust growth we are seeking a Financial Business Analyst for our Seawater Office in Blacks Harbour, NB. You will lead the forecasting process, working with management employees from our seawater operations to streamline the periodic forecasting and modelling process. You will prepare fixed asset budgeting, update projections and aide with the consolidation of information for senior executive. You will support the overall Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) function for the seawater group of companies. Additionally, you will be required to perform cost of production and key performance indicator analysis and will be assigned to specific projects as required.

You will have a minimum of 3 years of financial analysis experience, a professional designation considered an asset, and have finely tuned organizational and detail management skills.

The successful candidate will be a self-starter that thrives in a very dynamic work and data driven environment and will be proficient with Excel.

The Opportunity:

The role description is just one part of the story. This is an opportunity to grow, to stretch, to work within the parameters of the role but stretch to your fullest potential. We are a team that counts performance, we reward contribution and we recognize talent. It is about being at the center of the fastest growing company in New Brunswick and knowing you are part of that growth. The ability to bring your passion for learning, desire for growth, and energy for moving your career forward is what we offer.

The Why:

Why Cooke…simple because we are a company that rewards initiative, resourcefulness and work ethic. We will champion your growth and provide you with the platform to create your path, your career, and your future.

$72,444 - $94,964 a yearDo you enjoy working with data? Are you ready to expand your knowledge and skills for transforming data into high quality information enabling health system evidence-based decision making? If so, the Analytics and Performance Reporting (APR) Branch in the Health System Quality and Performance (HSQP) Division has an exciting opportunity for you!

APR responds to internal and external requests for analytic information and reporting to support informed decision making, business planning, health system monitoring, evaluation, performance management, and policy development.


In this role you will be working independently or leading project teams, preparing analytic information and reports, creating data cubes, data marts and data visualizations, and providing analytics support to the Ministry and other health system stakeholders.


You will employ your analytical and research skills to select the most appropriate methodologies, define the research problems, collect, transform and analyze data, write computer programs in SAS/R/Python, and use data science and machine learning algorithms as deemed necessary. You will be expected to conduct literature review, research on methodology, write qualitative and quantitate results in plain language for reporting purpose, apply your technical knowledge about managing very large databases for complex analytics initiatives and data management.

To be successful in this role, you need to be self-directed and have the knowledge, skills and abilities to engage in collaborative relationships with clients requesting analytic information products and seeking analytic support.

The following APS Competencies are critical to this role:

Drive for Results: The ability to manage a number of projects in a timely and cost effective manner so they follow provincial government and industry best practices.

Develop Self and Others: The job revolves around complex projects with the goal of producing high quality work within tight time constraints. The candidate must be skillful in identifying options and implementing contingency plans as well as having the ability to quickly shift priorities.

Build Collaborative Environments: By providing advice on information products and issues and also advise on areas of expertise to a range of stakeholders.


Qualifications

A University degree (Master's preferred) in statistics, computer science, public health/administration, biostatistics, economics, finance, or equivalents, plus a minimum of 4 years of directly related experience is required. Must have SAS programming skills (Classic or Enterprise Guide). Experience in SQL (Structured Query Language), R, or Python are desired. Project management experience is beneficial. Experience with health-related and/or large datasets is an asset. Research and professional writing skills will also be considered an asset. Equivalencies will be considered.


Competencies

Competencies are behaviors that are essential to reach our goals in serving Albertans. We encourage you to have an in depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process. The link below will assist you with understanding competencies: http://www.psc.alberta.ca/Practitioners/?file=learning/apscompetencies/titlepage&cf=9


Salary

job_title: Supply Chain Analyst - SD Key User
job_description:
Our purpose is simple and compelling: To release the natural power of stone to enrich modern living.
ROCKWOOL products save energy and water and reduce CO2 emissions, protect buildings from the spread of fire; reduce waste; improve acoustic comfort, building performance and aesthetics; and enhance Precision Growing, thereby improving the efficiency of fresh food production.
While the stone we use may be millions of years old, what we do with it is cutting-edge. Every day, ROCKWOOL colleagues are developing and applying new technologies to release yet more potential of stone wool to enrich modern life.
Would you also be proud to enrich society like we do? now to join us as we improve modern living conditions for millions of people worldwide.
POSITION: Supply Chain Analyst
The ROCKWOOL Group’s main business area is building insulation, providing thermal comfort along with fire safety and acoustical comfort for all types of buildings.
This is the Role:
Responsible for gathering data and conducting analysis with the goal of improving the organizations’ s supply chain
operations.
Sets and or, works within the guidelines of decision authority
Respects, listens, learns and challenges others thinking in a constructive manner to help all to improve in everything that we do.
Produces solutions to various challenges and problems, and able to connect one issue with the bigger picture.
Analyses and structures information and communications to meet audience’s needs.
Seeks new opportunities and ways to improve.
Develops innovative products, processes, ideas and solutions.
Utilize computer systems and software in order to research, analyze and document failures and inefficiencies in the supply chain in order to improve overall supply chain effectiveness.
Supply Chain Reporting – Create and generate reports as required by Supply Chain Management using Business Warehouse and Rockbis queries.
Maintain Price records in SAP
Coordinate Online Price List updates.
Maintain external Customer data bases.
Generate monthly Claims report
Analyse Customer issues to develop tools and process to improve customer satisfaction.
Execute SD related projects, including testing, documentation, and analysis
Provide EDI support for SD and LES Modules – including but not limited to, new customer set ups, new carrier set ups, changes to current accounts, trouble shooting and problem solving
Liaise with GRIT EDI support team, perform system testing
Create and maintain documentation relating to EDI functions
Maintain SD Master Data (SAP)– new accounts, customer hierarchy, pricing and discounts
Create templates for uploads as required
Support Customer Service and Accounts Receivable staff with Master data issues
Liaise with Marketing Company to ensure price list data and format is correct
MM Master Data – Assist Optimization Manager with MM master data duties when necessary (vacation, sickness, projects)
Provide efficient and accurate data entry into business system
This is what you offer:
Accredited University / College Degree, Appropriate College or Trade Accreditation, or equivalent experience.
Computer literate (Word, Excel)
5+ years’ experience in a related functional area
Knowledge of SAP
Drive, commitment, self-motivation and high energy.
Ability to work under pressure,
Good communication skills,
Passionate and values driven and will embrace the company’s core values including integrity, honesty and trust
Problem solving abilities
Practical business sense
Ability to successfully manage multiple priorities and meet established deadlines in a fact paced environment
Interested?
If you recognize yourself in this opportunity, please apply, sending an English version of your resume.
ABOUT ROCKWOOL North America
At the ROCKWOOL Group, we are committed to enriching the lives of everyone who comes into contact with our solutions. Our expertise is perfectly suited to tackle many of today’s biggest sustainability and development challenges, from energy consumption and noise pollution to fire resilience, water scarcity and flooding. Our range of products reflects the diversity of the world’s needs, while supporting our stakeholders in reducing their own carbon footprint. Stone wool is a versatile material and forms the basis of all our businesses. With approx. 10,500 passionate colleagues in 38 countries, we are the world leader in stone wool solutions, from building insulation to acoustic ceilings, external cladding systems to horticultural solutions, engineered fibres for industrial use to insulation for the process industry and marine & offshore. We encourage you to join our team!

Edmonton, ABInternshipJob Field:
Facility/Property Management
Job Type:
Internship/Co-op
Length of Assignment:
Summary of BGIS

BGIS, A Brookfield Company, is a leading provider of real estate management services, including facilities management, project delivery services, energy and sustainability solutions, building performance management, workplace advisory and management, and real estate services. With a combined team of over 7,000 team members globally, BGIS inspires better business performance across its client's real estate portfolios by developing and implementing real estate and facilities management strategies. Globally, BGIS manages over 300 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia.

Inspire change for a more sustainable future

As a current student or recent graduate, you are likely searching for an exceptional opportunity that will launch a bright and exciting professional future. A career with BGIS is one that leads the real estate management services industry, inspires change for a more sustainable future, makes a difference in our communities, and drives innovation through best practices and technology.

Your career starts with you ... your drive to be inspired in the work that you do. Innovation, change, personal growth ... it's all here at BGIS. So seize the opportunity and take control of your future.

If you are currently studying towards a degree or have graduated from university or college, with a major in Engineering, Building Sciences, Business, Arts or a technical program, we invite you to explore your potential and grow with us! We will provide you with the tools and resources you’ll need to successfully learn about our business and an exceptional learning experience that will help you meet the challenges of a continuously evolving industry.

Responsibilities of our internship and new graduate roles will include:

Collaborating with members of your own team as well as other functional areas within the organization to complete tasks and assignments related to your work stream as required.
You will apply basic and some advanced support or paraprofessional skills in procedures, processes and techniques appropriate for the position within the assigned functional area.
You will work under direction and select from a variety of established procedures to accomplish assigned tasks.
The Intern will shadow and assist BGIS Strategic Information Manager/Facility Management Staff with the following tasks:

STRATEGIC INFORMATION/QUALITY
Participates in client meetings to discuss client requirements. Facilitates the execution of client requirements with the account or product line team and the client
Audits account and product line team’s work execution to ensure compliance with factors including but not limited to internal processes and service delivery obligations
Collaborates with relevant stakeholders to ensure data integrity of operations data within applicable databases for assigned account
Identifies solutions to implement changes in internal processes and technologies for the assigned account. Collaborates with the account and product line team to implement changes
Collaborates with the client and account or product line leaders to identify and establish performance metrics, baseline levels and improvement targets
Compiles, monitors, measures, analyzes and reports performance results
Conducts root cause analysis and identifies business issues contributing to performance gaps, recommends solutions to remediate performance gaps and resolve business issues
Monitors action plan for progress
Supports process improvement efforts. Conducts business process audits and analysis to determine process effectiveness and to identify areas for improvement. Participates in the review, development and refinement of business processes. Leads the implementation, facilitates the adoption of processes and monitors for compliance for the assigned account
FACILITY MANAGEMENT

Manage external service providers, including consultants and other contractors, to ensure that the deliveries of facilities services are done according to clients’ expectations and contractual obligations.
Manage assigned projects, including outside contractors, and monitor all work that is being done in a way to help ensure success.
Conduct regular inspections of facilities for compliance, client satisfaction and asset integrity.
Help to resolve client service contract issues to ensure a high level of client service.
Create purchase orders for the payment of services and monitor vendor invoices
Administer environmental and energy management strategies and initiatives.
Ensure client satisfaction; identify / monitor issues as they arise and implement prompt solutions.


Please note that this position does not provide a subsidy for relocation expenses. Thank you for your interest in joining BGIS.

job_title: Business Intelligence Financial Analyst, 12 month term
job_description:
Ottawa, ONTemporaryHear what the hiring manager, Pier, has to say. Click here
With close to 50 years of physician-focused experience, MD has one main goal: to help Canada's physicians and their families achieve financial well-being. Our commitment to work/life integration, employee well-being and ongoing learning are key factors that contribute to our overall success.
For the sixth consecutive year, MD Financial Management has been recognized as one of the Achievers 50 Most Engaged Workplaces in North America. The annual award, given by Achievers, an industry-leading provider of employee recognition and engagement solutions, commends top employers that display leadership and innovation in engaging their workforces.
MD Financial Management’s Corporate Financial Analytics (CFA) team is looking for a talented, curious, and motivated Business Intelligence Financial Analyst. This team is responsible for all financial-driven analysis across the company, producing financial models, data analytics and client reporting including building, designing, and maintaining data visualizations. In this role you will collaborate with members of the Corporate Financial Analytics team, the Enterprise Data Warehouse and Client Insight teams to generate unique insights which support and advance enterprise strategy.

We are a dynamic, highly involved team of data professionals who love what we do! If you are a strong communicator with great interpersonal skills, have hands-on experience with data analytics, and enjoy learning both new business and technical concepts, this may be the right challenge for you!

What You Will Do:

Answer tough analytical questions in an intuitive and understandable way, and confidently communicate the results to a variety of audiences
Be a key player in more complex data science projects involving large-scale data analysis, algorithms, and predictive modeling
Master our business and data environment to become an expert problem-solver using advanced modelling techniques
Organize and research economic trends, industry developments, industry benchmarks, MDF revenue and cost structure and, by considering internal priorities and the results of the research, identify opportunities for growth, enhanced revenue, greater expense effectiveness and profitability margins
Manage crucial aspects of organizational data quality: contribute to data documentation, quality assurance, and sharing of best practices across the enterprise
Lead the creation and maintenance of compelling data visualizations and dashboards to deliver insights about the business

What You Need:

You are an outstanding communicator: you actively listen, use a minimum of jargon, and are easily understood even when speaking with non-technical people
You drive change and momentum; you finish what you start and aren’t shy about sharing your work
You are inherently curious, have a passion for what you do, and actively seek new ways to improve
You LOVE learning new tools, techniques, and concepts
You make ‘getting things done’ a priority
You enjoy the collaborative process and look forward to partnering with other teams to get things done

What You Bring:

An undergraduate degree in a related field: Economics, Statistics, Business, Computer Science, Statistics, or equivalent work experience
3-5 years of analytics experience: you are skilled at using data to answer tough questions and can demonstrate this
4+ years of business experience: you have experience relating data to business operations and you understand the link between business goals and corporate results and KPIs
Experience with BI and data wrangling tools outside of the standard Microsoft suite (Excel/Access), such as SAS, Tableau, PowerBI, Crystal Reports, Cognos BI, etc.
Experience working with complex data across a variety of data sources, such as relational databases, data warehouses, text files, and web data (APIs)
Assets include:

Ability to speak both English and French
Experience working with senior leadership teams
Applied experience with other areas of data analysis: text mining, machine learning, predictive modeling, etc.
Hands-on experience with Tableau and/or open source tools/web libraries (Pandas, Shiny, D3, etc.)
Experience with open source tools like Python and R
An advanced degree in a related field: Masters/PhD mathematics, IT, economics, stats, etc.
Financial industry knowledge and experience

What Success Looks Like:

You take great pride in the effective and thorough working relationships you have developed across MD.

You are constantly learning and honing your skills.

You are technology savvy and endeavor to find new and exciting ways to use technology.

You feel rewarded and recognized in a way that inspires you to do your best work.

You are engaged, enthusiastic and clearly understand how what you do contributes to MD’s overall success.

Licensing Analyst
Your passion is striving for Operational Excellence!
The role as a Licensing Analyst is responsible for the integrity and accuracy of Softchoice database systems. The Analyst will maintain service level agreements and deliver accurate information to various business units. This individual is responsible for compiling data and carrying out statistical analyses to evaluate data quality and deliver accurate information to various business units.
Reporting to the Director, Licensing Operations, this incumbent will have accountability for internal reporting to support our partner programs and incentives. You will oversee best practices related to reporting, reconciliation and analysis of monthly performance files. Your understanding of the Microsoft program and incentive policies will allow you to provide guidance with operational execution.
We are looking for someone that can contextualize strategic vision, with the learning agility to think nimbly, communicate and co-ordinate cross-functionally and find creative solutions.
Your mission as the Licensing Analyst for the Licensing Group at Softchoice will focus on:
Establishing, maintaining, and executing licensing policies and workflow management. You will proactively manage the integrity and accuracy of the licensing database. You will be responsible for managing the policies that govern Softchoice’s licensing data including acquisition of data, transformation, and handoff to downstream systems to ensure compliance, through a high focus on innovation and data analytics.
Responsibilities will include in-taking business needs to identify variances or gaps, identifying inherent/ residual risk(s) to drive department automation and most importantly, supporting the Director with business transformation initiatives for scalable growth and increased profitability.
We’re looking for an incumbent who will be responsible for:
1. Data Quality and Reporting
Assist in establishing policies and procedures to ensure licensing data meets defined quality targets.
Establish data policies and procedures to ensure data meets or exceeds quality metrics as defined in the Licensing Scorecard.
Work with stakeholders, especially IT and the SFDC Team, to inform and drive system improvements to increase data integrity.
Work closely with IT to help maintain/develop/refine the data model to ensure it meets business needs.
Creation of reports and dashboards that provide the data necessary to measure business performance and analyze trends.
Understanding and analyzing changes of new incentive programs to determine impact to current business performance.
2. Analytics and Process Management
Assist in defining key performance indicator (KPIs) for all licensing data parameters, and build/maintain relevant dashboards.
Assist the licensing teams in the creation of business rules, data structures and entities to maximize automation and increase accuracy rate.
Proactively identify data issues, perform root cause analysis and provide recommendation to drive data issue resolution.
Maintain changes to data process maps, document new processes and support ongoing audit requirements.
3. Project Management
Work with cross-functional teams to deliver process improvement projects.
Management of project plan(s) for all ongoing projects within the Licensing Operations Team.
Act as a subject matter expert and support corporate projects to ensure that processes meet corporate data policies and procedures best practices.
As our ideal candidate you’ll also have:
Post-Secondary Degree (BA in Economics, Finance, or Business OR BSc in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, or Mathematics)
1+ years of experience in business analytics or business operations
Excellent interpersonal skills with strong orientation towards high energy teams based work environments
Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with senior management and other business units
Self-driven, motivated to excel, ability to work with minimal supervision, and maintain productivity
Strong sense of internal customer and the importance of the voice of customer
Knowledge of SQL or Python required.
How Do We Hire Great People?
We believe in matching the right people for the right role. Once you’ve applied for a position, our team of Talent Advisors will review your resume and application against all open roles at Softchoice. We also keep in mind any future or upcoming roles you may be a fit for. As part of our selection, onboarding and development process, we utilize tools to help us better match candidates with our roles.
Applying for a role at Softchoice is not complete until you have completed both the formal online application and the Predictive Index tool (PI). Completing the PI tool will take no more than 10 minutes of your time.

If we see a match with your skills and our open roles, we will reach out to you to schedule time to talk so that we can learn more about you and you can learn about us. Only those candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted directly. However, we will retain your application on file and would be pleased to contact you if further opportunities arise.
Need more convincing this is the right next step in your career? Here are the reasons why folks love working here!
Softchoice has been recognized as a Best Workplace in Canada by the Great Place to Work Institute for 13 consecutive years
Softchoice certified as a Great Place to Work in the United States (2016)
Meaningful work that drives professional development
Ability to enter and grow within the technology industry
Being part of a winning, high performance team
Every employee gets two paid volunteer days per year
We serve large and mid-sized clients from a variety of industries
We’ve raised over $2 Million through our staff-run charity Softchoice Cares
1 in 5 employees have invested in an ownership position in Softchoice
About Softchoice
Softchoice is one of the largest IT solutions and Managed Services providers in North America! We are an influential, growth-oriented organization determined to enable our people, our clients, our partners and the communities we serve to realize their potential. Our unique culture fosters a friendly, open-minded workplace where employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work. As a member of a dynamic, high-performing team, each Softchoice employee is hungry to learn, valued for their contribution, and approaches each day excited to make an impact.
We would like to thank you personally for applying to Softchoice.

Please note that we will review your application and only those candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted directly. However, we will retain your application on file and would be pleased to contact you if further opportunities arise.
Again, thank you for your interest in a career at Softchoice!Note: Completion of a satisfactory criminal record check, education verification and reference checks are required prior to employment.

AccommodationSoftchoice is proud to provide employment accommodation during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodations, please let us know in your application or reach out to asktalentacquisition@softchoice.com and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

#LI-JC1

Toronto, ONPosition:

Supervisor, Data Governance


Reports To:

Sr. Manager – Data Governance & Analysis


Tier:

Supervisor/Team Lead


Department:

Data Governance & Service Optimization


Company:

GS1 Canada


Location:
Toronto


Status:

Permanent, Full Time


Job Number:

1434



Keys To The Role

Our mission is to generate the greatest possible return on internal data assets by protecting the integrity of enterprise information through data management policies and guidelines. This requires a deep understanding of governance principles and a genuine desire to create, document and audit the conditions which will enforce its robustness.

Reporting to the Sr. Manager, Data Governance & Analysis, the Team Lead, Data Governance will spearhead a team of Analysts to manage organization-wide data governance activities and will have responsibility for improving the quality and maintaining the integrity of subscriber data and information assets. In addition, they will assist in defining indicators of performance and quality metrics and ensure compliance with data related policies, standards, roles and responsibilities, and adoption requirements that aid in increasing cost recovery.

The Team Lead, Data Governance will manage day-to-day activities and workflows by monitoring timelines, allocating resources and ensuring all deliverables are met. This may involve addressing escalations and negotiating deadlines. Data is our asset and thus ensuring Analysts are conducting thorough review of policies and procedures is critical for this role. While being adaptable and responsive to changing priorities, the Lead will also contribute operationally where and when required.

The Team Lead, Data Governance will possess solid understanding of GS1 Canada’s data content across various platforms and will develop and maintain strong relationships with SMEs across the organization to develop this knowledge. The incumbent will be a champion in establishing best practices while maintaining standards and be a pillar of consistency which the team can emulate, and the business can rely on. They will work closely with the Team Lead, Data Analysis to ensure standard operating procedures are clearly documented and reviewed regularly, processes are mapped, and protocols are followed.


Core Responsibilities
Lead day-to-day data governance operations of 2 or more analysts within the GS1 Data Governance & Service Optimization umbrella
Analyze and oversee strategies designed to enhance data reliability and minimize redundancies and complications
Propose and/or establish the policies, standards, rules, processes and technologies to effectively manage GS1 Canada’s data assets.
Create and maintain common data dictionaries and the tools or methods that support data standards for an organization
Work closely with senior business and technology leaders to create programs, disciplines and practices to significantly improve the ownership and quality of critical data assets.
Have a key role in guiding and influencing various stakeholders across the organization to achieve the goals defined in the enterprise data governance and enterprise data management strategies.
Coach Analysts in validating and modeling data with the purpose of defining clear governance protocols.
Triages requests from the business using workflow management tools, prioritize and delegate tasks. Follow-up daily/weekly on request status and ensuring progress is being made and deadlines are met.
Evaluate business requirements gathered from multiple sources and identify underlying business needs vs wants and work with Analysts to prioritize development efforts.
Create process maps which succinctly represents the flow of data and key decision-making steps.
Closely monitor project resources, tasks, risks and milestones. Bring forward blockers and make recommendations on course corrections when necessary. Act as a point of contact to resolve policy, procedure, or technical issues within the scope of Data Governance Team’s responsibilities and ensuring prompt escalation to Sr. Manager or Sr. Director for critical or time sensitive issues.
Champions initiatives to enhance data quality by identifying opportunities for continuous improvement and efficiencies in reporting, analysis and/or product development
Develop data remediation plans: Monitor and track quality issues, identify gaps, and build action plans to remediate gaps
Lead and develop team members in technical proficiencies required for them to succeed in their roles
Assist with screening, interviewing new staff and conducting onboarding/training as required
Ensure ongoing understanding of relevant emerging technologies and services provided by GS1 Canada.


Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience
University degree or college diploma in business, science, mathematics or a related area of study; or combination of skills and experience in working in high performing teams
A minimum of 2-3 years’ work experience, preferably in data management, governance, reporting and/or analysis
Preferred minimum of 1-year team management experience in supervisory or team lead capacity, or senior analyst with proven ability to lead.
Ability to analyze, understand and effectively communicate/confirm business requirements, technical design and operational implementation of systems and processes
Proven ability to apply critical thinking. Able to read between the lines to extrapolate requirements not explicitly written or identified and anticipates next steps
Proficiency with Excel and advanced capability with other MS Office applications highly desirable
Background in business intelligence (BI) and familiarity with master data management highly preferred.
Knowledge of Data Warehouses, design and/or architecture highly desired
Demonstrated ability to coach and guide others through both technical and situational problem solving
Works with passion and promotes optimism; fosters respect and builds trust; exhibits confidence in self and develops in others
Takes pride in the team’s work and celebrates their success
Validates with vigour to ensure accuracy and correctness; follows-up promptly
Meticulous with high attention to detail particularly when reviewing work of others
Proven ability to work on multiple projects, multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
Entrepreneurial spirit suited for fast-paced, results-based environment, requiring flexibility to ever-changing needs
Demonstrated ability to interact in a professional and courteous manner
Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to positively influence others; communicate with a negotiating standard
Able to speak and present to stakeholders at all levels
Strong organizational focus, with demonstrated analytical, problem solving and planning skills
Working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamic CRM would be an asset

Overview
Purpose:
To manage and support the scheduled and ad-hoc reporting functions of the dedicated portfolio. Utilizing quantitative and qualitative data to help measure the effectiveness of sales programs, brand marketing initiatives, and sales campaigns. Collaborate with partners to help plan, execute, and deliver programs according to KPIs and key imperatives.

Department: Trade Development

Reports To: Business Manager
Responsibilities
Required Duties:
Lead the reporting needs of the portfolio and the creation of ad hoc reporting according to business needs
Collaborate with provincial leadership to measure and assess the effectiveness of strategies and tactics in retail and on-premise, measuring KPIs, and reporting on a regular basis
Collaborate with internal partners including finance, business analytics, and shared services to deliver weekly, monthly and ad hoc reporting
Own the gathering and reporting on monthly wins from the field
Collaborate in the creation of business reviews gathering data and insights that will add value to the business and also communicate the effectiveness of key programs and initiatives
Collaborate with business partners to identify key customers where programs can be successful and tactics are maximized
Collaborate with the business manager to ensure the portfolio and brand strategies / key initiatives / sales incentives are top of mind in the field
Must be able to:
Live and demonstrate the company values.
Build and grow relationships with key client contacts including brand managers, marketing, logistics and finance
Build and grow relationships with internal partners including provincial leadership, analytics, trade development, and finance
Understand, analyze and summarize business metrics and quantify key imperatives
Demonstrate and exhibit high levels of professionalism with internal and external customers
Qualifications
Required Skills & Experience:

Degree in Business Management, Administration, or finance is preferred
4 years of business experience in CPG / beverage alcohol / finance is preferred
Proven analytical skills, experience working with and manipulating data
Experience utilizing analytics and reporting tools / databases; taking raw data and creating business presentations
Proficient or expert level of experience in Excel, Powerpoint and other MS Office products
Excellent negotiation and influencing Skills
Takes initiative, self starter
Strong interpersonal skills
Excellent communication skills: verbal, listening and written
Strong organizational and multi-tasking capabilities
Seek out new ideas, exhibit initiative and be proactive

At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize her dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.

Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuels us, and moments define us.

Who we are

We are Rogers, a dynamic Canadian media and telecommunications company. Innovation is our legacy and building a brilliant digital future is our mission. As a leading Canadian company, we are passionate about winning and committed to pursuing the best. This translates into everything we do, including the selection of a candidate.

Rogers Digital team is seeking a Sr. Business Systems Analyst to work on project definition, documentation and delivery for the Rogers and Fido front end delivery teams. Reporting to the Sr. Manager BSA, the successful candidate will add significant value to the delivery of effective Digital solutions for high profile Rogers & Fido initiatives that enhance both consumer and business customer experience.

This position involves the following primary responsibilities:

Document internal business user and functional specification requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, surveys, and task and workflow analysis in moderate to highly complex environments.
Prepare documentation on expected benefits, use cases, current/proposed process, workflows, data flows, process re-engineering studies, functional specifications, risk integration, end-user adoption plans/ guides and organization structures.
Interact with the users of the functional applications to understand their needs and to anticipate ways in which technological solutions can enhance the business processes.
Collaborate with Product Owners, Design and Delivery teams to achieve a holistic solution

Description
As our company slogan states, the Staples’ Supply Chain is Making Things Happen for our customers every day through our network of more than 10 warehouses, 300 stores, and hundreds of delivery trucks. And even though we already operate the best supply chain in our industry, we need talented individuals like you to help us leverage advanced analytics and optimization algorithms to achieve breakthrough performance levels.

Position Summary
The Operations Research Analyst (Supply Chain) is responsible for applying analytical methods to improve decision-making across the Staples’ Supply Chain
Using mathematical modeling, statistical analysis, and mathematical optimization, the individual will play an important role in the tactical execution of optimal or near-optimal solutions to complex decision-making problems
These problems will come from all parts of the Staples’ Supply Chain and will include challenges like:
Developing inventory management procurement strategies that minimize Staples’ investment in inventory while achieving or exceeding service-level targets
Refining the Staples’ logistics network strategy to ensure facility locations and store / customer assignments are optimized to minimize variable costs
Enhancing and implementing product profitability / cost-to-serve models to ensure the right products are being stocked in the right locations
Primary Responsibilities:
Apply analytical methods to solve complex, data-driven business problems that will ultimately have a direct impact on the Staple’s bottom-line
Communicate results to management as needed
Research, design, and implement data models and innovative algorithms to analyze diverse sources of data to realize actionable results
This role will be directly or indirectly supporting all functional areas within the Staples’ Supply Chain

Qualifications
Qualifications
Basic:
MS in Operations Research, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field plus 1-3 years industry experience.
PhD in Operations Research, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related (no industry experience required)
Experience with data mining, mathematical modeling, statistical analysis, and mathematical optimization tools, including linear programming, integer programming, mixed-integer programming, Markov decision processes, and multivariate analysis
Demonstrated analytical thinking, strategic problem-solving capabilities
Preferred:
Knowledge and experience using major statistical analysis tools such as R, Matlab, or SAS
Experience working with development toolsets such as Hadoop, MYSQL, Teradata, NOSQL, etc.
Experience with financial modelling
Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner with both technical and non-technical customers

If you require an accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact a Customer Care Representative at 1-866-782-7537.


Staples is an equal opportunity employer and an accommodation will be provided during the hiring process if requested.

POSITION: Distribution/Allocation Analyst
EMPLOYMENT STATUS: Exempt
REPORTS TO: Demand Planning & Distribution Manager
LOCATION: Sephora Field Support Center (FSC) – Toronto

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Distribution/Allocation Analyst works in partnership with the Category Merchant, Supply Chain, Operations, Merchandise Planning and Demand Planning Teams to achieve optimal store inventory levels while maximizing profitable sales and bottom line results. The Distribution/Allocation Analyst applies analytical skills to distribute product to multiple store formats across Canada.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

Determine optimal store allocation and replenishment based on the Merchant strategy, merchandising plan, store size and sales performance
Provide data and recommendations to influence the development of department/class level plans
Assist in the development of department/class level allocation strategies
Ensure allocations and replenishment is completed by the required timelines for DC processing to ensure product arrives to pre-defined store set-up dates.
Manage the inventory levels for product categories through analysis of trends, exceptions, rate of sale, minimum order quantities and minimum presentation quantities.
Store level in stock and sales analysis with the goal to increase in stocks
Maintain a well-balanced inventory in each assigned classification to maximize sales while minimizing obsolescence
Partner with Planning/ Merchandising team to identify and communicate sales and inventory trends or issues.
Monitors and manages store side forecasts for newness and core SKUs to ensure in stock targets are met.
Management of all Hotline Online Store Requests for respective brands.
Provide inventory analytics with information to maximize sales and profits
Share responsibility with the merchants, merchandise planning and demand planning team for Weeks of Supply, age of stock, and stock to sales (category and store) provide analysis and provide recommendations as required.
Analyze and report all in-season sell through results. Evaluate performance of promotions and key programs to extract learnings. Complete ad-hoc analysis or reports as required in a timely matter as it relates to allocations, sell-through, and inventory
Compile store grading analysis based on required timelines and liase with merchandising, merchandise planning and demand planning teams to review proposed store clusters/grades.
Collaborate with operations, districts store specialists, to ensure timely product allocations to new and/or renovated stores or any special store request or concerns.
Effectively communicate expected store delivery flow to DC Operations and Operations team and troubleshoot any issues
Provide feedback and recommendations for various processes and applications to improve efficiencies in everyday tasks and assigned projects.
Ad Hoc Analysis, Projects/ Reporting as requested.

CORE COMPETENCIES:
Analytic Skills: Ability to think objectively and interpret meaningful themes from quantitative and qualitative data
Financial and Business Acumen: Ability to evaluate financial and business indicators and translate data into actionable information to drive results; proficiency in retail math
Problem Solving & Decision Quality: Able to use rigorous logic and methods to solve problems with effective solutions
Influencing & Negotiation: Can present ideas and directions that lead others to action
Systems and Tools Acumen: Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, and have aptitude to learn technical applications quickly
Collaboration: Able to build constructive and effective relationships with a broad and diverse group of business partners
Possess strong organizational and time management skills

REQUIREMENTS:
Post-Secondary Education in Finance, Supply Chain and/or Business preferred
1 – 2 years of Allocation and/or Supply Chain Experience required
Strong numbers aptitude; able to compile statistical reports
Problem solving and analytical skills
Strong organizational and time management skills; able to handle multiple priorities
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Flexible; team player.

COMPANY OVERVIEW:
SEPHORA has been changing the face of prestige cosmetics since its debut in 1970s Paris. Sephora was acquired by luxury group Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton (LVMH) in 1997 then launched stateside in 1998, and is currently home to 200 world-class brands - including its own private label, SEPHORA COLLECTION. Sephora's curated assortment features more than 14,000 products including makeup, skin care, perfume, hair care, body, professional tools and more. Sephora is the beauty education hub, offering consultations at the Beauty Studio, a variety of complimentary classes, one-on-one service from Personal Beauty Advisors, and exclusive retail technology SKINCARE IQ, COLOR IQ, and FRAGRANCE IQ. Sephora is an international force in beauty, and its award-winning website and ever-growing presence on social-media make it the world's premier digital beauty destination.

Calgary, ABData Analyst, Nutrien Financial - (Calgary, Alberta, Canada)
At Nutrien, our Purpose is to grow our world from the ground up and we do so with safety and integrity as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.
Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With approximately 20,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers.
We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, who are innovators in search of a better way, and who believe in inclusion.
Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us Feed the Future, and grow your career while earning a competitive salary and great benefits.
Reporting to the Financial Program Manager, the Nutrien Financial Analyst will manage and consolidate financial program data, perform analysis, and assist with system project tasks as required. The Analyst will assist with conducting market research on competitive grower financing and implement analytics and tools to assist the Retail platform in optimizing the use of customer loan products. The Analyst will have skills necessary to learn data modelling techniques, and the ability to leverage available systems to prepare and optimize reporting. Excellent communication and collaboration skills are required to manage Nutrien Financial relationships globally (retail branches, corporate offices, supplier contacts, etc.)
What you will do:
Maintain and periodically update finance program data in PowerBI
Update background tables and formula logic as reporting requirements change

Burnaby, BCBest Buy for Business
Creativity and customer service are what fuel the success of the Best Buy for Business team. This group provides unique product and service solutions to diverse clients across the private and public sectors — from hotels and restaurants to some of the country's largest corporations.

The BBfB Analyst provides analysis, executes processes, and utilizes business tools and metrics to ensure that decisions to purchase are well informed. Innovation – as a tech company we are constantly changing and evolving; an openness and willingness to embrace change is critical

facilities and community settings.

projects at the same time, and have the ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing.

The Logistics Management Analyst (LMA)/items Analyst Sr (IA) position is based at the Contractor Field Office (CFO) at 8 Wing Trenton, Ontario and will be responsible to the LMA Lead on all matters concerning logistics support to the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) C-130J aircraft fleet.

The primary function is to provide support to both Marietta, Georgia, U.S. logistics personnel and to the on-site LMA Lead. The successful candidate will have a solid background in logistics support or supply chain management and be able to enforce contractual requirements while satisfying customer expectations. This position requires a proactive approach to supply issues. Strong communication skills are necessary to work effectively amongst a dynamic group of internal and external customers. The position is co-located within the customer's facility. The candidate will be working in a team environment and must demonstrate the ability to take direction from the logistics lead in the CFO and work with the CFO manager. The IA assists in decision making related to day-to-day execution of the C-130J support contract. The position also serves as the secondary spokesperson for LM Marietta, representing LM Aero in the execution of the support contract and working in concert with the CFO, contractors and the customer.

The candidate will provide supply support services and support efforts such as audits and other forms of analysis of the inventory database to ensure its integrity and accuracy Establish a proactive approach to identify and mitigate supply related issues before they occur Deliver oral and written reports of data and/or status.

Duties include, but are not limited to:
Responsible for assuring inventory sufficiency with respect to mission requirements throughout the life cycle of supported systems.
Manages and controls the asset position of inventories, especially under the conditions of performance based logistics (PBL).
Makes and executes decisions to operating inventory to include suppliers, repair facilities and 3 PLs, including priority interpretation, inventory allocation and asset redistribution as necessary among sources of supply and military operating locations.
Responds to military service inquiries; supports requests for proposals and provisioning determinations; understands and uses various inventory optimization models; forecasts and manages budget requirements; interfaces with company and DND information management systems; ensures fidelity of asset identification; resolves technical and support problems for assigned classes of items by actively interfacing with engineering and suppliers; prepares status reports and metrics relating to supplier performance and mission readiness.
Employee TypeFull Time

Lockheed Martin Canada is the Canadian-based arm of Lockheed Martin Corporation, a global security and aerospace company employing 98,000 people worldwide, including nearly 1,000 Canadians. By applying innovative approaches of our highly skilled and experienced Canadian workforce, we have been Canada’s trusted defence and aerospace partner for over 75 years. We operate major facilities in Ottawa, Montreal, Halifax, Calgary and Victoria and work on a wide range of major programs from advanced naval technology products and unmanned systems software to providing delivery and in-service support of the latest military aircraft to commercial engine repair and overhaul capabilities.

ContractABOUT HOME EXPERIENCE
HomeX is building the future of Home Services.
Our unique service and technology platform has been engineered to make next generation experiences for both consumers and service providers come to life.
Reinventing our industry requires creating end-to-end solutions. This is why HomeX is combining a managed service network, a technology platform for providers and full service experiences for consumers. Together, these efforts put us in a unique position to deliver differentiated, fresh, simple and highly personalized solutions making dream experiences come true.
Founded in 2016 by industry veterans and headquartered in Chicago, HomeX (Home Experience LLC) is determined to be a positive force and help the industry evolve from the inside, creating, for the first time, value and magical experiences for customers and service providers nationwide.
Requirements
ABOUT THE JOB
HomeX is seeking multi-faceted, customer-obsessed, analytical Product Management MBA Interns to join the HomeX Product & Design team based out of Toronto, ON.
Key responsibilities include:
Ideate: Partnering with design and business stakeholders to narrow in on the problems and goals that will define HomeX in the market.
Design & Define: Craft concepts and validate through analytical thinking, justifying decisions through intuition and/or teeing up stimuli and hypothesis to validate via research.
Execute: Work with the design and engineering teams to build intuitive and stable products by articulating use cases and user stories, and clearly communicate priorities..
Launch: With business stakeholders, drive go-to-market strategy and new product launches from start to finish.
Analyze: Leverage business case modeling, AB testing, and product and business analytics to deep dive into the performance of your products, with an eye towards continuous improvement on key product and experience metrics.
Product Leadership: While this is an individual contributor role with no direct reports, you are expected to inspire the product & design team to do their best work and provide leadership and mentorship.
Voice of the Customer: Establish a deep understanding of our customer and their needs, evolving your product intuition and the HomeX product the more you learn.
About You
The right candidate for this role is always looking to push the envelope in creating differentiated experiences, while also being dedicated to operational excellence to ensure we can deliver. We’re looking for someone who can help us transform an industry.
A PM Athlete: Be a jack-of-all trades who can inspire and lead cross-functional teams of creatives, engineers, analysts, and data scientists toward a common vision and roadmap.
Empathetic: Be able to put yourself in the customer's’ shoes. Understanding their needs, mindset, and pain points is the foundation of creating a UX and a business that they will be happy to return to again and again.
Team-Oriented: You excel at collaborating across the company, including with Business, Marketing, and Engineering teams as well as your fellow PMs and Designers.
A Believer: You understand that technology can simplify, delight and enhance our lives and hope to build transformative innovation as your career.

job_title: Data Governance Solution Analyst and Data Architect
job_description:
Requisition ID: 16925
Job Category: Information Technology

With over six decades of business and technical experience in the mining, energy, and infrastructure sectors, we understand that challenges are changing rapidly in every industry. We respond quickly with solutions that are smarter, more efficient, and innovative. We draw upon our 9,000 staff with experience in over 150 countries to challenge the status quo and create positive change for our clients, our employees, and the communities we serve.
Hatch is currently seeking a Data Architect and Data Governance Solution Analyst for our Hatch Digital group covering Hatch’s business systems. This opportunity will be based out of our Mississauga office.
Hatch has a number of business systems. The iPas TF Team in Hatch Digital configures, programs, and maintains the SAP enterprise applications including SAP ECC (modules include HCM, Time, FI, CO, SD, PS, CPM and Readsoft), SuccessFactors, C4C, Fiori and Fiori LaunchPad, Business Warehouse, Business Objects as well as some other cloud-based HR solutions.
Agile development teams in Hatch Digital deploy other off-the-shelf systems and develop and maintain custom, Hatch-specific systems.
The complete business systems architecture covers all of these systems with many integrations between them.
The Data Architect and Data Governance Solution Analyst will proactively work with business owners, business representatives, other systems team members, SAP functional consultants, the technical teams and the reporting team to understand business and governance requirements around master data and other key data, and to implement solutions to address these requirements.
You are a team player, yet an independent thinker, comfortable with sharing and accepting ideas in an open manner. You are a hard worker, able to take on demanding and time-constrained tasks.

Duties and Responsibilities
Ensure quality of master data and key data in SAP and the other business systems.
Work with the Business data owners to document data definitions and business rules
Develop or facilitate the development of documentation covering master and key data flows and transformations between systems, including the business rules applied to the data.
Participate in all team initiatives to review early data model designs, integration data flows, data uploads and transformation designs and participate in testing.
Identify areas for data quality improvements and help resolve data quality problems.
Develop processes and procedures for data ownership, data management, integration, replication and uploads to support ongoing data maintenance and data integrity.
Collaborate with the reporting team and understand the design of the data warehouse.
Work with business representatives to gather and understand functional requirements, develop complex queries and provide reports.
Respond to auditors concerning data management processes, improvements and information requests.
Design and implement systems solutions in collaboration with other team members, provide advice to management and stakeholders, recommend a course of action for required solutions: solution scoping, requirements analysis, gap analysis, feasibility, functional design, application configuration, technical specification, testing, production deployment, support and training.
Conduct / facilitate data cleaning to remove old, unused data.
Implement an archiving solution for SAP data.
Provide escalated production support if needed.

Skills / Qualifications
B.Sc. or Business degree or equivalent
4+ years of experience in elements of data governance: quality, analysis, administration, architecture
Strong understanding of databases and data structures
Experience with or understanding of taxonomy management
Experience using modelling tools to convey concepts, architectures and designs
Superior attention to detail
Strong analytical, problem solving and organizational skills
Ability to compare technologies and make recommendations to senior members of the team.
Experience in establishing a project plan and facilitating the setting of priorities
Strong written and verbal communication skills and excellent inter-personal skills
Results-oriented, self-starter, capable of working independently and within a team environment to meet deadlines
Willing to work outside of normal business hours as part of a global team and to travel if required

Nice to have
Qualification in information science, data management, computer science
Experience working with information security practices and security software
Understanding of privacy laws and regulations
Experience with software development
Experience with SAP Master Data Management

We are committed to fostering a workforce in each of our locations that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. Hatch is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability or any other protected status. If you have any special needs requirements, please let us know. We will do our utmost to accommodate, in accordance with applicable local legislation.

Mississauga, ONWarehouse Analyst – Canada Cartage System

Reports to: Director, Enterprise Applications and PMO Department: Information Technology
Location: Mississauga, Ontario

Job Summary:
The individual in this position will play a key role in supporting Canada Cartage’s Applications, with a focus on warehousing/logistics. This portfolio currently encompasses the 3PL/Warehouse Management System, Customer Web Portal, Shipping Platforms and smaller Ancillary Systems. The applications are a mix of 3rd party systems with some customizations and internally built applications.

The individual will administer the 3PL/Warehouse systems while ensuring day to day issues on these systems are supported in a timely manner. They will also act as a Subject Matter Expert for all internal initiatives relating to these applications. This is a key role in ensuring the ongoing smooth operation of the business and becomes the natural go-to person for both resources within the technical team and the business community.

Job Responsibilities:

Application Support
Log, prioritize, troubleshoot, route and monitor all support incidents or questions relating to the applications supported. The applications could be COTS vendor applications or internal applications.
Assist internal teams with troubleshooting, technical support and other issues relating to the applications supported.
Perform root cause analysis to determine the cause of recurring issues and either fix or provide recommendations toward solutions.
Mentor L1 staff or Super Users within the Business departments on activities they support in the systems.
Manage the upkeep of the application. Ensure that the application is updated routinely and functioning at an acceptable performance level. This would involve working with the Infrastructure team to ensure sufficient resources are provisioned.
Continually drive improvements within the support processes by identifying opportunities for automation or transforming processes into something simpler. You may have the opportunity to then drive those as small projects.
Subject Matter Expertise
Be a Subject Matter Expert for the Applications being supported. Progressively understand the current functionality, keep up with future enhancements on the product roadmap, and assess capabilities in competing applications within the same domain.
Provide feedback into various projects’ Solution/Design phases that involve the application portfolio. Assist the team members by providing system requirements and/or test cases for initiatives concerning the applications.
Prepare training documentation/SOPs and train both users and other trainers on system use.
Support process mapping and SOP building for business processes undertaken using the application set.
May participate in testing activities within the supported applications by preparing test plans and test cases, managing or executing the tests, capturing results and ensuring defects are raised to the Project Manager or Vendor.

Relationships & Communication
Use effective communication and listening skills with internal customers, external customers, vendors, and team members within the IT department while troubleshooting system issues.
Professional communication with current and new customers.
Be flexible and astute in tailoring communication to different audiences. Example: Technical/vendor vs every day users
Build and maintain strong relationships with key day-to-day users of the system such that you can reinforce proper use of the system and become a change agent during project rollouts.
Manage the relationship with the Application vendors. This will involve routine touchpoints to ensure open issues are being addressed promptly and escalated for further attention as required.

Experience & Skills:

Must haves:
Experience working within the Supply Chain along with a good understanding of the business lifecycle managed within the Applications supporting it.
Strong analytical & prioritization skills
Excellent communication skills (written, verbal, listening and presentation).
Keen to learn and understand new technologies and their applicability
Ability to work with minimal supervision and also the work well with a cross-functional team to achieve organizations goals.
Active person who shows initiative and enjoys a challenge
Able to handle multiple initiatives in parallel but recognizes the importance of prioritization
Completion of Post-secondary degree in an analytical specialization (Engineering, Sciences or Business with IT concentration preferred).
Technically competent with Microsoft Office suite of products including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio.
4 or more years working in the capacity of an Application, Systems, Technical or Business Analyst
Proficient within HighJump 3PL System or other Warehouse Management Systems including RF functionality
Understanding of Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) within Warehousing standards
Nice to haves:
Competence using SQL to query tables within 3PL database
IT industry certifications
Experience working with Business Intelligence tools such as PowerBI
Project Management skills
Logistics industry certifications

Working Hours and Location:

Weekend and afterhours support is required based on production issues and project timelines
Flexibility to travel between multiple facilities in the Mississauga area
Some out of province travel may be required if involved in a project. Supply chain WMS Inventory

job_title: Business Support Analyst - Functional Business Systems
job_description:
Work Site: Finance Offices - West 8th Avenue

Status: Regular Full Time

Reference#: 112268-ale


JOB SUMMARY:

Reporting to the Manager, Financial Process Integration & Support and Regional Business System (RBS) Sustainment, you will be responsible for ensuring functional business system issues are resolved effectively and in a timely manner and continually looking for opportunities to maximize usage of the system to ensure on-going business process improvement.

As the primary point of contact for designated business area users across Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH) and Providence Health Care (PHC), you will work with stakeholders to streamline and standardize processes and implement best practices as well as troubleshoot system problems, test system solutions, establish clear lines of communication and ensure clear visibility of critical functional issues.

The Business Support Analyst:
Provides expert functional RBS support to ensure that business needs are met and to ensure the application is used to its full potential.
Champions RBS and builds relationships with stakeholders that enable the sharing of knowledge and information and encourage collaboration on issues.
Identifies opportunities and makes recommendations for further engagement of RBS by ensuring system enhancements are developed, tested, deployed and function according to agreed upon requirements.
Maintains up to date knowledge regarding new and upcoming system functionality.
Works closely with key stakeholders in the determination and implementation of best practices including participating in the preparation of business cases, process re-engineering, and improvement initiatives.
Represents the department at system meetings, establishing and maintaining clear lines of communications between user department and technical IMITS team members.
Configures system changes and prepares related documentation for changes impacting on system processing, other RBS modules including changes to common data elements across shared modules, non-RBS applications, and any changes requiring use of the Application Designer tools.
Provides technical guidance and direction to Analysts and/or other team members in all aspects of reporting, auditing and testing. Assigns project priorities to ensure overall timelines are met.
Develops and maintains training materials and reference documentation related to new systems/processes to ensure knowledge transfer and consistent usage by users. Coordinates and facilitates training sessions, drives train-the-trainer activities, and provides one-on-one guidance.
Writes queries to customize reports to meet user needs and conducts system audits to ensure data integrity.
QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERTISE:

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in a related discipline supplemented by related Information Systems courses
A minimum of five (5) years’ recent related experience within a large organization with an emphasis on business systems and reporting , health care or information management or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Extensive experience with complex ERP systems, project planning and control.
Experience supporting PeopleSoft’s HCM (Timekeeping, Human Resource, Payroll) module and/or expert knowledge in these areas will be an asset.
Expertise:
Expert ability to apply knowledge of RBS modules relating to the designated business area (Human Resources, Timekeeping, Payroll) and maintain an understanding of interdependencies with other modules.
A solid understanding of business functions and processes in order to enhance business processes and create efficiencies through enterprise application systems.
A strong sense of ownership and a results-oriented attitude to continually improve processes and systems, enhance efficiency and contribute to overall organizational success.
Strong communication skills and the ability to establish and maintain strong communication channels with stakeholders.
Solid technical and troubleshooting abilities in the provision of RBS support.
Strong initiative, self-direction and problem solving abilities to identity gaps and opportunities for improvement.
A strong ability to keep abreast of technological changes, anticipate opportunities and ensure readiness for future technology changes and enhancements.
Superior analytical skills for data, documentation and workflows, including the ability to comprehend, analyze and resolve complex issues and present information in concise meaningful ways.
Highly developed business writing and verbal communication skills with the ability to document work appropriately.
Knowledge of project structures; business case development; contract management; documentation of workflows; health care setting and analytical tools.

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.

***Employees of VCH must apply via the Internal Application Process. Refer to the staffpostings.vch.ca site for How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***

Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

Join our team

TELUS is committed to changing the way healthcare in Canada works for you, your family, and your loved ones. What part might you play?

We collectively need to find solutions that will benefit all Canadians to meet the challenge of unsustainable rising costs, long wait times and an increasingly older population. Make no mistake, our journey to address Canada’s greatest social challenge of this generation, healthcare, will be long and challenging, but the chance to have an impact on all Canadians and build a new business for TELUS will be worth it!

The TELUS Consumer Health team is focused on empowering Canadians to take control of their health and the health of their loved ones with the right information, tools and support they need to live healthier and happier lives. As a global telecommunications leader and one of the largest Information Technology (IT) healthcare providers in Canada, we are well positioned to play a leadership role in bringing new services to market to address this significant challenge.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

You will join a small high performing Consumer Health team, and utilize your strong analytical skills to build and evolve the centralized reporting capabilities for our portfolio. This will enable us to make well-informed decisions to continuously grow our business. Your ability to actively assess situations, take initiative and assume ownership of what needs to be done, and prioritize work in a dynamic and high profile environment, will make you a strong addition to our team. You will use your relationship building skills, to collaborate with various partners within the team and across TELUS.

We are looking for someone who is a true utility player and can wear many hats as data expert, project manager, and creative thinker. You have a ‘can-do’ attitude and are willing to roll up your sleeves to get things done. But most importantly, you have the passion to help transform healthcare for every Canadian and take our business and your career to the next level.

Here’s how
Collaborate with internal partners to identify, assess and prioritize data analysis and reporting requirements and improve reporting capabilities
Develop and iterate reporting and business intelligence solutions
Monitor critical metrics and performance against targets to actively recommend improvement and suggest corrective actions as situations arise
Assist in forecast and outlook analysis to identify risks and build mitigation plans
Contribute in building and evolving reporting and dashboard roadmap
Support ad-hoc analysis and reporting requests and other strategic priorities when needed
Qualifications

You're the missing piece of the puzzle
Recognized for your ambitious spirit, and drive you are passionate about using data to inform decisions
With proven critical thinking abilities, you use your problem solving and data analysis skills to find opportunities and recommend improvements for the business
Known for your data analytics experience, you are fluent in using data analytics tools, excel, and tools such as Domo and Tableau to build reports and visualization
With a knack for adapting to a changing environment, you thrive in an ambiguous environment and can pivot when needed and handle conflicting priorities
Great-to-haves
Experience with database, SQL and VBA scripting
Experience in sales, marketing and/or product management environment
Experience in working with data sources from TELUS systems or other complex systems
A bachelor’s degree in business or related field and 3 years of experience in business analysis or similar role

Edmonton, ABPermanent$73,500 a yearPosition Overview:
Do you want to be a part of a team that helps injured people get better and get back to life?
Do you have experience building strong, trusting relationships with clients and co-workers?
Can you organize and manage a diverse workload that requires a hybrid of technical knowledge and strong business acumen?

At WCB-Alberta, we make a meaningful impact in the lives of working Albertans. We are a not-for-profit organization legislated to administer the workers' compensation system for the province. When any Alberta worker is hurt on the job, we are here to help. We provide compensation and benefits for workplace injuries and occupational diseases to over 1.7 million workers.

Every day, we work hard to make a positive difference in the lives of our customers. At WCB-Alberta, you too can make a difference.

We are a small team who believe in the power of collaboration, teamwork, and the importance of providing quality to our customers. We are curious, problem solvers, and translators between technical and business speak. If this resonates with you, we’d love to hear from you.

Responsibilities:

Support the design, development, and maintenance of integrated financial systems and solutions.
Consult with clients using financial systems regarding improvement opportunities that contribute to business efficiency, enhanced financial information, optimized business processes, and the integrity of financial information.
Support financial system business processes by carrying out compliance functions, risk assessments, and small application development and maintenance.
Maintain close relationships with IT professionals, colleagues and key stakeholders on issues relating to financial systems or processes.

University degree in Commerce or equivalent, with a focus on Management Information Systems.
At least 3-5 years of progressively responsible experience working with complex financial systems preferably in the insurance industry or with a financial institution.
Experience with automated solutions to enhance financial budgeting, forecasting, and reporting would be an asset.
Well-developed verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical staff.

Experience with PeopleSoft, Lotus Notes, Cognos Metrics Manager, and or Data Warehouse would be an asset.
