About JLL –
We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. As a Fortune 500 company, we help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. We have nearly 300 corporate offices across 80 countries, with a team of more than 86,000 individuals.
If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. With us, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections and be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions—join us at JLL!
JLL is currently seeking a dynamic individual for the role of Hotel Investment Sales Analyst to provide reliable, timely, efficient support to Hotels & Hospitality group at our Toronto location. The position entails working with a diverse group of internal and external Stakeholders at all levels of the organization, and the individual will require the independent judgment to plan, prioritize, and organize a diverse workload in a fast-paced environment. This role provides a wide variety of support services to the brokerage team and the successful candidate will be detail oriented with strong organizational skills and a team player attitude.
Responsibilities:
Support Hotels & Hospitality team members in securing listings, marketing and closing of real estate transactions.
Input financial data from P&L statements into valuation models.
Under supervision of senior team members, develop pro forma financial projections.
Under supervision of senior team members, complete preliminary asset valuations using discounted cash flow, income capitalization, leveraged IRR, comparable sales and construction cost techniques.
Gather, compile and present economic and demographic data in formats pertinent to real estate transactions.
Assist in all aspects of preparing presentations, offering materials and miscellaneous reports.
Abstracting legal documents.
Communicating with and coordinating work of third-party vendors (graphic and web designers) in connection with preparation of offering materials and presentations.
Under the supervision of senior project team members, facilitate transaction due diligence process.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Finance, Hotel Administration and/or Real Estate Finance
Strong record of academic achievement
Demonstrated quantitative skills
Hospitality-industry specific work experience, preferably in valuations or general consulting
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong organizational skills, attention to detail
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously
Ability to work independently while also maintaining rapport with a team
Ability to work within formal reporting relationships
Strong computer skills (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.)
Knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign) considered a definite asset
Flexibility to work after normal business hours and on weekends as needed
What you can expect from us
We’re an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. We succeed together—across the desk and around the globe. We believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success.
Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, well-being, benefits and pay. We’ll offer you a competitive salary and benefits package.
With us, you’ll develop your strengths and enjoy a career full of varied experiences. We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL.
Apply today!

Smiths Falls, ONLegalization has opened up the recreational cannabis market in Canada, and the global demand for medical cannabis continues to expand. In this exciting new environment, Canopy Growth’s mission is to be the No. 1 cannabis company in the world. We’re looking for incredible people to join us on the journey.

The Company

With millions of square feet of licensed cannabis production and operations spanning five continents, Canopy Growth Corporation (“Canopy Growth”) is the largest legal producer of cannabis in the world. It is a listed company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (WEED), the New York Stock Exchange (CGC), and is part of the S&P Composite Index. Its wholly owned subsidiaries — including its flagship, Tweed, and international medical companies operating under the Spectrum Cannabis brand — are leading producers of legal, regulated cannabis.

Headquartered in Smiths Falls, Ontario, Canopy Growth recognizes that employees are at the core of its success, and takes pride in a corporate culture that emphasizes inclusiveness, collaboration, and diversity. Our employees come from a wide range of backgrounds, each bringing their own unique skills and talents to the table, working together to continue and increase our incredible momentum of growth.

The Opportunity

Reporting to the Sr. Quality Systems Manager, this role will appeal to an outstanding problem solver who thrives in a collaborative environment. In addition to being an excellent communicator, you must be a team player who can translate non-technical requirements into solutions. Lastly, if you are the type of analytical individual who is committed to planning and prioritizing tasks, then you would be a great addition to our team.

Responsibilities

Supports data driven decision-making by gathering key information and building reports that effectively communicate complex topics to a variety of audiences
Routinely analyzes key data for the quality department to identify emerging trends and strategic opportunities
Provide subject matter expertise within the department and to business partners on available data sources and the appropriate methodology for conducting analysis
Develops briefing notes and presentations for management including recommendations on key issues
Leads, participates and facilitates meetings and working group sessions with various stakeholders
Monitor KPIs, identify and highlight trends and perform variance analysis
Create and maintain quality scorecard
Liaise with all relevant stakeholders to build out robust project plans to drive the entire lifecycle of both strategic and operational projects
Coordinate all necessary resources to ensure timely delivery of projects
Develop and implement effective reporting to keep project stakeholders and senior management informed on key project metrics
Other duties as assigned

Experience


Post secondary education preferably in statistics, business application or related discipline, and four years related experience, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience
1-3 years’ experience managing corporate projects
PMP designation or equivalent certification is considered an asset
Broad knowledge and excellent understanding of a range of business intelligence concepts and common business functions and practices, including but not limited to maintenance management, customer service, records management, policies and procedures, and reporting
Monitor and report out on KPI's. Log and track actions items associated with the reporting
Demonstrated ability to quickly adapt; maintain focus and a high degree of accuracy while working with complex data in an environment of ever-changing deadlines, priorities and requirements
Excellent communication skills (oral, written and presentation)
Proven ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and collaborate on projects

Other Details

This is a full-time position based out of Smiths Falls, ON.

We appreciate the interest from all candidates, and promise to review all applications, but we will only be contacting those who best fit the requirements. If you don’t hear from us, don’t fret; every resume we get is kept in our database for six months for consideration in future searches for talent.

Canopy Growth welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.
Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

One last note: the chosen applicant will be required to successfully complete background and reference checks.

Thank you so much for your interest in Canopy Growth.

Winnipeg, MBDescription
Are you passionate about reaching new heights, teamwork and making a meaningful contribution? Do you picture yourself as a valued member of an industry-leading organization? If you answered yes to these questions, Air Canada is seeking enthusiastic individuals to join the diverse and vibrant team working together to lead the growth and expansion of Canada’s flag carrier.
We are looking for a highly motivated person for an Analyst, Commodity Taxes position. This person will report to the Director, Commodity Taxes/ Audits, Compliance & Accounting.



Will assist Tax team with commodity tax audits (taxes and fees of all nature including Federal, Excise, Provincial, States as well as International taxes) and contribute to the development of commodity tax strategy for major audit issues.

Overview
The Manager Business Analyst is responsible, through independent contribution and the management/supervision of staff, for the resolution of complex business problems for the assigned Lines of Business.This includes managing multiple small projects, participating in and/or managing specific sections of large projects, and providing ongoing support to all assigned units worldwide.
What we are looking for?
We are looking for someone who will independently resolve complex, multi-faceted problems to meet the business needs of the assigned Lines of Business, by applying their financial and technological knowledge to the design of methodologies, models, and/or systems solutions. Conduct research and analysis, accurately and clearly defining user requirements and processes, and liaising with the users
Manage multiple small projects and/or manage specific sections of large projects to implement solutions to business problems. This involves planning and scheduling resources, developing detailed project plans, monitoring progress against planned objectives, financial review, and securing consensus and co-operation from users and senior management.
Participate in the systems implementation process by defining business requirements and processes, developing test strategies and test cases, performing testing, defining user procedures and workflows, developing conversion and implementation strategies, verifying conversion, providing user documentation, providing user training, and providing post-implementation support.
Provide business support to all units Globally, including new and existing product and deal structuring, ad hoc queries and MIS, user training, and assisting with the design and implementation of systems enhancements.
Continually acquire and enhance knowledge of the Division's business strategies and policies, risk management practices and methodologies, product offerings, financial markets, financial instruments, regulatory requirements, Back Office processes, and rapidly changing technology to be able to provide effective business solutions and services to the end user business lines.
Effectively manage and supervise business analysis staff by setting performance expectations, monitoring performance, and providing performance feedback including the preparation of performance appraisals, providing counsel and coaching.
Are you the right person for the role?
You Have;
Must have advanced knowledge of financial instruments, including market conventions and valuation methods, risk management methodologies and models including best practices, current and anticipated regulatory requirements, Back Office processes, and the end-to-end workflows among the Front, Middle, and Back Offices, within at least one financial market area (e.g. foreign exchange, interest rate derivatives) and a very good knowledge of at least one other financial market area.
Must be a creative, self-starting, results-oriented, and highly motivated individual with very good analytical skills in order to apply this knowledge to independently resolve complex business problems.
Must demonstrate leadership skills with very good interpersonal, communication, and negotiation skills and good time management and organizational skills.
Must have a very good understanding of current Electronic Data Processing practices, systems development techniques, including requirements specification and testing methodologies, real-time analytical and formal modelling tools, and keep current with rapidly changing technology.
A recognized degree in business, econometrics, mathematics or a related discipline and related work experience of 4-5 years.
Spanish Language skills is a must.
What’s in it for you?
The opportunity to join a forward-thinking company surrounded by a collaborative team of innovative thinkers.
A great opportunity to leave your “stamp” as we are undergoing multiple exciting and forward thinking initiatives.
A rewarding career path with diverse opportunities for professional development.
Internal development to support your growth and enhance your skills.
A competitive compensation and benefits package.
An organization committed to making a difference in our communities– for you and our customers.

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2017, we had approximately 34,000 employees, 73,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 26 million customers. As of December 31, 2017, we had over $1.04 trillion (US$829.4 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $26.7 billion in payments to our customers. Knowledge of standard metrics and key performance indicatorsKnowledge of HR data privacy laws, information security and quality principles.Strong relationship and communication skills across multiple countries and culturesExcellent teaming skills required to work in a virtual work environment A self starter, self motivated and able to work with specific but minimal direction.Extensive technical experience in Success Factors, SAP Cloud Analytics, Business Objects, Microsoft Excel, MS Sharepoint – SSRS, Power BI, Oracle Business Intelligence, SQL, and technical knowledge for report production. Advanced Excel skills required such as vba, automation, power pivot, power query, interaction with SQL, programmability.Ability to build strong working relationships with diverse client base, including senior leadershipProven track record of working with managing a senior stakeholder population

job_title: Senior Business Analyst, Production Accounting Systems (PAS)

The O&G / Energy BU works with 5 primary products: “PAS” (Production Accounting Solution), “RMS” (Royalty Management System), “PVR” (Production Volume Reporting), “LandMan” (Land & Asset Management) and enVision (O&G Financial Management). CGI is well known in the industry as a leader in the Energy field for providing custom tailored, high quality and high impact systems.

This position will work on our PAS team; the PAS product is very large, extremely complex and offers continued challenge to our Agile based Development team. As a business analyst on this team you will be working with a team of business analysts, developers and Subject Matter Exports on multiple projects for various clients that are large in scope and involve complex functionality enhancement and creation. You will work closely with CGI’s product development and support team, off-shore development team and the clients. This position has very strong potential for career growth within CGI and the Energy sector.
Build your career with us.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

Able to work independently and as part of a team

Trillium Health Partners (THP) is one of the largest community-based acute care facilities in Canada. Comprised of the Credit Valley Hospital, the Mississauga Hospital and the Queensway Health Centre, Trillium Health Partners serves the growing and diverse populations of Mississauga, West Toronto and surrounding communities and is a teaching hospital affiliated with the University of Toronto.
Our Mission: A New Kind of Health Care for a Healthier Community
When we set out to build our vision and future, we connected with our community - patients, families, visitors, physicians, staff and volunteers. The foundational goals of our new strategic plan - quality, access and sustainability - anchor everything we do. Our mission for a new kind of health care is built on an inter-connected system of care organized around patients - inside and outside the hospital.
At THP, we are relentless in providing high quality, compassionate care to our communities and take great pride in fostering an inclusive and accessible environment and we are all accountable for contributing to a healthy, safe and respectful environment for healing and promoting excellence in patient care though advancing patient and staff safety. If you are passionate about what you do, motivated to improve the health of the community, committed to excellence, quality and patient safety we would like you to join our Better Together team!
Job Description:

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join the Partnership Projects team within the Strategy, People and Corporate Affairs Division to support Project Zero (PZ). PZ is a cross-sector mental health initiative aimed at eliminating death by suicide for children and youth through improved prevention and care delivery across Mississauga. Preliminary partners include Peel District School Board, Peel Children’s Centre, Peel Public Health, Trillium Health Partners, the Dufferin Peel District Catholic School Board, and the Mississauga Halton LHIN. As a member of the team, the ideal candidate will support the Senior Project Manager and Director to drive forward this strategic partnership project to improve the mental health of children, youth, and families in our community.
Here’s what you will get to do:
Participate in the planning, coordination, communications and engagement processes for core partners, affiliate partners, project committees and working groups, and children, youth, and families;
Support a project team and leadership through all aspects of the various phases within the project;
Contribute to the development of materials such as reports, presentations, briefing notes, requests for proposals, data analyses and communications throughout all levels of project governance structure;
Support project research, literature reviews and data / information gathering to enhance subject-matter knowledge relevant to the project;
Engage in data analytics, reporting and critical thinking to support project deliverables and planning;
Contribute to the development and dissemination of project control documents, including status reports, risk / issue analyses, and project plans, and;
Monitor and report on progress, problems and solutions of the project to project management team and escalate issues as appropriate.

Accountabilities:
Engage with external project partners, affiliates, and supports as appropriate;
Support key committees working groups that are integral to the success of the project as required including meeting scheduling and coordination with multiple project partners;
Support the Senior Project Manager in the planning, development and coordination of complex project work plans, timelines, and deliverables related to project mission;
Engage and communicate with stakeholders and project partners on an ongoing basis and ensure changing resource and project requirements are met and understood;
Liaise with project partners to ensure the successful completion of project deliverables; and
Other duties assigned, as required to meet timelines and deliverables.

Qualifications:
All candidates must have an undergraduate degree.
Masters degree in public, business administration, or healthcare administration or equivalent experience considered an asset.
Minimum 3-5 years of experience in a healthcare or partnership environment working with complex and dynamic teams.
Excellent organizational, time management and project management skills.
Strong understanding of Trillium Health Partners strategic plan.
A strong understanding of Health, Education, Community and Social Service sectors is an asset.
Strong analytical, problem solving and systems-thinking abilities.
Strong adaptability, collaboration, and relationship building skills are essential for this role.
Experience effectively engaging with and managing third-party partners and delivery partners required.
Ability to work under pressure and tight timelines.
Demonstrated effectiveness at working with teams as well as working independently.
Experience in human-centred design thinking, planning, and engagement is an asset.
Superior writing and PowerPoint design skills.
High proficiency in Excel and Microsoft Suite is a must.

Internal Candidates who believe they possess the necessary qualifications and experience for this position and who have been in their current position for at least six (6) months are encouraged to apply.

To pursue this career opportunity, please visit our website: www.trilliumhealthpartners.ca

Mississauga, ONConagra Brands has the most energized, highest-impact culture in food. Conagra Brands, be part of building something BIG.
Position Summary:
The objective of a CPFR Analyst is to develop, analyze, and recommend forecasts at both the store and distribution center level. The role of this position is to partner with the Customers Replenishment Managers to implement strategies, maintain service levels, and support promotional activity. This position will also collaborate internally with supply chain, customer service, and logistics to maintain best in class service to the customer.
Position Responsibilities:
This position requires independent decision-making that impacts revenue for customer and for ConAgra Foods.
Reviews forecast accuracy exception reports and make recommendations for forecast changes to Customer replenishment team and ConAgra Supply Chain Team.
Identify daily store out of stocks and root cause. Recommend business process changes to improve future in-stock. (Late truck, demand variability, incorrect forecast, miss-shipments)
Perform gap analysis before/after forecast changes and communicate issues to Replenishment Managers.
Manage ordering system to maximize opportunities and growth for ConAgra products while minimizing errors (i.e. item set up, item forecast)
Make recommendations on adjustments to Economic Order Quantities (pallet vs. multi-layer vs. layers)
Maintain service levels including fill rate, OTD compliance, in-stock, inventory levels (WOS), to maximize inventory effectiveness.
Make recommendations to facilitate forecast expectations, event plans, promotions, and projected lifts in sales trends.
Monitor orders through customer supply chain and Replenishment planners/Business Analysts to avoid over/under inventory situations.
Recognize and avoid potential issues by using strong analytical skills and customer specific knowledge and recommend ideas to improve service levels.
Forecast changes in order patterns and timing brought on by change in distribution, planogram changes, seasonality, and promotions to coordinate with supply chain and the customer
Meet (at least) quarterly with customer replenishment planners/business analysts to discuss forecast and promotional plans and discuss opportunities for improvement.
Qualifications/ Education/Experience/Skills:
2 year Logistics experience through Customer Service or Supply Chain required.
Strong quantitative and analytical skills with demonstrated proactive problem-solving skills.
Understanding of logistics and inventory management concepts.
Ability to analyze information and provide a business case that is actionable.
Technical skills that allow for ease in learning new systems.
Capability to troubleshoot and resolve data quality issues.
Self-motivated and able to work with little direction.
Extreme attention to detail and strong organizational skills.
Ability to manage many details and tasks with a high level of accuracy.
Ability to manage dual roles of Customer advocate and Company employee.
Strong written and verbal communication skills to work with customer, sales and supply chain.
Proficient in Microsoft Office skills, including Word, Excel, and Power Point required.
Experience in Retail Link a plus.
College degree preferred.
Ability to travel upon request

Toronto, ONYou’ve heard this before: With rapid growth and a laser-focus on shipping, data and insights were capabilities that fell off the priority list. This is natural when you’re focused on building a product, especially with tight timelines and commitments. Fast-forward to today, we’ve grown a lot and created three businesses in three years! We’ve got data in multiple spots - e-commerce platforms; web analytics platforms; order management systems; customer survey platforms and more; but we haven’t tied them together.
Our business teams have made great efforts to gather, cleanse and organize this data in order to gain insights into how our customers are using our products. Naturally this doesn’t scale. We’re at a point in our journey where there’s a focus on organizing our data and getting the cross-system view of what our customers are doing.
To this end, we’re looking for an expert at building and maintaining data pipelines to help expand our BI platform by integrating data from internal and external sources into our Oracle data warehouse as well as feeding other application systems that depend on the data warehouse for reporting and analytics. The successful candidate will also empower our business by training and enabling business users to self-serve data from our platform to drive insights and fact-based analytics.
Responsibilities:
Develop and scale quality and performant data pipelines using our in-house data framework
Build and implement robust data models and structures using dimensional modeling techniques
Be a subject matter expert on the entire stack of our BI framework
Support reporting and analytics needs from all areas of the business. For example: Developers, Product Managers, Product Designers, Merchandizers, Marketers, and Operations Analysts
Help us in our mission to be a hypotheses-driven product development organization which means data is at the centre of everything we do
Be an enabler by showing others how to master the reporting tools available to them, thereby empowering our team and getting us to scale
Requirements:
5+ years of solid hands-on experience with relational databases (e.g. Oracle, SQL Server, DB2, etc.)
2+ years of Python experience building automated data pipelines that source and push data across various application and data systems is a must
Experience with ETL/Data Modelling/Star Schema design and development
Hands-on experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Tableau, Qlik, Microstrategy, etc.)
Experience working with sourcing and feeding data from REST/SOAP apis (e.g., Omniture, Salesforce, SurveyMonkey, etc.) is nice to have
Experience with data pipeline automation using a code focused scheduling tool (e.g. Rundeck, Airflow, Luigi)
Strong oral and written communication skills
Solid stakeholder management skills
Proven team player that will work well in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Experience working in an agile environment
Strong desire to learn and to push the boundaries of what can be done to better empower our business with data
How You’ll Succeed:
At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.
We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce.
If you have big ideas, undeniable enthusiasm, and thrive in a collaborative, creative, and diverse group, we’ll get along just fine.
Looking for a challenge? Good. Love an innovative work environment? Even better.
Apply today.

Pull and analyse data to identify trends in data & develop scenarios to tests/simulations to identify potential activities for opportunity.10%

Within the Finance and Corporate Services Division; the Corporate Operations Support Branch is responsible for supporting the Service Delivery Division with finances and accounting data analysis. The Corporate Operations Branch delivers a range of services to the Service Delivery Division through four key business areas, including facilities, assets and administration; financial operations and systems, financial reporting and forecasting; and analysis and decision support.

The Ministry of Children and Family Development provides services that support healthy, safe environments where children are connected to their family and community. To strengthen our business model, the Financial Reporting and Forecasting Unit within the Corporate Operations Support Branch provides leadership and guidance on daily operations to optimize the use and development of financial and corporate resources, maximize Ministry capacity and provide quality services to support improved outcomes for children, youth and families.

The Financial Management Consultant is responsible for providing expert advice to service delivery management in the planning, reporting, and analysis of financial information in the delivery of Ministry programs and services. The Financial Management Consultant also provides expenditure forecasting; implements accounting operations, financial controls, operations auditing and ensures financial management practices are consistent with applicable legislation, quality assurance principles and Ministry core policies.

Vaughan, ONData Warehouse Analyst, Operations

Daisy Intelligence is an artificial intelligence (AI) SaaS-based platform that transforms vast volumes of business data into meaningful insights. Daisy exists to enable companies, such as retailers, to make smarter operational decisions using math and science. Our platform can simulate potential outcomes that will directly affect our clients profit and loss. Daisy gives voice to the facts and helps our clients prepare for a better future. Using our proprietary mathematical solutions, we provide retailers with a tool that helps them make the optimal decision in their strategic marketing and/or merchandising planning and promotions.

Key Accountabilities

As a Data Warehouse Analyst, Operations you will be responsible for:

Schedule and run jobs in the production DevOps environment
Perform troubleshooting for jobs that end abnormally and seek assistance from supporting developers, if required
Run and monitor scheduled jobs, troubleshoot any issues that may arise, escalate to next level support as required
Monitor Production ETL Packages and assists in troubleshooting
Define and/or keep current, operational playbooks for various production batch job streams
Ensure the timely delivery of client deliverables based on contractual SLAs
Support and develop data quality and validation for maintaining high-quality data
Perform other DevOps duties as assigned
Extended weekend/evening coverage may be required
Technical Skills:

Operational experience in a multi-platform environment (Linux, Windows)
Good knowledge of Hadoop and DB2 databases and Data Warehouse development methodologies
You have experience with a scheduling platform (preferably Control-M)
Proven data analysis and manipulation skills, as well as experience in Big Data
Extensive experience with SQL preferably in a DB2 and Hadoop environment
Demonstrated proficiency in the use of shell scripting (Linux Bash, Python, etc.)
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Excel, Access, Word and PowerPoint
Knowledge of the Software Development Lifecycle
Skills & Qualifications:

Strong written and oral communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to think critically, laterally, problem solve and innovate within a team environment
High level of attention to detail, excellent time management skills, ability to perform under pressure
Ideally you have a minimum of 3 years experience in an Operator role
Post-Secondary education equivalent to a college/university degree in Computer Science
Role & Responsibilities

Work on teams or individually to execute ETL (Extract, Transform and Load) processes for data from a variety of database sources (DB2 and Hadoop)
Review data quality, and perform data cleansing and data management tasks
Work with the client delivery team to ensure the smooth delivery of customer deliverables in a timely manor
Develop standards for automating data processes and routine tasks
Run investigative queries and provide formatted result data sets
Proactively contribute to the creation of presentation materials relating to data activities for client and stakeholder discussions
Support application testing and production implementation as required
Come to work with an intrinsic desire to change your world
Understand business challenges, associated data points and actively participate in formulating solutions through process, technology and data
Willing to work extended hours (including weekends)
Why Daisy Intelligence?

Picture yourself building a successful career at Daisy Intelligence —working alongside other talented, driven individuals to deliver artificial intelligence solutions that are not out of reach for any organization. Daisy Intelligence transforms massive quantities of consumer data into profitable decisions. Our proprietary mathematical solutions simulate all the possible business scenarios that set our clients on the optimal path to grow their bottom line.

You will join a team of dedicated, entrepreneurial employees that are building a company out of the ordinary. We operate in a team-based culture: one that combines a strong customer focus with a devotion to improve everything we do. We are the future of analytics. Daisy Intelligence is located in the Greater Toronto Area. If you feel you meet the qualifications for this position, please apply online.

Perks

Skills development
Access to cutting edge technologies
Forefront of machine learning and AI
Working as a part of a great team
Building something cool
Flexibility
Equity plan
Competitive Salary
Group health benefits
Vacation allowance
No agencies or B2B services please.

Ensure that published automobile statistical exhibits satisfy established quality standards.

Qualifications
Degree or diploma in business, actuarial science, statistics or mathematics.
Currently pursuing Insurance Institute of Canada or other property/casualty insurance designation.

High level of organizational and task management skills.

Toronto, ONRPIA is a Toronto based asset management firm with over $5 billion AUM that provides fixed income solutions for family offices, foundations, and pensions in Canada. We specialize in publicly traded global corporate bonds. Through an actively managed and trading orientated investment process, we have developed alternative fixed income solutions for our clients utilizing our expertise in this segment of the market.

Portfolio Analyst:
Reporting to the Director, Risk Management & Analytics. The candidate will ideally bring a combination of expertise in technology and portfolio/risk management, be professional in demeanor, and comfortable working in an intense, fast-paced capital markets environment.

What You'll Do:
Participate in infrastructure build-out to support RPIA’s risk management platform, working in Risk Management & Analytics team but closely with Portfolio Management.
Work closely with the portfolio management, client portfolio management, compliance, and operations teams to develop and implement investment performance, risk analytics and reporting solutions; translate user requirements into reports and solutions.
Assist in the development of fixed income analytics – including but not limited to: multiple currency support, custom swap/basis curves, rich/cheap analysis, etc.
Develop risk management tools and models – such stress testing, jump-to-default, etc.
Build, implement and test security pricing and curve fitting models.

Who You Are:
Someone with knowledge of financial markets in particular fixed income, a strong background in software development, and a desire for a career in the middle office.
A highly motivated and entrepreneurial individual that is comfortable taking responsibility and ownership for a number of business-critical tasks.
Someone with exceptional attention to detail, accuracy, and completeness
A focused and efficient multi-tasker who is able to calmly and professionally manage their time and possible conflicting priorities.
A creative thinker who is always looking for ways to streamline processes in order to improve and increase efficiencies.
A thoughtful communicator with exceptional written and oral skills.
Someone who thrives in a demanding, fast-paced environment that requires resourcefulness.
A team player who exemplifies and understands the importance of the accuracy of your work.
Someone who will embrace the importance of upholding RPIA’s controls and service standards.
Someone who will exemplify inclusiveness, respect and accountability in the workplace.

Requirements:
University degree preferably in one of the following disciplines: Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Finance, Commerce or Economics.
Strong programming skills are essential, in particular but not limited to: C#, SQL, MATLAB, SQL, Java, Web Frameworks (JS, Angular, React, etc.), and VBA.
Knowledge of software development methodologies, and working experience developing software is preferred
Data visualization and modeling skills including summarizing in a cohesive fashion is an asset
CFA designation is an asset
Knowledge of Calypso (RPIA’s Portfolio Management System) a plus

What RPIA Can Offer:
Comprehensive health benefits package
Competitive salary commensurate with experience
Opportunity for growth, development and continuous learning
Collaborative teamwork environment

Additional Information:
Position Type: Full Time
Work Location: 39 Hazelton Avenue, Toronto, Ontario, M5R 2E3
Must be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work permit or study permit that allows the candidate to fulfill the requirements of the role.

RPIA is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture, one which reflects the world in which we live. We encourage applicants from underrepresented groups including visible minorities, members of sexual minority groups, first nations persons, persons with disabilities, and women to apply. At RPIA, we are dedicated to creating a culture with a diversity of talented individuals who join, stay, and work in an environment that enables them to thrive.

About RP Investment Advisors - Toronto


We are a growing investment management firm that specializes in publicly traded global corporate bonds. RPIA was founded in 2009 by a group of partners, each with more than 20 years of international and debt market experience. Since then, we have grown to 50+ employees with over $5 billion in assets under management for private clients, family offices, foundations, and pensions in Canada.

job_title: Intern - Investment Analyst, Strategy & Risk (4 month contract)
job_description:
Toronto, ONTemporaryThe opportunity
April – August 2019
Do you want to get exposure to asset management and cutting edge analytics while working with financial data and implementing business logic using SQL?
We are always investigating new topics such as machine learning and big data analytics, with a view on how they can be practically applied within a pension plan.
You will supply financial data and help develop analytic tools used by researchers to address practical topics for managing the total fund portfolio
You will learn about asset classes and their risk and return characteristics
You will work with modern web-based technologies and architectures
Who you’ll work with
Working in a team with 5 other quants and/or software developers
The work is project based, with projects ranging from half a day to the full term
Reporting to Director of Research & Analytics in the Strategy & Risk department
Immediate clients are the researchers using the tools and data you develop
Work location is Toronto head office in our hoteling work space
Hours are reasonably flexible with no additional travelling involved
What you’ll do
Depending on the candidate’s skill level in SQL, the role will either be primarily SQL development with some data management or primarily data management.
Programming business logic in SQL
Implementing new analytics in web-based UI
Updating financial time series data in an Oracle database using SQL
Investigating and resolving spikes, gaps, and overlaps in time series data
Interpreting financial and accounting data by applying investment knowledge
Trouble-shoot in-house software applications for performance and functionality
Perform research on other investment managers such as endowments and sovereign wealth funds
What you’ll need
Must have working knowledge of SQL programming
Must have familiarity with asset classes and their distinct characteristics
Must have solid mathematical background, particularly in statistics
Concentration in Mathematics, Computer Programming, Statistics, finance or related field.
Knowledge of object-oriented programming is an asset.
Preferred knowledge or interest in machine learning or AI
Previous work term experience preferred
Must be enrolled in 3rd / 4th year or related Master’s program
You must be enrolled in a co-op program or returning back to your studies after the work term is completed
What we’re offering
We operate in a pay for performance environment that offers competitive salary and numerous opportunities for professional growth and development.
At Ontario Teachers’, diversity is one of our core strengths. We are a globally minded organization and take pride ensuring that the people we hire and the culture we create reflect and celebrate diversity of thought, background and experience.
Accommodations are available upon request for candidates with a disability taking part in the recruitment process and once hired.
How to apply
Are you ready to learn about investment fund management and take your career to the next level? Submit your application online at www.otpp.com/careers and apply to requisition #1677. The following documents are required to be uploaded with your application:
Cover letter
Resume
Copy of your transcripts
**Once your resume is uploaded, you may use the ‘upload’ button to attach more documents such as those required and outlined above.
The deadline to apply for this role is March 28, 2019.
Please note that as part of our eligibility criteria it is required you are available to begin on or before April 29th, 2019 for onboarding and training purposes.
We thank you for applying, however, only those selected to continue will be contacted. Note that candidates must be legally entitled to work in the country where this role is located.

Toronto, ONMedical cannabis markets are rapidly expanding in Canada and around the world. Recreational cannabis is on the horizon. Now is your chance to join the largest, most recognized cannabis producer in the country as we set off to build something amazing, relying on established but ever-evolving brands.

The Company

Hi.

Canopy Growth Corporation ("Canopy Growth") is a listed company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (WEED), the New York Stock Exchange (CGC) and part of the S&P Composite Index. Its wholly owned subsidiaries, including its flagship Tweed and international medical companies operating under the Spectrum Cannabis brand, are leading producers of legal, regulated cannabis. With millions of square feet of licensed cannabis production, and operations spanning five continents, Canopy is the largest legal producer of cannabis in the world.

Headquartered in Smiths Falls Ontario, Canopy Growth recognizes that employees are at the core of our success and take pride in a corporate culture that emphasizes inclusiveness, collaboration and diversity. Our employees stem from a wide range of professional backgrounds; each bringing their own unique skills and talents to the table, working together to continue our incredible momentum of growth.

The Opportunity

Tokyo Smoke became a household name in cannabis long before the first legal gram was ever sold. Through our award-winning concept of combining craft coffee with cannabis accessories and lifestyle goods, Tokyo Smoke has been revolutionizing cannabis retail well before 10/17. In addition to our Tokyo Smoke coffee shops, we now operate a growing network of beloved cannabis dispensaries. A proud part of the Canopy Growth family, we are now better positioned than ever to write cannabis history.

Canopy Growth is looking for a strategic and analytically driven Analyst, Retail Solutions & Infrastructure to help establish and evolve its retail infrastructure at a time of rapid retail expansion in the cannabis industry. Reporting to the Director, Retail Solutions & Infrastructure, you will serve as a critical partner to in developing new capabilities, defining and standing up supporting processes. Through data driven analysis, you will support driving the business forward. You are action oriented and want to help out across the business. You enjoy projects and will be a key contributor to achieving strategic priorities. You have a natural analytical way of thinking, and your quick and strategic problem-solving mindset allow you to get sh*t done quickly.

Responsibilities


Support Director, Retail Solutions and Infrastructure in establishing foundational capabilities to fuel rapid expansion
Support the retail infrastructure teams to improve processes, gain efficiencies and expand
Use cross-functional knowledge to identify gaps, understand issues, and establish perspectives that help achieve strategic business objectives
Stretch skills across a range of inter-departmental disciplines establishing and owning new capabilities as required
Complete strategic analysis to enable data driven decision making
Assist in the management and delivering of projects
Develop strategies and solutions to solve complex technical challenges
Other duties as assigned

Experience and Background

Undergraduate degree in Business, Economics, or a related discipline
Minimum 3-5 years’ experience in a strategy or analyst role providing actionable strategic insights and analysis to internal or external clients
Management consulting experience is considered an asset
Analytically driven; quick and strategic problem-solver
Adaptable, flexible and able to manage competing priorities
Advanced user of MS office suit
Effective Program Management skills, with demonstrated ability to lead complex strategic and operational initiatives
Experience in Retail/CPG/Alcohol industry/Management Consulting is considered an asset

Other Details

This is a full-time position based out of Toronto, Ontario.

Note: The chosen applicant will be required to successfully complete background and reference checks.

We appreciate the interest by all candidates however we will be contacting those that best fit the requirements. All resumes will be maintained in our database for six months for consideration in future searches for talent.

Canopy Growth welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Montréal, QCABOUT LEGER
Leger is the largest Canadian-owned polling, research and strategic marketing firm with over 400 employees located in its offices in Montréal, Québec, Toronto, Edmonton and Calgary in Canada, and Philadelphia in the United States. Our firm is distinguished by the marketing intelligence and strategic advice we offer our customers.

Being at the forefront of our industry, working for Leger means working on ambitious and compelling projects, integrating a team of passionate people who are invested in their work, and evolving in a stimulating and convivial environment. Joining the Leger team is to have at heart the values of quality, innovation, collaboration and commitment.

JOB DESCRIPTION
Leger is looking for an Analytics and Business Intelligence Analyst to join its expanding team in Montréal. Reporting to the Associate Vice-President of the Analytics Department, the Analytics and Business Intelligence Analyst performs advanced statistical analyses using various types of data (structured and unstructured), and leverages survey data, big data, live data, CRM data, etc. to provide our clients with insights that facilitate their decision-making.

Using data mining and modelling expertise, the successful candidate will produce and conduct analyses, as well as relevant, effective and innovative dashboards and insights to support our clients’ business processes and strategic decisions.

In this position you will be challenged daily by some of the best. This role is for a creative and entrepreneurial team player and for someone with a hunger for learning.

We can’t wait to welcome you, so apply today!

RESPONSIBILITIES
Perform data mining and modelling
Identify, define, consolidate and analyze the data required to implement solutions
Propose and develop effective business intelligence solutions in alignment with the business’s needs
Develop simulation models, dashboards and predictive models
Perform advanced statistical analyses: segmentation, MaxDiff, TURF, joint analyses, factor analyses, etc.
Develop analytical solutions to support clients’ strategic decision-making
Respect clients’ quality requirements and turnaround times
REQUIREMENTS
Master’s degree in statistics, operational research, business intelligence, marketing, or any other related discipline that focuses on quantitative methods and data science
A minimum of two years’ experience in the field of business intelligence/data modelling, is preferred
Advanced R user, required (Advanced knowledge of Shiny a strong asset)
Advanced knowledge of machine learning algorithms (R or Python)
Ability to build statistical models with tools (SPSS, R, and Python)
Ability to develop interactive dashboards using sur R/Shiny, Tableau, and Excel
Strong computer skills, including proficiency with Excel, pivot tables, macros and database interfaces
Bilingualism (French/English, spoken and written)
Skills in statistical analysis and multi-project management
Thoroughness, attention to detail and precision in processing data
Curious, self-sufficient, creative
Team player who wishes to be a key player on a small team
Strong sense of responsibility toward the projects entrusted to him
WHY WORK FOR LEGER?
Dynamic and technological marketing research firm and forerunner in its field / Our remarkable team / Stimulating projects / Major clients / A world of opportunity / Friendly environment / Office in the heart of Old Montreal / Easy access by public transit


This position is an opportunity for a stimulating career within an expanding team. If you wish to become a member of our incredible team and you feel you are the talented, motivated and ambitious person we are looking for, contact us!

T1 Consulting is an internal team of experts at the T1 Agency that specialize in strategy, sponsorship and revenue generation. We use tools, data, research, future-forward thinking and industry knowledge to uncover our clients’ next move and provide solutions. From building sponsorship strategies and revenue generation plans for some of the biggest charities in Canada, to auditing and valuing sponsorships for major brands, we work on sponsorship on both sides of the table.

Role Summary

Reporting to the Manager of Business Intelligence, the Business Intelligence Analyst/Developer will create and manage BI, Big Data and analytic solutions that convert data into information used by several business units within Laura Canada. The role calls for someone who can work autonomously as well as within a team, is an excellent communicator and has extensive experience in BI development. This individual will be part of the BI Team and work closely with other IT Team members and business users to deliver enhancements and solutions to existing BI platform.

Critical functions

 Participates in business analysis activities to gather required reporting, ETL and dashboard requirements.
 Understands Key Performance Indicators that drive company measurement, reporting and analytics across key data sources and functions.
 Translates business requirements into specifications that will be used to implement the required reports, ETL and dashboards, created from potentially multiple data sources.
 Provides support as required to ensure the availability and performance of developed BI solutions for both stores and Head Office users.
 Provides technical assistance and cross training to other team members.
 Provides training and assistance to users for generation of adhoc reports.
 Designs and implements technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processes.
 Performs technical troubleshooting, code debugging, and problem solving for custom-built data warehousing solution.
 Communicates regularly with Programmers and System Administrator to ensure database integrity, security and optimized performance at the application and database level.
 Identifies, communicates, and resolves data quality and data reconciliation issues.
 Participates in and supports all planning and problem resolution.
 Performs independent audits and reviews, and validates databases to ensure data integrity.
 Develops and enforces standards and procedures for the storage and retrieval of data.
 As required, performs data cleansing activities in support of BI solution needs.
 Is available to provide off-hour support for any reporting and BI issues.

Requirements

The Culinary Systems Analyst is responsible for the input, administration and analysis of culinary-related data for SSP America’s menus, recipes, ingredients, food cost, food safety and nutrition. The position is under the supervision of the Director of Culinary Systems. The position will report to the Director of Culinary Systems.
 Essential Functions

Analyze recipe cooking techniques, ingredient quantities, assembly procedures and recipe yields to identify potential errors in recipes
Review menu & recipe nutritional analysis using Crunch Time software solution in compliance with USDA and FDA guidelines and regulations
Review and analyze recipe & menu theoretical costs for commercial viability
Professionally write culinary specific preparation methods and HACCP procedures for food service style recipes
Culinary Data Input:Recipes, ingredients, costs, cooking procedures and nutrition into multiple software systems (Excel, My Inventory, Crunch Time Restaurant Management Software)
Assist with the preparation, development and testing of SSP recipes in coordination with SSP’s Research & Development Chef
Ability to travel as needed
Regular attendance as required by SSP America attendance policy
Performs any other duties as assigned by manager


Minimum of five (5) years’ experience as a working Chef or Kitchen Manager required
Formal Culinary Education or equivalent professional experience required, with a background in nutrition preferred
Excellent communication (verbal and written), the ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing, organization, project management, time management, and follow-up skills
Proven analytical, technical, and problem solving skills; capable of critical thinking
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook) advance experience in Excel with the ability to manage spreadsheets and other software as needed
Exceptional interpersonal skills and the ability to interface effectively with all levels of management in the field and at the SSP America corporate offices, as well as the SSP Group parent company offices in the United Kingdom
Proven ability to handle conflict, work under pressure/deal with high stress situations, and resolve uncomfortable situations with clients, customers, peers and direct reports, and do so while exercising sound judgement and decision making
Ability to maintain a dynamic and positive attitude to support our culture and work environment and foster positive and effective working relationships with others in the organization, clients, vendors, etc.; Must be open to feedback and criticism and adjust performance/behavior accordingly
Capable of critical thinking and problem solving
Demonstrated ability to work both independently and among cross-functional teams with minimal supervision; ability to juggle multiple tasks, work in a fast-paced environment, successfully manage multiple projects, and effectively prioritize assigned job duties to meet deadlines and objectives
Strong business acumen with a desire to make a positive impact on the business; highly motivated to take ownership of assigned roles and to improve upon current processes and procedures
Effective organizational maturity to prioritize daily, weekly, monthly, and yearly activities
Competencies

Commercial Influence…Quality Conscious…Drive & Tenacity…Leading Change…Guest Focus…Communication & Impact…Working with Others…Planning & Analysis…

Administrative Responsibilities

This position works directly for members of senior management within the organization and will require the exercising of discretion and independent judgment with respect to matters of significance to the organization. These include, but are not limited to analyzing techniques, ingredients, and recipe specifications and making and/or recommending changes that could affect the financial performance of the organization; making and/or recommending changes to recipes, production standards, or menus that could have an effect on the companies compliance with FDA, USDA, and HACCP regulations, and other responsibilities listed within this job description.

Position Type / Expected Hours of Work

This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work will vary, Wednesday through Tuesday and are dependent upon the hours mutually agreed upon with manager and based on the needs of the business. However, the position will work with multiple sites across the United States and Canada, so flexibility to early morning and evening hours is expected to compensate for the change in time zones, or as job duties demand. Work and travel on weekends and holidays and trips that require overnights may also be required.

Work Environment

This job functions independently, and/or in conjunction with cross-functional teams, with little or no direct supervision in an office setting, or may be home-based at the discretion of the manager. If travel became necessary, job duties would be performed in an airport environment, both pre and post-security, both within an office setting and in a restaurant, warehouse, and/or production environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers and multiple computer programs, phones, smart phones, video conferencing and/or web conferencing, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.

Physical Demands

SSP America, Inc. complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), as amended by the ADA Amendments Act, and all applicable state or local law. Consistent with those requirements, SSP America, Inc. will reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with a disability if such accommodation would allow the individual to perform the essential functions of the job, unless doing so would create an undue hardship. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a team member to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

 While performing the duties of this job, the team member is regularly required to communicate with fellow team members and be able to accurately exchange information in these situations; resolve difficult situations and effectively manage and deal with stressful situations and areas of ambiguity within the functions of the job; while working within the office setting, will remain sedentary 100% of the time; while working out in the field, will be required to be mobile and move about to the company’s location(s) within the airport environment 100% of the time, to include standing, walking, bending, kneeling, stooping, and crouching; operate a computer and other office equipment.

Work Authorization/Security Clearance

Must be able to establish eligibility to work in the United States. This position requires successful completion of a criminal background check.
Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

You possess Business acumen and analyze business requirements, create and execute test cases/scripts
You effectively communicate issues to proper team members and track to resolution Strong communication, interpersonal, analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills

Possess confidence in making judgment calls in resolving problems

Minimum 4 year experience with integration testing (batch, real time, ETL, message queues)

Experience with test automation using Selenium and/or related automation framework, preferred

Perform regression testing

Mississauga, ONThe joint venture between SNC-Lavalin and Aecon has been awarded a contract with Ontario Power Generation (OPG) to carry out the Darlington Retube and Feeder Replacement (RFR) project. The project involves refurbishment of all four reactors at the Darlington Generating Station and consists of two phases – a Definition Phase and an Execution Phase. The Definition Phase includes the construction of a full-scale reactor mock-up to simulate key elements of the refurbishment work, and the development, procurement and testing of specialized tooling required for the project.


The Execution Phase involves refurbishment of the reactor cores using the tools and methods that were developed and tested during the Definition Phase.

Job Description
Enterprise Data & Analytics is responsible for providing Districts and Customers with exceptional data analytics support for planning, root cause analysis and process improvement activities that accelerate Expeditors’ business. Scope, plan, develop and deploy impactful data-driven solutions for our Districts and Customers

Support our District as a subject matter expert on our data, tools and environments

Toronto, ONAt Sun Life, we work together, share common values and encourage growth and achievement. We offer many career paths that attract a wide variety of talent and skills. Follow a path that lets your talents shine.
Job Description:
Sun Life has launched an ambitious journey to deploy data as a foundational pillar and strategy across the whole business. Be a part of an exciting and challenging opportunity by becoming part of the analytics community helping to accelerate the growth and application of data science capabilities.
As a Data Scientist, you will be part of a large analytics community and will be focused within the Individual Insurance & Wealth (IIW) management business helping the team by, but not limited to, mining data for business insights, analyzing and interpreting trends using statistical tools and techniques, reporting on business performance, and triaging code and data-related issues.
Within SLF Canada, IIW is one of the largest business units, with over 1,700 employees. Individual accounts for approximately 20% of worldwide earnings in the overall Sun Life Financial group of companies, and over 45% of Canadian earnings. We manufacture and distribute leading-edge life insurance, health insurance and wealth management products and solutions for over two million individual customers.
This role sits in the client experience insights team within IIW, a team focused on using data and analytics to understand our clients and how our business can best support them in achieving their goals of lifetime financial security and living healthier lives. The team supports the IIW marketing team, but this role will be focused on short to medium term special projects, tackling the most pressing business issues using data and analytics to change decisions and the way we do business.
Sun Life views success in this role related to 4 key characteristics:
Fierce curiosity. You are drawn to discovering and leveraging new data and taking on challenging business puzzles. Understanding business. We’ve got a lot of data, but it’s not going to turn itself into insights, and you can’t help with that unless you understand what the numbers mean. A passion for solving problems. The most successful data analysts don’t just spin data and give numbers, they solve the problem. Technical skills. How to wrangle structured data is a must (i.e., SQL) with strong SAS skills needed currently and the opportunity to move to other analytical tools (R, Python etc) as our data environment matures.
Accountabilities:
Analyze and interpret data to identify key insights and opportunities to better understand advisor and client behaviour through data mining client databases and other information systems, including analysis of CRM data, web and mobile applications to enhance the advisor and client experience
Help tackle key business problems via analytical work, from requirements specification, data gathering, analyst and statistical model building to presentations and adoption
Work closely with stakeholders across Sun Life as a subject matter expert in the individual client data and to understand their business problems and how data can be best leveraged to inform decisions
Ability to draw out business insights from analytical output and work with team leads to put together business recommendations.
Put together effective presentations of findings and desire to present to multiple levels of stakeholders
Leverage internal training, peers and other sources to continue to grow capabilities
An active contributing member to the analytics academy to help foster and grow the data science community at Sun Life
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
5+ years working with data (i.e., quantitative analysis experience, including handling, manipulating and analyzing data and creating analytical reports)
Comfortable writing complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources
Experience with building predictive and prescriptive models in a business setting (i.e., regression, decision trees, deep learning etc.)
Expert using SAS to work with data, including macros
Experience with BI tools such as Tableau to aid in effective and concise oral and written storytelling and insights communication
Ability to work as a team to help deliver multiple projects with courage in managing expectations of team leaders
Demonstrated business acumen and ability to translate knowledge of audience insights into marketing strategies
Proven track record of successfully operating in a matrix environment with cross-function team participation successes
Strong partnering approach with a commitment to meeting internal and external business partners' unique needs and expectations
BSc in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field (i.e., computer science)
Nice to haves:
Past experience in life insurance/wealth management, or other financial services industry (e.g., retail banking, credit card, re-insurance and casualty insurance)
MSc preferably in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field (i.e., computer science)
Additional statistical programming languages (i.e., Python/R)
Experience working with unstructured data
Big Data Technologies: Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, HBase, Storm, Spark, Kafka, etc.

Job Description
Reporting into the Sr. Manager of Sales & Operations Planning, the Analyst, Supply and Material Planning is responsible for leading the end to end planning of finished goods from a demand, supply and materials management perspective, while delivering key Management by Objectives (MBO’s). This role will report directly to the Sr. Manager of S&OP and be accountable to develop and maintain a rolling 12-18 month demand/supply/material plan while leveraging teams across the organization to resolve issues impacting the delivery of MBO’s. The incumbent will be in a key requires strong business knowledge, systems acumen (APO SAP) and be able to influence various teams to effectively balance MBO’s across the total supply chain.
Responsibilities:
Interact frequently with sales, marketing and supply chain personnel to balance supply and demand.
Develop, maintain and publish a rolling 12-18-month demand, production and material plans.
Generate weekly and monthly statistical forecast based on input from monthly KHBM (KraftHeinz Business Management) reviews, using all data pertinent to creating the sales forecast (historical sales, market trends, seasonality, promotions, and eventually tier 1 account POS and inventory levels)
Develop valid, feasible production plans for finished goods and component items based on equipment, labor and raw material availability.
Attend & contribute to daily, weekly and monthly MBO management meetings
Perform root cause analysis on GAP(s) to MBO’s (CFR, Working Capital, MUDA and Forecast Accuracy) and implement corrective actions
Work with centralized best practices team to ensure utilization of best methods (statistical models and software tools) in the development of forecasts, production and material plans.
Interact with manufacturing finite schedule schedulers to ensure production plans adhere to run rules while minimizing the costs of idle labour and changeovers
Maintain long term capacity plans with input from marketing and business development on growth and continuous improvement assumption(s) and share risk and opportunities via monthly supply review
Requirements
Completed Bachelor’s degree
Prior management or coaching experience. Ideal candidate will be an effective people leader
Knowledge of principles of production planning, inventory management, and forecasting (APICS subject areas).
Thorough understanding of production capabilities, inventory theory, and cost trade-offs in managing the supply chain.
Well-developed interpersonal and communication skills, team building skills, influencing & negotiation skills.
Strong computer skills, especially using software like Excel and APO-SAP (APO-SNP, APO-DP)
Strong quantitative and analytical skills, ability to analyze ambiguous data, determine key information elements, develop optimal plans, and recommend & execute action plans that weigh risks and benefits.

Location(s)
Don Mills

Metal Supermarkets, the world’s largest supplier of small-quantity metals, is seeking IT Support Analyst to join our team. Known worldwide as The Convenience Stores for Metal, we are a business to business franchised brand with 90 brick-and-mortar stores across the United States, Canada and the United Kingdom. The HRIS Analyst is responsible for all HR information systems, content management systems and electronic data management initiatives, including the planning and directing continual improvements of the HRIS to support organizational, operational and HR objectives.

They are responsible for the accuracy of the data housed in the system and ensure access to reporting and analysis of the HR data. They coach and develop the HRIS team to ensure a high quality of experience for end users of the system.

Business Intelligence Analyst – Large independent Fuel and Power Company

An exciting company that delivers high-quality petroleum products to motorists, businesses, consumers and wholesale customers across North America. They are one of North America’s fastest growing and largest independent distributors and marketers of fuels and lubricants

Title: BI Analyst
Location: Calgary, AB OR Montreal, QC
Position status: Full time permanent
Salary: Highly competitive + Benefits + Vacation

TO APPLY: Please send your resume to: adam.hassoulas@groomassocies.com
The Business Intelligence Analyst would be responsible for managing a portfolio of BI customers from various business areas across the organization. The position owns the relationship with the key BI decision makers from these groups and leads requirement gathering for metrics, reports and dashboards. They will coordinate with the BI Report Development and ETL teams to access data and build reports. Another key function of the role is to ensure that governance rules are being followed within the business intelligence environment.

Key Responsibilities:

Relationship Management & Governance:

o Manages a portfolio of BI customers (functional business units)
o Lead regular discussions with business units to ensure BI roadmap is on course
o Monitor BI workspaces to ensure governance standards are met
o Deliver training and support to user base
o Recommend solutions and enhancements to business units based on research of new features and/or methods within BI applications


Requirements Gathering:

o Lead sessions with business units to determine BI reporting needs
o Document requirements for key metrics, reports and dashboards with a focus on driving to decisions
o Identify all sources of data that underpin BI reporting
o Deliver reporting requirements to BI Report Builder and ETL teams to define data gathering process

Report Building:

o Develop data models based on report requirements
o Support BI Report Builders to build, test and promote reports
o Coordinate communication between the business units and BI Report Builders for report trouble shooting and maintenance

Provide business intelligence support to Project teams for acquisitions and integrations into the company’s BI platform

Qualifications and Skills:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Business is preferred. However, relevant experience or related education would also be considered
5 years of related experience in Business Intelligence and/or Business Analysis
History of relationship development and strong requirement gathering skills
Proficiency with Business Intelligence software (Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, etc.)
Technical knowledge of data modelling and databases
Experience with Power Query (M-code), DAX, and SQL is an asset
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to communicate effectively to technical and non-technical audiences
