job_title: Principal Business Analyst, Lending Professional Services
job_description:
Nomis is seeking a high calibre Principal Business Analyst to serve our growing client base of retail banks in the US, Canada and worldwide, in the area of pricing optimization of their lending portfolios. You will lead and manage end-to-end client pricing engagements from "kick-off to go-live", including business consulting, requirements gathering, analytical and technical solution design, data pipeline configuration and statistical modelling, testing and validation, user training, and supporting customer adoption and insight generation as they "put rates in market" leveraging our proprietary software. We are seeking a candidate to work from our Toronto or San Francisco Bay Area offices.

Who We Are & What We Build

We partner with Banks and FinTechs on their journey to best-in-class pricing technology and analytics so that they deliver more value to their customers, employees and shareholders. Our top-notch people, proven technology, and innovative analytics are tackling big data challenges at banks and lenders every day. We deliver market-leading cloud-based Pricing & Profitability Management solutions and insights for the Banking & Financial Services industry leveraging cutting-edge behavioral data science. We are a Blue Chip venture-backed company with the vision to transform the consumer banking landscape.

Who You Are

Intensely curious, collaborative, structured and detail-oriented, you are a strong and credible client-facing business consultant and project manager, as well as an experienced hands-on data analyst and model builder. You are equally comfortable thinking through and communicating the big picture and the technical/analytical details. You have a keen understanding of financial services and have a significant track record of translating business user needs into transformational analytical solutions that yield real business value. You have experience and skill working and effectively communicating with a wide variety of business and technical stakeholders (both vendor and client side).

Responsibilities

Consulting


Serve as an engagement manager taking on a visible leadership role across multiple concurrent engagements with leading US and/or Canada banking clients
Direct the efforts of more junior team members (business analysts and consultants)
Elicit business requirements from clients in a structured, collaborative way and translate into analytical/technical solution design.
Coordinate project teams (including vendor and client stakeholders) to keep projects on-time and on-budget, with high quality and customer satisfaction/retention.
Create and deliver impactful presentations to influence clients and facilitate team communications
Communicate pricing recommendations clearly, concisely and confidently to clients

Data & Analytics


Develop data pipeline and modelling specifications based on customer requirements.
Build, adapt and validate data pipeline and customer response models leveraging strong SQL, R, and Excel skills.
Develop expertise regarding the Nomis Price Optimizer (NPO) and its various analytical and technical components; apply this expertise to effective and efficient solution design and configuration based on a given bank's requirements.

Solution Design


Design and implement A|B test programs to prove product and pricing recommendations in market
Collaborate with internal teams to translate requirements into solution design, modelling plan and execution, software configuration, and timelines
Design and develop Tableau dashboards and reports that drive informed business decisions and measure performance
Identify insights, features, and enhancements to be productized by the development team

Desired Skills & Background


Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field
5-10+ years of experience in business and data analytics
Strong statistical skills and experience focused on business decision making and problem solving
Demonstrated skill and extended experience with R, SQL, Tableau, Excel, and PowerPoint
Exceptional problem solving skills, collaborative teamwork, intellectual horsepower, curiosity, initiative, and attention to detail
Polished communicator, persuasive presenter, fast on your feet, and innately organized
Experienced project manager able to lead multiple engagements simultaneously
Ability to simplify complexity, in particular to communicate statistical and analytical concepts and findings to a wide range of business and technical audiences with appropriate levels of detail and emphasis
Sufficient interest and exposure to Java coding to engage with dedicated developers (be a good consumer of code)
Willingness to travel up to 30% of the time
Experience within banking and financial services sectors

job_title: IT Security Policies and Exception Management - Senior Analyst
job_description:
Greater Toronto Area, ONOverview of the Role


Deloitte leads with purpose, solving complex issues for our clients and communities. Across disciplines and across borders, Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited (DTTL) Global supports our network of national member firms by developing and driving global strategy, programs, and platforms, and creating new solutions and transformational experiences. Our people share a passion for igniting change and a strong service orientation that shapes our organization and those it supports.


The Deloitte Global Cybersecurity function is responsible for the firm’s overall objectives of enhancing data protection, standardizing and securing critical infrastructure and gaining cyber visibility through security operations centers. The Cybersecurity organization delivers a comprehensive set of cybersecurity services to Deloitte member firms through regional delivery hubs and a Global Fusion Center. We are seeking a Senior Analyst, Security Policies and Standard Exception Management to join the team.


The position reports to the Senior Manager, Security Policies and Standards Exception Management. The role has a primary focus to:

Conduct evaluations of exception requests by reviewing policy requirements, security standards, system and member firm architecture, designs and material
Make informed risk analysis and decision based on identified information security issues
Responsibilities


As part of the Global Cybersecurity team, this professional will have the following responsibilities:

Operational
Perform exception analysis including gathering all relevant rationale, costs/constraints, and risks
Develop exception report and recommendation
Assist in presenting exception recommendations to senior cybersecurity, risk, and technology leadership
Relationship Management
Develop and maintain relationships with primary exceptions management leaders in member firms
Participate in security policies and standards exception management working group
Expectations from the Professional


Our purpose is to make an impact that matters and our aspiration is to be the undisputed leader in professional services. At the root of these goals are our Shared Values, which describe the distinctive Deloitte culture. Our Values are timeless, all-encompassing and embrace the cultures in which Deloitte member firms operate. We expect all professionals to live our purpose and shared values and be the brand ambassadors holding Deloitte Global and member firms together.

Integrity


At Deloitte, everything we do starts with integrity. In our marketplace, nothing is more important than our reputation and, accordingly, we commit to conducting business with honesty, distinctive quality, and high levels of professional behavior.

Outstanding value to markets and clients


We play a critical role in helping both the capital markets and our member firm clients operate more effectively. We consider this role a privilege, and we know it requires constant vigilance and unrelenting commitment.

Commitment to each other


We are proud of our culture of borderless collegiality and work hard to support our people. We strive to create an inclusive environment that reflects our strong, clear expectations about diversity, respect, and fair treatment.

Strength from cultural diversity


Our member firm clients' business challenges are complex and benefit from the innovation and varied perspectives that our practitioners bring. We understand that working with people of different backgrounds, cultures, and thinking styles helps our people grow into better professionals and leaders.

Calgary, ABPermanentOperations Analyst III
The Senior Operations Analyst will be required to partner with internal stakeholders and external sources to gain knowledge and insight on our business and industry. They will be primarily responsible for leading projects, building vendor relationships and focusing on operational improvements. The successful candidate should be comfortable managing multiple responsibilities, possess strong analytical acumen and business judgement with a track record of relationship management. The Senior Operations Analyst is an expert at identifying opportunities and implementing creative, simple and smart solutions, all while building strong relationships and influence with both internal and external stakeholders.
Your Impact:
Lead projects that provide Banking Operations with improved vendor performance, increased process efficiency and/or reduces costs with a focus on opportunities to improve overall capabilities.
Extract and analyze data, with the subsequent ability to synthesize the data into information and insights, which will be used to support the decision making process.
Evaluate ad-hoc requests for reports and develop procedures to extract data from various sources.
Collaborate with various teams to gain a strong understanding of project requirements and maintain strong relationships
Work with Banking Operations leaders to identify opportunities, either current or future state, and explore how to best implement solutions through data, strategic planning and working with business partners
Perform industry analysis to identify competitive positioning, industry trends, benchmarking and best practices
Develop strong working relationships relationships in order to identify and implement opportunities to eliminate waste, create value, ensure cost effectiveness and make processes smart, simple and helpful.
Ability to resolve the root cause(s) of complex business problems using measurements and analysis to support decision making
Ability to assist in the development of complex RFP requirements including data collection and analysis.
ATTRIBUTES FOR SUCCESS:
Connector: You build relationships naturally and bring people of mutual interest together easily
Translator: You have an uncanny capacity to convert large volumes of information, complex or ambiguous, into readily-understood communication
Hungry: You combine the intrinsic motivation and drive to excel with the ability and determination to achieve success
Collaborator: You are a strong partner
Customer Service Passion: You have an unrelenting desire for exceptional service by going beyond expectations
Business Judgment: You are keenly aware of business issues, processes and outcomes that could affect ATB & the Customer
Job Requirements
As the ideal candidate you possess:
University Degree in Business, Supply Chain Management, Economics or related field.
A minimum of 5 years of Vendor Management, Data Analysis or relevant experience, in a highly complex environment.
Experience with contract administration would be an asset
Experience with G-Suite and SAP would be an asset.
Exceptional analytical skills with the ability to accurately interpret and translate data in a straightforward manner.
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively within a team environment including a keen aptitude for communicating effectively through verbal and written communication.
Demonstrated ability to build collaborative relationships and influence decisions across various stakeholders in order to move initiatives forward.
Strong organizational skills with ability to manage multiple priorities.
Superior problem solving, analytical, and strategic thinking skills; can see the "big picture" in a complex business environment to drive decision making.
Advanced and broad knowledge of business issues, processes, and strategic planning
Innovative individual who can identify opportunities to add value and create efficiencies
So what can ATB Financial offer you? Imagine paying less for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments. Throw in an excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow. As an award-winning employer-of-choice – we have the best of the best working for Albertans. Sound like a team you want to be a part of?
Advancement. Fun. Rewards… We get it.

Montréal, QCJob Description

The incumbent will work closely with stakeholders to optimize cross-business processes, such as the automation of processes related to marketing, sales, pipeline management, and social media platforms.
The candidate will also analyze, harvest business learnings and formulate recommendations to the marketing team based on the analysis of the data captured across a variety of platforms.
If you love numbers, if they speak to you and if you have a talent for translating their insights into actionable and measurable outcomes, this might be the job for you. Develop processes to continuously monitor the quality and integrity of data;
Develop training content and provide training to users.

Strong business acumen, especially at the financial level
Motivated and results-oriented
Strong attention to detail
Focus on quality
Collaborative approach

Competitive salaries
Corporate bonus program
Employee recognition program
Employee referral program
Flexible hours
Comprehensive insurance plan
Training & skills upgrading
Social events
Dynamic culture

job_title: Senior IT business analyst and consultant
job_description:
We are looking for a senior IT business analyst and consultant who will be the vital link between our customers and our development teams to ensure the successful completion of analytical, building, testing and deployment of our technical cloud business solutions. Our ideal candidate has strong technical skills, the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and translate business data into digestible information that improves corporate processes.

Responsibilities

Own and develop relationship with customers, working with them to define the project requirements and optimize and enhance our solution.
Help design, document and maintain solutions and system processes.
Report on common sources of technical issues or questions and make recommendations to product team.
Lead and communicate key project requirements to the solution development team. Test and validate the solution and verify it meets customer requirements.
Constantly be on the lookout for ways to improve monitoring, discover issues and deliver better value to the customer.
Identify business trends utilizing real data, compile analysis reports that are delivered to developers and then follow-up on all results.
Implement a comprehensive management plan for each project and hold regular stakeholder meetings to keep all interested parties updated in project progress.
Requirements

MANDATORY: Based in Montreal, QC, Canada. We do not finance or subsidize relocation.
MANDATORY: Perfect spoken and written English. Strong spoken and written French an asset.
Required experience: Relevant Software, IT and business experience: 5 years or more.
A university degree in IT / Computer Science / Software engineering / Business administration / Business Technology Management.
Previous experience in Business / Systems Analysis.
Previous experience in defining, developing or testing software solution.
Proven experience in eliciting customer requirements and testing.
Experience in analyzing data to draw business-relevant conclusions and in data visualization techniques and tools.
Experience with cloud platforms like Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Power BI, Salesforce, is a plus.
Experience with databases systems (SQL, NoSQL, cloud databases, Salesforce) is a plus.
Salesforce Administrator certification is a plus.
Be driven, autonomous, hard working, and hands-on.
Be curious and ready to learn and update your skillsets continuously.

Victoria, BCThe Research Analyst reports to the local Market Research Director or Senior Research Analyst. The Research Analyst is responsible for supporting the development of local research output and thought leadership. Specifically, this position provides support for gathering and analyzing local market data and interpreting this information to identify trends in the market. Output of the analysis is used to produce research deliverables to be included in pitch and/or proposal materials and reflects opinions of various market dynamics. The Research Analyst is also accountable for accurate and proactive maintenance of third party and proprietary databases with local market data, as well as pulling data from said systems to support thought leadership and forecast development. This position is not specific to a service line, but may specialize by property type.
Job Description

Key responsibilities include:
Conduct property level analytics or retrieve comps

Receive requests and collect all input and documentation
Create and analyze market data spreadsheets
Utilize inputs provided to develop market comps
Review analysis with Research Supervisor
Participate in development of local requests for research information for pitch and/or proposal materials with Research Director and Marketing

Receive requests for data and/or analysis from Research Senior Analyst, fee-earner, or marketing team
Perform research analysis for pitch and/or proposal materials to develop pitch and/or proposal materials
Consolidate information for pitch and/or proposal material content
Work with Senior Research Analyst and Marketing to organize data for presentations
Support Research Supervisor in creation of market analysis and work with Marketing Specialist to publicize market analysis to social media platforms and website
Manage research databases

Proactively reach out to fee-earners, Managing Principal, and regional research teams to actively update and maintain databases within a defined frequency
Routinely cleanse databases and update with new information
Work with Project Coordinators to update databases after deal closes with deal terms and transaction information
Work with Senior Research Analysts to accurately cleanse data in databases
Generate and maintain statistical reports
Reporting relationship

Role will report to the following:
Solid line reporting to Managing Principal
Dotted line reporting to Regional Research Director
Metrics

Role will be evaluated on the following:
Quality of written market narrative
Service Delivery: Request Turnaround Time and Quality
Data quality
Pursuits supported
Center of Excellence reporting/participation
BACKGROUND AND EXPERIENCE

Demonstrated experience should include:
Bachelor’s degree required
Professional acumen, demonstrated interest in real estate leasing and capital markets business
Economically versed
Experience in data entry/data management and time series analysis/forecasting
1-3 years’ experience in real estate or business for other positions
Competencies
Strong oral and written communication skills
Ability to successfully resolve problems with minimal direction
Strong Microsoft Office Suite skills
Ability to plan, organize and manage processes
Knowledge of statistical calculations involved in correctly reporting vacancy rates, absorption, construction, rental rates, leasing, sales activity, renovation and proposed activity
Strong knowledge of economic data and analytical tools

RBRO Solutions is seeking a Quality Assurance Analyst to join our team at our head office in Pickering, Ontario.

The Company

RBRO Solutions, a leading business solutions provider, is dedicated to helping organizations get the greatest value from their business content and work processes. The company, trusted globally with over 400,000 business application licenses in use, has also worked with over 500 medium, large and Fortune 500 companies. RBRO was established in 2003 at the forefront of the enterprise content management, big data and document management era.

We are working on disruptive solutions that transform the way professional services organizations work. If you are looking for an opportunity to put your superior analytical skills to the test, then look no further. As a QA Analyst, you will be responsible for performing in all areas of Quality Assurance on a motivated SCRUM team with high expectations to deliver high quality software continuously.


THE OPPORTUNITY

As a Quality Assurance team member, you will be expected to contribute, analyze, review, and improve processes and tools used to ensure growth and success of the organization. Your responsibilities will include but not limited to the following:

Participate throughout the requirement analysis, design and development process, analyzing features to point out weaknesses or inconsistencies.
Support all test activities, enhance, develop and execute manual and automated test scripts, record and track software deficiencies
Participate in the creation and execution of test plans and test cases.
Write new automated tests, and modify existing tests to account for functionality changes.
Develop automated tests in partnership with developers for continuous regression testing.
Investigate, report, validate, and track bugs to resolution.
Actively participate in test automation initiatives.
Report regularly on testing progress and results.
Identify and escalate issues related to requirement gathering and product quality.
Ensure that all domain knowledge and test cases are articulated and structured well to enable swift execution by any other members of the QA team.
Actively participate to improve quality in all processes.
Do exploratory testing and acceptance of new features as part of a story-driven Agile development process.
Identify bugs through systematic testing, help developers reproduce errors, and ensure that defects are fixed.
Work with project stakeholders and developers to ensure that all aspects of the system have proper testing coverage and overall system reliability, performance and quality.
Other duties as assigned.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

College or university graduate in minimum 3-year related program
3-5 years of experience in a Quality Assurance role
Knowledge of one or more automated testing tools (Selenium preferred)
Working knowledge of SDLC and STLC methodologies
Knowledge and experience working in Agile/SCRUM teams
Experience in using bug-tracking tools
Experience in an Object Oriented environment
Strong knowledge of SQL Server
Skills:

Solid experience in designing and implementing test plans, scripts and scenarios
Solid experience in software testing and quality assurance
Superior skills in problem solving, planning, organizing and implementing testing efforts
Proficient knowledge of structured methodologies for the development, design, implementation and maintenance of applications
Experience in automated tools and version control systems on one or more platforms
Goal oriented to achieve project deadlines through self-motivation, persistence and determination
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to work independently and deliver with minimal supervision
Must be a team player, and work well under tight deadlines


Apply today! Come build your career with us!

Please no phone calls. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly by RBRO. You must be legally eligible to work in Canada. RBRO Solutions is an equal opportunity employer and will accommodate individuals with disabilities through the recruitment and selection process based on the Ontario Human Rights Code. Please advise us of any needs when your interview is booked.

PermanentWhat is the opportunity?

The GRM Corporate Insurance Risk Team is responsible for providing advice and placement of RBC’s global insurance program and risk management activities.

The Analyst, Property & Casualty will support the team in the effective execution of the corporate insurance risk management programs ensuring accuracy of analytics and insights for management decision making. You will partner directly with the business to facilitate the implementation of the Corporate Insurance Risk Management program and practices across all business platforms in the organization.

What will you do?
Support the strategy, culture and activities that enable the team to operate as an integrated organization. Support a culture of integrity and behaviors that align to RBC’s Code of Conduct and professional standards
Execute and maintain policies, standards, processes and tools for one or more corporate insurance risk management programs
Conduct research into areas of perceived elevated or emerging operational risk. Build detailed risk assessments and investigate risk events to assess for potential systemic weaknesses
Monitor large loss events/incidents as well as key risk indicator trends and provide analysis for a view of systemic issues and trends used for assessment of action plans
Provide subject matter expertise to support management to colleagues and management in understanding corporate insurance risk policies and procedures within a domain or event
Support the team in independent, thematic reviews and/or emerging risk assessments to increase awareness of risk exposure
Contribute to the production of risk dashboards and metrics to support the development of operational risk profiles /exposures. Support analysis and monitoring of claims environment information
Analyze and report on the results from corporate insurance risk program execution deliverables and outcomes

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have
1+ years of experience in risk management (1LOD or 2LOD) or related field, knowledge of financial services products, processes, and regulatory environment
Strong analytical mind-set and ability to leverage data across multiple internal and external sources
Proficient presentation skills and ability to pull together concise and effective presentations and dashboards
Willingness to work on new initiatives and work collaboratively to resolve challenges
Experience working across multi-functional teams

Nice-to-have:
College degree. Preferred Undergraduate degree, with a designation associated with risk management

What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to do challenging work

Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. Job Description:
Under the direction of the Manager, Process Excellence and Stewardship, the Analyst, Process Excellence analyzes operational processes, identifies best practice processes, and facilitates process and operational improvements to maximize every dollar donated.

Responsibilities:

Promote and drive Lean and Six Sigma (LSS); and CI as part of daily work activities – such as planning schedules, requirements, tracking budgets and metrics
Support business units with LSS deployment
Build excellent relationships with key business partners across business units
Gather data, directly investigate and analyze bottlenecks and inefficiencies to seek solutions
Translate requirements, document processes using flow diagrams and recommend solutions to improve quality system standards, procedures and processes to eliminate waste in the organization using LSS methodology
Promote a systemic approach to define problems, identify root causes, and develop and implement counter measures to achieve sustained improvements
Review and update procedures as necessary
Participate in project teams and coordinate to help execute on recommendations
Deliver on financial and other KPIs with business units
Create metrics and reports to track continuous improvement savings, and value creation
Conduct audits on recommendation roll out
Assist with training and improvement events to help socialize and change behavior

Desired Skills & Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Business or other related subject matter required
3-5 years in process improvement experience
Six Sigma Certification preferred
Demonstration of Design for Six Sigma experience
Demonstration of analytical thinking, and project management skills including being a project lead
Demonstrated process improvement success

job_title: Business Intelligence & Product Development Analyst (AMA Analytics)
job_description:
Edmonton, ABYOU LIVE BY THE MOTTO:
knowledge IS POWER.

Posted: 2019-02-13

Closing: When Filled

Location: Edmonton South
ABOUT YOU
Just like Indiana Jones, you love digging for information. You can whip up analytical reports faster than Indy can find himself in trouble. You have a knack for data and details and sharing what you've discovered in a way that makes it easy for people to understand. You're fluent in Power BI and Highcharts and don't need to reference Indy's diary to help you make heads or tails of the information you discover. You work well with a broad group of people and communicate clearly every step of the way. We like that about you!
WHAT MOVES YOU
You know the key to building strong relationships is being a great listener.
You're comfortable collaborating with people from all levels of the organization to accomplish common goals.
You have a knack for quickly understanding business unit goals and linking them to standardized analytical products that can be easily used across the organization.
You don't need anyone to light a fire under you; you know what needs doing and get it done.
You're a stickler for details and accuracy and have an uncanny ability to get your hands on the right information quickly.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Report to the Manager, BI & Product Development.
Develop highly effective and visually pleasing analytical products such as marketing segmentations, churn analysis, member profiles, etc., in such a way that it's easily consumed by the business.
Build BI reports in Power BI based around internal stakeholder needs.
Respond to internal, field and vendor requests for information regarding products.
Consult with stakeholders on options to modify or enhance analytical products; identify themes based on requests and raise them with management.
Design performance metrics, reporting formats and dashboards.
Ongoing development and enhancements of impactful dashboards, reports and products to effectively enable insights and business decisions.
Develop in-depth knowledge and understanding of business strategy, financial goals, processes and requirements across multiple business lines.
Determine requirements, define key performance indicators, and develop BI solutions to business problems by regularly communicating with executives, business and operational leaders, and subject matter experts.
WHAT YOU'VE DONE
You have a bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, business management, specialized training/certification or equivalent work experience.
You're no newbie. You have 5-7 years of Business Analysis or related technical experience – on this we must insist.
You'll get bonus points if you have experience with Microsoft Power BI and/or Agile/Scrum.
You're an expert when it comes to using data analysis technology and language (SQL, Python, DAX, SSRS, BI tools).
You can analyze and interpret data and do queries from multiple data sources (SQL< SQL Sparks) with one hand tied behind your back.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

StarTech.com is looking to add two new Data & Analytics Specialists to its Data Analytics Department.

Reporting to the Manager, Analytics, the Data & Analytics Specialist will contribute in areas such as data compilation, analysis, modelling and reporting. This role is responsible for interpreting and analyzing large data sets, turning information into meaningful insights and ultimately aiding the organization in making informed decisions.

In addition, this role will be support the development, monitoring, testing and implementation of data models, and be accountable for the quality, timeliness, and completeness of their work.

This position offers a competitive salary, bonus potential, and benefit package.

In this role you will:

Evaluate and obtain data from multiple sources (internal and external) and interpret / analyze using statistical techniques to provide ongoing reports as well as identify trends or patterns
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize efficiency and quality
Leverage your Data Modeling toolkit by summarizing and providing summary statistics on data using Excel, understand the functional nature of various pre-built R scripts and update, clean, organize and format data for input into R scripts

Toronto, ONPermanentHelp us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

Primary focus is subject matter expertise and ownership of CTC’s CAFM (Computer Aided Facility Management) system (FM Systems) for consistency and accuracy on a global basis. This role reports directly to the AVP, Facility Services. This data will be used for decision making on long term portfolio planning, capital budget development and prioritization, benchmarking and continuous improvement opportunities.

What you’ll do

Provide drawing updates to reflect recent renovations and furniture reconfigurations

Advise and Monitor drawing standards made to third-party services as needed

Create preliminary space plans in AutoCAD for Planner and Stakeholder review as needed

Develop internal and external benchmarking to compare the corporation with similar industries

Act as CAFM subject matter expert for all data maintenance and reporting activities

Roll out/ incorporate and maintain CAFM for all CTC Banners across the country

Address issues with CAFM performance / functionality

Collect and report issues with the tool to Vendor services, monitor issues for resolution and closure;

Identify key metrics using industry standards and best practices, create and continue to develop dashboard reporting for performance metrics using CAFM and other databases.

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

Inclusive leaders who build and develop teams that effectively anticipate and respond to disruption, while consistently delivering strong performance

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

Experience in using CAFM systems such as FM Systems, Aperture, Manhattan etc. required.

Dilpoma/ Degree in Interior Design/ Architecture / AutoCAD Technician preferred

Experience in Corporate Facility Management/ Real Estate fields is an asset

Technical skills to integrate different databases to support CAFM outcomes, including HR, IT and Finance systems

Ottawa, ONMedical cannabis markets are rapidly expanding in Canada and around the world. Recreational cannabis is on the horizon. Now is your chance to join the largest, most recognized cannabis producer in the country as we set off to build something amazing, relying on established but ever-evolving brands.

The Company

Hi.

Canopy Growth Corporation ("Canopy Growth") is a listed company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (WEED), the New York Stock Exchange (CGC) and part of the S&P Composite Index. Its wholly owned subsidiaries, including its flagship Tweed and international medical companies operating under the Spectrum Cannabis brand, are leading producers of legal, regulated cannabis. With millions of square feet of licensed cannabis production, and operations spanning five continents, Canopy is the largest legal producer of cannabis in the world.

Headquartered in Smiths Falls Ontario, Canopy Growth recognizes that employees are at the core of our success and take pride in a corporate culture that emphasizes inclusiveness, collaboration and diversity. Our employees stem from a wide range of professional backgrounds; each bringing their own unique skills and talents to the table, working together to continue our incredible momentum of growth.

The Opportunity

The Retail Labour Analyst will work as part of the retail team to evaluate & lead labor optimization planning, including retail key performance indicator (KPI)management, labor scheduling, gap analysis and retail labor dashboards on a national level. This role will identify new opportunities, execute labor scheduling with store leaders and district management, conduct due diligence, provide labor management recommendation, track KPI’S and perform directed research. Success in this role requires strong written and verbal communication skills, an analytical and questioning mindset, demonstrated project management abilities, creativity and enthusiasm for optimization of resources and KPI’s.

Responsibilities

Evaluate, analysis, due diligence and valuation tasks that include:


Qualifying labor opportunities and performing comprehensive due diligence on a labor scheduling system to meet or exceed labor targets
Reviewing confidential vital retail information and data. preparing analyses and presenting summaries of findings/recommendations to internal decision makers on a store and operational level
Reviewing, developing and maintaining dynamic labor models that incorporate optimized service scenarios, sensitivity analysis, business decline/increase options, valuations, historical and forecast data to analyze non-routine & routine labor in a manner that supports decision making
Work with service and guest feedback partners to strategize and optimize labor execution correlation to guest/employee feedback

Research tasks that include:

Compiling, analyzing and synthesizing information from a broad range of sources such as financial databases, industry analysis, traffic pattern analysis, competitive factors, financial statements and HR planning software
Preparing ideal labor summaries and presentations to the internal customers
Assisting in developing comprehensive labor management dashboards to measure daily, weekly, monthly

Portfolio company support and reporting tasks that include:

Supporting the team in generating and executing value-add strategies within the operating businesses
Monitoring ongoing financial and operational performance of national retail planning, budgets and execution
Provide assistance in the preparation of performance reporting as required.
Conduct periodic site visits and on occasion oversee and understand labor constraints, opportunities and best practices

Experience and Background


2+ years of related work experience (retail or service industry preferred)
Demonstrated research, project management, financial modeling, problem solving, analytical and valuation skills;
Ability to systematically manage a challenging workload independently and meet deadlines;
Current technology skills with advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office, Advanced Excel skills, Google sheets & pivot tables;
Financial acumen and demonstrated ability to identify risk;
Awareness of economic conditions and indicators;
Professional, friendly and courteous demeanor;
A degree, designation or certification in a related field is preferred

Other Details

This is a full-time position based out of Smiths Falls or Kanata, Ontario.

Note: The chosen applicant will be required to successfully complete background and reference checks.

We appreciate the interest by all candidates however we will be contacting those that best fit the requirements. All resumes will be maintained in our database for six months for consideration in future searches for talent.

Canopy Growth welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

The successful candidate will have to ensure an optimal Prime Brokerage Services production quality by providing a stable information system thanks to a technical and functional support across cash and syntethique chains

The candidate has to manage the expectations and relationships of users, sponsors and senior management.


§ Production:
§ Manage the Morning Check: ensure all the information system is up and running before the market opening

§ Track recurrent issues and define the action plan/ date for the definitive fix

§ Ensure that Each release is thoroughly tested to ensure software quality is maintained.

§ Rapid development software development to ensure a rapid incident resolution and facilitate the daily activity of our team.
§ Investigate and ensure that the production is under control (investigation, debug when possible, develop and fix the issue)

§ With the Agile method, work closely with your business to increase customer satisfaction by rapid and continuous delivery of useful software

§ Help on some post-trade tool specifications thanks to our good business understanding and to our project impact analysis
§ In case of Major Incident or a Crisis, manage the communication with business accordingly to their criticality and with all the involved stakeholders

§ Ensure we have an accurate representation (diagrams) and documentation of our applications/systems architecture, otherwise create/update them. Be sure they are all understandable and available

§ Follow-up the investigation with the concerned team
§ Manage all administrative tasks (1st level) providing major incident and problem report in our system also sending a postmortem to the concerned stakeholders
§ Manage the life-cycle of all problems on Listed Derivatives, Equities (cash/synthetic), FX, Fixed Income and OTC Cleared perimeter.
§ Implement a procedure on how to manage a Major Incident or Crisis at the team level and share it with them
§ Make sure the procedure is well understandable and accepted by the team members
§ Plan trainings each month in order to make a point on this procedure or update it
§ Project management :

Job Description
Job Summary
Responsible for category inventory management across HD Supply network. Responsible for creating replenishment strategies, executing SKU transitions, maintaining network balance through parameters, and collaborating with internal and external cross functional partners.

Major Tasks, Responsibilities and Key Accountabilities
Leverages SAP and other systems to execute "day to day" inventory control, in order to consistently achieve fill rates while minimizing Inventory days on hand across the global supply chain. Identifies and prioritizes root causes of fill rate issues and excess inventory, and drives corrective actions and control mechanisms across cross-functional teams.
Utilizes and monitors exception reports and daily analytics for all business metrics; taking appropriate and timely action to prevent stock outs, minimize DOH, and expedite delivery to fill potential backorders.
Develops and executes inventory strategy for new SKU introductions, discontinued SKU reductions and dispositions, customer-specific inventory positions, direct import SKU sets, and seasonal inventory requirements. Audits product master data (e.g., UoM, vendor SKU number, case quantity) to ensure accuracy.
Partners with Inventory Analytics and Merchandising teams to proactively identify fill rate and excess inventory issues, and execute respective corrective actions as needed.
Partners with Demand Management to align inventory system controls (EOQ, min/max, safety stock, velocity rankings) with business objectives. Analyzes and communicates impact of proposed changes.
Manages supplier relations and partners with supplier to address fill rate, lead time, damaged in-transit issues and supplier return process. Creates import orders based on containerization requirements.
Collaborates with Merchandising, Sales, Marketing, Inventory, and Finance to incorporate the on-boarding of new products, retirement of old products, customer-specific inventory requirements, regulatory changes, and promotions into the demand planning process and recommendations.
Supports and executes aged, obsolete and excess inventory reduction strategies - RTV, "fire sale", contests, transfers, scrap, liquidation, donation, etc. Analyzes forward buys to reduce exposure to excess inventory on hand.
Nature and Scope
Demonstrates skill in data analysis techniques by resolving missing/incomplete information and inconsistencies/anomalies in more complex research/data.
Nature of work requires increasing independence; receives guidance only on unusual, complex problems or issues. Work review typically involves periodic review of output by a supervisor and/or direct customers of the process.
May provide general guidance/direction to or train junior level support or professional personnel.
Work Environment
Typically located in a comfortable indoor area. There may be regular exposure to mild physical discomfort from factors, such as dust, fumes or odors, temperature extremes, loud noise, strong drafts, or bright lights.
Most of the time is spent sitting in the same position or standing/walking and/or there is some requirement to lift or handle material or equipment of moderate weight (8-20 pounds).
Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.
Education and Experience
Typically requires BS/BA in a related discipline. Generally 2-5 years of experience in a related field OR MS/MA and generally 2-4 years of experience in a related field. Certification is required in some areas.
Qualifications
Preferred Qualifications
1-3 years experience in inventory or operations.
Bachelor's degree in Logistics, Industrial Engineering, Information Systems, Supply Chain Management or Transportation
Demonstrated work experience performing inventory control duties
Demonstrated capabilities working on large scale inventory initiatives.

Toronto, ONJob Requisition: Sourcing Analyst
The Challenge
Reporting directly to the Sourcing Director, the Sourcing Analyst provides support to the Sourcing Team by providing analysis and assisting in routine business and financial data tracking and business systems management. The Sourcing Analyst works in conjunction with the Sourcing Team providing a strong & effective exchange of information between Vendors, Accounting, Facility Managers and other Operations support groups.
Specific duties
Maintain and manage a comprehensive database of current contracts and insurance certificates in an electronic format accessible to all team members. Minimize risk by reviewing monthly contract and insurance terminations.
Analyze spend data and report on trends, determine the need to reforecast and or change vendors, renew or terminate the existing contract(s).
Manage vendors PO requests and monthly follow up for invoices for completed work.
Support Accounting in managing and keeping the PO open amounts to minimum.
Prepare contract documents, PO requests and ensure proper contract terms and conditions and insurance are in place and maintained in accordance with the Management Agreement and established legal requirements.
Interface with Jones Lang LaSalle national procurement to access preferred supplier and national contracts programs and collaborate with Jones Lang LaSalle peers to exchange best practice procedures.
Manage electronic reporting tools for cost savings and value add accomplishments across the entire team.
Collaborate with Sourcing Specialists & Contracts Administrators with analytics to execute sourcing and vendor management activities
Assist with evaluation of cost changes with additional analysis and review of cost change templates
Work cross functionally with other teams to handle vendor questions/issues/problems on an as needed basis
Perform general administration and other duties and projects as assigned
What you bring to this role
2-5 years supporting a purchasing/buying department
Post-Secondary education with a focus in Business and IT database management
Demonstrated strong knowledge and experience in Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint
Strong quantitative skills
Attention to detail
Sense of urgency
Excellent follow up skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to adapt to constant changes in priorities
Solid critical thinking skills

Hartland, NBJob Description
The Day & Ross Transportation Group is currently seeking a full-time Operations Analyst for our Freight division in Hartland, NB.

Day & Ross Freight is committed to an exceptional customer experience. We achieve this by being: authentic, committed, caring, trusted, and enthusiastic.

As an Operations Analyst, you are the owner of data collection, analysis and presentation for the Operations Team. It is your responsibility to ensure your work is completed in an accurate and timely format.

This position is all about data collection, analysis and presentation to support improvement initiatives.
To be successful in this position, you will be able to do the following (not an exhaustive list of responsibilities):
Own the collection and analysis of operations KPI.
Identify potentially inaccurate points within the data, validate source of data and confirm accuracy to ensure understanding of the data.
Create awareness, identify issues, problems, opportunities.
Use a data analysis method to support the determination of root cause solution as related to gaps in performance measures. The data analysis prepared will be used to impact efficiency and improvement, therefore accuracy and presentation becomes a key component.
Recommend solutions when it comes to the measurement process and collection of data. Bases decision on how their actions impact by understanding the impact that data they are presenting plays within business decisions.
Prepares all dash-board reports and display in a user friendly format. Presentation of data to department with explanation to support findings. Quality based on mutual respect, friendly, customer focused.
Provides accurate data/presentation and translates the relevant data to achieve business objectives.
Provides support with change initiatives by providing relevant data to the team to demonstrate the requirement for change.

To be qualified for this role, please ensure your resume clearly displays some or all of the following:
Computer skills – accuracy, MS products, data and statistical analysis, exposure to Operations Management techniques is preferred
Advanced communication skills (written and verbal)
Superior time management skills
Manage multiple tasks with the ability to focus and work independently on projects with appropriate guidance
Deadline driven environment
Team player focused
Results focused
Education – University or technical training with a focus on data analysis
Previous experience in similar data analysis roles required; within the transportation industry an asset

Please apply directly on our website at www.dayandrosscareers.com or send your resume to yourcareer@dayandrossinc.ca and note the job title and location in the subject line.

Please note that the successful candidate will be subject to reference and criminal background checks prior to employment.

Company Overview / Présentation de l’entreprise:
Chez Nuance, nous donnons aux gens la possibilité d'interagir naturellement avec leurs divers appareils connectés et le monde numérique autour d'eux. Nous créons un monde où la technologie pense et agit de la façon dont les humains le font en concevant des modes d'interaction avec la technologie plus intuitifs.

Notre technologie agile utilise des analyses et des algorithmes avancés pour transformer l'inanimé en animé et transformer des processus complexes en processus simples.

Rejoignez notre équipe entreprise ... un excellent service à la clientèle commence ici. Nous concevons des assistants virtuels facilitant le service client intelligent. Les clients de diverses compagnies peuvent maintenant facilement trouver les informations dont ils ont besoin en utilisant tous les canaux qu'ils préfèrent.

At Nuance, we empower people with the ability to seamlessly interact with their connected devices and the digital world around them. We are creating a world where technology thinks and acts the way people do by designing the most human, natural, and intuitive ways of interacting with technology.

Our nimble technology uses analytics and advanced algorithms to transform the inanimate into animate and reduce complicated processes into simple ones.

Join our Enterprise team…great customer service starts here. We design virtual assistants for intelligent and effortless customer service helping customers find the information they need using whatever channel they prefer.
Job Summary / Sommaire du poste:
Relevant du directeur principal des programmes, le stratège de l’optimisation numérique II s’occupera de l’analytique et de la recommandation de mesures d’optimisation pour le programme d’un client important. Il sera responsable de fournir des idées axées sur les données pour améliorer la performance du programme et de présenter ces idées ainsi que les mises à jour sur la performance au client de façon régulière. Le stratège de l’optimisation numérique II collaborera avec les gestionnaires du service à la clientèle pour répondre aux besoins du client.

Principales tâches et responsabilités
S’assurer que les processus internes sont bien compris et respectés afin de garantir la satisfaction, la fidélisation et la croissance du client tout en s’assurant que le compte est rentable pour Nuance. Pour ce faire, il doit déterminer les besoins et les occasions de services de clavardage supplémentaires et les possibilités d’optimisation
Effectuer l’analytique de l’inventaire du site du client et documenter le rendement des principaux entonnoirs, flux et pages
Mettre à jour la documentation sur le lancement et le programme, y compris la conception des règles de gestion, les demandes de gestion du changement et les tickets de soutien technique
Créer une stratégie de performance de base pour chaque client
Faire le suivi de la performance du site du client sur une base hebdomadaire afin d’en tirer des renseignements, des constatations clés et des pratiques exemplaires et les communiquer à l’interne et à l’externe
Harmoniser la performance du site du client aux tendances de la performance du clavardage
Concevoir des diapositives axées sur les données pour les exposés de diagnostic pour les clients et les leur présenter. Cette étape peut nécessite des déplacements limités
Tester les meilleures pratiques existantes et les remettre en question; offrir son aide pour la documentation des approches, des stratégies et des résultats éprouvés
Aider le client dans la planification et la communication sur l’orientation stratégique
Avoir la capacité d’effectuer des tâches essentielles avec une supervision et une gestion minimales et encadrer ses collègues
Travailler avec des clients stratégiques difficiles en faisant preuve de succès
Développer continuellement des habiletés analytiques et de présentation
Études : Baccalauréat en administration, en économie, en finances, en marketing ou tout autre domaine connexe souhaité

Années d'expérience au minimum : 5 ans et plus

Compétences requises
Excellentes aptitudes de communication (écrites et orales)
Appuyer la création et la préparation de présentations
Analyse de données
Connaissances approfondies de Microsoft Excel
Compétences privilégiées
5 ans et plus d’expérience en consultation en technologie, en commerce électronique ou en analytique Web fortement souhaitée
Doit posséder des compétences en communication exceptionnelles (écrites et orales) et des habiletés de présentation de groupe L’employé doit recueillir et analyser des données et préparer des notes de service, des courriels et des présentations sur les données recueillies
Doit être en mesure d’utiliser des connaissances en mathématiques et en statistiques et des principes financiers pour interpréter les données recueillies
Doit avoir la capacité de définir des problèmes, de recueillir des données, d’établir des faits et de tirer des conclusions valides
Avoir une connaissance avancée de Microsoft Excel et la capacité de communiquer des données et des idées complexes au moyen de présentations PowerPoint
Expérience des logiciels Internet et de bases de données

Job Title: Supply Chain Compliance Analyst

Provide support to Replenishment, Transportation and Category teams in the form of Vendor Compliance summaries, Service Level impact analyses, metrics on effectiveness of Compliance Programs and vendor performance as well as guidance on Compliance related issues internally and to the vendors.

Assist with the weekly No Show Report: pull and consolidate DC schedules; consolidate the PO’s recapped as “No Show/Refusal” by DC’s; distribute the report to Replenishment teams for review and validation; facilitate timely response across all categories; review and consolidate completed reports to identify valid penalties
Assist with vendor setup by tracking and ensuring completeness of submitted Vendor Buying Agreements (Supplier Terms and Conditions). Execute appropriate follow up with vendors, Category and Central Data Management team to facilitate vendor setup.

Role Title
Fraud Analyst
Purpose of role
Reporting to the AVP, SIU, this position is responsible for supporting the management of SIU activities for Foresters Financial. This role will be responsible for triaging referrals to the SIU and also for analyzing and synthesizing data from various sources to identify possible situations of frauds. The position will also identify trends and communicate trends via ad hoc reporting and regular monthly/quarterly reporting of SIU activities. In addition, this position will be responsible for post-investigation activities that may require regulatory reporting and subsequent production of information as requested by external third parties.

Triage the SIU inbox, identifying referrals that meet the criteria for opening an investigation and assigning and logging the case to an Investigator.
Analyze and synthesize data from a variety of sources to track and monitor fraud trends or suspicious business activity to facilitate early detection.
Participate in the creation of ad hoc reports and written communication as well as regular monthly/quarterly reporting of SIU activities and trends/issues identified.
Coordinate anti-fraud reporting to regulatory agencies.
Coordinate the production of documents requested from regulatory bodies, law enforcement or outside counsel.

University Degree in Criminology, Business, Math or related discipline.
Minimum 2-3 years of fraud related work or data analytics preferably in a life insurance/financial services organization. Life insurance knowledge preferred.
Strong analytical and technical data mining skills
Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills, displaying a high degree of independence and initiative
Life insurance/annuity product knowledge an asset
Effective verbal and written communication skills
Demonstrated strong problem solving and analytical skills

Company Overview
Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) est une importante entreprise de café et de boissons en Amérique du Nord, engrangeant des revenus annuels de plus de 11 milliards de dollars et dont les deux sièges sociaux sont situés à Burlington, au Massachusetts, et à Plano, au Texas. KDP occupe une position de choix dans les marchés des boissons gazeuses, des thés et cafés de spécialité, de l’eau, des jus et boissons à base de jus, et des préparations pour cocktails, et commercialise la plus importante marque de cafetière une tasse à la fois aux États-Unis. L’entreprise exploite un réseau de distribution sans pareil pour son portefeuille comptant plus de 125 marques – incluant des marques maison, sous licence ou partenaires – afin de servir tous les consommateurs, où qu’ils soient. KDP offre une grande variété de boissons chaudes et froides pour combler tous les besoins, notamment les produits des marques Keurig®, Dr Pepper®, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters®, Canada Dry®, Snapple®, Bai®, Mott’s® et The Original Donut Shop®. L’entreprise est aussi le principal fournisseur de services de café au Canada, grâce à sa division des Services de café Van Houtte, offrant diverses solutions à travers le pays. Elle emploie plus de 25 000 personnes et exerce ses activités dans quelque 120 bureaux, usines de fabrication, entrepôts et centres de distribution en Amérique du Nord.

Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) is a leading coffee and beverage company in North America with dual headquarters in Burlington, MA and Plano, TX, with annual revenue in excess of $11 billion. KDP holds leadership positions in soft drinks, specialty coffee and tea, water, juice and juice drinks and mixers, and markets the #1 single serve coffee brewing system in the U.S. The Company maintains an unrivaled distribution system that enables its portfolio of more than 125 owned, licensed and partner brands to be available nearly everywhere people shop and consume beverages. With a wide range of hot and cold beverages that meet virtually any consumer need, KDP key brands include Keurig®, Dr Pepper®, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters®, Canada Dry®, Snapple®, Bai®, Mott’s® and The Original Donut Shop®. The company is also the leading coffee services provider in Canada with its Van Houtte Coffee Services division offering diversified solutions across the country. The Company employs more than 25,000 employees and operates more than 120 offices, manufacturing plants, warehouses and distribution centers across North America.

Wyndham Hotels & Resorts is now seeking a Analyst, Intraday - Term to join our team at Saint John in Saint John, New Brunswick.
Job Summary
An exciting career opportunity is available in our dynamic team-spirited environment. We are currently seeking three (3) highly motivated Intraday Analysts to work as part of the Workforce Management team.

As an Intraday Analyst you will actively and consistently support all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experience within General Reservations, Wyndham Rewards, and Customer Care.

In this role, you will review, analyze and assess Volume and FTE forecasts to insure the forecasts are accurate given recent results, trends in contact volume and AHT, absenteeism and attrition. You will update intraday (interval) contact volume and average handle time for all call types and contact centers based on global forecasts and real-time trends. You will make manual adjustments in IEX Totalview to account for out-of-pattern days, including days after holidays, events, or outages.

The Intraday Analyst partners with all sites to provide specific direction and schedule recommendations to ensure a positive customer experience. Communicate opportunities to individual sites to ensure recommendations are implemented in an accurate and timely manner.
General Requirements
Your background includes:
2 + years post-secondary education or comparable work experience
Minimum 3-5 years of workforce management/command center experience
Progressive workforce management, budget planning, analytical and/or statistical experience, preferably in a call center environment
Experience in resource planning software
Assets in your background are:
Working knowledge of Avaya CMS and NICE IEX.
You have the proven ability to:
Utilize Microsoft Excel at an advanced level
Be well organized and systematic in work processes
Recognize patterns and trends in large volumes of data
Work independently and as part of a team to solve complex problems in a fast-paced environment
Demonstrate excellent communication skills and collaboration skills
Work effectively with groups and conduct meetings
COMPANY OVERVIEW:

Title: IT CONSULTANT/ DEVELOPER
Program: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY
Status: TEMPORARY FULL TIME (1 Year)
Schedule: 8 HOUR DAYS SHIFTS (SUBJECT TO CHANGE)
Site: LAKERIDGE HEALTH CORPORATE OFFICE
Salary: $38.659 - $43.425 per hour
Posting No.: UNEX-1800001289

DESCRIPTION:
The IT Developer is responsible for supporting, designing, testing and providing regular updates & maintenance to both new & existing custom software and data models. The IT Developer provides a key role in identifying opportunities for improvement related to the creation, use and management of both existing and custom software applications. The IT Developer works collaboratively with Data Analysts, IT staff and other key stakeholders to gather clinical and business needs, perform workflow analysis, process design, testing, ongoing support, training and general maintenance of customized applications. The IT Developer also helps to align clinical, administrative & financial systems with the organizational objectives and strategies and provides recommendations regarding the potential use of various information systems.


JOB DUTIES:
Works collaboratively to identify user requirements and prepare business and technical specifications; and where indicated translates requirements, specifications and rules into data models or customized software applications;Reviews new and existing custom applications, features, functionalities and workflows and identifies any gaps, risks and/or opportunities for enhancement;Works collaboratively with Data Analysts & IT staff across the organization;Support and maintenance of SQL databases;Develop and maintain ETLs for data transfer to SQL;Creation of data reports through a variety of tools;Prepares and delivers training and materials to support newly developed IT systems and enhancements to existing systems;Manages, monitors, and troubleshoots operational issues and requests using the ticket tracking system;Prepares and maintains support and troubleshooting documentation for the team;Participate as a resource for IT projects;Assist in the evaluation, selection and implementation of new technology;Coordinate with external vendors for required support on software tools;Escalates issues to managers as required;On-Call responsibilities on a rotational basis (based on need);Performs other position related duties as required;

REQUIREMENTS:
Diploma or Degree in Software Development or equivalent;Strong verbal, written communication, customer service skills, with the ability to communicate technical items in a user friendly way that non-technical persons can understand;Strong analytical skills with the ability to multi-task and adapt to changing priorities;Proven knowledge and experience working with Visual Studio including VB, .NET, HTML 5, JavaScript and CSS;Strong knowledge and experience with Microsoft SQL 2012 and above relational databases, SSIS and SSRS reporting;Knowledge and experience with Microsoft BI tools and Data Cube development, MDX/DAX;Data modeling and warehouse experience;Experience with Meditech Magic is an asset (specifically Meditech Data Repository);Experience in Healthcare is an asset;Demonstrated commitment to our core values of Compassion, Innovation, Courage and Trust;Demonstrated understanding of, and commitment to, Lakeridge Health's comprehensive safety program and practices, including staff, patient and environmental safety, and participation in regular in-service education; and,Proven good attendance record, with the capability of maintaining the same standard.
CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT:

This position is open to all qualified staff throughout Lakeridge Health.

The terms and conditions of employment are in accordance with Lakeridge Health's policies and procedures.

Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the recruitment and assessment process as required under Lakeridge Health's Employment Accommodation policy. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance.

The Analyst , Advanced Analytics is accountable for delivering tactical and strategic knowledge through multivariate statistical analysis.
What you'll do
Manipulation and calculation of large complex data from various sources, convey complicated information concisely, simply with clarity, and deliver actionable insights that enable business partners to fully understand key drivers of business results
Conduct sophisticated multivariate analysis/ predictive modeling at product, portfolio, and customer level, and recommend appropriate actions to ensure profitable and sustainable business growth
Design, develop and evaluate business cases that consider multiple drivers and relay those drivers into accurate forecasts, and presented to varying audiences in order to move business idea forward
Collaborate with the business areas to assess opportunities and measure results of campaigns & initiatives and ensure timely communication of strategic and operational results
Develop and implement statistical models using machine learning techniques that include linear/logistic regression, decision trees and k-means clustering analysis

Bachelor’s degree in quantitative discipline (e.g. computer science, engineering, statistics or other analytically based discipline). Master’s degree in Business Analytics, Management Analytics or other professional designation is highly preferred.
Minimum 3 years proven strong business analytical and modeling experience including statistical and segmentation analysis; data analysis and insight development; financial statement and competitive analysis
Must be proficient with SAS, SQL, Data Warehouses on large datasets; R or Python, knowledge of SAS Enterprise Data Miner, Hadoop & HIVE are asset.
Advanced proficiency in MS Excel & VBA and building complex models for financial, portfolio analysis, and comprehensive business case evaluation.
Strategic critical thinker with proven ability to think conceptually (use numbers to tell a story) and make meaning of complex data to develop insights and communicate results
Strong communication skills and desire to work in cross-functional groups.
Experience working with machine learning algorithms including linear/logistic regression, decision trees, k-means clustering analysis

Demonstrated ability to work with confidential data

Toronto, ONPermanentHelp us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

This is a highly visible role across the organization that will challenge your ability to work with ambiguity, manage large amounts of data, turn insights into action, and make strong connections with business leaders. You will be working independently with category business managers, building relationships and Interpreting category, brand, and vendor strategies and their impact on price. You will have the opportunity to develop and implement new or existing frameworks that improve our customer’s price perception, while maximizing our categories profitability. And you’ll work across a team of high performing individuals looking to make an impact at Canadian Tire.

What you’ll do

Lead the development and execution of pricing strategies across various product portfolio’s, based on our category management framework

Create and implement integrated CTR pricing strategies based on market intelligence to drive bottom line results

Support Category Management team overall strategy initiatives including strategic planning and analysis

In-depth analysis of competitive shop data, price match data, research and reporting on CTR dealer pricing concerns, in order to develop and recommend optimal pricing strategies

Ensure that pricing and strategies are developed, implemented, measured, and monitored effectively and efficiently through analysis and reporting

Develop and maintain the existing competitor database by ensuring key competitors are identified in the market and execute competitive market price shops

Collaborate with cross functional teams to leverage internal company data to help influence pricing decision and recommendations

Manage operational relationships with the Category Management and cross functional teams to ensure effective coordination, communication and timely execution of price updates

Examines and streamlines work flows and processes within the team to increase efficiency

Drive ongoing pricing process improvements from both a tactical and a strategic perspective

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and businesses

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

University degree or equivalent combination of education and experience

Analytics background and an ability to turn data into information

Excellent influencing, communication and interpersonal skills

Ability to work in a team environment

Demonstrated analytical skill with experience gathering and interpreting quantitative and financial data

Ability to work autonomously in a fast paced business environment

Ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities

Self-starter; able to work with minimal supervision, meet aggressive deadlines

Ability to work in a highly self-directed manner and with cross functional teams

Possess an inquiring mind, excellent analytical and complex problem solving skills

Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

Excellent oral and written communication skills in both formal and informal settings

Highly proficient in MS Office applications, specifically MS ACCESS and EXCEL are a must

Strong presentation skills and experience in using MS Power Point

Plan and control the manufacturing schedule to coordinate manufacturing plans that achieve the company objectives relative to customer service, resource/capacity utilization and low inventory investment.
