Cutting edge solutions? Working for a brand that people know and love? We’ve got you covered!
We reach over 60M users internationally and have been named one of Apple's best apps for 2018. Not to mention we are a trusted, reliable and dependable brand that inspires…we have been ranked 12th overall in the Ipsos’s annual study of Canada’s 100 Most Influential Brands – being #1 for Canadian Brands!
The Opportunity
As our amazing Digital Analyst, you will create sophisticated, insightful and interactive reports, generating insights for audience and yields for our digital platforms, and provide recommendations to solve complex business problems and create awesome customer experiences. This role works with the Digital Services team to grow The Weather Network and MeteoMedia business in Canada, U.S. and emerging markets. You are key in assisting platform owners and internal stakeholders to understand customers and competitors by leveraging data from multiple sources across all our digital properties (i.e. websites, mobile and tablet applications) and within the industry. You have a passion for data, a strong background in quantitative analysis using the latest technologies and a gift for extracting actionable insights!

A day in the life of a Digital Analyst:

Support the analytic needs of the Digital Services business unit by using tools from Google Analytics, Google Optimize, Firebase and others to analyze user data.
Have a deep understanding of how consumers interact with our digital properties and relevant research within the Digital, Mobile and Advertising space to forecast trends
Work closely with the Business Systems team to extract insights and identify key trends within our standardized reporting
Report and analyze user path and engagement activity data across our digital properties
Be investigative and proactive in finding the data that answers the “why” of user behaviour.
Lead our consumer testing process through developing, creating and executing multivariate or A/B/ tests that drive fundamental improvements to the site and app experiences that improve customer experiences and grow the business.
Exhibit a high-level expertise in understanding the data and developing the strategies across platform feedback, surveys, testing, CRM systems and market research.
Own the platform optimization and targeting strategy – work with the steering team to develop algorithmic models to drive insights and further the knowledge base of our user traffic
Work closely with the platform business leads to assist in data visualization for presentations and assist with their decision making
Architecting the procedure and process for how to test and learn and resolve all key debates on design and functionality on all websites and apps
This role manages and analyzes inbound and outbound traffic, assesses performance of our external partnerships, search and other syndicated partnerships with 3rd parties that drive traffic to The Weather Network properties.

This is what YOU have:

BA/Business degree/MBA from an accredited college or university in Business, Finance and/or Marketing focus
Established track record in digital analytics or similar role and at least 3 years of working with Google Analytics, Google Optimize, App Annie, Big Query and SQL
Broad understanding of analytical processes including but not limited to data management, forecasting, optimization, predictive modeling, and visualization

But what really makes you stand out is…

Passionate about digital analytics using large scale data (framing – execution – presentation)
Strong collaborator, yet able to work independently and manage multiple projects/responsibilities
Highly effective communicator; able to clearly articulate key learnings or concepts to non-technical partners; excellent presentation skills
Passion for finding the stories the data can tell
Can orchestrate multiple activities at once to accomplish a goal; anticipates and adjusts for problems and roadblocks

job_title: Analyst/Senior Analyst, Risk Analytics, Investment Risk
job_description:
Job Description

We are recruiting for an Analyst/Senior Analyst to join the Risk Analytics team in the Investment Risk Department. The candidate is responsible for executing the daily production process and prepare timely and accurate investment risk reports. The candidate will ensure that risk estimates are calculated correctly by ensuring that analytical reviews, reasonability checks, position reconciliations and established processes are completed and followed in accordance with Investment Risk Management Standards and Methodologies. The candidate is expected to work with internal data governance team in response to exceptions management process with respect to his/her primary supporting areas.
The Analyst/Senior Analyst is responsible for developing a deep knowledge of the current risk infrastructure, identifying opportunities for improvements and may involve in the design of solutions to address shortcomings or enhancement in coordination with the Solutions Engeering team within Risk Analytics, the Investment Risk group and IT. Additionally the candidate will participates or leads ad-hoc Investment Risk projects and autonomously liaises with other departments to satisfy dependencies and acquire source data. The candidate will facilitate where appropriate the integration of tactical and manual solutions into production-grade systems by framing and documenting the functionalities for IT.
This position requires someone with high attention to detail, strong sense of ownership and integrity and strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Depending on experience, some basic understanding of risk measurement principles (i.e. risk factors, Value-at-Risk, stress testing, backtesting) is preferred. The position also requires the ability to work diligently with third party risk applications and internally developed applications.
Position Requirements
Prepare, validate and distribute regular CPPIB Investment Portfolio risk reports satisfying both established time-line and accuracy level
Require to accommodate early work shift (8am to 4pm) to support critical daily compliance monitoring requirement
Analyze risk results at both portfolio and aggregated fund at a detailed level to ensure completeness and accuracy of the results. Carry out risk attribution to individual investment strategies and risk factors using established methodologies and applications
Adhere to established standards with regards to escalation protocols of both limits violations and production operational issues
Assist in developing and executing tests to ensure the accuracy and completeness of information being used to calculate risk measures
Develop and maintain documentation related to Risk Measurement processes and activities
Work with functional teams, in particularly Risk Oversight teams to develop strategy-specific risk reports and to analyze investment department strategies
Provide on-going support function to both management reporting and financial reporting
Work with data service departments and/or IT partner to identify and source necessary position, market and reference data to fulfill risk measurement practices
Develop and foster effective working relationships across the CPP Investment Board and external risk service providers
Other duties as required

Qualifications

0 – 2 years of work experience (Analyst) in financial industry or 2 – 4 years of work experience (Senior Analyst) in financial industry with a focus on Financial/Risk/Management reporting areas
Previous work experience in an operational role would be a strong asset
Undergraduate or advanced degree in Business, Finance, Engineering, Math or other relevant discipline with a strong appetite for quantitative and statistical data
Professional designation; CFA, CA, CAIA, FRM or other would be an asset
Strong analytical skills and problem solving abilities
Solid working knowledge in the use of Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Ability to build/automate solutions and lead initiatives using SQL/Database/VBA skills is an asset
Flexibility and adaptability
Able to deliver in a constantly changing and fast paced organization
Able to partner with different areas of the organization and with different employee levels
Ability to deliver in a high performance culture operating under time-sensitive deadlines
Exemplifies our guiding principles of partnership, integrity and high performance
Additional Information

Visit our Linkedin Career Page or Follow us on LinkedIn. #LI-PM1

Burnaby, BCJob Summary

Start a rewarding career! iData’s mission is to empower healthcare device manufacturers to succeed in making intelligent, data-driven decisions. We provide industry research that assists Fortune 500 companies across the globe to make strategic marketing and business decisions.

Who We Are:

iData’s mission is to empower healthcare device manufacturers to succeed in making intelligent, data-driven decisions. We provide industry research that assists companies across the globe to make strategic marketing and business decisions.

Our Entry-Level Market Research Analystapplies a scientific approach to market monitoring. They are responsible for secondary research concerning medical devices and markets, and primary phone research with key opinion leaders and other participants within the medical market, in addition to data analysis and report composition.

About Us
SCIEX – An operating company within Danaher’s Life Sciences platform

SCIEX helps to improve the world we live in by enabling scientists and laboratory analysts to find answers to the complex analytical challenges they face. Our leadership in LC-MS and CE-MS have made us a trusted partner globally to those who are focused on basic research, drug discovery, food and environmental testing, forensic toxicology, clinical research and diagnostics. With over 40 years of innovation, we continue to redefine what is achievable in routine and complex analysis.

We are seeking smart, team-oriented people who have purpose and are committed to helping us deliver Answers for Science. Knowledge for Life. ™ Our global team, located on every continent, is our greatest strength, bringing diverse perspectives and breakthrough thinking. With the power of the Danaher Business System behind us, it’s our people who have made us the industry leader. Come join our winning team. Visit us at www.sciex.com.

Sciex offers a broad array of comprehensive, competitive benefit programs that add value to associates' and their families' lives.

Sciex is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, gender, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Join our winning team and Follow us on LinkedIn!
Description
The Manager, Commercial Data Quality & Analytics will work within the Global Commercial Operations and Effectiveness team to lead the charge in transforming data analytics and business intelligence to enable and drive commercial growth and efficiency. The person needs to have a great vision for what’s next, identify major business growth and efficiency improvement opportunities to demonstrate and champion the power of strong data analytics, and bring the business impact as a result of intelligence and insights into real life.

Reporting:
This role reports to Director, Global Commercial Ops and Effectiveness. It is also important that this role builds strong and effective relationship with regional sales leaders and service leaders.

Responsibilities:
Lead a team to solve complex and ambiguous business problems by navigating through data to find the real performance drives and drive data insights to actions, to deliver improved operational, financial, strategic, and customer success outcomes
Transform the commercial analytics team from basic reporting (descriptive of what happened) into insightful data mining (diagnostic – why did it happen) and/or predictive modeling (predictive of what will happen as well as prescriptive of calling to action – what should we do)
Work closely with business leaders to understand the business problems/challenges they need to solve, clarify and formulate assumptions and hypotheses in simple business terms, and breaking down business problems into manageable projects
Lead cross-functional and cross-regional project teams to analyze opportunities, synthesize findings, develop action plans, gain consensus and translate recommendations into results
Participate in the design, planning, prioritization and execution of a broad range of analytics designed to support data-driven decision-making in global Sales & Service organization

#LI-SL1.
Qualifications
5-7 years of working in analytics or commercial planning and reporting field; life sciences industry experience preferred.
At least 1 year of people leadership experience with direct involvement or management of an analytics team and demonstrated success in cross-functional leadership with ability to work execute across matrices
Strong commercial understanding of lead generation to funnel management and experience using data to uncover actionable growth opportunities is preferred
Demonstrated ability to take initiative and be flexible in a fast paced, dynamic team environment
Must be creative and detail-oriented in ambiguous situations with a relentless focus on execution
Experience using Power BI or other advanced analytic software, and Salesforce.com, Service Max or another CRM platform

Additional Requirements:
Creative and intellectually curious demonstrating strong conceptual thinking skills
Strong communicator, both verbal and written, to engage, influence and get buy-in from all levels of internal and external stakeholders and to influence key decisions on product issues
Strong work ethic with ability to manage and prioritize a diverse mix of issues, responsibilities and challenges on a daily basis
Demonstrates key leadership traits including integrity, adaptability, vision, judgment, courage and passion
High degree of awareness and sensitivity to a diverse, global work environment
Travel
If Framingham based, 50% travel expected
If Concord based, 15% travel expected

Job Summary
We currently have an opportunity for a Systems Analyst within the Hotel Technology Client Support department, located in Saint John, New Brunswick.

Using compiled data they will provide strategies to achieve a reduction in call volume through Change Requests to Software, Hardware, and Network. The Systems Analyst works and supports Vendors in identifying and correcting incidents daily and is responsible to create and manage all documentation required to assist Tier 1, Tier 2 and Tier 3 in providing solutions for reported Incidents by Wyndham Franchisees. Utilizing Subject Matter Expertise the Systems Analyst assists and trains other Wyndham Hotel Group departments and is responsible to ensure all escalated incidents are resolved.

Exceptional computer and systems skills
Post-secondary education in an administrative or IT related program and/or equivalent experience

 An asset in your background includes:

Experience with Opera and/or SynXis Property Management Systems (PMS)
Salesforce experience
SynXis central reservations experience

Prioritize and meet simultaneous deadlines with continual attention to detail
Communicate effectively while working in a culturally diverse work environment
Take ownership and be responsible for tasks and projects while working with little day to day supervision
Provide Count On Me! Service with excellent interpersonal skills

STEP into a career with one of BC’s Top Employers since 2009.

The Liquor Distribution Branch (LDB) is one of the largest distributors and retailers of beverage alcohol in Canada, generating a net income of approximately $1.08 billion on annual sales of approximately $3.3 billion in fiscal 2016/17. LDB has a workforce of approximately 4,000 full and part-time employees, operates 197 retail stores across the province, oversees the operations of approximately 220 Rural Agency Stores and has the role of wholesaler to approximately 700 private liquor retail outlets and 10,000 licensed establishments. The LDB is also responsible for distribution of non-medical cannabis including wholesale, e-commerce and brick and mortar stores.

The LDB is a unique government entity that operates with similar independence to a Crown Corporation under the direction of a General Manager and CEO.

In February 2018, the LDB was assigned to distribute, wholesale and sell non-medicinal cannabis inclusive of a government owned online channel with a mandate to support government’s key priorities of protecting children and youth, ensuring health and safety standards, and keeping the criminal element out of the supply chain.

The Finance Business Process Analyst conducts Finance business operations projects, smaller initiatives, process improvements and operational break-fix work to enhance the alignment between the business requirements and operational processes/systems. The Finance Business Process Analyst collaborates with clients, colleagues and IT professionals to design, fine tune, implement, and trouble-shoot project, initiatives, and process improvement implementations.

The Finance Business Process Analyst also work with the functional and operational staff to resolve technical issues and ensure the systems are performing to expectations and investigate new or unused software application features for fit and applicability to business needs.

Cubic Field Services Canada, LTD. (CFSC) is the wholly owned Canadian subsidiary of Cubic Global Defense (CGD) Inc., based in San Diego.
CGD provides world-class training, readiness, and communications solutions for military, security, and public safety forces. In Canada, CFSC has a long standing presence with the delivery and support of Live Training Systems.Today, CFSC is headquartered at 45 O'Connor St. Ottawa, Ontario, Canada K1P 1A4, and operates five field sites throughout Canada.
The Areas Weapon Effect System (AWES) project is in support of British Army training, and is related to its sister site in the Salisbury Plain, United Kingdom. The AWES provides state-of-the-art simulation of combat operations at the British Army Training Unit Suffield (BATUS) located at CFB Suffield in Alberta. INFANTRY ANALYST, INSTRUMENTED COLLECTIVE TRAINING (AREA WEAPONS EFFECTS SIMULATOR)

Vancouver, BCPosition Summary:
Transfer pricing is a key component of International Tax. It is estimated that over 60 percent of all world trade takes place between members of multinational groups. Transfer pricing rules address the prices charged on transactions undertaken within a multinational group. The transfer prices charged should be representative of arm’s length prices. Tax administrations are concerned that transfer pricing rules can be misapplied so that the result is an allocation of profits within the Group that is not aligned with economic activities that produced the profits, thus potentially minimizing income taxes payable in certain countries.

Most tax authorities have laws, penalties and audit practices that aim to give them their fair share of tax, and taxpayers have noticed increased activity by the tax authorities. A recent survey of multinationals showed that they not only viewed transfer pricing as the most important international tax issue for them, they considered it more important than all other tax issues combined. With market globalization, ongoing expansion of companies worldwide and the tax authorities’ growing knowledge and aggressiveness in these matters, we consider transfer pricing to be the most significant and difficult tax issue for our clients.

Specifically, you will work with and under the guidance of our talented Global Transfer Pricing team to assist our clients in addressing the various complexities, issues, challenges and opportunities that arise from the transfer pricing laws, and conducting business in multiple jurisdictions. The assistance to our clients includes various forms of analysis, planning, verbal and written communication of findings and recommendations, drafting of reports, as well as defense against tax administration challenges to our clients’ pricing.

In addition to Transfer Pricing, our team assists clients with a variety of Economic Services. These services provide the quantitative analyses clients need in identifying, assessing and addressing their most critical needs in the local and global markets. Providing advice that is based on the key principles of economics, accounting and finance applied to the clients’ specific situations.

What you will do in Transfer Pricing:
Assisting our clients to undertake and document tax-compliant pricing for intercompany transactions.
Writing reports and other related deliverables that involve documenting and analyzing clients' transfer pricing policies.
Helping our clients currently undergoing transfer pricing audits by tax administrations.
Assisting with negotiating agreements with multiple tax authorities on behalf of our clients that reduce or even eliminate the risk of audit for past and future tax periods.
Developing and evaluating transfer pricing policies for our clients in respect of their international product sales, services, and intangible property.
Performing risk analysis of companies by reviewing their operations and identifying potential transfer pricing issues.
Developing strategies to assist clients in managing exposure to the constantly changing and evolving transfer pricing issues.

What you will do in Economic Services:
Economic cost modelling and analysis
Pricing analysis and benchmarking
Market equilibrium analysis
Economic and social impact analysis
Predictive modelling and data analytics
Econometric modelling and statistical sampling

At times, business needs arise and employees are required to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. Likewise, people need time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this.

What you bring to the role:
Bachelors or Masters Degree in Economics, Statistics, Math or Business.
Proven written communication abilities.
Strong command of the English language.
Demonstrated commitment to client service.
Outgoing, strong interpersonal skills.
Comfortable managing multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong time management skills with the ability to meet deadlines.
Ability to work independently and within a team.
Technical skills modeling, analysis, writing and communication outstanding, and great attention to detail.
Advanced Microsoft Excel Skills and econometrics skills (Stata, SAS, R, etc.) is an asset.

Monthly close process:

Reference #73638/73639/73640

PHSA IMITS is establishing a new 24/7 first alert surveillance and response Service Operations Centre (SOC) to monitor key technology infrastructure and services supporting patient care delivery. The successful candidate will join a new, dynamic team and play a key role in both developing and evolving the services provided by the SOC as well as ensuring the availability of systems needed by our health care providers to deliver care. You bring broad industry knowledge and experience and a passion for working in a complex systems and technology diverse environment to the position.
The IT Analyst, Citrix performs a variety of complex duties related to the configuration, maintenance and utilization of server based or thin client computing and remote application connectivity solutions (E.g. Citrix Metaframe and Microsoft Terminal Services). Typical duties include conducting feasibility studies, developing specifications for complex systems, configuring and maintaining operating systems, remote application connectivity technologies, and related core infrastructure technologies, services, and applications by utilizing knowledge of Citrix and other remote application connectivity solutions. The IT Analyst, Citrix develops specialized solutions, analyzing and diagnosing problems and formulating solutions requiring considerable knowledge of the complex computing environment to meet the organization’s server and remote application connectivity infrastructure and communication requirements and tests, maintains and supports infrastructure systems to achieve the highest level of server, workstation and system availability throughout the PHSA.
Key Accountabilities
Performs a variety of duties related to the utilization of server based or thin client computing by performing tasks such as configuring and maintaining servers and sessions through the implementation of technologies such as Citrix MetaFrame and Microsoft Terminal Server solutions.
Maintains operating systems by performing tasks such as analyzing current systems and recommending adjustments and /or new systems to improve operating activities. Develops instructional material for operating systems and operations staff.
Provides technical troubleshooting and support for a variety of server and remote application connectivity environments by performing tasks such as standardized building, scheduled changes, tuning and maintenance, analyzing and diagnosing problems and formulating solutions. Identifies unresolved issues and escalates to the Manager, following established problem management and change management processes. Implements solutions that promote the integration of technologies based on industry standards, and are compatible with PHSA’s network environment and standards.
Verifies all incidences are logged by methods such as reviewing system automated alerts for priority assignment, logs incidents and resolves or assigns to another team.
Performs performance monitoring/reporting and capacity planning/reporting as related to the Microsoft Windows server and remote connectivity environment by performing tasks such as running vendor supplied utilities to observe and record performance and utilization statistics.
Implements system upgrades and system tuning to ensure maximum performance, security and stability of servers including capacity planning such as storage, processor and memory bandwidth for current and anticipated loads in response to policy/client requirements or technology related to server systems by performing tasks such as completing system usage analysis, forecasting and new technologies assessment and implementation.
Develops technical support procedures, for areas such as server hardware and software installation and testing by performing tasks such as following industry best practices on hardware and software configurations.
Develops and maintains system documentation by performing tasks such as the online creation of standardized documentation which describes in detail the server configuration and image standards used, in addition to the creation and maintenance of server hardware and software installation instructions.
Develops and maintains documentation of items such as communication plans, scheduled downtime plans and emergency recovery procedures (ERP) by performing tasks such as creating and distributing IM/IT server related communications, organizing and implementing scheduled downtime events, and performing walk-through testing of existing ERP’s.
Provides technical support related to the acquisition of new systems and standards and/or the implementation of new applications on existing systems by performing tasks such as completing hardware and software compatibility testing and making recommendations on configuration and support strategies.
Performs a variety of duties related to infrastructure operations by performing tasks such as providing physical support to related Data Centre maintenance and upgrades to ensure all changes meet specified PHSA standards such as server rack mounting, network and power patch cabling and monitoring the completion of electrical work in computer rooms, by internal or external resources.
Performs a variety of duties related to software distribution by performing tasks such as packaging and distributing platform and software updates, including operating system and infrastructure technology application patches, fixes and drivers. Maintains and creates requested inventory queries such as systems management server (SMS) and crystal reports. Ensures workstation remote control capabilities are provided to support staff by performing tasks such as ensuring that it is incorporated into the standard workstation images deployed throughout the PHSA environment.
Performs a variety of duties related to server monitoring by performing tasks such as the configuration and monitoring of utilities such as Microsoft Operation Manager and Hewlett-Packard Insight Manager and escalating and resolving alerts generated by these tools.
Performs a variety of duties related to rapid deployment processes by performing tasks such as developing and maintaining standardized server imaging and deployment processes.
Performs a variety of duties related to operating systems such as Microsoft Windows 2003/2008/2012/2016 including configuring and maintaining active directory group policies, Domain Name Service (DNS) and Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) administration.
Performs a variety of duties related to application servers by performing tasks such as configuring, optimizing and maintaining business and/or clinical application servers.
Performs a variety of duties related to the implementation of security policies, procedures and peripherals by performing tasks such as security audits, infrastructure security best practices, server and remote application connectivity solution security hardening, site security assessments and the configuration and tuning of security and antivirus appliances.
Performs advanced monitoring and problem analysis activities for the server and remote application connectivity environments by investigating unknown system behaviour conditions, patterns and trends, and recurring issues to identify underlying causes to produce recommendations and remediations.
Conducts feasibility studies for computerization by performing tasks such as determining user department requirements, examining and identifying problems with existing systems and recommending modifications to and/or new systems. Provides details of estimated implementation costs including associated staffing requirements.
Develops specifications for complex systems such as integrated systems which impact several functional areas within a facility by performing tasks such as: gathering detailed information from user departments; developing and documenting systems and procedures by designing forms, preparing flow charts and detailing hardware and software specifications; preparing detailed implementation plans.
Performs other related duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Education, Training and Experience
Graduation from a recognized degree or diploma program in Computer Science, three (3) years recent related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Skills and Abilities
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
Ability to deal with others effectively.
Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
Ability to organize work.
Ability to write programs in a variety of programming languages.
Ability to operate related equipment.

Markham, ONJob Title
Trade Funds Analyst
Job Description
Job Title

Trade Fund Analyst

Job Description

We are in search for a Trade Fund Analyst to provide support to our Trade Analytics Operations team in our Personal Health business group. This position is located in the Philips Canada corporate office located in Markham, Ontario.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:
Manage the trade promotion management process for the organization across all businesses. This includes trade funds reporting, system management and analysis/monitoring.

In this position, you will monitor the total trade liabilities for the business and helps facilitate the reconciliation process.

You are responsible for (but not limited to):
Run trade fund management reporting function. This includes Open Balance Reports, CO Monthly Report, annual trade Summary Report, and Volume Spend Report.
System Management of the Adesso Trade Promotion Management system. Adesso Administration: New User Set up, New user Training, Reoccurring sales Rep and Customer maintenance. Adesso System Management: Daily Deduction flow into Adesso from SAP, Aged Deduction Reporting, and Valid Deduction Maintenance. Image Silo Administration and Management: New user setup, New user training, Daily monitoring.
Daily/Weekly communication with collections team to ensure accuracy of flow between SAP and Adesso.
Analyze and monitor spend: Account spend performance to date and projected reporting for full year liability, Individual account event analysis on trade maintenance, Account true up of spend based on performance and financial approvals.
Partners with accounting and finance to reconcile spend between Adesso and SAP.
Perform quarterly Trade Spend ICS controls
To succeed in this role, you will have the following skills and experience

Bachelor’s Degree required
3+ years minimum experience in sales analysis within a major CPG company
Problem solving, general knowledge of sales operation and support,
Microsoft Office, advanced ability with Excel, PowerPoint, Database reporting
Sales analyst experience
Trade funds knowledge
Strong analytical, communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work well in a cross functional environment
High energy and drive to succeed
Desire and ability to build new organizational competencies
Data curiosity and strong attention to detail
In return, we offer you

A path towards your most rewarding career. Philips is growing its marketing capability enterprise wide. Succeeding in this market-based role in a complex environment will open many doors for your long term career, in other areas in Philips or otherwise. We also believe that we are at our best as a company when you are at yours as a person. Thus, we offer competitive health benefits, a flexible work schedule and access to local well-being focused activities.

Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

Pearson is constantly looking to add to our AMAZING team! We are actively searching for a detailed and highly organized Principal Analyst for our Sales Ops, Reporting and Analytics (R&A) CANADA team. You will support all standard reporting, ad-hoc reporting, statistical analysis and benchmarking, forecasting, predictive modeling, and influence of operational optimization, transforming business reporting requirements into meaningful visualizations, KPIs and dashboards. The opportunity will be located at our Toronto, CANADA office.

Gather requirements for reports and interactive dashboards

Develop, and support the development of reports and visualizations that address business needs

Perform data analysis to ensure on-going data integrity, quality and operational efficiency

Analyzing data with standard statistical methods, interpreting the results, and providing summary of data analyses

Adherences to publication approval standards for dashboard release reviews and provide feedback to help with process improvement

Disseminate information regarding tools, reports, or metadata enhancements

Provide technical support for existing reports, dashboards, or other tools

Maintain catalog of reports, templates, and other reusable knowledge assets

Discusses reporting, or information needs with stakeholders, strategic and business partners, and teams

Participate in ongoing decisions concerning data collections, data design, methodology, and data analysis

Works together with BI Mgr. that design and build data models and internal ETL-processes

Qualifications
Required Knowledge and Experience:
In-depth experience in data reporting & analytics tools, process, methodologies and best practices

Knowledge and wide application of principles, theories, and concepts, and working knowledge of other related fields

Expert knowledge of Tableau development required; data management & reading code-huge plus!

Solid experience in building reports and dashboards with Tableau Desktop and administering Tableau Server – critical!

Strong, successful storytelling with data, data visualization design and visualization best practices

Knowledge in designing data models for optimal use for analytics

High-level analytical and problem-solving skills

Solid time management skills - including ability to work well under a fast-paced high-pressure business environment, plan, set priorities, adapt to change, and meet established timelines

Ability to manage team deliverables in close alignment with overall departmental and corporate objectives

BA in Business Administration or related discipline, or equivalent combination of education/work experience

2 vacancies available - 1 in Serious & Organized Crime and 1 in the Office of Crime Reduction & Gang Outreach.
The Policing and Security Branch (PSB), Ministry of Public Safety and Solicitor General (PSSG) is comprised of two divisions; Police Services Division and Security Programs Division. The branch provides central oversight of policing, law enforcement and the security industry in British Columbia. Policing in British Columbia is provided by the RCMP, 11 independent municipal police departments and one First Nations administered police service. Several agencies, such as the South Coast British Columbia Transit Authority Police Service, provide supplemental policing.
The Director of Police Services superintends policing in British Columbia on behalf of the Minister. The Director establishes provincial policing standards, inspects and reports on the quality of policing and law enforcement and administers programs.
The government of British Columbia is committed to taking action to prevent the harm created by Organized Crime, the trafficking of deadly drugs and the violence in our communities that result from gun and gang violence. The Executive Director, Serious & Organized Crime Initiatives, reports to the Director of Police Service and works with law enforcement, provincial and federal government ministries, communities and non-government agencies in the identification, development and implementation of strategies in support of these public safety priorities.
The Program Evaluation Analyst, reporting to the Executive Director, Serious & Organized Crime and Deputy Director of Police Services, will be supporting the Serious & Organized Crime Initiatives Unit (SOCIU) in its responsibility of administering, analysing and reporting to Canada. A by-product of this position will be the leveraging of analysis for the purposes of the provincial work on Social Return on Investment (ROI) indicators currently underway. will be leveraging analysis for the purpose of the provincial work on Social Return on Investment (ROI) indicators currently underway. This will determine the broader reaching economic and social cost resulting from gun and gang violence.
The Program Evaluation Analyst, reporting to the Director, Office of Crime Reduction & Gang Outreach, will be supporting the Office of Crime Reduction and Gang Outreach (OCR-GO) by conducting grant program analysis, managing and administering evaluation and reporting processes, and analyzing data to determine the effectiveness of funded initiatives. This position will liaise with a counterpart in the Community Safety and Crime Prevention Branch to research, recommend and develop community safety and wellbeing initiatives in priority communities affected by serious and organized crime.

About Us
SCIEX – An operating company within Danaher’s Life Sciences platform

SCIEX helps to improve the world we live in by enabling scientists and laboratory analysts to find answers to the complex analytical challenges they face. Our leadership in LC-MS and CE-MS have made us a trusted partner globally to those who are focused on basic research, drug discovery, food and environmental testing, forensic toxicology, clinical research and diagnostics. With over 40 years of innovation, we continue to redefine what is achievable in routine and complex analysis.

We are seeking smart, team-oriented people who have purpose and are committed to helping us deliver Answers for Science. Knowledge for Life. ™ Our global team, located on every continent, is our greatest strength, bringing diverse perspectives and breakthrough thinking. With the power of the Danaher Business System behind us, it’s our people who have made us the industry leader. Come join our winning team. Visit us at www.sciex.com.

Join our winning team and Follow us on LinkedIn!

Description
The Manager, Commercial Data Quality & Analytics will work within the Global Commercial Operations and Effectiveness team to lead the charge in transforming data analytics and business intelligence to enable and drive commercial growth and efficiency. The person needs to have a great vision for what’s next, identify major business growth and efficiency improvement opportunities to demonstrate and champion the power of strong data analytics, and bring the business impact as a result of intelligence and insights into real life.

Reporting:
This role reports to Director, Global Commercial Ops and Effectiveness. It is also important that this role builds strong and effective relationship with regional sales leaders and service leaders.

Responsibilities:
Lead a team to solve complex and ambiguous business problems by navigating through data to find the real performance drives and drive data insights to actions, to deliver improved operational, financial, strategic, and customer success outcomes
Transform the commercial analytics team from basic reporting (descriptive of what happened) into insightful data mining (diagnostic – why did it happen) and/or predictive modeling (predictive of what will happen as well as prescriptive of calling to action – what should we do)
Work closely with business leaders to understand the business problems/challenges they need to solve, clarify and formulate assumptions and hypotheses in simple business terms, and breaking down business problems into manageable projects
Lead cross-functional and cross-regional project teams to analyze opportunities, synthesize findings, develop action plans, gain consensus and translate recommendations into results
Participate in the design, planning, prioritization and execution of a broad range of analytics designed to support data-driven decision-making in global Sales & Service organization

#LI-SL1.

Qualifications
5-7 years of working in analytics or commercial planning and reporting field; life sciences industry experience preferred.
At least 1 year of people leadership experience with direct involvement or management of an analytics team and demonstrated success in cross-functional leadership with ability to work execute across matrices
Strong commercial understanding of lead generation to funnel management and experience using data to uncover actionable growth opportunities is preferred
Demonstrated ability to take initiative and be flexible in a fast paced, dynamic team environment
Must be creative and detail-oriented in ambiguous situations with a relentless focus on execution
Experience using Power BI or other advanced analytic software, and Salesforce.com, Service Max or another CRM platform

Additional Requirements:
Creative and intellectually curious demonstrating strong conceptual thinking skills
Strong communicator, both verbal and written, to engage, influence and get buy-in from all levels of internal and external stakeholders and to influence key decisions on product issues
Strong work ethic with ability to manage and prioritize a diverse mix of issues, responsibilities and challenges on a daily basis
Demonstrates key leadership traits including integrity, adaptability, vision, judgment, courage and passion
High degree of awareness and sensitivity to a diverse, global work environment
Travel

If Concord based, 15% travel expected

The Dufresne Group is currently seeking an Operations Analyst for our Logistics Team within our Home Office located at 116 Nature Park Way in Winnipeg, MB.
As an Operations Analyst, you will conduct analysis to uncover insights and support data-driven decision making within our Logistics Division. This will include working effectively with time-series/panel data, conducting exploratory analysis, creating informative data visualizations, identifying key performance indicators, correctly applying statistical techniques, and creating predictive models of Supply Chain and Logistics processes.
The Dufresne Group is committed to investing in our team members; we offer:
Market competitive wages;
Comprehensive benefits plan and excellent employee discounts;
Employer Sponsored Retirement Savings Plan;
Career growth and continuous development;
Respectful and family-oriented working environment with strong company values.
As an Operations Analyst, you will:
Key role in advising the Logistics management team and shaping its data architecture and infrastructure that will enable future technologies and underpin our digital transformation
Drive new analytical insights from large sets of data, using sound statistical tools and techniques to evaluate business hypotheses
Supports all supply chain and logistics analytic initiatives.
Conducts detailed quantitative analysis on operations including supply chain and other areas controlling for key performance metrics, locations, performance groups, and geographic regions.
Develops financial variance analyses, linear models, charts and action plans as required to illustrate issues and/or present recommendations for issue resolution.
Develops analytic-to-action templates based on the financial variance analyses and linear models of the action paths that can influence outcomes.
Solve a wide variety of operational problems as they arise that will require significant analysis of our data, research and deep thinking
Manages timelines, milestones and internal details to ensure timely provision of all deliverables
As a successful candidate you will have the following:
Undergraduate degree in a quantitative discipline such as in Accounting, Business Administration, Supply Chain, Economics, Finance, Mathematics, (or a related field); MBA or Master’s preferred
3+ years’ demonstrated experience in predictive analytics, operations research or other analytical roles
Experience in the application of quantitative techniques for market analysis and planning, including business need identification and process management
Passionate about finding insights from complex data and translating into actionable, pragmatic insights and recommendations that drive decision making, while being able to communicate these results to a non-technical audience
Strong functional knowledge of financial reporting and accounting, with strength in budgeting and forecasting
Superior organization, project management skills, and attention to detail
Rigorous approach to problem solving and tackling analytical challenges
Advanced skills in Excel and other data storage and manipulation languages such as SQL, R, and Python
Strong interpersonal skills and proven ability to build consensus and work effectively with cross-departmental teams and 3rd party partners
Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to organize thoughts, ideas and communicate clearly, completely and concisely
Displays professionalism, strong work ethic, flexibility and ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paces, deadline-driven environment
Criminal check required
Travel may be required on an occasional basis, and encompasses approximately 10% of this position
Apply now!

Vancouver, BCMANAGER, ANALYTICS AND DATA SCIENCE

Our Business Intelligence and Analytics department integrates data and develops modern reporting solutions, provides advanced analytics and data science support to all business units across Aurora to generate insights and foster innovation.

As the Manager, Analytics and Data Science, you will work very closely with the business stakeholders such as Marketing, Sales, Operations, Finance, Research and Science etc. You possess well-blended interpersonal skills and technical skills. You have proven ability in leading the data scientist/analyst team whose members are in multiple cities to perform data mining, statistical and predictive analytics.

You will have excellent familiarity of advanced analytics process including identifying the business needs, gathering data from multiple sources, and deliver results. You will lead data science initiatives including machine learning and artificial intelligence. You will purposefully develop partnerships with vendors and universities. You will champion the best practice in data science and develop the center of excellence in analytics at Aurora. You will be a key contributor who enables Aurora to make strategic decisions with insights.

We are looking for a highly effective team leader who keeps the team focused and motivated to deliver on time. Apply if you love analytics, are flexible and self-driven, can work under pressure, and desire to develop a strong team in a new and fast-growing international business.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop, and maintain strong relationships and work closely with stakeholders to ensure business needs are addressed. Lead the team to identify business objectives, gather requirements from stakeholders, and translate requirements into user stories.
Lead the team to develop dashboards, reports. Extract and merge data from multiple data sources. Perform data cleansing, transformation, exploration, analysis and visualization.
Lead the team to support day-to-day requests for data analysis such as decision support and KPI’s. Use advanced techniques, conduct in-depth analytics for strategic initiatives as directed by the management.
Work side-by-side with the business stakeholders, iterate the analytical work in an agile fashion to deliver insights.
Develop the best practices for advanced analytics and data science.
Develop partnerships with vendors and universities to collaboratively working on data science initiatives.
Establish center of excellence in analytics at Aurora. Provide leadership to ensure consistency across all analyst teams.
Work closely with the Business Intelligence team in the Enterprise Data Warehouse development and enhancement.
Work closely with the Data Governance team in developing and rolling out the data management programs.
Lead the team to manage multiple project simultaneously while exhibiting professionalism to ensure an incredible stakeholder experience.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:
A university degree or diploma in Computing Science, Statistics, Mathematics or similar disciplines plus 8+ years of work experience in Analytics.
3+ years manager or team leader experience with people management skills.
Very strong experience in database systems including data warehouses and multi-dimensional analytic solutions. Very strong experience working with various data types.
Outstanding skills in Microsoft technologies including SQL Server, Power BI, Power Pivot and Azure environment. Excellent MS T-SQL skills to write complex queries.
Proficiency in Python or R.
Experience with Google Analytics, ArcGIS.
Strong Agile project experience with proven ability to prioritize and manage time.
Demonstrated success in people management and career progression.
Demonstrated success with strategic analytical projects, working with various stakeholders across the business areas.
Demonstrated ability to work under pressure in fast-pace organizations.

We would like to thank all applicants for their interest but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Requisition ID: 57054
Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

DEPARTMENT SUMMARY


The Risk Management mandate is to provide oversight, monitoring and reporting of all operational, credit and market risks, including fraud exposures on an enterprise-wide basis. It is comprised of four well-defined functions: Operational Risk Management, Retail Credit Risk Management, Wholesale Credit Risk Management and Market Risk Management.

ROLE PURPOSE:


Regulatory Operations and Controls team supports a comprehensive and integrated program designed to identify, measure, assess report and monitor operational risk exposures facing Tangerine. The main areas of responsibility for the Analyst, Regulatory Operations and Controls are to provide assistance in the overall implementation of the Operational Risk Management Framework within the first line of defense. This includes working with and reporting to key stakeholders including the executive team. The Regulatory and Operations Analyst will report directly to the Director, Regulatory Operations and Controls.

ROLE ACCOUNTABILITIES:


Assist Senior Management in implementing applicable policies, standards, guidelines and processes that reduce the frequency and severity of potential losses through the identification, assessment, measurement and monitoring of risk exposures.
Establish and leverage strong partnerships with internal business units to ensure risk exposures are measured, monitored, mitigated and reported.
Development and implementation of company-wide Key Risk, Key Performance and Environmental Risk indicators and be responsible for the monitoring of such indicators and recommendations on an on-going basis.
Measure, monitor and report risk exposures and related profit and loss developments (e.g., incident database).
Responsible for training and communication to the business and key stakeholders regarding all elements of the Operational Risk Management Framework.
Responsible for coordinating collection, analysis and reporting of company-wide incidents and maintaining the incident reporting tool.
Assist in the planning, co-ordination and facilitation of the company-wide Risk and Control Self-Assessment program.
Support the change management process to ensure effective risk mitigation strategies are in place for new/changing products and processes.
Assist in the ongoing analysis, documentation and testing of the key financial and non-financial controls within functional areas.
Assist Regulatory Operations and Controls team in monthly reporting packages to the Business Committee’s as required.
Maintain Operational Risk Incident Database and perform root cause analysis.
Liaise with the Risk Ambassadors collecting incident data, near misses and KRIs.
Assist management in the documentation of risk, controls and process flow charts.
Other duties as assigned in keeping with the constant changes/needs of the company.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:


Education/Experience
University or College Degree in Business
Minimum 2+ years of Internal Controls Compliance or Operational Risk Management experience
Minimum 2+ years of related Financial Institution experience with strong knowledge of processes, risks and controls and/or compliance related role
Experience in communicating results and recommendations to various levels of the Bank
Experience in operational risk management
Experience in internal/external audit is an asset
Specialized Knowledge
Working knowledge of financial market products
Working knowledge of Operational Risk Management Framework
Working knowledge of internal control over financial reporting frameworks and requirements
Technical Skills
Sound decision-making and analytical abilities
Abilities
Self-starter with the ability to efficiently multi-task
WORKING CONDITIONS:


The Analyst, Regulatory Operations and Controls will be working in a traditional office environment and may be subject to special working conditions as needed by the business. Special working conditions may cover a range of circumstances from regular evening and weekend work, overtime, shift work, working outdoors and/or working with challenging clients.


DIRECT REPORTS:


No.

DISABILITY ACCOMMODATION:


Tangerine will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental disabilities of an otherwise qualified employee or applicant for employment, unless undue hardship to Tangerine would result. Any applicant or employee who requires accommodation in order to perform the essential functions of a job should contact Human Resources or his or her supervisor.

MANAGING RISK:


All members of the Tangerine Team are responsible for managing risk and compliance within their departments. As such, employees should maintain and demonstrate the highest standards of integrity and ethical conduct in accordance with Tangerine policies, guidelines and directions.


Location(s): Canada : Ontario : North York
At Tangerine we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the team, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know.

Execute test cases, gather statistics, monitor and verify test results
Identify and escalate ambiguity in design and requirements to provide accurate test cases
Participate in scrum/status meetings, planning sessions, estimation sessions and bug triage meetings

STEP into a career with one of BC’s Top Employers since 2009.

The Liquor Distribution Branch (LDB) is one of the largest distributors and retailers of beverage alcohol in Canada, generating a net income of approximately $1.08 billion on annual sales of approximately $3.3 billion in fiscal 2016/17. LDB has a workforce of approximately 4,000 full and part-time employees, operates 197 retail stores across the province, oversees the operations of approximately 220 Rural Agency Stores and has the role of wholesaler to approximately 700 private liquor retail outlets and 10,000 licensed establishments.

The LDB is a unique government entity that operates with similar independence to a Crown Corporation under the direction of a General Manager and CEO.
In February 2018, the LDB was assigned to distribute, wholesale and sell non-medicinal cannabis inclusive of a government owned online channel with a mandate to support government’s key priorities of protecting children and youth, ensuring health and safety standards, and keeping the criminal element out of the supply chain. Effective October 17, 2018 the LDB has added wholesaling and retailing of non-medical cannabis –named LDB Cannabis Operations to the existing business of wholesaling and retailing of Liquor.
LDB’s Information Technology Division (IT) provides reliable, responsive and secure systems and services to support LDB in operational excellence and delivering superior customer service.
The LDB’s Information Technology Division consists of six departments and 23 distinctive units, with 200+ FTEs. IT has adopted a multi-sourcing strategy and leverages a combination of internal and external expertise, including outsourced services, contracted services and shared services, to deliver the IT mandate of supporting current operations and future business needs. Strategic plans, governance of standards and risk management are all developed internally to support Divisional and Corporate goals.
The Technical Analyst supports the development of systems changes/enhancements through the various phases of the application development life cycle and undertakes integration project work which has a significant impact on client departments. This position is responsible for supporting the planning, analyzing, designing, developing, testing and implementation of effective solutions to meet requirements and maintaining and enhancing assigned systems as necessary.
This position oversees system applications’ maintenance and enhancements from small to medium initiatives entailing both short and long term projects that may be either of a self-contained nature or ones which require the assignment, coordination and monitoring of work performed by other team or project resources to support the business objectives of the BC Liquor Distribution Branch.
The Technical Analyst emphasis project control, coordination of project performance and economic utilization of resources assigned to the project and in-depth systems analysis to deliver key benefits to LDB departments.

job_title: Senior Business Systems Analyst - TELUS Partner Solutions
job_description:
Toronto, ONTELUS Partner Solution team is on a mission to, “Bring a world of possibilities to our customers and the best of TELUS to the connected world”. Our team members are continuously learning, insatiably curious, challenge the industry norms and approach uncertainty as an opportunity. At TELUS we embrace change and initiate opportunity through strong collaboration and a desire to take our ideas global. By creating a safe environment of support, we encourage our team to take calculated risks, have the courage to innovate and learn from our mistakes. As a team we are also aware of the world around us and we work to make a positive and lasting difference in our communities and the lives of others. The difference we make today can help build a brighter tomorrow.

TELUS Strategic Sourcing Provider team (SSP) manages both Buy and Sell for Strategic accounts, supporting revenue and expense for TELUS. We pride ourselves on managing partnerships with domestic organizations to provide product offerings and build a broad range of possibilities for their end customers.

The Senior Business Systems Analyst role requires a mixture of financial, technical, business analysis, and communication skills. As part of a larger team, you responsible in assist the SSP team to drive profitable growth by supporting and developing monthly reports, forecasting, development of predictive analytics, and translating data in simple yet intelligent information. You will be responsible in managing monthly reports, dashboards, translating complex data in to meaningful (simple) format, identifying opportunities, exposing risks, forecast and developing predictive analytics. You will lead presenting key analysis through analytic tools to help provide critical decision making for our key customers across Partner Solutions.

If you’re looking for a collaborative, high performance, and customer focused culture, come join our team!

Responsibilities:
Works closely with SSP team to develop monthly financial reports capturing key highlights, variances and risks
Take ownership of month end reporting activities for the SSP portfolio; you will be responsible for preparation of reports/dashboards and variance analysis explanations
Assist in cultivating a fact-based-data-driven decision making culture and implement the best in class end-to-end predictive analytical process to effective business decisions
Prepare monthly triage forecasts, Strat checks & annual budgeting
Build complex models using statistical or operational research tools and techniques focused on providing clarity to complex business issues and situations
Conceptualize and present key drivers and relationships between data sets to support strategic business decisions
Act as a data and Key Performance Indicator (KPI) consultant to the business, ensuring high quality of repeatability and reproducibility of system and process data
Lead strategic complex end to end team project efforts and develop tactics and timelines to address specific project objectives to ensure customer needs are met
Synthesize analytical and modeling findings/insights, and ensure it is clearly communicated to stakeholders in business context in order to be able to solve customer/business issues and objective
Work collaboratively with external vendors on solution requirements where required
Support a number of business critical operational activities
Continue to enhance our Business, Customer and Market Intelligence and drive actionable insights for our sales, marketing and care teams
Manage and maintain buy side tools and data visualization tools
Mentor, coach and provide expert guidance to team members
Support ad-hoc financial analysis requests from senior management team
Recognize, recommend and execute process improvement opportunities

5+ years of related work experience in telecommunications, wholesale, wireline and/or IT industry
Minimum of 3 years of related predictive modeling/statistical experience
Knowledge of Wholesale Telecommunications Industry (considered an asset)

Ability to deal with ambiguity and complex issues and concepts
Ability to react quickly and take advantage of changing business conditions
Required Skills & Abilities:
Ability to pick up predictive analytic technical concepts quickly
Thinking differently with the mindset of constant progression in new technologies, and seeking to improve/optimize work activities
Experience in all of the above technical qualifications with the expectation of being a subject matter expert in one or more of the listed technologies
Ability to work and lead multiple complex activities in support of multiple teams
Independent and proactive thinker
Strong presentation skills and excellent analytical skills with strong attention to detail
Strong knowledge and experience in accounting principles and practices
Ability to effectively manage multiple priorities, projects, and activities
Strong public speaking and presentation ability
Sales skills training/Target Account selling strategy is an asset
Competitive Analysis skills

University degree in Engineering, Telecommunications

3-5 years of related experience, minimum of 2 years in a predictive analytics, consulting, or financial modeling role
Experience in all of the above technical qualifications with the expectation of being a subject matter expert in one or more of the listed technologies

About Cardtronics

JOB PURPOSE/ROLE
Project Management is used to transform the business through change, by using the management of workstreams and projects which collectively are closely aligned to achieve benefits as defined by the business. The Project Analyst will take total accountability for planning, structuring, leading and executing smaller projects and/or workstreams on bigger projects with low risk and complexity. Ensuring that the alignment of the three organizational elements Corporate Strategy, Delivery of the mechanisms for change and a Business as usual environment is maintained.

Provide the framework that will integrate and reconcile the competing demands for resources. Recognize the effect of the project transformation changes has on the culture, style and character of the Organization and accommodate for this to ensure success. Define, lead and manage smaller projects and/or workstreams across AGCS. Work in collaboration with the Business Lead for the projects to secure effective business engagement in taking forward the agenda and agree benefits. Ensure the delivery of new products or services from the portfolio are to the appropriate levels of quality, on time and within budget, in accordance with the projects plan.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Project Management and Integration

Be responsible for overall Program Scope Management, whilst the individual project teams will manage the respective scope of an individual project you will be wholly responsible for the adherence to the overall plan, SOW and other associated documentation.

Actively performance manage the project to ensure initiatives and supporting workstreams together with enabling projects are delivered and to escalate appropriately the situation if progress is delayed.

Maintain knowledge in all areas of the program/projects includes processes that are required to ensure all components are coordinated. This knowledge area may include the project plan development processes, project plan execution processes, and integrated change control processes. Use a high quality of PM methodology and constantly drive more methodology improvements in alignment with PMLC.

Responsible for the management and analysis of issues. Manage the projects budget, monitoring the expenditures and costs against delivered and realized benefits as the project progresses. Identify, analyze and interpret relevant global and local activity data in order to define, challenge and secure best practice underpins the project. In addition using the information to set standards and use for decisions making for specific projects.

Manage third party contributions to the project as appropriate. Manage both the dependencies and the interfaces between projects within the project. Manage the risks to ensure the projects successful outcome.

Change Management

Stakeholder Management
Ensure early engagement with Stakeholders and manage this engagement throughout the project, keeping them informed of progress and issues throughout the project. Develop and positively influence key, strategic position holders across locations and functions. Willingness to support project delivery colleagues where interdependencies demand collaborative action and team work.

Communication and Project Reporting

Ensure provision of timely and transparent program / project information to provide the Program Sponsor and other stakeholders with accurate, relevant decision support material. Providing accurate progress reports, identifying risks and issues in a timely manner.

Standards & Methodology

Be responsible for directing and leading initiatives and supporting workstreams that will support the delivery of this project ensure adherence to Portfolio Governance and control.

Use PM Methodologies to best assess the risks and issues that may threaten the successful delivery of your program.

Validate new standards and methodology elements in internal projects and initiatives.

(Project) Team Leadership

Build, manage and motivate the project team, this will be virtual teams across multiple projects which will include workstream leads, project support staff and team members from other departments.
KEY REQUIREMENTS/SKILLS/EXPERIENCE
Bachelor Degree: Business Administration Degree or similar
Certification: Professional qualification in the domain of practice preferred
Ideal experience, though not required: Experience in the domain of practice of the role

Minimum 1 to 3 years: Project management experience
Ideal experience, though not required: Experience in the insurance industry domain

Business skills: break complex subjects into manageable pieces; determine status quo, business requirements, target and course of action

Project Management: from individual task management to ability to manage large complex projects

Change Management, including stakeholder management, change curve, communication

Consulting skills: relationship management, customer satisfaction, understand customer needs, build CBA & Business Case, facilitation, consult business

Basic communication & presentation
Inquiry skills, constructive feedback & conflict resolution

If you require accommodation at any stage during the recruitment process, upon request, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Job Description:
As a member of the Individual and SLGI Services (ISS) PMO team, the Project Information Analyst provides portfolio planning, reporting and analysis for the ISS Team and supports key tools that are vital to creation of our reports and metrics. The successful candidate will work closely with the ISS Portfolio Manager to compile and analyze data supporting the ISS Portfolio delivery, including tracking the IT Delivery pipeline, reporting status, and budget and forecast information.
The Project Information Analyst coordinates efforts to collect data, manages spreadsheets, and identifies anomalies and trends. Sources of data could be project delivery actuals in days or cost, delivery planning, project status, chargeback to business partner actuals, IT resourcing requests, etc.
This role provides the successful candidate with the opportunity to exercise and develop technical, analytical, and relationship management skills. The Project Information Analyst will support an environment that promotes knowledge sharing, client service, quality, innovation and teamwork.
This position is part of a dynamic, fast-paced team that offers ample challenges and opportunities to support on-the-job learning and skills development.
What will you do?
Populate, maintain and distribute bi-weekly Portfolio delivery reporting to ISS Delivery management.
Support and govern the ongoing delivery pipeline process, to support Resource Allocations.
Participate in Budget and Forecast setting/reporting for pipeline planning and staffing.
Support consistent and effective use of the time tracking tool (Changepoint) set-up and reporting.
Identify reporting requirements, design the solution, and deliver the expected results.
Support vendor contract process by updating P/O’s and eSig routing, and tracking Invoices.
Proactively identify opportunities for process improvements and drive to solutions.
Takes ownership of small initiatives and engages the appropriate resources to reach solution.
What you need to succeed:
University or other Post-Secondary education in a relevant field (Business, Mathematics, Accounting, Finance or related).
2 years of experience in a similar or equivalent role
Expertise with MS Excel is required, including use of complex data formulas, data validation, data sources and linking, Pivot Tables, charting, etc.
Working knowledge of financial concepts such as expense, chargeback, purchasing cycle, total cost of ownership (TCO), capitalization, amortization, etc.
Experience with Sharepoint, OneNote, MS PowerPoint.
Experience with ChangePoint project / time tracking.
Preferred Skills:

job_title: Analyst, Real Assets Credit - Real Estate
job_description:
Toronto, ONJob Description

Real Assets Credit invests globally across the following assets classes: real estate, infrastructure, energy and resources, and renewables. The Real Assets Credit Real Estate team invest flexibly across the capital stack, typically in large scale b-notes, mezzanine debt and preferred equity, secured against real estate assets in most major asset classes and global markets, with a current portfolio exceeding C$5 billion.
Based in Toronto and reporting to the Senior Principal, the Analyst will play a key role in the research/analysis, underwriting and transaction management of new real estate debt opportunities and portfolio management activities for existing debt investments. The team utilizes a global staffing model, and has a presence in Toronto, London, and Hong Kong.
Role-Specific Accountabilities
Analyze Investment Opportunities:
Research, analyze, underwrite and evaluate a variety of real estate debt opportunities
Compile industry, market and asset level data and financial information
Build dynamic financial models to analyze investment opportunities (reviewing debt structures and income producing capacity of the specific assets, and completing sensitivity analyses)
Perform detailed underwriting and transaction management activities including past and projected investment performance, sponsor evaluation, investment merits and risks, expected returns, and sector dynamics; as well as assist in the evaluation, structuring and execution of investments including closing activities
Review 3rd party due diligence reports (appraisals, environmental, construction consultants, etc.)
Produce investment memoranda for transaction recommendations to CPPIB credit committees and other relevant lines of approval
Monitor Real Estate Debt Investments:
Participate in portfolio management activities including monitoring and evaluating the investment portfolio performance, participating in third party meetings, and analyzing proposed budgets, capital plans and other transaction-related requests
Coordinate with third party servicers and operation groups at CPPIB with respect to monitoring ongoing investments

Qualifications

0-2 years of investment experience, preferably in the real estate sector
Demonstrates passion for principal investing
Undergraduate business degree preferred
Strong research, quantitative, financial modelling, and analytical skills
Working knowledge of Argus financial software, MS Excel, PowerPoint
Strong interpersonal and communication skills (written as well as verbal)
Demonstrates adaptability, flexibility and initiative
Key Competencies:
Self-driven; attention to details and passion for quality
Flexibility, adaptability and intellectual curiosity
Team player who enjoys a high performance culture
Exemplify our Guiding Principles of Integrity, Partnership, and High Performance

Additional Information

Visit our Linkedin Career Page or Follow us on LinkedIn. #LI-LW1
