Lower Mainland, BC$70,055 a yearPlans, develops, coordinates and implements quality assurance and business process practices in accordance with industry standards and regulations. Responsible to review and assess maintenance methods and develop/maintain the maintenance change management and non-conformance programs; as well as, perform audits on business processes, procedures, work tasks, and practices. The Quality Assurance Analyst may also be required to assist in the assessment of work practices, draft work methods documentation and participate in risk management and change management activities.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

Analyses and audits compliance with applicable industry standards, provincial and federal regulations and BCRTC business processes and initiates any required corrective and preventive actions; prepares and distributes audit reports. Compiles audit checklists and templates based on industry and regulatory standards including previous findings and corrective action records; performs audits as defined. Identifies the need for and initiates corrective and preventive action(s) for product and/or business process discrepancies.

Reviews engineering drawings, specifications and change documentation, as well as, products to ensure quality elements are included; recommends revisions and improvements in accordance with standards, regulations and BCRTC business processes.

Develops and maintains non-conformance system and templates. Tracks and analyses repeat non-conformances and takes action to initiate change.

Develops and analyses maintenance engineering, change management and methods data in support of maintenance programs.

Maintains Change Management database, reviews change requests, analyses proposed changes for completion; ensuring costs, impacts and risks of change are adequately documented.

Work in close collaboration with Engineering, Maintenance and Procurement in relation to defining and documenting work methods and procedures.

Participate in continuous improvement initiatives such as identifying non-value added activities, high maintenance cost drivers to provide recommendations and innovative solutions to optimize methods.

Act as a Quality Assurance representative on the Change Management Panel.

Qualifications
Education and Experience:

Requires a post-secondary diploma or certification in a Quality, Mechanical, Industrial or Manufacturing Engineering discipline. Requires a minimum of four (4) years of practical experience in a maintenance or manufacturing environment, including at least three (3) years’ experience in a Quality Control or Quality Assurance capacity. Requires an in-depth, demonstrable knowledge in manufacturing or, operations and maintenance practices and specifications; as well as an understanding of industry quality standards.

Other Requirements:

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Strong analytical, problem solving and organizational skills

Strong interpersonal, and relationship management skills

Strong leadership skills

Good relationship management skills across departments and organization levels

Strong time management and organization skills to balance and coordinate effort across multiple, concurrent activities

Highly motivated with the ability to consistently seek out improvements to current processes in order to achieve operational efficiency

Strong knowledge of standard office software including word processing and spreadsheet, web-based and data/business management system

Familiarity with provincial and federal standards relating to the operation of a railroad as well as SMS (Safety Management System) requirements, combined with technical documentation experience is considered an asset.

Other Information
Recruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process.

A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.

Bookkeeper/Analyst

About You

Are you highly self-motivated and thrive in a fast-paced environment?

Do you excel at collecting, monitoring, and studying data to make strategic recommendations?

Do you want to join a growing company where you can make a positive impact while working from home?

If you answered yes to these questions – then you’ll be a perfect fit at Gillis providing tactical, analytical and strategic bookkeeping support!
About Us

We believe that sales is the life blood for all organizations, and our mission is to make sales accessible and achievable to all hotel owners. We deliver amazing results for our clients and incredible experiences for our team members. We are unconstrained and have the freedom to pursue whatever it takes to create great results – allowing us to support our clients in ways that others cannot and do not.

We truly care about our clients, our work and one another, which is why we go deeper into their business and partner with them as an extension of their team.
Work from the comfort of your home office in a fun, fast paced environment where you can grow and be rewarded for your success!

About the Role

Overview

Reporting to the Director of Sales Operations, the Bookkeeper/Analyst is responsible for maintaining an accurate record of business transactions and cash flow, which will be done using tools such as QuickBooks and other accounting software. In this position, the Bookkeeper/Analyst will be creating income statements, manage balance sheets and overseeing financial transactions. The ideal candidate will have strong attention to detail, is great with numbers, and has the ability to take initiative and multitask under tight deadlines.
This is primarily a home-based position with 1-2 days per week in the Cambridge, ON office.

Job Description

Success in this position requires solid financial and accounting capabilities with the ability to analyze data and provide strategic recommendations. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Accounting

Perform all bookkeeping functions using QuickBooks.
Process payables, receivables and payroll
Review and pay employee expenses
Complete bank and other account reconciliations
Maintain the annual budget/forecast and chart of accounts, and issue monthly financial statements
Monitor the company’s expenditures and revenue regularly and provide recommendations which may include cost reduction measures, revenue generation ideas, and ways to streamline operations or increase profit margin.
Administer employee benefits plan
Prepare and submit tax remittance forms, HST, and other government documents, as required
Comply with federal, state, and local financial legal requirements by studying existing and new legislation, enforcing adherence to requirements, and advising management on needed actions.
Analysis

Summarize current financial status by collecting information; preparing balance sheet, profit and loss statement, and other reports.
Improve financial status by analyzing results; monitoring variances; identifying trends; recommending actions to management.
Increase productivity by developing automated accounting applications and coordinating information requirements
Other Duties & Responsibilities
Other administrative tasks as assigned by leadership team
 Requirements

Minimum 5 years of experience in a similar bookkeepr/analyst position
BA/BS degree, ideally with focus on finance, bookkeeping or accounting
Possess good understanding of accounting principles and possess basic accounting skills
Expert Excel skills and proficient in all other Microsoft Office applications
Must have extensive knowledge of QuickBooks and good command of various accounting software and web-based applications
Extremely well organized with strong attention to detail. Must be able to work on multiple tasks in a highly active and dynamic environment
Excellent problem solving, analytical and communication skills
Must maintain a high level of confidentiality
Ability to work independently and meet deadlines with minimal supervision, while also being able to take and follow direction
Must be able to adapt to a growing office environment

With close to 50 years of physician-focused experience, MD has one main goal: to help Canada's physicians and their families achieve financial well-being. Our commitment to work/life integration, employee well-being and ongoing learning are key factors that contribute to our overall success.
For the sixth consecutive year, MD Financial Management has been recognized as one of the Achievers 50 Most Engaged Workplaces in North America. The annual award, given by Achievers, an industry-leading provider of employee recognition and engagement solutions, commends top employers that display leadership and innovation in engaging their workforces.

What You Will Do:

Reporting to the Manager, Operations & Finance Projects, as the Process Analyst, you will be responsible for enabling the success of process automation and improvement initiatives by working closely with Finance and Operations subject matter experts to develop and document business processes. As a key member of the RPA team, the Process Analyst’s contribution to each initiative requires a mixture of methodology, curiosity and attention to detail.

In this role, you will facilitate workshops with stakeholders and SME’s to gather information and create and/or update current state process maps. You will also job shadow SME’s to identify existing process exceptions and error handling.

An important aspect of your duties will be to assess findings on business processes, methods, systems and procedures for potential business process improvement and make recommendations as required. You will prepare detailed process documentation required to support robotic process automation. In addition, you will participate in RPA build and test cycle to ensure outcomes meet functional requirements prior to User Acceptance Testing (UAT).

As the Process Analyst, you will also be responsible for the creation of future solution design documentation, including future state maps. You will prepare additional documentation as required to support RPA deployment to production environments based on input from team members. Lastly you will create work instructions and user documentation where required. .

What You Need:

A University degree, or equivalent educational or professional experience and/or qualifications

8-10 years of experience eliciting and documenting business requirements and solution requirements including functional, non-functional and data requirements

Advanced knowledge of MS Office Tools particularly Visio

Agile, Six Sigma, Lean experience an asset

Demonstrated ability with the people side of change enabling successful adoption of new technologies and processes

Familiarity with process automation software such as Blue Prism a definite asset

What You Bring:

Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to thrive in a team environment

Superior attention to detail

Time management and task prioritization abilities with an emphasis on balancing competing deliverables

Strong verbal and written communication skills

Ability to develop and recommend creative solutions to complex client problems

Ability to work with minimum supervision and take initiative

Flexibility and a willingness to do what it take to get the job done within established deadline

What Success Looks Like:

Mississauga, ONA Sustainable, Forward Thinking Protein Company
Maple Leaf Foods is a leading meat and plant-based protein company, employing over 11,500 people and publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange. We are proud of our roots, which trace back well over 100 years, but our vision and purpose are decidedly forward looking. As we pursue our vision to become the most sustainable protein company on earth, we are committed to creating shared value – creative business value through addressing some of the world’s most critical social and environmental challenges. Our goal is to build a more sustainable food system, which provides nutritious affordable food, operates within planetary limits, cares for animals responsibly, and meaningfully engages with our communities to advance a more just society. We are advancing bold changes within Maple Leaf and more broadly within society to pursue our vision. We deeply believe this is the sustainable path to growth.


Our job is to make great food
Maple Leaf Foods embraces a strong values-based culture, where our people are deeply engaged in work that is purposeful, fast-paced and challenging. We cultivate an open, non-bureaucratic and inclusive workplace that fosters safety and transparency, along with individual leadership and accountability. Each Maple Leaf team member has a voice and plays an active role in helping all of us achieve our goals with passion and discipline. We support one another to grow professionally, to learn new skills and to take on challenging experiences in the spirit of continuous improvement.


Raise the Good in Food
We have united behind a shared purpose – to Raise the Good in Food. This spans a dramatic transformation of our flagship Maple Leaf brand, replacing anything artificial with simple, natural ingredients; investments and process changes to reduce our environmental footprint by 50% by 2025; building a diverse and inclusive culture where all talent thrives; becoming a leader in animal care; and advancing food security through our charitable foundation, the Maple Leaf Centre for Action on Food Security.


Our Leadership Values
Six core values guide us in everything that we do.
Do what’s right
Deliver winning results
Build collaborative teams
Get things done in a fact-based, disciplined way
Learn and grow, inwardly and outwardly
Dare to be transparent, passionate and humble
 Analyst, Master Data Shared Services (MDSS) - Contract

The Opportunity:

 The Master Data Shared Services (MDSS) team is accountable for the maintenance and quality assurance of master data and adherence to data standards across all operating units within Maple Leaf Foods. The Data Analyst is responsible for supporting the business by:
Validating requests received to create or change master data against existing master data governance and quality standards, including ensuring all required approvals and supporting documents are properly included
Accurately maintaining master data in SAP and GS1, within established service level agreement (SLA) timelines
Responding to all data maintenance related inquiries with a customer service mindset
 A snap shot of some of the exciting things you will lead and do:
Validate data maintenance requests and perform data maintenance for all operating units within Maple Leaf Foods, ensuring only accurate, complete and compliant data is loaded into SAP and GS1
Prepare data extracts and reports as required
Participate in regular audit cycles
Ensure SOP’s and process maps for assigned data domains are well documented and up-to-date
Interact collaboratively with fellow MDSS and Data Governance team members to drive continuous improvement and ensure overall data integrity
Demonstrate an eagerness to understand business functions and use this knowledge to provide excellent customer service to internal customers through partnership and education
 What we have to offer you:
Be part of a company with an inspiring and unique vision, with a deep commitment to sustainability and expanding its leadership in sustainable protein across North America
Professional and career development opportunities, supported by our commitment to talent development through our partnership with the Ivey School of Business.
Competitive Health and Wellness benefits that start on your first day of employment
Defined Contribution Pension Plan
Commitment to Learning – courses, resources and tools provided to all employees
Employee Assistance Program
 What you will bring:
A minimum of 3 years of SAP experience with master data management, specifically Material, Customer, Plant Maintenance and Vendor Master
Strong written and oral communication skills. Must be able to communicate issues and data governance policy effectively across a wide and diverse group
Ability to manage a large volume of work through effective prioritization, communication and excellent execution

Ability to manage a large volume of work through effective prioritization, communication and excellent execution
 Other competencies required:
Customer service mindset

The Role: Analyst, Demand & Fulfillment


Reporting to the Director, Demand & Fulfillment the Analyst Demand & Fulfillment is responsible for central demand forecasting and replenishment activities across the Front Store business area to ensure inventory availability of the right product at the right time in Rexall store locations. The Analyst Demand & Fulfillment creates and maintains forecast models for their assigned categories incorporating business intelligence and forecast information gathered from category management, marketing, stores and industry insights.


Principal Responsibilities:

Execute Demand Planning & Replenishment activities utilizing JDA Demand & Fulfillment modules to maximize in stock levels and optimize inventory across the Rexall network of stores.
Create statistical forecasts: gather/analyze and validate data, execute statistical modeling, review resulting statistical forecast models, apply error analysis techniques to improve forecasting, summarize/aggregate statistical forecast.
Review historical sales trends, research demand drivers, prepare forecast data, develop statistical forecast models, and evaluate forecast results.
Coordinate cross-functional research activities to reconcile significant variances and refine the forecast model to reflect updated sales and marketing assumptions.
Utilize a collaborative and consensus approach interacting with Marketing, Category management, and Store ops to understand demand forecast drivers.
Utilize forecast and reporting tools to analyze forecast accuracy to understand root cause for error and drive continuous improvement within the organization
Participate in monthly demand review meetings to evaluate forecasting effectiveness, determine root-cause of significant issues and coordinate the action plans to improve forecasting effectiveness.
Identify the root causes of issues such as out-of-stocks and aged inventory by identifying discrepancies through the collection and analysis of data and provides recommended solutions.
Effectively document and communicate key assumptions related to all published demand plans and scenarios.
Provide input within the Supply chain and Category management team in developing inventory strategies on existing items, new products, and product phase-outs

Undergraduate degree in business, supply chain or a related field
Minimum 3-5 years of progressive experience in supply chain with a focus on Demand Planning & Replenishment
Demand Planning experience is required with a preferred focus leveraging JDA Demand, JDA Fulfillment software modules
Experience in the retail industry is required, OTC, HABA, Beauty, Daily living category experience preferred
Real world forecasting experience in a national network supply chain business that includes multiple points of distribution, and retail locations
Experience collaborating across an organization with Merchandising, Marketing, Store Operations
Clear understanding of end-to-end supply chain and supporting business processes
Demonstrated ability to inspire confidence, communicate and operate effectively.
Experience establishing key performance indicator metrics to benchmark and track performance.
Advanced written/Verbal communication and presentation skills.
Well organized and strong time management skills.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and multi task.
Self-directed and motivated to independently accomplish results.
Viewed by clients/stakeholders as an emerging subject matter expert.
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to interact with all teams, areas and levels of business affecting the forecast process.
Ability to assist the Director and Senior Analyst with large-scale projects from conception to implementation.
Demonstrated ability to produce work products that make an impact on management decisions and business results.

JOB CATEGORY: Business Professionals

This is an exciting opportunity for an energetic, positive self-starter with an interest in research and advocacy working as a Policy and Research Analyst. This position is for you if you have exceptional time management, organizational and people skills, experience in government relations, public policy or politics, a passion for creativity, and a degree in political science, public administration or equivalent. You are comfortable and competent working with diverse individuals and groups. You thrive in a challenging position and adapt well to change.
The Policy and Research Analyst is a support position shared between the Vaughan Chamber of Commerce and the Newmarket Chamber of Commerce, reporting directly to both Chambers though the Manager of Government Relations and Policy. This individual will play a significant role in coordinating the Chambers' public policy research and development initiatives to further the interests of members. The successful candidate must be aware of current trends and capable of reacting quickly to changes within the business landscape or within York Region. Highly developed communication, relationship building, and conflict resolution skills are required as there will be recurrent interactions with external stakeholders.

Organizational Overview:
The Vaughan Chamber of Commerce is the premier membership and networking association in Vaughan. The VCC proudly represents business from all sectors of the economy including large corporations and small-to-medium enterprises (SMEs). Our core member offerings include facilitated networking, large-scale signature events (Business Achievement Awards, Women's Symposium, Mayor's Luncheon), and exclusive member-to-member products and savings. VCC members also benefit from business leads, learning seminars, professional peer groups, and co-branding opportunities. The VCC is a strong voice on public policy issues of importance to the local business community, such as infrastructure, transportation and opportunities for business growth.
The Newmarket Chamber of Commerce represents the interests of business in a variety of ways, including advocacy and development of public policy. The Chamber offers programs, events, resources and connections to help member companies learn, connect and thrive. It promotes trade and commerce and leverages the skills and knowledge of its network to increase the vibrancy of the Newmarket community.
HOURS: 37.5 hours per week
LOCATION: Vaughan Chamber Office (with travel throughout the area)
REPORTING TO: Manager of Government Relations and Policy

Job Duties:
Conducts background policy research and analysis to support existing projects as well as proposals for new bodies of work; segments and synthesizes research findings to identify and recommend best practices.
Extracts, collects and aggregates data across databases, information sources, survey responses, and other data sources; ensures data quality; cleans and checks exiting data for consistency and accuracy.
Assists in the research, development and implementation of a policy research program that addresses the needs and issues of the membership and addresses the strategic plan objectives.
Assists with researching, analyzing, developing policy positions, papers, briefs, resolutions and other policy communication tools.
Works closely with Manager of Government Relations and Policy to advance public policy positions of interest to the Chambers by building partnerships and coordinating with members, key stakeholder groups, levels of government, and elected officials.
Applies advanced critical thinking skills and experience to conceptualize and define policy challenges and opportunities and recommend innovative policy solutions using the best available evidence.
Helps build community consensus on public policy issues through coordinating workshops and consultations, and represents the Chamber at public policy events.
Assists with one-pagers and topic briefs to support both the Newmarket and Vaughan Chambers' work as a business advocate.
Assists with creating and maintaining a policy manual of Chamber issues, positions and internal policies.
Monitor Municipal and Regional council meetings, community meetings and legislative activity to assess and identify advocacy opportunities for the Chambers.
Assists in coordinating content for Chamber publications, articles and other communications.
Assists in planning and executing media events and briefings.
Assist in the preparation of articles for inclusion in various mediums; prepare speeches, speaking notes, key messages, letters to the editor, etc.
Takes minutes at committee meetings.
Other related duties as assigned.
Core Competencies:
Superior research skills
Strong communicator
Innovation
Negotiating
Networking and relationship building
Strategic and critical thinking
Political aptitude
Requirements:
University degree in Political Science, Public Administration or Policy, Commerce, Business Administration, Journalism, Communications or a related field.
A minimum two years of directly related experience including volunteer work.
Experience working in the not-for-profit sector and/or for a membership-driven organization is desirable but not required.
Highly effective project management, prioritization, multi-tasking, and time management skills to meet deadlines.
Strong portfolio of writing samples required.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills along with proficient computer skills.
Valid driver's license and use of a reliable personal vehicle.
Ability to work well with others, and handle direction and constructive criticism in a positive manner.
Energetic, self-motivated, and results-oriented.
A well-defined sense of diplomacy, including solid negotiation, conflict resolution, and people management skills as well as political and cultural sensitivity.
Strong problem identification and resolution skills.
High level of critical and logical thinking, analysis, and/or reasoning to identify underlying principles, reasons, or facts.
Preference will be given to candidates with regional knowledge and connections.
Must have background in creating and monitoring social media.
Works ethically and with integrity; follows policies and procedure. Maintains a commitment to privacy.
Consistently at work and on time; ensures work responsibilities are covered when absent.
Working Conditions:
Some travel is required.
Ability to attend and conduct presentations; may be outside regular office hours.
Overtime as required
Some event set-up required, including lifting and carrying up to thirty (30) pounds.

At Golder, we thrive on challenges.


Golder is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture of ownership.
Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment?


Golder has a new opportunity for a Total Rewards Analyst to join our HR team on a full-time basis based in Calgary or Mississauga.


Reporting to the Regional Director of Human Resources, Canada, this role will see you responsible for performing compensation analysis, fully supporting the annual compensation management process. You will also contribute to the development, implementation and administration of total compensation policies and programs, aligned with supporting Golder’s achievement of our strategic business initiatives and HR strategy.


An overview of your role will include:
 Investigating and resolving service issues escalated by HR advisors, both internally through colleagues such as HRIS and Payroll, and externally through various total rewards program vendors
 Participating in a variety of annual compensation survey activities for 15 global annual remuneration surveys including data collection, organization, and submission
 Administering the annual year-end Salary Level Review process, including performing data validation and supporting system configuration and testing
 Evaluating new and existing jobs using Mercer’s proprietary IPE system, formulating salary recommendations using available market data as required
 Supporting ongoing communication and education of HR
 Working with HR to support communication and education to ensure that all employees are aware of their entitlements and responsibilities regarding out Total Rewards offerings
 Working with HR to ensure the integrity of Total Rewards data in the HRIS
 Maintenance of the Intranet portal including managing user access, updating content, posting files, and creating new pages as required
 Managing delivery of Golder’s rewards and recognition program
 Compiling data and performing requested analysis as required
 Other duties and special projects as assigned


You will possess the following:

 University degree in a business discipline preferred
 1-3 years of demonstrated experience in human resources administering total rewards programs
 Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
 Knowledge of Oracle applications is considered an asset
 Demonstrated organizational and prioritization skills
 Strong understanding of priorities and deadlines is essential, along with a sense of urgency
 Highly organized with strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively build relationships, while also a self-starter that can work independently
 Ability to multitask in a demanding work environment


Your benefits at Golder will include:

 Competitive benefits and remuneration packages
 Option to purchase shares in Golder
 Employee owned structure - own the business, own the result
 Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment
 Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects
 On the job training, mentoring and coaching
 Global projects and travel opportunities


One of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, Platinum member status 11 consecutive years


Renowned for technical excellence, Golder is a leading, global employee-owned engineering and consulting firm with over a half century of successful service to its clients. With over 165 offices in over 30 countries, Golder’s 6,500 professionals are driven by a passion to deliver results, offering unique specialized skills to address the ever-evolving challenges that earth, environment and energy present to clients across the infrastructure, mining, oil and gas, manufacturing and power sectors.

OMERS (Ontario Municipal Employees Retirement System) is one of Canada's leading pension funds. Experience working both independently and in a team-oriented collaborative environment is essential.Independent and self-motivated.You are curious, creative, biased for action and love solving problems.Your strengths come from collaborating with others, reading, learning, and sharing your knowledge with the team.Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
Our story:
Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $97 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2018. A jointly sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers, OMERS invests and administers pensions on behalf of almost half a million active and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS has employees in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

Responsibility
Support risk efforts to continue to meet compliance for Credit Risk under the BCBS Principles for effective risk data aggregation and risk reporting and/or get regulatory agreement for phased-in compliance beyond that date.
Semi-annual updates to Board and regulator and an annual detailed action plan

Support communication development strategies across the organization in support of the change agenda including with meeting with senior business and risk leaders.

Creating and maintaining an Inventory of all regular board, senior risk committee and regulatory reporting to determine the critical data elements, determine project scope assess against current remediation projects.
Refreshed process mapping leading to streamlined manual processes that can be automated
Maintain the control framework across all critical data elements with robust monitoring and reporting
Key resource in the independent validation and for testing compliance processes.
Client Contact
This role is internal to Central Credit Risk Reporting , ERPM and provides support

Bachelor’s degree
Knowledge and understanding of business unit compliance and risk management principles
Expert Microsoft Office Suite Skills with Word, Excel and PowerPoint as key strengths

Strong troubleshooting/problem solving abilities
We’re here to help
At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. ABOUT US Aecon Group Inc. is Canada’s largest, publicly traded construction and infrastructure development company. Aecon and its subsidiaries provide services to private and public sector clients throughout Canada and on a selected basis internationally.Aecon Energy offers a suite of unparalleled services to some of Canada’s largest energy suppliers, providing best-in-class solutions to the oil and gas, nuclear, co-generation, and renewable sectors.POSITION OVERVIEWThe MOP Validation Technician will primarily be responsible for completing Engineering Assessments to evaluate and verify the Maximum Operating Pressure (MOP) of high stress pipeline systems in Enbridge Gas Distribution areas. The successful candidate is responsible for searching, retrieving, sorting, analyzing and categorizing physical and electronic records, as well as, identifying where/when duplicate records exist so that de-duplicate and disposition action can be taken by others. An integral part of the continuous improvement cycle of the program, the Validation Specialist is expected to identify efficiency and effectiveness enhancements. The successful candidate will verify and sustain pipeline operating limits by completing the following activities under the supervision of a P.Eng/Senior Analyst. Note: This is a contract opportunity till December 2019, with a possibility for extension. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Perform engineering calculations on all components in existing and proposed pipeline installations to ensure pipelines are qualified to operate within material design and stress limitations, by applying knowledge of stress analysis, fluid mechanics, metallurgy, welding, or corrosion
Assess pipeline installation and maintenance records to collect and evaluate critical asset and condition information
Consult codes and standards pertaining to the design, installation, operation, and maintenance of gas pipeline systems, in particular CSA Z662 Oil and Gas Pipeline Systems
Prepare and updating technical reports to document activities and decisions relating to engineering assessments
Prepare field verification work packages to issue to field Operations, per the assessment methodology, to obtain additional material information and create verifiable, traceable, and complete asset records for all components in the pipeline system
Develop and sustain the MOP assessment methodology according to applicable codes, engineering principles, Company procedures, and industry best practices
Determine and implement new and existing Company policies, practices, and procedures which may affect the governance and control areas of the Company specific to design, construction, planning, maintenance or records keeping
Work with the MOP Project Records Coordinator to retrieve physical records from on site storage and complete requests for retrieval from off site locations
Pre-process of documents for further analysis or imaging
Review, analyze and sort records based on specific research criteria
Enter descriptive and other metadata before storing/archiving electronic records
Maintain records research tracking sheets of work completed
Implement quality control procedures to ensure integrity of documents and/or records metadata
Identify improvements in processes, systems, technology and procedures
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS
High level of oral and written communication skills are required for writing technical documents, responding to inquiries, and presenting issues to a variety of audiences
Co-ordination of multiple projects requires effective organizational skills, results orientation, innovative problem solving and decision making skills, and the ability to work on project teams.
Must be able to quickly understand the impacts of technical and operational issues and provide a safe, thorough, and correct response to inquiries
Graduates of recognized Engineering programs in a discipline of Chemical, Mechanical or Industrial Engineering with eligibility to participate in the EIT program of Professional Engineers Ontario.
Experience in any/all of the following areas:
Gas distribution
Pipe design
Construction practices
Technical records management
Previous experience using computer systems to manage data, records and information is preferred
Experience reading technical & engineering drawings is required
Must be able to read and interpret engineering drawings, construction as-builts and technical records
Demonstrated attention to detail and ability to efficiently proof read documents
Ability to work in a process based environment with high work volumes and transactions
Proven ability to plan, organize and execute task objectives required
Strong computer skills required – MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and MS SharePoint ; experience in GIS is an asset

In Ontario, the fully integrated Guelph beef facility employs over 820 employees and processes 1,800 head of cattle per day, while the Guelph Case Ready facility has over 600 employees. In Quebec, the Chambly Case Ready facility has over 500 employees serving national retailers and food service customers.

Who we are – TAI
Tindall Associates, Inc., known as TAI (pronounced as T.A.I.), was founded in the mid-1970s and later incorporated as a privately held 'C' Corporation. The initial business was general insurance consulting.
Today, TAI is the market leader in life reinsurance systems in North America with clients in the United States, Bermuda, the Caribbean and Hong Kong. TAI is focused on simplifying life reinsurance administration through software and services. TAI software automates reinsurance administration for life insurance companies and TAI services identifies and solves areas of reinsurance risk that are impacting the bottom line.
Reinsurance is global business, and TAI's base system is flexible and can be customized to meet the needs of these new markets. TAI offers a complete software solution for the life companies to self-report all their reinsurance information; assumed, ceded or retroceded in an electronic format to share with their partners on a cost-effective basis.
TAI was previously a subsidiary company of LOGiQ³. In early 2018, LOGiQ³ was acquired by RGAX, making TAI a portfolio company of RGAX. RGAX is the transformation engine and a wholly owned subsidiary of Reinsurance Group of America, Incorporated (NYSE: RGA). A Fortune 500 company, RGA is among the leading global providers of life reinsurance and financial solutions.
Position
TAI is currently seeking a Reinsurance Accounting Analyst to join our team of industry experts at our Toronto Office.
Reporting to the Manager, Accounting, Reinsurance Services, you will administer all necessary facets of reinsurance accounting including premium accounting and billing, claims accounting, booking of reinsurance reserves and facilitating settlement with multiple reinsurance partners.
What you will be doing…
Ensure accurate and timely, monthly, quarterly and year end accounting related to Premiums, Claims and Reserves.
Ensure data quality on accounting systems including performing various systematic and manual reconciliations between administration system and ledger.
Ensure timely and accurate reporting of all periodic reporting to external clients as per SLA.
Ensure timely and accurate preparation of bank reconciliations.
Execute a variety of reinsurance processes currently done using MS Access databases or MS Excel worksheets.
Support administration and claims teams in running of monthly and quarterly administration cycle runs by reviewing and processing exceptions.
As needed, assist in projects to improve process efficiency or enhance data quality and administration systems.
Respond to ad hoc internal or reinsurer requests.
Are you who we're looking for? The qualified candidate will have…
Post-secondary education with an emphasis on accounting or business administration.
Min 1-3 years of related work experience in the Insurance/financial services industry.
Working knowledge of accounting procedures. (e.g. Journal creation and posting, account reconciliations, bank reconciliations, trial balance reconciliations)
Ability to work with large data sets to recognize systemic trending issues and/or data anomalies.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Word.
Ability to manage multiple and changing priorities and deliver results according to deadlines.
Some extras that would be a bonus…
Working knowledge of insurance accounting would be an asset.
Understanding of various life insurance products written in the North American market.
Industry relevant education such as LOMA.
Familiarity with reinsurance administration and treaties.
Exposure to project management concepts and practices.
Working knowledge of MS Access/SQL
Interested?
Take the time to learn more about us and tell us more about who you are and why we should invite you to the team. Apply on the LOGiQ³ website or read up first on TAI's blog, LinkedIn, and Twitter.
About our parent company
RGAX is the "transformation engine" of RGA that leverages the talent, resources, and insight of RGA's 40+ years of innovation. By partnering with carriers and entrepreneurs, RGAX incubates and accelerates new products and services to change the life insurance ecosystem.


RGAX is passionately driven to ensure success for clients and the insurance industry while achieving the core purpose of helping people live longer, healthier, more financially secure lives, everywhere. To learn more, visit www.rgax.com.
